Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: funkygibbon3
Reviews.Content: Family hotel with a warm welcome, very friendly staff and excellent service. My room was small but well laid out, bright, spotlessly clean and very well furnished. The balcony was a welcome bonus. Location is 10 minutes easy walk from Statione Termini and 10 minutes walk from the Coliseum. The restaurant was good and there are several excellent eating places close by. The park opposite the entrance is a great place to relax and access the Metro system. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Missy C
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with very helpful staff. Lovely lobby. We stayed for 2 nights and the room was large compared to the usual European hotel. Clean room and nice amenities. Location is so-so but the metro is right outside the front door. I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gerrycon
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel at the beginning of April for 4 nights and the experience was great. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and the hotel was excellent. We booked directly with the hotel and got picked up at the airport as part of the deal and that was good as we were at the hotel 25 minutes after leaving the airport. The conciege met us on our arrival and spent some time explaining how to get about the city. The location of the hotel is great with the subway right outside the door and many of the attractions within easy walking distance. There are several nice restaurants in the nearby area and we enjoyed sitting in the park across the road and watching the world go by. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very close to metro”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in March. The hotel is very close to the metro Vittorio Emmanuelle (10 yards from the Piazza Dante exit!) and 15 mins walk to the Colloseum. The room was good, although some of the furniture was a bit dated. Clean bathroom and the bed was comfortable. Very helpful staff. Free wifi worked very well. The buffet breakfast was OK but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Exteremely helful staff and great location to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: Parama C
Reviews.Content: The location is so convenient. From FCO to Termini and Metro line A (first stop) or walk to the hotel. I didn't like the area much but didn't have to care about it as the Metro stop is almost at the front of the hotel. Staff, without asking, gave a great map of Rome and how to visit the main attractions from the hotel. Room was small but very nice. beds and pillows very extremely nice. Shower worked as well. Wish the room had more windows or a balcony. The hotel also held our bags as we went around visiting other parts of Italy. Extremely grateful for that and if we come back to Rome, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: Brenda R
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the end of March 2012. The hotel was clean and comfortable and we couldn't have wished for more friendly and helpful staff, especially the concierge who pointed us in the right direction with regard to the various sites of Rome. Any problems we had with the room i.e. we couldn't find the remote for the air conditioning and the shower leaked were addressed promptly, in fact before we got back to our room after having told them these were being fixed. Breakfast was a buffet so you had as much or as little as you wanted and we ate a couple of times in the hotel restaurant at night and the food was good. I would certainly stay there again not only for the location (in the largest but probably the quietest piazza at night in Rome) but also for the metro, which was a stone's throw from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidOHanlon79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, very nice bar area and free wifi is always a big bonus for me, breakfast was fine, nothing special but it was decent. Staff are nice and friendly, very central, tube station outside front door and you can get anywhere for €1. I parked outside for €4 a day which is brilliant for Rome---but its difficult to get a space(I was lucky) I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: F D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is conveniently located to the train and the colloseum the beds and pilloes were extremely uncomfortable. The rooms are quite small as well... The hotel and staff were just fine but better deals can be had... Having visited Rome several times before, I would gladly pay the extra 15 euros a night for a comfortable bed and to have a room twice the size. This can all be had at at hotels just one more stop along the metro and still have the same walking distance to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, right next to subway stop”
Reviews.Author: Martha H
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very helpful. We enjoyed the manager's complimentary wine tasting on Friday night. The subway stop is right out the front door. The breakfast was good and plentiful. The room was large and I felt we got good value for the price. The only drawback was that the window opened to a very uninviting alley -- we would have preferred a room on an upper floor or one with a better view. My daughter and I took the fast train to Naples and then went onto Pompeii by ourselves, and saved lots of money over the rate quoted for a guided tour from Rome. It was easy and I felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: hacktus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights starting 26 feb with my dad and brother in law .excellent value hotel! Breakfast very good rooms v Comfortable staff excellent especially night reception guy on Sunday 26 feb and it is 20 feet to the metro! Remember to go to the Dante exit to arrive at the hotel door. There is a park with ruins opposite the hotel If in Rome for 3 days get Roma Christiania 72 hour tickets good for open top bus and all metro/regular bus/trains in Rome excellent value for 25 euros !

Reviews.Title: “Picked it with a pin and couldn't have picked better”
Reviews.Author: Barry T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Napoleon at the end of February 2012 with a party of 10 on a city break holiday and it was perfect. It is central to all the tourist sites and for ones slightly farther than a 10 /15 minute walk there is a Metro station near by and plenty of bus stops . The hotel staff were brilliant as nothing was too much trouble and at times provided services above and beyond the call of duty.One of our party had a birthday during the holiday and although none of us conveyed this to the staff, the cleaners noted the cards in the room and that night the manager provided 2 bottles of sparkling wine and a card from hotel staff. I would highly recommend this hotel and if I were to visit Rome again I will be staying at the Napoleon

Reviews.Title: “even better than last trip”
Reviews.Author: Jmhzx
Reviews.Content: was here 2 years ago and had a great time. went back last week and it was even better. many of the rooms have been upgraded and to a very good standard. this is a great hotel, a great location and without doubt, the staff are it's greatest asset. they simply can't do enough for you. they clearly love their city and they feed off the enthusiasm of visitors. they even do those little extra things like notice your birthday on your passport and send you a bottle of bubbly to your room. breakfast is unhurried and plentiful and being gluten free, the staff made a huge extra effort to accommodate my needs. There is one tiny thing I think they could improve on, thats the scrambled egg but i still managed to polish off great big platefuls. I can't wait to go back. this hotel is my home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: CinthiaLopezDaher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Napoleon Hotel during two nights at the beginning of February. It was freezing Rome, actually it was snowing and I arrived on a very early flight (7:00AM). I was picked up at the airport and when I arrived at the hotel the manager had my room ready for me eventhough I was checking in at 9:00AM! My room was really cosy, very clean and nicely furnished. Everybody who works at this hotel was extremly nice and friendly. The hotel has an excellent location, away from tourists crowds but just some blocks away from the Colesseum and just two meters away from the subway entrance that it is some stops away from Piazza Spagna, Piazza di Popolo and the Vatican city. I highly recommend this hotel because it is comfortable, very well managed and good located. I will for sure come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel next to a underground station, with a very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful head-concierge.”
Reviews.Author: Haje1946_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice at this very pleasant friendly 4 star family-run hotel in a 19th century palazzo, next to an underground station with a lot of bus-stops nearby (buy a map of Rome showing the bus lines for around € 2,-, it helps in finding the right bus-stop). The reception is one stair up on the first floor, porters help you with your lugage, the rooms are spacious and clean, sheets and towels are changed daily, free in-room Wifi; breakfast is good, the italian restaurant OK. There is a small park opposite the hotel where children play. The head-concierge is very friendly, knowledgeable and extremely helpful, helped us buy our 7 day Rome Travel Passes (€ 16,-) before we arrived so on arrival we could travel around Rome freely, helped us with online check-in and printing boarding passes before leaving for home which on the Alitalia website was quite a challenge, I even overheard him helping out a guest who phoned him from a hairdresser's salon to tell the hairdresser what she wanted! The hotel can on request arrange pick-up from and to the airport for € 48,- one way for each saloon car (up to 4 persons). The Colloseum and other sights are just a kilometer away, but in the heat the underground is preferable. Just be very wary of the very skilful pickpockets, especially when exiting the train! In the direct vicinity of the hotel there are some very nice, very affordable and authentic chinese(!) restaurants, since the Chinese have bought a lot of property around the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Steveaddy59
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay, at this lovely hotel I visited with my wife and 11 year old daughter and from the moment you step foot in the hotel you are made welcome, the foyer is quite small but don't let this put you off as there is lovely relaxing open room on the next level where you will find a bar and the breakfast room. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful, (special mention to Roberto the concierge at the front desk, thanks for all your recommendations Roberto!) There was even a wine tasting night were we had the pleasure of meeting the owner Mr Roberto Cioce, a lovely warm and welcoming man. I cannot recommend this lovely friendly hotel enough, just go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Eldad D
Reviews.Content: My wife and i hosted between 17-21.2 The staff was very helpful about routs to tourist locations, and always with a smile. The location is right in front of line 'A' metro station, and very close walk to the Colosseum and Termini. The breakfast was rich and varied. the room was clean,spacious and cozy. Also there is safety box in each room we will definitely come back next time in Rome !

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Swallow56
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night visit to the Hotel Napoleon. The hotel is excellent in every way. Spotlesssly clean,peaceful for a good night's sleep , very helpful staff and an amazing breakfast to suit all tastes. Situated a few steps from the Metro for speedy visits around the city .

Reviews.Title: “Buonissimo!”
Reviews.Author: AllIndianNoChief
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Italy vs England 6 Nations match, spending 4 nights at the hotel with sub zero temperatures and snow & sleet in Rome, but more than compensated for by the warmth of the hotel. Special mention has to be made of the Managing Director Roberto who made sure that every guest felt special. Really mention worthy is what was dubbed 'wine tasting' one friday evening, turned out to be endless supply of free wine and hors d'oeuvres which lasted well over an hour. In spite of being a strong Italian rugby supporter himself, Roberto made sure that we had free vistory beers waiting for us after the match. Well done Roberto, we'll see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Great family break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: Just spent the half term in Rome with the family and stayed at the Hotel Napoleon. Communication with the hotel via email was prompt and efficient - and a nice touch was an email just prior to our visit 'looking forward to our arrival' and just after our stay 'thanking us for our visit'. We requested two rooms together and were given inter-connecting which was even better. It was a great 5 days made the more memorable by the friendliness, courtesy and helpfulness of the staff at the hotel and in particular the Concierges. We requested and received promptly different pillows, we were given great recommendations for places to eat, shown the best places to shop and calls were made on our behalf to check information and availability about things we wanted to do and see. The location was great - a short walk from Termini, 15 minutes to the Colosseum, and easy walking to anywhere else you'd want to visit! The metro was literally outside the door and only a 20 minute ride to Vatican city. The hotel itself was comfortable, spacious and well laid out. The rooms were clean and tidy and nicely presented, not massive but certainly large enough if you are spending most of your time sightseeing. Breakfast catered to everyone's taste and though we did not eat in the restaurant the menu looked good and reasonably priced. We had snacks in the small bar a couple of times - toasted sandwiches were lovely and thanks for serving us at 10.45pm!! All in all a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Sure_10
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12 (6 couples) in Rome for the England - Italy Rugby. Made the reservation via the hotel's user friendly website. 1 km away from the Colloseum and just feet away from the metro...The hotel organised the airport transfer for 10 euros each. Pleasant welcome on arrival. ..I am a travel agent and reasonably well travelled and have a fair idea what to expect in an older European city hotel... Generally rooms are on the smaller side and more often than not without a view... Our "Classic" rooms whilst not huge (but equally not a bad size) were nicely furnished with the my "requested" bath tub (nice bathroom) and all very clean. After the first night a few of us asked for extra pillows, no problem, that evening they were in our rooms. Lovely large public lounge with enough room to accommodate our large group and another Irish party that were also staying. Breakfast good and is served to a reasonable time... A great idea is the Friday night wine tasting. The owner and general manager Roberto, as a Rugby fan thanked all of the English for coming to the Rugby and of course much banter followed!!! On our return he had instructed the barman to furnish us with a few much appreciated complimentary drinks.The Napoleon is a family run hotel whose staff and owners make it what it is..Nothing is too much trouble. The longer you stay, the more you appreciate it!...This is not a large hotel chain but a pleasant family run hotel and all the better for it...Personally I would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Addie V
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Rome (9-14 February) which was booked as a surprise for my husband’s 50th birthday. It also coincided with the Italy v England Six Nations rugby match at the Stadio Olimpico. I emailed to ask if we could have early check in and late check out due to the times of our flights, for an airport transfer and the most important, if they could help with obtaining tickets for the rugby match. I immediately received a really friendly response from Roberto Cioce the general manager who advised that he was an old ‘rugger’ and was more than happy to assist us with sourcing tickets. He fulfilled every request and as he was attending the match too, he travelled with us to the stadium. This has to be the friendliest hotel in Rome. The staff go out of their way to make sure you have an enjoyable stay and if you need anything, you only need to ask. There is even a note in the rooms to advise that if you do not like the firmer mattresses and pillows, you can request for them to be changed to softer ones. As Roberto mentioned, if you ask for something they will do their upmost to accommodate the request if it is in their power to do so. We had a large room that accommodated 4 (2 + 2), which consisted of a double bed and 2 singles and it wasn't cramped at all. The bathroom had a bath with overhead shower which was powerful and hot water was plentiful. The room as well as the whole hotel was very clean. The decor and furniture within the hotel was in keeping with the style of the building. We can quite honestly say that the official hotel photos are a true reflection of the interior of the hotel with absolutely no nasty surprises on arrival. It was so quiet near our room that we struggled to wake up in the mornings, especially with the curtains closed making it really dark! The breakfast which is included for all guests has a good variety of choices and is of a good quality. Food and beverages are available throughout the day and an a la carte menu is available in the evening. Prices are competitive and often cheaper than we paid outside the hotel. The hotel is in an ideal location with good links to public transport. There is a metro station right on the door step! The Friday night wine tasting hour was enjoyable with tasty hors d'oeuvres on offer too. There was a great atmosphere due to a lot of the guests attending the match the following night and Roberto announced that he wanted to offer all guests a drink after the game and two if Italy won! We had an amazing time and didn't want to leave. We will definitely return and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to all our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Pamela S
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Napoleon Hotel in Rome. We were met with a very welcoming and helpful reception who couldn't do enough for you as they definitely went out of their way to help. Hotel was of a high quality- immaculate,comfortable, warm as it was freezing outside! and very relaxing. Room was cleaned everyday to a high standard which was great for me as I am very fussy. Would definitely recommend it and go back and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ursieqm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night trip to Rome which started off as a trip to watch England play rugby in Italy. The weather was some of the coldest Rome has experienced for around 50 years. The hotel was a haven of warmth and comfort. The room was kept immaculately clean for us with changes of linen and towels upon request. The bed linen was of very good quality. The standard room was a good size and was elegant, in keeping with the style of the hotel. All staff were welcoming and kind and helpful. The hotel seemed busy, but not overly so, mostly with rugby supporters for our first few nights, but the atmosphere was brilliant. Mr Cioce is a rugby supporter himself and made himself known chatting with us all. He runs an excellent hotel with many personal touches that distinguish it from the larger chains. I would unhesitatingly recommend it - so if there are any Scottish supporters booked in at the Napoleon for your match, I am sure you will enjoy yourselves. But, with rugby in mind, Rome transport to the Olympic Stadium is not great - especially in snow and ice, so allow plenty of time to get there, and be prepared to queue for return transport - it took is over two hours to get back, once we had left the stadium - mainly due to the snow that fell in the afternoon. So we were doubly glad to have booked a table at the hotel dining room once we did get back. Their food is not expensive and we ate in two evenings and thoroughly enjoyed it. Also, be aware that Termini station, the local transport hub is being removated with 14 escalators out of action, not a lot of fun if you are not that agile and have luggage to cart around. Finally the Colisseum was closed, (due to adverse weather? or so it was rumoured) except our last few days were bright, sunny , but cold) though you could walk round it, may be open again by now.

Reviews.Title: “just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: waterville
Reviews.Content: We are just back from rome after visitung to celebrate a joint birthday party..14 of our group of 19 stayed in the wonderful Napoleon hotel. its the easiest hotel to get to ,just 1 stop ffrom Termini on the red line get off at vittorio emanuele metro stop ,exit to the lefft and you literally come up the exit and about 10 steps from the hotel door..(be very vigilant on metro as daughter had wallet robbed by gypsy kids, see my post on the forum, just a word of warning and dont be victim like we were.) anyhow on to the hotel, all the staff are truly exceptional, professional and so helpful..no problem if you need anything, i printed out our return boarding passes at the front desk and as there were so many of us i was about an hour there , taking over the computer but there was no problem , i didnrt feel i was a nuisance in any way.. the rooms we were in 301 a triple, were brilliant, the beds are most comfy and we slept soundly everynight. the bathroom has a bath with overhead shower annd plenty of toiletries.. flatscreen tv thou we didnt even turn it on.hairdryer, and its just the perfect room temp, it was bitterly cold out b ut the minute we steppedinto our hotel it wasx heaven. brekkie was 7.00 to 10 or 10.30 on sunday and plenty of everything.. boiled, and scrambled eggs, all sorts of rolls breads pastries croissants, rashers(bacon) mini sausages, ham cheese all fruits cereals veg, yogurts and the coffee is to die for..needless to say we enjoyed our breakfast there!!! we ate there sun night i ordered saltimbocca but unfortunately i had to leave dinner as i lost my camera and had to return to a pub we were in to retrieve it so i was so dosppointed as it was my birthday dinner as well.. but i found my camera so all was well.. it was one of the nicest hotels we stayhed in ever and i would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairestoke-on-trent
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four day trip with four others , one including my 88 year old mother in law. From enteriing the hotel we were met by nothing but friendliness and courtesy. We had a standard double room and a triple room both of which were fine. Beds were very comfy and clean and bathrooms lovely with a great shower. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff and they definitely go that extra mile. Breakfast was plentiful with as much tea and coffee as you can drink and their is something to suit all tastes. We had a couple of meals in the hotel restaurant and they were both lovely and not too expensive. We hope to return to Rome soon and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berty007
Reviews.Content: We choose the family run Napoleon Hotel to celebrate my wife’s 60th birthday and our 40th wedding anniversary from the 27th January 2012 for four nights. From the moment we were collected from the airport and greeted at the Hotel concierge desk we felt it was the right choice of hotel. The staff are helpful, always have a smile and are very professional and give you their best attention to make your stay at the Napoleon Hotel and Rome a pleasant one. We were asked if we wanted to change our pillows if they were not suitable and we had clean towels each day. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a balcony overlooking the courtyard. Our room was very comfortable, spotlessly clean and quite which was tastefully furnished and a big modern bathroom. When we shown to our room there were fresh flowers on the dressing table which was a nice touch and on our wedding anniversary Roberto Cioce, the owner, sent flowers and a bottle of bubbly to our room. There was a variety of good food for all tastes at breakfast and plenty of coffee and tea and we also had a couple of meals in the restaurant which were inexpensive and comparable with other restaurants in the area. The metro entrance is just a few metres from the hotel and the concierge have tickets which saves you working out how to use the ticket machine at the station. If we do return to Rome and I certainly hope we do, I will not have to search the web to find a Hotel, I will go straight to the Napoleon web site and book. Thank you to Roberto and his staff for making our trip to Rome a memorable four days and I would not hesitate to recommend the Napoleon Hotel to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: RhiRa
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've ever experienced such friendly and helpful staff before! They were so welcoming. The hotel is in a great location for walking to attractions such as the Colosseum etc. The area itself is not so pretty, but I felt perfectly safe walking around, even at night. The rooms were clean, and big enough.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrDeak
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel during the spring of 2007 and I was 100% satisfied with all service, food, and kindness of staff. A great surrounding area for exploring the real Rome, and for me it was a nice walk to the Colosseum. I will definitely return and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Dan W
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon is the best hotel we have ever stayed in, the staff were so helpful, the breakfast fantastic and the room was beautiful. It really felt like home from home. Thank you so much. The Friday night wine tasting was great and nothing was too much trouble for the professional staff. We booked four nights and then an extra night because we loved it so much. Don't worry about the area, you can just pop in the metro at Vittorio Emanuele and get anywhere very quickly. Plus, it is within walking distance of the Collesium. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and extremely helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: crystallakecoach
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at Napoleon Hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. We had planned on visiting Rome because of the Vatican and were not too excited about visiting a large city such as Rome. We thought it would be too busy and not as personal as our favorite city of Florence. We could not have been more wrong! Beginning with Roberto and all the staff at Napoleon Hotel, the people of Rome could not have been more inviting and warm. Napoleon Hotel is close to the train station and just feet away from the subway which can take you anywhere in the city. Again, Roberto at Napoleon Hotel was helpful in making us reservations with a wonderful tour of the Vatican and the Colosseum and even subway tickets. He also took the time in mapping out a daily itinerary for us. We will return to Rome and we will definitely stay at Napoleon Hotel. I highly recommend this property to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wedding reception venue for a Irish couple!”
Reviews.Author: jodie30
Reviews.Content: We married in the Irish Pontifical College in October 2011, we were joined by just over 50 family &friends from Ireland and the UK. We stayed in Hotel Napoleon for the week around our wedding, and held our wedding reception there also. We found all staff to be very professional, warm &helpful. We had been in contact with Marta Perotti in the months previous, she's the hotel's wedding planner &was very organised and a pleasure to deal with. We had a delicious five course meal , the room was beautifully decorated, and afterwards we danced the night away to an Italian band. They provided a similar wedding service to that of Irish hotels. They also organised the bridal party flowers, which were beautiful, the flowers were delivered to the hotel on the morning of the wedding. The hotel is somewhat dated, but very homely, there's a spacious lobby area with lots of comfy couches, which went down a treat with lots of guests! We enjoyed many nights drinking Italian wine on those couches! There's a metro station right outside the door of the hotel, and so this makes sightseeing very easy, the hotel is only about a 10/15 minute walk from the Colosseum, and there's lots of very reasonable, good quality restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel. The bedrooms were small compared with Irish hotels, but were clean &comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJC2975
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Napoleon Hotel in November 2011. We had a triple room which was quite large and comfortable for the three of us. The room was nice and quiet wth a rather modern bathroom. The entire hotel staff was most accomodating and pleasant for our entire week stay. The hotel lobby is spacious and cheerful with a small bar off in a seperate room with the formal restaurant off of the bar. The restaurant is a real gem. The food was great and the service even better. The location is very central to all of Rome in that the metro station is twenty steps from the hotel door. For the price, the room, the service, the location and the ease of getting around you cannot beat this hotel. We will stay here again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: SandraLong
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel pretty close to the Colosseum (walking distance). Super close to a subway station which can be good if you plan on using it, but it does get pretty busy and dirty during the day. If you are looking for comfort this may not be the best place as it is just average. If you just want a clean place to crash at night, this will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: csttoronto
Reviews.Content: My son (18) and I stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for 7 nights arriving just before New Year's Eve. This is my third stay in three years. The hotel is family owned with owners and staff that take a real interest in their guest comfort, well-being and holiday experience. The rooms are well-appointed, big bathrooms, multi lingual TV and a fast free internet connection. All rooms face into courtyards; while not very attractive views the rooms are quiet as rooms in Rome facing streets can be very noisy. Ask for a room on floors 4 - 6 as they will be brighter than lower floors. There is a large bright breakfast room with a varied selection of Italian, Meditarrean and North American breakfast items. Cappucino and/or expresso are offered along with a wide selection of good teas. Mary and Mirella are always in a pleasant mood and great you happily each morning. The unseen room attendents do a wonderful job keeping the room clean. There is a cosy bar and small dining room. We had a drink in the bar one evening where good wines are offered by the glass at reasonable prices. We dined in the restaurant one evening as well. The food is good and the service attentive. A good place to eat if you do not want to go out one evening. There is a lounge on the 1st floor with two internet capable computers. Complimentary newspapers are also available in the morning. The great thing about the hotel is that the Vittorio Emmanuel Metro stop is just outside the front door providing easy access enabling dry travel even in bad weather. It is only one stop to Roma Termini. In good weather you can easily walk to Roma Termini to connect to the Airport Express train. If you prefer a dedicate airport shuttle the hotel will arrange one for 48 Euro. There are good little restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel. We particulary liked: Tempio Di Mercante Osteria Dal Angelino 1899 Da Danilo The real heros at the Hotel Napoleon are the concierge staff who are happy to assist you with travel plans, sightseeing tips, dinner reservations and a happy greeting one arrival or when departing for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel in room 306 over Christmas and New Year 2011. The hotel itself is ok - it is quite dated in style but it's clean and the staff are friendly. The breakfast again is ok - good choice (fruit, cereal, toast as well as the continental cheese, ham, cakes options) and the dining room staff are friendly and attentive. The main problem is the insulation in the rooms. It is extremely noisy when other people are going in and out of their room so you get woken up several time a night by doors banging and people walking around. They weren't being particularly noisy it was just the thin walls. The other problem is the noise of the water pipes and water noises in general i.e. when someone flushes the toilet, has a shower, turns on a tap etc... it sounds like you are in their bathroom! The sound of the water gushing and the water pipes bang so we didn't sleep particularly well. I'm not sure if it is just a problem with the rooms on this wing but I would avoid rooms in the 300 wing particularly room 306. As everyone else says the staff are nice and the hotel is clean. It is quite far East of the sites although near the Colluseum and there is a Metro outside of the hotel and the main station is about a 15-20 minute walk so not a bad location.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SomersetHappytravels
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently celebrated our birthdays with a long weekend at the Napoleon Hotel and it was terrific. We had a superior room and enjoyed the slippers (which I am still wearing!) and the robes, the wonderful service, the huge breakfasts with every choice under the sun and the every friendly, ever helpful concierges (who worked long, long hours but were always smiley and efficient). Rome is a fabulous city to be in at the best of times, but the hotel certainly added to the magic. Cant wait to bring my husband next time. Gracia tante to everyone at the hotel and look forward to the next time .Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all departments”
Reviews.Author: HarshVardhan30
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Rome for my honeymoon. When I booked the hotel, I had done extensive scouting before that. Hotel Napoleon staff was one of the quickest to revert and right from exchanging emails with Roberto I got to know that they were the friendliest too. When I arrived in Rome, I was more treated with more than I expected. My wife and I were flattered with the impressive property and superior room. Francisco and Roberto were very helpful and helped us navigate the city. The breakfast was sumptuous and served by smiling staff in the restaurant. From service to affordability to ambience to rooms, Napoleon scores full marks in all departments.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: BirdPinoTrollFin
Reviews.Content: This our third stay in the Hotel Napoleon Rome in the past 7 years. The hotel is well located, right in front of the Metro staion and it is only one station away from Central station. The staff of the hotel are very helpful and professional, which makes guests very comfortable. The hotel rooms are good in size, so are the bathrooms. Breakfast is abundant. We tried the dinner at the hotel restaurant, it was very good, inexpensive and good quality. Quite often the hotel senior management invited guests to its "wine and talk" evening, with complimentry local wines and local produce, i.e. cheese, ham etc. It was a wonderful occassion to mingle with other guests and senior management of the hotel. Very good PR excercise. The only drawback is the connection room. Normal connection rooms have double doors, providing good insulations. However Napoleon's connecting rooms only have one thin normal door. One can hear everything, absolutely everything from next door, so aviod connecting rooms if you could. Otherwise, it is a very good quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: SnappleApple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Napoleon Hotel in December 2011. It was a great choice. We had just flown in to Rome, and the hotel was super easy to get to from Termini station. From Termini you take line A on the metro one stop to Vittorio Emmanuel. Once you exit throuh the turnstyles, go left and keep taking each left until you exit (we didnt do this the first time and had to walk around). The hotel is literally steps away. The staff is super nice, and the breakfast was more than I anticipated. We had a very very quiet room facing off the street. It is close to Santa Maria Maggiore, a large church, and about a 15-20 minute walk to the Coloseum. It is a little far from the city center. The pickings are somewhat slim for restaurants, but you can always take the metro or bus in to the city center. For the price and the service, I definitely recommend the Napoleon. Thank you, Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stopover”
Reviews.Author: LondonSal
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel for a layover in Rome and selected this hotel from reviews, location to the train station and price. We had an excellent stay from the greeting to the farewell. A very good, clean room, excellent breakfast, and simply super service from the desk, arranging our car to the airport. We felt welcomed and cared for. Thanks very much!

Reviews.Title: “The Service is unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: iLoveSantaNellaHouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon. The head concierge, Franco Quirinis, is worth every Euro they pay him. We needed a good dinner recommendation - he delivered. We needed a ride to the airport the next morning - he set it up for us. We needed help packing up some bottles of wine and olive oil so they wouldn't break in our luggage - he wrapped them up almost air-tight with padding. I needed to be sure that breakfast would be gluten free for me - he arranged it for me the night before just to be safe. We left a small painting behind accidentally in our room - he shipped it to us in Boston for free. They guy was incredible and he made us feel like royalty. The location is decent, the rooms are just fine, nothing amazing. Breakfast in the morning was nothing amazing but not bad. But really everyone on staff, especially Franco, makes this 4 stars instead of 3 to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: catf87
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 4 nights and chose this hotel on recommendation from a family member. The location is very central, about 15 minutes walk to the Colosseum, 10 minutes from Termini train station and a metro stop just outisde the door. Although I found many people in Rome to be very rude and unhelpful; the same cannot be said of the staff at Napoleon Hotel. The concierge and reception staff were helpful and very professional; and the bar and restaurant staff were very pleasant. We had dinner there on our first evening which was delicious; we got plenty of bread and breadsticks with the meal and a digestif with compliments. Our room was small but quiet and very comfortable, with a bathtub as I had requested - definitely a plus when you have spent hours walking and walking and walking! Good value for central Rome also.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, area not so bad as some say”
Reviews.Author: tmthompsonsc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not luxury, but it is very comfortable. Sure the area is not the most exclusive in Rome, there are outside vendors on sidewalk and area selling their junk, but there are plenty of nice restaurants, pastry shops, and cafes within easy walking distance. Hotel staff recommended two close restaurants and they were excellent. Metro is right in front of hotel. Easy 10 minute walk to Colisseum area. Staff is most accommodating when needed. They provided complimentary limo from airport for stay of 3 nights or more. Would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Roberto was a Lifesaver!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 days in Rome capped off by a terrific stay at the Napoleon Hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a balcony room and that was wonderful. Our friends had a triple which was very large with a roomy bathtub. As we were leaving was asked Roberto to call a cab to bring us to the Train Station so we could take the train to the airport. Roberto said "NO NO senora." He proceeded to call a driver with a large van that took all 5 of us and our 8 pieces of luggage directly to the airport for a minimal cost. The driver helped us find our car rental place, helped translate, drove with us in the car back to his van and loaded our luggage. I can't tell you how helpful it was and how much it meant to us. This is just one story of the fantastic service we had at Hotel Napoleon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Telephonist
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice of Hotel ,good price and great breakfast.We had a triple room .one large double and a single,the beds were very comfortable and there was plenty of space for three of us.We ate locally some better than others.The hotel was reasonably central ,near to the open top bus route.We had a great time ,the weather was lovely for Nov ,we would not hesitate to use this hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fantase62
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights recently here, coming from a smaller town up north. It was pretty easy reaching it from the train station and then the metro. The hotel staff are very nice and helpful. The concierge went out of his way to help us with restaurants and especially a cab for the airport (there were four of us) which was large enough and probably cost less than the train. The rooms themselves are a bit small by American standards, but clean and comfortable. There is a large lobby area where you can use the free internet, wath TV on the larger screen TV, or have a drink. It was convenient getting out and about in Rome by metro as the metro stop is just outside the door. The breakfast was good -- especially since it was included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly decent and comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: docvwLondon
Reviews.Content: Ths hotel is good value and deserves its ratings in Tripadvisor. The area is very convenient for sight seeing as the Metro stops literally outside the hotel door. It is just 15 minutes walk to the Colloseum. Our room was large, very clean and well equipped. The bed was most comfortable. The bathroom was clean and had both bath and shower. The fittings throughout the hotel are a little tired, but perfectly functional. Breakfast was OK, nothing to rave about, but perfectly adequate. The hot buffet selections were very limited bacon and scrambled eggs only. We ate at teh restaurant in the hotel just once on the first night. Again it was OK but it was not so good that we wanted to eat there again during the week. having said that we had the meal for free as part of the 1 week package that the hotel offers. During the week we ate at three local restaurants all of which are within 10 mins walk and which we would recommend. Baia Chia, Via Machiavelli Trattoria Monti ' Just off Via carlo Alberti ' excellent Trattoria vecchio conca ' Via Carlo Alberti ' good for fish

Reviews.Title: “The Best 4 Star in Rome”
Reviews.Author: modella
Reviews.Content: After being picked up by a limo service at the airport, we arrived at the hotel and were invited to have a complimentary breakfast. A short time later we were escorted to our room on the second floor overlooking the courtyard. Service at the front desk during our ten day stay was beyond expectation. Language was not a problem as they are conversant in many languages. We needed help with some online reservations and it was done at the front desk with a smile and a pleasant attitude. There is nothing that they will not do for you to make your holiday a pleasant experience. We would recommend this hotel for women traveling as there are so many choices of restaurants and the Metro is just outside the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel with personal service”
Reviews.Author: Goranssons
Reviews.Content: This is one of these hotels that transport you a bit backwards in time. Everyting, including the guests, are i bit dated in a nice way. You are far from the bland hotel chain experience and also from the over-designed botique places. I went alone to Rome this the winter to buy some wine and just relax for a long weekend. The weather was terrible, so I spent far more time in the hotel bar then I had planned to. The service was personal andr friendly, I got good recommendations about wines to buy, restaurants to visit etcetera. The hotel has a lot of charm and is really good value for money. I didn't eat anything but breakfast in the hotel and I was obviously not impressed by breakfast either, since I don't remember it. Overall, this i a place I would like to come back to some day, but when I travel with the family I prefer to rent an apartment. The room was nice and clean, no view but quiet instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Belinda M
Reviews.Content: Arrived morning only to stay 1 night after a long cruise before heading home. The website looked great! Comments were very good. But reality is an eye-opener! It is located in an area where I did not feel safe. We were greeted with looks of scowls & dread...we were asked if all the luggage was ours(5 pieces). We asked for room looking out from the front of the hotel and were told in a nasty way that those were the villas! Our room was on the 4th floor with a view of the terrace. The terrace view is nothing but a dirty alley with trash! Directly in front of our noses were peoples' laundry hanging not more than 15 ft. from window and a view of people in their apts. The bed was hard as stone. Room was small, old, outdated, smelly..don't bother with TV. Bathroom had backed up water ankle deep while taking shower in lukewarm water. Hard cotton hand towels to dry off with, hard bath tissue. Rude and unfriendly hotel. Notice the pictures on the web say "professional photo"! I suggest staying in Vatican City. It is beautiful, clean & seems safe. The Hotel Napoleon Rome was expensive and offered nothing but disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwalker8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Napoleon Hotel from March 27th - April 2nd. We researched hotels for our trip for several months and finally decided to stay at Napoleon Hotel. We stayed a total of 6 nights; in the middle of our stay we traveled to a different city for the night and the hotel held our extra luggage for us while we were gone. The staff was friendly and helpful. They recommended a restaurant right around the corner. The gnocchi was amazing. The hotel is also a few blocks from the oldest gelateria and the best gelato in Rome. Our room was clean and we had a small balcony. By American standards the room was small and the shower was tiny but it was a great place to stay since most of the time we were out sight seeing. The breakfast was good and they served cappuccino and it was free. It is walking distance to the subway, I recommend walking or taking a bus as the subway is dirty. Also, I recommend paying for a car to and from the airport. We took the express train from the airport. It was 32 euro for both of us and not as convenient as taking a cab. We would stay here again if we ever get back to Rome. It was safe, a great value, and most importantly clean.

Reviews.Title: “I have just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: dastbury
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well placed to explore Rome. Minutes from the metro, with buses and the train Termini very close.The rooms were very comfortable and spotlessly clean as was the rest of the hotel. Breakfast was delicious with plenty of choice for those who wanted a cooked meal to those who might prefer just fruit and toast. Coffee was amazingly good and the service was excellent. Many thanks to the ever helpful Roberto; his suggestions encouraged us to look at things not on the usual tourist trail ( like the Michaelangelo Moses) and he and Franco were always friendly and would always go out of their way to help. Will always recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: allenpooh
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The location is a ten minute walk from the Coliseum and ancient Roman sites. The entrance to the underground is right out the front door. You can get to all the wonderful sights efficiently and inexpensively. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was no request they wouldn’t assist us with. The room could have been bigger, but it was clean and well appointed. The breakfast was excellent (how is it their bacon is better than ours?). We have found our home in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good cost for the service offered”
Reviews.Author: brunocosta1408
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in front of the metro and walking distance of termini station, which allows you to go anywhere you want in Rome. The room was clean, had a confortable bed and new bathroom. Was pretty spacious although the one I stayed had no view to the outside. Breakfast was very good, plenty of options and well prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Whitey30
Reviews.Content: We were picked up by arrangement with the Hotel by Taxi at the Airport - 48 euro. The transfer was excellent and the welcome at the hotel was very friendly. We had a medium sized room with all facilities, spotlessly clean with the most comfortable beds possible. The ensuite was fine with a powerful shower. The lounge is lovely with fresh flowers, interesting paintings and comfortable chairs. Breakfast is a comprehensive buffet and the restaurant serves delicious food - we had a complimentary dinner. All staff were very friendly and the reception staff were pleased to offer help and advice. The hotel is not in the best location for easy access to the major sites and restaurants but there is a Metro right outside. We bought a 3 day ticket for Roma Christiana Hop on Hop off Bus which included Travel on Metro and public buses all for 25euro and this ticket got us to all the major attractions. If you are over 65 do not buy the Roma pass as you can get cheap entry to the Colosseum - we booked online through http://www.tickitaly.com/ which worked well. We enjoyed our stay in Hotel Napoleon. It was comfortable and served us well at a good price. I am sure there are hotels in better locations and more modern and luxurious at a cost. But Napoleon suited us well and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First time or regular Rome visitor this perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ianbowater
Reviews.Content: This was a one night transit stop on our way to Orvieto but we would stay here for longer. It is a perfect location... minutes from Terminii Station and right on a Metro stop. The room was spacious and comfortable. The rate was very reasonable for a central Rome hotel. The public areas are like a living room. The bar and restaurant is good value and delicious fresh food. Remember to book the restaurant to avoid disappointment. Perfect for a rainy November night in Rome. The staff were courteous and helpful... all spoke good English. I felt there was a family atmosphere about the place. The owners and management were happy to have the photographs on the wall alongside all the other workers. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in Roma.”
Reviews.Author: bejula
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights in early November. We were picked up at the airport by the hotel and also received a complimentary dinner with our package. Airport pick up was fantastic! Our room was large for Europe with a separate sitting area where our daughter slept. The Hotel Concierge were excellent and provided a great map which they highlighted and colour coded with the best shopping, restaurants and sightseeing routes. We really enjoyed the breakfasts and we ate at the restaurant twice and had a great meal both times. We also loved the wine and cheese evening. Hotel WiFi was fantastic and contrary to some of the reviews we found the area to be great. It was away from the really touristy and expensive areas, however it was a short walk to the main attractions and some great local restaurants, particularly Romantica ( see separate restaurant review). All in all a terrific week in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: 165LRC
Reviews.Content: I have never encountered such warm and helpful people. The hotel was beautiful and spotlessly clean at all times, the food on offer delicious and the personal touches just made all the difference. For example, when the hotel manager heard that it was my birthday, he personally delivered a bottle of Champagne to our room! Wonderful experience, couldn't recommend more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is to much trouble!”
Reviews.Author: Leighton N
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to all the staff at the Napoleon, we stayed from the 2/11 to the 6/11, and we cant fault our stay, we were on honeymoon with a bottle of Champayne waiting for us in our room. Rooms are clean and spacious staff are excellent, and the food in the restaurant is good, Ideally located particulary for the colliseum.

Reviews.Title: “Was really nice to be here!”
Reviews.Author: Tomazas
Reviews.Content: Napoleon Hotel is really good place to stay in Rome. Maybe is a little bit expensive, but it is worth it. 5 metres from Metro station, good breakfast, nice rooms, good staff. Everything was excellent. Good restaurant. Quite are, with good supermarket just 3 minutes walk. I really advise this nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: SpencerLV
Reviews.Content: Good location, right at the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele II Metro and about a 1km walk from the Colosseum area. Termini train station was close by, not for walking but a very easy cab ride. We decided to splurge a bit and got a king deluxe room. Pros: Large room - for Europe! - good sized bed with a sitting room with sofa separated by an archway. Bathroom was really big, plenty of room for two and lots of storage shelves. We even had a walk in closet with two great spaces for large luggage. Staff was mixed, some reserved and not openly helpful, though the concierge, Roberto, very friendly and helpful with anything (he does tend to overcommit!). Nice lounge area on second floor, could get English news, papers, etc (also English news channels in rooms). Free wifi throughout hotel - thank you!! Bar in hotel was small but convenient, attached to restaurant, which was reasonably priced and handy when we were too tired to leave again. Cons: Stains on sofa, bedspread was old and tired, one of the doors on the shower kept going off its track, so there is definitely some renovation needed. Full breakfast provided but the food was not so good. Location was fine during the day, neighborhood was a little dicey at night. We never felt like we were in real danger, but there were questionable characters wandering about, lots of graffiti, and it felt a little abandoned. We never took the metro, it seemed like every cab ride in Rome was around 10 euros, so we opted for that between the 3 of us. Overall, a good price for a good location in Rome. Doesn't look like much from the outside, but once you get upstairs to the lounge, you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “They treat everyone like family!!”
Reviews.Author: Regina2878
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napoleon is very close to Termini Station, only a 10 minute walk. Plus the metro red line is right outside there front door. The Colosseum is only a 10 minute walk. The hotel is across the street from a very nice park. At night it gets very quite. The Staff is wonderful. Franco spent so much time with us helping plan out our days. We had trouble with some tours we previously booked and he helped us solve all our problems. Roberto found out is was our anniversary and sent us flowers. They have a wonderful wine and cheese on friday nights where everyone can socialize. They have a beautiful lounge area with couches and computers. There is a bar and restaurant. They truly go out of there way to make your stay memorable. Roberto told us the guest are like there extended family. The only negative is there showers and hair dryers. Hair dryers is very old from the 60's. The hand piece gets so hot it can burn your hand, so you just have to let it cool before finishing or bring your own. The shower is the size 2 x 3. Two shower doors that close together. Don't drop the soap or your butt will touch the wall. And I am an average person. After the shower water always gather on the side of the wall, not really sure where it comes from. The room is a nice size and very colorful. The queen size bed is very comfortable and so are the pillows. Be careful of the elevator on the first floor. We got stuck in it right after we got there with our luggage and the bell hop. Needless to say we walked the rest of the flights. Overall this is a wonderful hotel and I would come back again. Thank you to everyone who made our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: EstelleJwaneng
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity of spending two nights at the napoleon Hotel. We arrived a day late and as such we had lost a day of sight seeing in Rome. The staff were more than helpful to get us to see the various sites, giving us a marked up map and assisting us with tickets and instruction to the underground. Our first night we were able to spend time meeting the team and other guests at the Friday night wine tasting event; this was fantastic. The second day we had to leave early for a trip to Venice, which mean that we would have missed breakfast, but as we were departing on the trip we were handed food parcels for our trip; this is something that I have never experienced at any hotel that we have stayed at. The room was great, comfortable bed and bath room more than adequate. If anybody is in any doubt about this hotel, don't be as you will not be sorry, it is a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “A lovely caring hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandra c
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon exceeds the standards of comfort, attention and generous friendlines other hotels try to aspire to. A beautifully presented and delicious breakfast awaits you each morning. And a lovely social wine tasting invites each Friday evening to mingle with fellow guest and wonderful staff of the hotel, while enjoying outstanding wines of Italy. I look forward to my return visits. SOC , Washington State

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to everything to see”
Reviews.Author: steve s
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are 5 star. The Napoleon is conveniently located to metro, bus, and easy walking to Coliseum, Trevi, and many other great locations plus restaurants. Our room was very large and clean, the hotel has a bar, restaurant, and breakfast is included. The reception staff not only explains the Rome map, but can sell you metro tickets so you do not have to figure that out. They also offer guided tours if you want that. The hotel was recommended by a friend, and we have recommended it to our friends. We would definitely return to the Napoleon if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Gail K
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. Staff is extremely helpful and accommodating, from the concierge, to the restaurant - breakfast - bar staff to the cleaning staff. The breakfast buffet was had a large selection - something for everyone. The free Wi-fi is an added bonus. The rooms are varied - we had a small balcony (overlooking the adjacent building & laundry!hanging from the windows!) and it was pleasant to sit out in the early evening before going out to dinner. We do not speak Italian, and the staff made us feel very welcome. Service with a friendly smile makes for wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, Location and staff all a gem”
Reviews.Author: Katrina F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reccommended by my friend Natalie who stays at the hotel whenever she visits. It's about a 10min walk into the main tourist area but does offer a small selection on resturants and bars around the area. the hotel was really clean and the staff were so friendly and helpful. it was my birthday when i was there and when i came back to my room after a day out there was a bottle of champagne and a note to say happy birthday. beds were clean and comfortable and room was a good size for 2 people considering the amount of time spent in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on Oct. 4th for 4 days”
Reviews.Author: DebColMills
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. It was average. It seemed clean. We shared our room with our son & he was given a sofa to sleep on & was not very comfortable. Our bed was comfortable. It appears that this hotel is under some renovations as our daughter & son in laws room was more modern looking than ours. The staff was friendly & accommodating. The location of this hotel was not great if you like to go out in the evening as everything shuts down in this neighborhood by 8 p.m. However, there is a subway stop right out front of the hotel so that makes it very convenient to ride the Metro. Next time I would prefer to stay in an area that has more night life in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: jackie c
Reviews.Content: The staff are so friendly and helpful and did all they could to make our stay an really enjoyable one. Roberto has an amazing ability to remember each of the guests, giving that personal touch. The hotel is typically Italian & the only reason that I didn't give it an 'excellent' review is because none of the rooms had a view of the square or street. We loved the quirckiness of the lifts. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok but not great....”
Reviews.Author: JohnRCa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in August. I had a good time but I was a little disappointed with the hotel. Staff were great but I thought the hotel was bit tired - also not a lot of natural light which may have added to the impression the hotel was a bit run down. Room was fine, breakfast was ok but I'd had much better else were in Italy. I thought the hotel was expensive for what you got, hotel is the kind of place I imagine would have been amazing 20 years ago but little improvement since then. Loved Rome but I would stay somewhere else if I returned, Location was ok but I loved the Trastevere area the most and so would stay in this area next time!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Italy - Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kropee10
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Rome and the Amalfi Coast and Napoleon Hotel was our Roman hotel. We selected a package offered through the hotel to have one of the hotel's drivers pick us up. This was a smart choice on our part as our arrival in Rome caused us to be a little overwhelmed, and we didn't want to worry about finding transportation to our hotel on the other side of the city. We enjoyed the quiet, dark rooms of the hotel, our free champagne upon arrival (for our honeymoon), the free breakfast (good selection of both American and Europe favorites), the two free computers to use for free internet, and its relative proximity to the Coliseum. What we were not expecting were the hard pillows (new pillows were available through housekeeping but we did not request them), small lift, not 'right in the action' (most other attractions are a walk or a short cab ride away), and the difference in neighborhood from day to night. What was both good and bad about the hotel was the concierge staff. We had excellent luck with one member of the staff, but not so much with the other. For example, we asked prior to our visit if Romapasses would be available through the hotel and were told yes. Upon our arrival, Romapasses were not available and information was not readily provided on where we could acquire one. Since this was our first stop on our honeymoon, we were slightly expecting a higher level of helpfulness than what we encountered. For our overall visit, the hotel was very good but would probably select to stay someplace closer to the main attractions next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Tai-land
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 4 star and more on the pricier side so maybe that is why I was expecting a little more, but overall it was a good experience. Room was ok, but looked way better online. Location was quiet and not noisy at all. About a 20 min walk to the Colisseum. Breakfast was continental. They had some eggs and bacon but I passed on that. Freshed squeeze OJ was a $3 euro surcharge, otherwise you had to deal w/ crappy juice. i just drank water and cappacino/tea for breakfast. Concierge Roberto Lombardi was very nice and helpful. Talk to him if you need to book tours or need to get around in Rome. Metro right in front of hotel, but closes around 8:30pm and you need to get to some of the stations by 7:30pm in order to catch the last subway stops. Pros: Free Wifi Metro in front of hotel (but stops running at 8:30pm from Sun-Fri at least until the end of the year) Cons: Hotel Pictures are a litte deceiving (probably photoshop)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: Ideal position to visit the Forum and the Coliseum, but the area was quite seedy with a high police presence. We only stayed one night, fortunately, as we were returning home from Sorrento. The room was fine, the breakfast was terrible. We felt the hotel was vastly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: LItraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the railway station and really close to a Metro stop. You can walk to the Colliseum in just 10-15 minutes, too. The staff is very helpful and address any issues promptly. We had a request for a little soap dish in the shower and they installed one that day. Good selection for breakfast. Only complaints were that the elevators are tiny as was the shower stall. But this is Europe, so it wasn't unexpected. You can deal with that OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Maggie H
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel. The rooms were of average size, but they were so quiet and the bed was really comfortable. The staff were absolutely wonderful, so helpful and pleasant. They also mostly spoke very good english. The hotel was very convenient for both Roma Termini station and the Colliseum. The metro was right outside, although we chose to walk everywhere. On our first night the hotel restaurant was closed, but the concierge Roberto directed us to a lovely local restaurant, where we ended up eating every night. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice of breads, meats and cheese, plus lots of fresh fruit. The public areas were very well appointed. Although on a busy piazza, which was mostly market stalls and local shops, the hotel was very quiet. We had an excellent stay and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: minthillgal
Reviews.Content: As many of the reviews note, the hotel is great! One of the best sleeps we had in a two week stay in italy. The concierge was so helpful and the bed and bath were wonderful! The room though small, was very quiet, which is a rare find in Rome. The location, though very close and convenient o the Termini train station, is also somewhat shady. If you can overlook that though, its also only a 10 minute walk to the station (easy access to the airport), and 15 minutes to the Colloseum. The metro is literally just out the doors. Breakfast each morning was great and we found two fabulous restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Helen and Paul Y
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel ! Recently stayed for the 3rd time, and this time brought my mother as a celebration of her 70th birthday. The staff are the best they look after you so well, and we cannot fault the hotel facilities. Fabulous meal in the hotel restaurant on mums birthday. Everyone impressed with the location - metro outside the door but walking distance from all the attractions - what more could we want

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, geat place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ilikeallholidays
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and it was a good experience. We had the free airport pick up which is great after a long flight from Australia. I was abit disappointed when I first arrived. The photos on the website were very flattering and the hotel is not as luxurious aas they would have you believe but... the rooms are good the service friendly and the location great. The concierge was was wonderful, had a supply of maps and highlighters to help you plan your day. The breakfasts were very good and a great start ot the day. We ate in the hotel one night (one of our party had been pickpocketed so we were not in the mood to go out) the meal was very good and the price reasonable, they also have a bar that serves light lunches which we found used before we had to leave Rome. The Friday drinks get together for guests was fun and we got to swap stories with travellers from around the world. All parts together added up to an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lamaree
Reviews.Content: This was the beginning of our Italian adventure to celebrate my nieces College Graduation and the Hotel Napoleon was the perfect place to start! Everyone was very friendly, helpful & knowledgeable! There was an organized strike of the Public Transport during our stay & the desk advised us of it & how to get around the city. Our room was very spacious, quiet & calm and of course, since it was still pretty hot in Rome the A/C was a blessing. Breakfast buffet offered many choices so everyone was happy! The comfortable lobby area afforded a quiet oasis to relax after or before a day of site-seeing. The location was great for us since we all are walkers & there is a Metro stop right outside the hotel entrance which will whisk you around the city!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What I Needed”
Reviews.Author: limajt91279
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveler, I was looking for a great home-base for my four nights in Rome, Italy. Hotel Napoleon was the perfect hotel. The staff was affable and knowledgeable, and spoke great English. I booked a car through the hotel to pick up me up at FCO, and the driver was right outside the luggage area upon my arrival. The Vittorio Emanuele metro stop is right outside the hotel, which was perfect to get to most of the tourist sites (i.e. Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain). I booked a single room (fifth floor) and it was enough space for me and my luggage. The room even had a little terrace with a chair and table. The elevator is very small. I choose to take the steps during my stay. My only complaint was in the morning when the staff was cleaning the rooms - they tended to be a bit chatty and loud. The free breakfast was decent and kept me full until lunch time. Despite the minor noise hiccup, I had a comfortable stay at the Hotel Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CaAnn_11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. the front desk staff were the most professional and friendly group I have come across. Room is very nice with very good AC and TV. Breakfast was High End, eggs, bacon, fresh fruit and veggies. Best one for my 2.5 week stay in Italy. 10 min walk from hotel to aiport express train. Great value...if there is a con i would say you have a 15-20 walk to the center of Rome but I had an early flight so convenience of train station made it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Blosser123
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research on tripadvisor for our Rome hotel and I was very pleased with this hotel. We did the 3 night stay with free airport pickup on arrival and it was a great deal. Our driver Stefano arrived in time despite our flights delay. He was very nice and it was much easier than catching a cab after an exhausting flight. Rooms were ample size, very clean and breakfast was better than I expected. Good location to Colosseum and easy access to metro to anywhere in city. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and did everything to accomodate. Nice bar for a delicious glass of wine and not overpriced. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, clean, friendly hotel and decent location”
Reviews.Author: skiFriscoCO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 different occasions. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are average, clean and if you upgrade (for a slightly high price) you get a much better room, nice large bathroom and decent bedroom. You can walk to most popular sites, and good restaurants are a few blocks away. Nice park across the street, though I probably would not go through it a night. Daytime the neighborhood is o.k. and at night it is o.k. but be aware of your surroundings. At night we would walk to the more popular areas....this probably safer at night, but walking to and from the hotel is o.k. Good access to the train station, station is only a couple of blocks away. We walked with our roller bags 4 times to the train station and use the train to go to and from the airport....much better than a taxi! Also faster and much less expensive than a taxi. They have a couple of computers available (free) to check online/email. Breakfast was good. Would stay here again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Returning”
Reviews.Author: greenseasTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Napoleon Hotel in Sept 2009 along with my teenage son, and will be returning on Oct 2011 for another stay. Reason being I felt the hotel and area were safe, the rooms and hotel were clean but most of all it was the staff that makes this hotel what it is. There is nothing you cant ask that the staff will not deliver. As with any other city and or hotel there are always pros and cons but to date have not found one and therefore I am looking forward to my return trip and stay at Napoleon.. I was in room 404 overlooking the back, the breakfast was wonderful as was the bar area and wine tasting. Hope this helps and if you need further information please dont hesitate to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for our Rome Visit”
Reviews.Author: Gottagetawaymore
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you are in Rome for a few days. We stayed here three nights and found it excellent. The train station and many historic sites are within a 10-15 minute walk. The metro is just outside the front door. The staff is very accommodating, as they provided transportation and other needs. There are computers for free use - which is the only way we communicated with family back home. Yes, the rooms are typical European size and don't have a great view, but those places cost FAR more.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Napoleon Hotel on many occassions. The reason I return to this hotel is because the staff are brilliant the food is excellent and the rooms are excellent. I cannot believe the terrible review from Yalie97. Were they staying at this hotel are have they got confused???? I will be returning to Rome, hopefully in 2012 and I would not hesitate in staying at the Napoleon. My kindest regards to Franco, Roberto, Simone and Michel to name but a few of the wonderful staff. See you soon

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic week at Napoleon!!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoGator
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful six day stay at Napoleon. Great location just steps from the metro stop. The staff was very attentive. Franco helped us daily with our questions about the city and gave us a great map. The breakfast was very good, with a wide selection of food. Unlike other hotels on my Italy trip, this breakfast staff was very attentive and provided quick service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Our Magical wedding at Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: francesca m
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our perfect wedding in Rome which was on the 12/9/2011, made even more special by our week stay and wedding reception here at Napoleon. The staff were all lovely to us and our guests, also very friendly and so helpfull, a special thanks to our wedding organiser Marta who could not of done any more for us over the year and a half of planning, even though i'm sure we were fussy at times, she has alot of patience (lol). Also our bedroom was perfect and spacious with a big balcony and fantasic air conditioning in all rooms as well as lovely rooms for all guest, we much appreciate all complementry pick up's from airport and for our guests, not forgetting our champayne on arrival and bath robes and slippers, flowers, welcome note from Manager Roberto was far too much. The food was outstanding and wine, banquet room was so romantic and personal. The hotel's food and drink is very reasonable as well as the area, all guests were very happy as Rome centre is very expensive, although you can walk everywere by foot handy still and the metro is on the doorstep, so cheap. The hotel is in a safe and good area and so reaonable and do not be put off by any other rare reviews, its very clean aswell, music provided was brilliant too, thank you. Big Thanks to Roberto (Manager for his personal touch to us and to Marta and all the staff of Napoleon, we will for return as well as our guests and advise other's to stay here too. Alot of Thanks and Appreciation, John Bosco & Francesca Mc Grath 23/9/2011

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel at convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Tanyj
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at this hotel after reading up on all the reviews on Tripadvisor. Service was good, the concierge offers a printing service to print out documents. What I liked most was that the room and bathroom is clean, and housekeeping did a good job of ensuring cleanliness throughout my 4 day stay. Breakfast is AMAZING! Scrambled eggs/Omelette with bacon, various croissants/rolls, wide variety of ham/cold cuts, juices, cereal and interesting bakes/pies. Even the complimentary coffee tastes real good hot and delivered with hot milk! Many types of butter/jam/condiments that is displayed for hotel guests to choose from.
