Just the breakfast itself is much value for money. The hotel looks a little old, but the cleanliness and warm service of the staff makes up for it. Overall a nice cosy hotel, and a short walk of 5-10 minutes to Station Termini. I would stay here again if I ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not expansive hotel”
Reviews.Author: mia w
Reviews.Content: this hotel is near a square that I consider interesting,Piazza Vittorio, here on a Roman ruin is the formula to make gold amazing! the hotel is very nice for the furniture style of the nineteenth century, the palace is so named Umberto I style, so I told the concierge, but rooms are the same style, seemed to be back back in time by comparing the prices of the hotel where we were in Venice, here are much lower, luxurious roof garden with a good breakfast, good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: reddaithi
Reviews.Content: This is a real jem of a hotel. Close to Termini and not far from all the main sights. The staff are top class, really friendly. Cannot fault the Room in anyway. Spacious (except for bathroom), clean and well air conditioned. Reasonably priced too. The only fault i have is that the bar does not expect cash so you can find yourself running up a tab that you only discover at check out, however this is only a small problem. All in all, i cannot fault it. Top Class.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to us, and we recommend it too”
Reviews.Author: DeskTraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel central to Termini station and right by a metro stop. Small rooms, of course, but nice bathrooms, comfortable bed, and very quiet. Nice breakfast buffet. Didn't really enjoy the hotel restaurant for dinner compared to other restaurants in Rome - it was OK, just not great. The staff works very hard - dinner staff was serving again the next morning for breakfast! Book as far in advance as possible, as room rates go up incrementally as you get closer to your stay (not sure of their exact formula but the price seemed to go up $10 from 3 months out to 2 months, and 2 months to 1 month).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: little_old_devil
Reviews.Content: Just one stop from Rome's central station and an easy walk to all of Rome's main tourist sites The Napoleon was the perfect base from which to explore the city. The staff were bilingual, friendly and went above and beyond to help. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Wifi was always available free of charge and the location was quiet enough to feel like you weren't in the centre of a tourist trap. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: Traveler190511
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveninetly located next to a Metro exit but quite a walk from the center. Area looks a bit run down butbhas some nice places to eat in the area such as La Sorgente (good Chinese restaurant 100 m away and Fassi the ice cream factory, both see separate reviews). Staff is friendly, room small but ok, bathroom refurbished with very tiny shower cabin. Be careful: Water in shower switches temperature from very hot to cold unexpectedly. Free and fast Internet in hotel is great. Breakfast is good. Tried the restaurant once and was pleasantly surprised by the qualityof the food, service and professional staff. Paid €175 per day plus tax so certainly not cheap but I guess that's what you can expect in Rome. Many reviewers write about the 2 tiny elevators and I agree they are a bit weird but not a big hindrance. All in all a reasonably good stay but nothing special..

Reviews.Title: “We will certainly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonsonTour
Reviews.Content: We chose Napoleon Hotel for our sightseeing trip to Rome because of the reviews we read on Tripadvisor and I can honestly say we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived at the Hotel we found the staff more than helpful. Our room was practical, cool with aircon (much needed as the temperature was 30+, and sufficient for our requirements. The bed was comfy and we slept well every night which was much needed due to exhausting sightseeing each day. We noted a review which mentioned pillows......all you had to do was ask. Just as we got into bed on our first night we realised there were only two pillows. We called reception and within 2 minutes a member of staff was knocking on the door with two extra - very comfortable - pillows! Outside the Hotel is a Metro stop and across the Park was a bus and tram stop and it's only a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum!! So a great location. We cannot thank the staff enought for their assistance with our sightseeing of Rome - especially Franco. The initial map he gave us saw us through four days of signtseeing and some lovely evening venues - the detail of information - bus routes, metro, restuarants, timetables was just fantastic - and the Opera Concerto he recommended was wonderful! Thank you Franco. Breakfast is included in the price and there is plenty of choice - from cold meats and cheese, to cereals, to bacon and eggs and toast and constant supply of hot beverages. Just a personal recommendation - Forno Roscioli - a superb little deli/bakery/restuarant just round the corner from the Hotel - ask Franco. We popped in there on Franco's recommendation and the welcome was just wonderful, along with the food and wine. The staff were extremely friendly and we will definately eat there again on our return - not expensive either! All in all - we would thorougly recommend Napoleon Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best values in italy”
Reviews.Author: george j
Reviews.Content: a wonderfull place to be in,specially in italy,where warmth,hospitality and proffesionalism are hard to find ,the staff will go out of there way to help you ,and accomodate you in any possible way.we were two families,they put us close together on the same floor,the other family left behind in the hotel a small bag on the way to the train station after checking out ,the bag had valubles,and they sent the taxi cab to termini station to give us that bag,when we arrived in the morning and the room was not ready since it was too early,they sent us to have breakfast at their free breakfast room and pass time for the room to be ready,the owner is wonderfull person,so is fabio and the whole staff that are a big family,that strive to show you warmth.all other hotels on our trip were terrible although they were from a comparable class and more expensive.i would never stay in rome in another hotel.i am thankfull and gratfull for the experience.the rooms are spacious (we were 4 people in each room).clean, with very good airconditioning,and free wifi and computers in the lobby for general use.with metro station a few stepps from the hotel to take you anywhere in rome.my imppressions of italy in general with hotels restaurants waiters that are very rude arrogant and unproffessional in general,napoleone hotel was the ecception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome - Great Value - Great Service - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy D
Reviews.Content: 1) Hotel - The hotel is very nice and is well appointed. Each room has a great A/C which you can set so that your room is extremely cold if you like. The rooms are small (as are most rooms in Europe), but bigger than my rooms in both London and Paris. The only complaint (which is minor) is that the shower is tiny. The rooms do not appear to have been remodeled recently, but are extremely clean and have been kept up very nicely. The bed is comfortable. 2) Location - It is not centrally located, but is still only a short walk away from just about everything you would want to see in Rome. Maybe a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum, a 20-30 minute walk to Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps, a 30-40 minute walk to Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori, and a 45-60 minute walk to the Vatican and St. Peter's Basilica. All of these times are of course estimates and are very leisurely walks. - In addition, the metro stop is DIRECTLY outside of the hotel. Thus, if you do not want to walk you can easily take the metro to many of the locations mentioned above. On my way back from the Spanish Steps it took me about 15 minutes from the time I left the Spanish Steps to the time I was sitting in my hotel room. - Although not centrally located, I still think the location is EXCELLENT. 3) Staff - The staff is wonderful (especially Franco, the head concierge). Franco took the time to map out a fantastic walking route of Rome, tell me what times were the best times to avoid lines at particular places (which he was right about), and recommend places to visit and restaurants to eat at. The entire staff is friendly and willing to help you with any of your needs. Although this is a 75 room hotel, they try to make you feel like you are the only guest and really make you feel at home. 4) Miscellaneous - The WIFI works great in the hotel rooms. - The hotel offers a free buffet breakfast (which I cannot opine to as I have not actually eaten it yet, but I assume like everything else the hotel has to offer it is excellent). - On Friday nights, the hotel invites all of its guests to a little reception where they have light snacks and wine (all complimentary). - It is very quiet and you will be able to sleep in as late as you like with no disturbances. All in all, this is the best hotel I have stayed in thusfar in Europe (I have also been to London and Paris). I think the value is fantastic and would definitely return to this hotel on any future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT WEE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dopey2901
Reviews.Content: Don’t be put off by the unimposing entrance and small reception area. Inside there is an excellent hotel where the staff are friendly, informative and always willing to help. With rooms overlooking an inside courtyard there is no traffic noise allowing a peaceful sleep after a hard day’s sightseeing. There is free Internet access and rooms have air conditioning. Breakfast at the hotel is excellent with a wide choice of food and drinks – the buffet is constantly replenished to ensure an ample supply of food for everyone. A small reasonably priced bar is open from 11.00 am and the lounge next to the bar is spacious. With a central location transport is good: outside the hotel is the Metro and a 2 minute walk through the park takes you to buses and trams. A 10-minute walk will take you to Termini Station where you can find long distance trains, bus station, another Metro station and trams. I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends and would have no hesitation in returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok, not worth of four star”
Reviews.Author: Anu A
Reviews.Content: Staff is very good and helpful in all perspective. Room wasn't good, small room. During checkout only i was able to find out minibar in room. Lots of variety in brekfast but hot options were very less only. Would be nice to have if there are some more hot stuff duing breakfast. Tea/coffee which is very much essential during breakfast was also cold.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: tenny500
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Rome are often underwhelming and stars unwarranted. The Napoleon has great staff, very friendly and breakfast is excellent. The reception area doesn't do it justice but there are some nice lobby areas and a cost bar. Good value for money also and free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “1000% recommend - everything was excellent”
Reviews.Author: UkJonb
Reviews.Content: We stayed hear for 4 nights in Aug 2011 2 adults and daughter 17 and son 15. We we picked up from the airport at 11:00 by Taxi sorted out by hotel and taken straight to hotel. As our room was not ready we were invited to stay in their lounge with tv and free internet. Room was very clean and was big enough for the 4 of us. Had meal in hotel first night and was very good. We requested more pillows etc and staff were very helpfull. Roberto at the entrance desk went out of his way to be helpfull and arranged the tours etc we wanted to go on. Also recommended some good resturants, all the staff very very helpfull and all requests were acted on very quickly. On the last day we found the oldest icecream factory just round the corner and it was the best ice cream we had whilst in Rome. Cannot recommend hotel enougth - very hepfull staff , aircon in rooms was very good and the free wifi was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, simple rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: stevenr35
Reviews.Content: This is a busy hotel, lots of people really like it so not sure what I can add to this. Stayed here for 5 nights on business. Free wi-fi a plus and was basically outside the metro station. Very convenient. It was very reasonably priced for Rome too. Everything was very clean. Air condition in the rooms (not always a given for Rome). Quite a trek to the rooms with 2 different lifts due to the quirky hotel layout. Small bar opened in the evenings. The rooms were very simply furnished and the bathrooms too. Bed was pretty hard and those terrible pillows! Tiny slivers of foam. I personally would have graded the hotel a 2 star hotel: the 4 star rating is perplexing. Hot water was variably scalding to cold when having a shower. Got scalded a couple of times! Plentiful free breakfast and very busy in the morning. Far and away the best part of the hotel was the staff. They were fantastic. Multi-lingual, charming, very very helpful. They clearly know what they are doing and this makes the hotel worthwhile. Otherwise we're looking at a cheap but basic tourist hotel but they elevate it to something much more. Having said that, I'd be reluctant to stay there again because the room was so simple, the bed and pillows were bad and the bathroom and shower issues were a little too much. Maybe my room was unlucky.....clearly this is a much loved hotel by many people. I was going to give it 4/5 but the fact that I wouldn't stay there again means I have to give it 3/5, even with the superb staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: montgod
Reviews.Content: My family and friends stayed here for one night after a cruise to catch an airplane the next morning. I have to say that I was thoroughly impressed by the hotel staff and how helpful they were. Really made our stay, albeit for one night, a memorable one. Highly recommended! And just to give a few details, we were able to book a few double rooms for about 125 Euro per night which is a steal in Rome. Not only that but it included free wifi and breakfast along with a free invite for a wine tasting event in the evening at the hotel that they hold regularly. Rooms were very spacious and clean. It isn't the newest hotel, but you hardly even think about that with how helpful and gracious the staff were, the central location of the hotel in conjuction with the sites, and the affordable price of what the hotel offered. Not only that, If we had stayed three nights, the hotel offers a free ride to the airport!! What really summed up our experience was that during checkin we let them know we wouldn't be able to take advantage of the free breakfast since we had to catch an early morning flight. They responded by saying that it wouldn't be a problem and would box up our breakfast to take with us. We thought they might forget since we didn't mention it again, but as we left the next morning at 6am, there were seven bags waiting for us with a plentiful breakfast! Just a wonderful stay and would definitely stay again. Thanks Napolean staff!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and hope to be back someday”
Reviews.Author: avfalk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Napoleon for four nights in July and loved it. The rooms are basic but sparkling clean and comfortable, with a nice-sized bathroom, fridge with water, wine, liquor and pop, and it was very quiet, with comfortable beds. The hotel is wonderfully located within walking distance of all the sites. The concierge, staff, bartender, and diningroom (Mary is a sweetheart) staff were fabulous, friendly and always willing to help. Our two tours booked from home did not include hotel pickup but the concierge arranged it for us by calling the tour comany direct. One morning the tour had a particularly early departure and our boxed breakfast was at the front desk, waiting for us. And then the concierge called the breakfast room and had them open for us so we could have a capaccino while waiting for the tour company to arrive. The wine tasting evening was fabulous with lots of wine and appies. We would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat and if we're lucky enough to go back to Rome someday, will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely will come back!”
Reviews.Author: mikedief
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel from other reviews on this site, and I wasn't disappointed! The outstanding: - The staff! Always willing to help with any questions I had. The very good: - The location. Walking distance to Colosseum, other attractions. Laundrymat nearby if you need to wash clothes. - The breakfast buffet. Runs from 7-10 except Sunday when it's 7-10:30 - Metro stop right outside the hotel door The good: - Free internet access. Speeds aren't tiptop but adequate for checking email or doing facebook. Just don't upload too much! The fair: - Rooms are a bit on the small side, but I knew about that before. Shower setup was somewhat awkward. Other comments: Some other reviewers warned of pickpocketers in the area. We never ran in to any sort of issue like that, but of course we exercised due diligence. At no time did we feel unsafe, even coming back to the hotel at night. Other reviews complained about thin walls. I didn't hear anything from next door, but maybe the rooms were empty or the people were quiet. Either way, it was not a problem for me. Again I'll say how helpful the staff was. Couldn't ask for more. Anyone visiting between 1-30 August 2011 be informed that part of the metro subway is closed due to construction of a new "C" line. There are buses that are taking its place but those buses tend to be cramped. It's a PITA sometimes, but definitely not the fault of the hotel. To sum up.....EXCELLENT visit, whenever I make it back to Rome I'll definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantatstic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tully96
Reviews.Content: Definitely loved the hotel and staff. Francesco and Mary were awesome and very helpful. The hotel was clean, great breakfast and great restaurant, fantastic staff, close to awesone restaurants and very convenient to transit. 15 minutes walk to the Collesseum. Would definitely go back to the Hotel Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel,great location, superb staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: REALNICE
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel and the staff. This is the second stay here and when checking in they remembered that and even though we arrived about 10A.M. our room was ready. Front desk staff always very helpful especially Franco and Domenico. When we asked for a map they proceeded to layout, public transportation routes, shopping areas and restaurants. The metro stop is right outside their front door, very convient also very close to main train station. Rooms very comfortable, shower a little small, but that seems to be the norm in European hotels in this price range. Breakfast room was light and airy and with many choices. Staff always had a smile and eager to serve. In conclusion I don't know where a previous negative reviewer stayed, but it couldn't have been here as previous reviews all seemed to have positive experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Deluded Sense of Grandure”
Reviews.Author: Podgemonster
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this expensive hotel for a less than average cramped room. I felt the staff were very unhelpful, information on the city was poor, one receptionist answered the phone while he I was speaking to me and waved me away, while inquiring about a suitable nearby restaurant we were informed to get a bus,asking the breakfast staff in the morning for something was like asking them to jump out the window, felt very unwelcome. No tea or coffee making facilities. The bathroom was nice. The computers with internet access were useful. The area was shabby with homeless people and flea markets just 100m from the entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent public areas, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RubyLuby
Reviews.Content: Although the room decor was slightly dated the public areas were very impressive with deep carpeting and good quality furniture including a grand piano! Everything spotlessly clean and friendly helpful staff. Superb buffet breakfast included in the price, choice of meats, cheeses lots of fresh fruit, breads, scrambled eggs, bacon, cereals etc. Aircon brilliant and NO traffic noise. Free WiFi and laptop access. Manager arranged free wine tasting with delicious snacks and spoke with each individual guest - great! A 10 minute walk to the Colisseum then a short walk to the Trevi fountain, Spanish steps etc. Metro 1 minute away. Will stay here again on next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Italian trip January 2011”
Reviews.Author: Byrne-Sweeney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel the second week of January. Walking from the train.station was a bit of a hike but the hotel staff was kind and whisked our bags straight to our room. Although we didn't have much of a view our room was comfortable and kept us warm. The Hotel had a great bar and hosted a wine tasting our last night which was a great way to say farewell to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: SusQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming, conveniently located right next to a metro stop, walking distance from the colusseum, does a decent breakfast and most of all the service is fantastic. ok, so it might not be the grandest option in Rome and the rooms can be quite small, particularly the singles on the 4th floor, but mine had a little balcony, so who's complaining, but we were looking for something relatively inexpensive and this had such good reviews on trip advisor that we booked it. all I can say is that everybody is not wrong, I would definately recommend this hotel, the concierges were amazing, helping superbly with all requests including dining recommendations, directions to the nearest ATM, providing maps, ordering us countless taxis, speaking English (and I think several other languages fluently) and even greeting me by name when I walked through the door when I arrived - still not sure how they did that! They also went above and beyond the call of duty to sort out a bit of a mess caused by one of my ditsy colleagues and I'm sure one of them even came in on their day off to help!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Mid Range Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Beaverton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon for 6 nights. Hotel is conveniently located. Termini station is about a 10 minute walk with luggage while the Colosseum is 15 minutes walk away. There is a Metro station right outside. Surrounding area is not touristy and the Metro stops operating at 9pm. So be prepared to pay for taxi or walk if you like to experience the night life in Rome. If you like to be in the midst of the action, then this is not the hotel for you. Look for a hotel near Navona instead. Otherwise, it is a nice, quiet hotel that has easy access to most attractions when the Metro is running. We were in a Triple and the room is definitely adequate in terms of size and furnishing. The flat screen TV is small and the beds are hard. The bathroom with a bidet and awkward placement of the toilet makes it not as user friendly. From the front desk, you have to go up a long flight of steps or use a tiny elevator to get to the main lobby area. An interesting thing is they turn off the AC in the lobby during the day and in Summer, that can be suffocating. Having said all that, please don't be put off because I think that is the norm for a mid priced hotel in Rome. For similar American 4 stars standard in Rome, you will have to pay an arm and a leg. For the price conscious travelers, I think this is a good compromise.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay just as much as the first time three years ago”
Reviews.Author: nineteen1919
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel is very conveniently located near a metro stop and is within walking distance to many of the major tourist sites, including the Colosseum. The staff speak English and were welcoming when we arrived. Indeed, any time we needed information, they were very willing to help. The rooms are average size for a Europen hotel and comfortable. Since my last visit the rooms have been renovated and this work is continuing to improve the soundproofing. That is the only complaint that I had. If you have a noisy neighbour as we had our first night, then a sensitive sleeper will be disturbed. The general manager has advised me that the soundproofing will be improved, including new doors for all rooms. They serve a good buffet breakfast which is included in the room rate. If you need to get going before breakfast starts at 7 a.m., they will provide a box breakfast. I will certainly use this hotel on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Very Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: areyesdove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon for four nights. The airport transportation was perfect after our long flight. The breakfasts were very good and there was plenty to choose from. The rooms were very nice for an older hotel in Rome. The hotel is located in walking distance to the Collesium, Palestine Hill and many wonderful churches. We attended the Friday night wine tasting and met with Robert Cioce, the General Manager and he gave us several recommendations for places to see in Tuscany. He even printed us directions! His recommendations were wonderful and helped make the rest of our trip in Italy a huge success! We would definitely stay there again! Alicia and Nick Reyes

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BoysMom66
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in 2 rooms (2 adults in one / 3 older children next door) and quickly learned why we couldn't have 5 in any single room. The rooms are tiny as is typical of Rome and the beds (each one smaller than a US twin) fill the space. The showers are retro-fitted stalls and my husband (6'4") had to open the door to soap his feet. The only things smaller are the elevators that can hold one person with a suitcase at a time. But that is part of the "charm" of staying in a 150 year old hotel and our best memories. There are wide open public areas with TV and internet access. The breakfast buffet is fantastic and made it easy to start the day. The metro, Eurorail and taxis are outside the door and the old city is walking distance. The staff is warm and helpful and were always ready to assist.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingbug3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Napoleon for 13 nights in July. I had emailed the hotel previous to arriving and mentioned that we were arriving earlier than check-in. Upon arrival, the driver was ready to take us to the hotel and the hotel had our room ready for an early check-in. Franco did a wonderful job in preparing and explaining a map for us (which had to be taped several times throughout our stay). The beds are a little on the firmer side, however, if you ask at the front desk, they will supply a softer one for you. The breakfast every morning was delicious with a lot of variety. The breakfast staff do a great job - the first morning we were there, we did not realize our watches were behind by an hour, and ended up going for breakfast after 10:00. The staff still accommodated us, without complaint. We attended the wine tasting on Friday evenings. This was a very nice touch. The owner of the hotel attempts to meet as many of the guests as possible. We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant. It is a small restaurant which gives it an intimate feeling and the food was very good. The entire concierge staff is fantastic. They will give you directions to get to places or just tell you which restaurants locals like. Overall, the entire staff was very welcoming and respectful to us. There is a playground in the park right across the street which we took our 3 year old to and the metro stop is right out the door of the hotel. Would definitely stay in this hotel again. Thanks again for a great holiday from Karen, Bill, and Kiersten

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: debbieb1955
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this great hotel for 5 days. The staff was friendly and knowledgable. The rooms and sitting areas were very clean and well kept. Thge location of this hotel was definitely excellent-close to metro, stores, restaurants and sites. We enjoyed wonderful breakfasts every day. We will definitely recommend the Hotel Napoleon to other travellers . Our stay there was awesome in every respect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family place!”
Reviews.Author: post5
Reviews.Content: This was a PERFECT hotel! We really enjoyed our stay! Very clean- updated- large bathrooms- and quiet! Very close to the colosseum- train station. The staff was soooo nice! Our family of 5 walked outside at night and never had any problems at all! Breakfast was perfect and always greeted and asked if we wanted coffee etc... so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Metro with a great restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: MrsDann
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon had small, yet clean rooms. Its only a ten minute walk from the Colosseum. The food was dynamite! The complimentary breakfast is wonderful. The hotel's restaurant had the most wonderful and reasonably priced (for Rome, anyway) food. The service was great. We loved this hotel and we'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Only complaint is that the shower was VERY tight.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a capital in Southern Europe”
Reviews.Author: sun010
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Napoleon Hotel and were basically very pleased with the stay. Best parts: - Nice, clean room with air con and large bathroom. - No traffic noise at all at night since our room was facing the courtyard. - Very accommodating staff at the reception. - Free Wi Fi that worked perfectly fine. - Great to have both in room safe and mini-bar to store cold water in the July heat. - Very good selection at the breakfast buffée. - The hotel is conveniently located just a few meters from a Metro Stop (Vittorio Emanuele). On the downside: - Metro stops running at 9 pm except Saturdays until April 2012. - Very thin walls between the rooms. - The area around the hotel is not the best and nicest for shopping and dining. (But do try Trattoria Vecchia just around the corner - amazing authentic food and great atmosphere). The Colosseum and Forum Romanum is a short walk away. There is a few Metro stops to the area around The Spanish Steps and Fontana di Trevi. That is where I should stay if it was important for me to stay in a more upscale area. Napoleon Hotel is a great choise if its´more important to get as much as possible for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Spot in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: sparkyygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights with my daughter. I had wanted to stay here the last time I was in Rome so I did so this time. We stayed for 6 nights which included a free airport pick-up and dinner. They had this special on the internet. Their rate was competitive for a four star. They are within walking distance of the main termini. It was around a 15 minutes walk. Literally right outside their door is the entrance to one of the metro stops. This is one stop from the main termini. If you have luggage you would need to be able to carry it up and down stairs. If you are new to Rome this hotel would be so very easy to find since all you would need would be the correct stop and direction to go when you leave the stop. This information the hotel could provide. They have a free breakfast which was great and made for a wonderful start to the day. The rooms were extremely clean, he even washed the floor! I have rarely seen this this. They were always very helpful and friendly with all of our questions. The air conditioning was sufficient. The also have free Wifi and computers that you can use. I would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms are small but this is pretty standard for Rome. Beds are pretty hard but they were in our other hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mzhelen
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights here last week and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location is great - the metro A line is literally right outside the door, and it's only 1 stop to Termini (the main train station) where you can transfer to the B line to go down to the Colisseum, or stay on the A line out to the Vatican. The hotel is clean, modern, and the concierges all spoke perfect English. The breakfast was terrific in a very nice breakfast room, and it stayed open until 10 (much later than some other places). The room was decent sized for a city hotel, and the bathroom featured a full tub/shower (most European hotels have just a stall shower). There was a Friday night welcome party/wine tasting in the bar - 2 different wines and lots of nice hors d'oeuvres (free). We never ate in the restaurant as there are plenty of great restaurants in the neighborhood. This isn't the overwhelmingly touristy area, which meant it felt safer at night, the restaurants were better and less expensive, and there were amenities in the area. The hotel was able to make arrangements for a car service to pick us up at the airport. If you do, it's not part of the hotel so you'll have to pay the driver in cash (euros). Still worth it if you want the convenience of a car service meeting you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for Rome standards”
Reviews.Author: Sandra64
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Napoleon with my family. I often travel to Rome for work so I know several hotels. The Napoleon has the best quality/price ratio of all the hotels I stayed in Rome. As someone else pointed out, rooms don't look like '4 stars', but consider that in Rome it is really difficult to find even 3 stars reasonably prized hotels, so in this respect the Napoleon is a very good choise. We had a double room with an additional bed. The bathroom was spacious with a tub and a window. No view from the room. Breakfast was very good. The common areas are the best part of the hotel. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful. The hotel is located in a 'not so nice' area, but it is at walking distance from Termini train station and the Colosseum. Exactly in front of the hotel there is a metro station. All in all, I think I will stay there again and I definitely would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “not so great for family”
Reviews.Author: nickgaudreau
Reviews.Content: ok. breakfast was great, very clean, very friendly staff. but the problem is with the location when you are with young kids. near plazza vittorio - filled with drunken beggards. not great for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: SNFF
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and in good shape. The people were very helpful, kind, and spoke very good English. The hotel restaurant was very tasty and the room was a reasonable size and very modern bathroom. Good breakfast. Very worth while to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and a frat base for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: CHerron
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and the rooms were comfy. We were picked up at the airport by a friendly taxi driver, the staff were very welcoming and the hotel was clean. Breakfast had a selection of breads, & toast (with various spreads). But the fruit was overripe and off and the juices weren't fresh- fresh orange juice cost extra. This did not detract from our stay and we had a great time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Adamtamai
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent. Rooms were clean and cozy, and the staff treats you like family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome - Incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: christyreznor02
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel is an excellent choice in Rome. Great location. It is walking distance to Colosseum and Forum. The property is beautiful. Nice rooms. Very clean. Great breakfast. The hotel staff is incredible. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. The Head Concierge, Franco Quirinis, was especially helpful. He made our stay that much more enjoyable. Everything about our stay was terrific. I would definitely stay at the Napoleon Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly nice hotel, did what it said on the tin”
Reviews.Author: mand15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Hotel overall was very clean, with well kept common areas and very helpful, knowledge and friendly staff (at all hours of the day and night as we found with an early morning checkout). One drawback was that our room, whilst comfortable and clean, was a little on the small side and so, I feel value for money suffered slightly. Location wise, hotel is very close to the Colosseum so it meant a pleasant stroll to arrive there by foot rather than by Metro. Speaking of Metro, there is a stop right outside the hotel, however, that particular line is closed each weeknight from 9pm until 2012 due to works on Rome's new Metro line. Buses are fairly reliable and a useful alternative as it's makes for seeing the city rather than travelling underground all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!! Excellent Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Foodaholic5270
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon is located right outside the train station just a few steps away. The desk attendents are very knowledgeable and professional. The location is within easy walking distance of Mary Magiore Church - one not to be missed. Our room had a separate sitting area where the sofa opened into a bed. The rooms are spacious and the hotel has a certain amount of charm and warmth of elegance - priced reasonably considering location. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: debra_weinber
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week at the Napoleon and it was terrific! Great service, breakfast and very clean and accommodating. Great wine reception on Friday night. Roberto was terrific...very helpful and friendly. The room was small (single room) but very clean and quiet - no street noise. Walls are thin and you can hear your neighbors talking. This seems to very standard in Italy in the smaller old hotels. Just bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay, very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: hrw2mom
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here while returning from our trip to Naples. We booked online and were directed to a triple room on the 6th floor. It had a very large bathroom with tub and shower and a large patio. Roberto, the concierge was exceptionally helpful. He gave directions over the phone and then upon arriving helped us book last minute online tickets to the Vatican, as well as arranging a taxi and boxed breakfast for us in the morning! The hotel is well-appointed with a bar and restaurant, two computers and a lounge area. My only complaints are the apparent lack of a vacuum (all the public area carpeting was in desperate need) and the disrepair of the hallway on the 6th floor (which didn't seem to be in use for guests besides us). My friends peeked down the other floors and found them to be in much better condition. Overall, I'd book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: Jojo-bigD
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Superior room. These have a sizable European bathroom, and are super-clean. And VERY quiet!, considering location. Located on the Vittorio Emmanuelle garden, walking distance to Colosseum and Forum. Concierge calls your taxis etc., gives good directions. The restaurant bar is open when you ding the little desk bell, and the breakfast room is really quite refreshing, with good strong Italian caffe' to wake you up of a morning. There's a restaurant too but we didn't use it. There are little caffe' bars and gelaterias nearby as always. Being "downtown" gets you downtown prices, but you didn't go to Rome to pinch pfennigs, now DID you!

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon Hotel - Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: anglersvilla
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport & were able to check into our room immediately even though we were very early! They were absolutely wonderful and made our 3 night stay in Rome perfect! The hotel is in a great location and the staff were all most helpful. Wireless internet in our room worked fine. Breakfast was included and it was excellent! The front desk always helped us with calling taxi's, directions and answered every question we had.Their English was very good. Hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable & roomy. The elevators are small but adequate. We would highly recommend this hotel and if we ever visit Rome again, we would definitely choose the Napoleon Hotel! Thank you for a wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: jana_d_t
Reviews.Content: The room we were in was smalish but practical, we did like it though. The breakfast was great with a lot of great choices, and the staff was extremely friendly which made our stay so much better. the food in the hotel restaurant was to our surprise better than some of the expensive restaurant in the city. This was a great choice to go on a holiday for two, we can't wait for the next time...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff; Metro 10 Meters; nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BrasilBobPam
Reviews.Content: This is our 66th country. The staff is as good as the best anywhere. Conceirge staff is outstanding. Breakfast buffet is good. Very clean everywhere... rooms, etc. Agree - rooms are just average - but nice. Not 4 star - but we'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But Not a 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Nicky025
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, almost door to door to the metro Station. Very friendly & Helpful Staff. Average Room: ok in terms of size, there was Dust on the sidebed tables, No Dustbin Breakfast Average in terms of quality & variety. Twice the tea cups were NOT clean & we asked for other ones ...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, just too far away”
Reviews.Author: Cook69
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel and had good staff, who were very helpful. The bathroom was small and basic , bedroom was pretty typical size wise (small), had nice decor but lacked amenities such as a jug etc. It did have a balcony window which was nice for fresh air but had no view. Walls were quite thin and you could hear people in the the hallways.The area it was in was reflected in the price and I would recommend if you can afford a bit more, stay in the historical centre if you can't then stay here as the hotel in itself is fine. If you ride the metro, which is right out side, watch for pickpockets as we got robbed, they took my husbands wallet from his front pocket!

Reviews.Title: “Happy To Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Bambi53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel for four nights in May 2008 and were generally very impressed. We were made to feel most welcome by the friendly staff and we found the location to be very convenient. Based on this, we recommended the hotel to friends, who were having a few nights in Rome in May 2011. I emailled ahead to let the hotel know our friends were coming and that we had highly recommended the Napoleon to them. When our friends arrived, they were not disappointed. They had a wonderful stay, a lovely room and excellent attention from the staff. We were very happy to hear that all was as we said it would be. Thank you Roberto and staff. We'll be back in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: gus1959
Reviews.Content: My wife enjoyed our stay at Hotel Napoleon. We stayed for 4 nights in May, 2011. The staff was extremely helpful and accomadating. The hotel is family owned and operated and are attentive to details. The restaurant was very good and reasonably priced. The Friday night manager's reception was very well done with excellent selection of cheeses and red or white wine. My special thanks goes out to Roberto at the conceriege desk for fulfilling a special request to act as interpreter for my wife's great aunt and uncle. Roberto spent 4 hours on his off night to help us out and we were very appreciative of this gesture. One big bonus of the hotel is it is just a few steps away from the Metro station which will take you to a lot of the sights in Rome. Another bonus is free internet access and a nice buffet breakfast in the morning. The hotel is near the Train Station and the cost of a cab is under 10 euros to the hotel, The staff made our arrangements for a tour of the Vatican, called the airlines when our bags were missing for 2 days and made arrangemnts for a shuttle service from the hotel to the airport. I would definetly consider the Hotel Napoleon for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: fla030
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and just loved it. The staff was very friendly, the room was comfortable and the breakfast was amazing. The hotel is located very close to the central train station and has a subway stop right outside the door. We found the hotel to be in a great location, our furthest walk was back from the vatican and that only took 35 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DRebeor
Reviews.Content: First trip in Rome and chose the hotel from the Trip Advisor website. From the concierge to the breakfast room staff, everyone made us feel very welcome and were exceedingly helpful. Room was nicely decorated and bathroom was modern. Location is excellent for getting around most of the city and walking distance to the train station. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable, homely, warmly welcoming, hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoWLetchworh
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to Rome. As part of booking concierge took steps to ensure all needs would be met on arrival - all undetaken by email, very friendly. Concierge took extra steps to help plan our days to get the best out of three 3 day stay. His help was fantstic -planning maps for each day with time schedules in order we had best advantage, booking trip .and even walking and introducing to local travena in order we could submerge ourselves into local atmosphere. Room small,comfortable, clean and functional , note this was off set by large areas to loungs / chat on first floor. You may need a suite if you wish a bigger room. Small wait to access internet - not a problem. Concierge enabled flight book in and print out on last day. Although booked out, luggage left whilst we had a final day of sightseeing. On return sought to have a comforrt break ackonwledging we were officially no longer client. We were welcomed with 'You have not left our family home yet, your luggage is here, please go relax and talk as long as you need to prepare for your journey home'. Enabling a frshen up, and afternnoon tea in the restaurant before we left. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Palace”
Reviews.Author: brian3344
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport by Hotel chauffer...and from that minute we were extended a warm welcome. Once we arrived at the Hotel we were met and greeted like never before...and we both have travelled...but Here it felt like freinds greeting us at home. Quickly but without any rush we were checked in and shown to our room personally by the Recepton manager. The Room was spacoius and had all amaenities you would wish for.... Tele, Teas made, and wireless internet free of charge in the bedrooms. ..amoungst other amenities you look for on holidays. We stayed 6 nights and every night was with good sleep because our room backed onto a very quiet cout yard.. ..and we were on the 4th floor. Breakfast every morning was in a large and comfortable room...where the staff were always on hand to serve you while you helped your self to the buffet style breakfast...Very enjoyable start to the day.. Then you go off and enjoy the day...Then you return to hotel...and if you relax in the bar...where it is qiuet and calm.....you can have a relaxing drink.....or take advantage of the Hotels large screen tele in a lounge area just outside of the bar.....where you can control the remote yourself to view Sky HD channels on this partici;ar tele...what a picture... Or you should try the hotels dinner menu....such a wonderful treat...and such wonderful food... Just to end .....by sayng the Hotel Napoleon wil rank as on of the top i have ever visited or stayed in..and without boasting i do consider i have travelled alot throughout the world...but this Hotel is a palace........Give it a try........

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home - but better”
Reviews.Author: simpsonllynn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Napoleon Hotel and on both occasions we feel we could not have chosen a better place to stay. The hotel arranged car transfer from the airport was waiting as promised, and as we were only staying 1 night we paid for this, although the price was just the same as the taxi charge with none of the queuing. We were greeted warmly on arrival and had an easy registration. Our room was great, lots of room, very good bathroom and comfy bed, and very very clean. A big bonus for us is the free in room wifi as well as in the hotel public rooms. The breakfast, included in the room rate,would have to be one of the best we've ever had, wide choice of everything cold, cereals, meats, cheeses, breads etc & a hot buffet as well, fantastic, and no problems getting refills of tea and coffee. The next day we were heading off to join a cruise and the hotel had arranged a transfer from Rome to cruise port for us, again at a rate better than we'd been able to find, and were being picked up at 1.30pm, the staff were very apologetic as the hotel was fully booked (it was Easter week) and unfortunately we had to vacate our room by 11am. Normally they allow you to keep your room until you leave. They did arrange for our bags to be stored and they were more than happy for us to use the hotel facilities until pick up. We have had nothing but good times at the Napoleon Hotel, and from the warm welcome at reception, room service, restaurant & bar staff, all work together to make your stay with them as pleasant and enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay at a gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hilopatty
Reviews.Content: For four days, five of us (in three separate rooms) had an absolutely amazing time in Rome, thanks in no small measure to our hosts at the Napoleon hotel. When I arrived at 8 in the morning, I was invited to have breakfast at their elaborate morning buffet (at no charge) while my room was prepared. Within the hour, I was settled in and showered and ready to see Rome while the rest of my family members still were arriving. (We came from three different areas of the U.S.) Although my room was small, it was more than adequate for one person. The two rooms the others stayed in were substantially larger. While it is true (as one reviewer noted) that the route to the guest rooms involves two separate elevators, I cannot imagine that this is an inconvenience, since to get from one to the other, you must pass through the large and gracious receiving rooms of the hotel. If this is the price to pay for lodging in a beautiful historic building, it's one I'm happy to pay. Whatever shortcomings the building itself may have, the management more than made up for. They were accommodating, helpful, and of unfailing good cheer. I can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They really are at your service”
Reviews.Author: pipbb
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to Rome, I found my stay at Hotel Napoleon to have been a good choice. The location is perfect for metro access to the Vatican. It is also walking distance to the ancient city (as long as you're not in a hurry). The service was really excellent. I would like especially to point out the great advice from the concierge Roberto Lombardi. He was able to give me and my family suggestions for excellent restaurants, and made us feel safe and comfortable in an unfamiliar city. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Victorfernandes
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located. The staff is very dedicated, especially Franco. Good breakfast. Subway just in front of the hotel entrance. When coming back to Rome again, i'll try to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, suberb staff - very friendly and helpful, went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: hsh864
Reviews.Content: When they greeted us outside and welcomed us by name before we had even stepped into the hotel, I knew we had made a good choice. The hotel was very clean, rooms were spacious by european standards and the staff was fabulous. Everyone we encountered spoke excellent english. They helped us find transportation to the port, reserved us a table for dinner at a nearby restaurant and helped us find our way around. The location was ideal - as there was a metro stop literally steps outside of the front door. The staff even helped us set up transportation from the port back to the airport when our cruise was over, a good ten days after we had stayed at the hotel. Would go back. Next time we will stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal, comfy and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: shjnmee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Napoleon Hotel for 2 nights and only landed back home this morning! Our stay in Rome was amazing and the hotel was perfect for us! We didn't plan to spend much time in the hotel as there were so many things we wanted to see and do during our short stay, however due to the early closure of the metro we found ourselves relaxing in the hotel bar in the evening. The staff there were lovely, especially one barman who taught us some italian in between serving us and others. On arrival at the hotel we were immediately greeted with a warm welcome and checked in. Even though we arrived before 2pm (the check in time) our room was ready for us and we were given a brief tour of the hotel's amenities before being shown our room. The room we had was small but perfectly adequate for our use, it was clean with a sizeable bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The breakfast was thoroughly enjoyed by my partner who had more than one serving each morning, there was a good selection of bread, pastries, cereals, eggs, bacon, cold meats, fruits and yogurts to satisfy all, including myself who is a fussy eater. Tea/coffee was served instantly and the staff were more than happy to assist in anyway they could. One member of staff who made our stay a memorable one was Franco at concierge, he was very welcoming and gave us a detailed map of Rome, which he highlighted using various colours to represent all the different things and places for us to see. He continued to greet us throughout our stay and was helpful in every way, even when we requested additional pillows he sorted that within two minutes. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel as an ideal base for a city/sightseeing break in Rome. The hotel also offers metro tickets which you can buy at the front desk as well as city tours and recommendations for restaurants within the area (which the staff are more than happy to make reservations for). Many thanks to all the staff who helped make our visit to Rome a delightful one, we shall definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JamesBinos
Reviews.Content: Everything is good about the hotel except the rooms. They are very clean etc but, oh my gosh, they are noisy! Maybe it is an Italian thing.

Reviews.Title: “At home - in Rome The Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: Shika_11
Reviews.Content: This is a long established family owned & run hotel. From the car which met us at the airport, through check in, the cheerful porter who took us to our spacious & comfortable room & throughout our stay we enjoyed first class service. The decor, furnishings & food were something to be enjoyed. Of particular merit is the smoothly efficient & friendly service provided by the concierges (two, providing 24 hour service) All our questions were answered helpfully & our enjoyment of Rome greatly enhanced by the advice & information given by our concierge. Situated on the largest Piazza In Rome opposite attractive public gardens & with Metro access virtually on "the doorstep" the hotel was ideally situated as a base from which to visit all the famous attractions of the city. We certainly would not consider staying any where else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place (and price) when staying in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Kez_Barnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel from the 27th March - 2nd April and booked their 'plus 6' package which was fantastic value. The hotel is on a busy road opposite a lovely park. The area is really no worse than that of a central London hotel. We never had any problems or felt unsafe at any time. We were greeted at the front desk by Roberto who was very friendly and helpful and let us check in early - which was great seeing as we had an early flight! The room was very standard 'no frills', like that of any other really. The only complaints we had was that the bed is very hard and you only get one pillow, which gave us a bit of a sore neck! They advertise satellite TV - which fair enough you expect most of it to be Italian - but you literally have the choice of CNN or ESPN if you want to understand it. Not that I minded particularly but my husband struggles to sleep most nights and would have appreciated a bit more choice. The shower is a bit temperamental, I found it goes hot and cold randomly. Also the walls are thin, 90% of the time it was fine as we were awake but a couple arrived with a baby and we could hear her every time she cried and even when the parents were singing/talking to her! But apart from that the room was very clean and we had a comfortable stay for the 6 days. Breakfast was yummy, lots of choice and dinner was surprisingly good value. Cheaper than most restaurants near by! We never had a problem with service and the food was always cooked well and tasty. Even the bar and mini-bar drink prices were reasonable. Most food and snacks in Rome were very expensive (2 euros for a simple chocolate bar.) The hot tourist spots are within walking distance but if you're feeling lazy (or just worn out!) the metro is right outside the door. We were a bit weary of using it but it was simple enough, you can select English on the ticket machine and the prices are very cheap. 4 Euros for a day ticket or you can pay 1 Euro for a ticket that lasts 75minutes. Meaning you can basically visit the Vatican for 2 Euros. We would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone looking for a reasonable priced hotel in a city center location for a clean and comfortable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “ABC - Adequate, Basic but Classy”
Reviews.Author: HipsterGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of it's positive reviews on Trip Advisor. Our own experience was surprisingly adequate, nothing more and nothing less. I must confess, I did expect more 'oomph' from a hotel rated so highly on this site. Hotel Napoleon stands on a major busy road, facing a small park. Along the street are a number of clothes shops, a pharmacy and a very tasty corner ristorante about 5 minutes walk to the left on exiting the hotel. The best thing about this hotel though is that the metro station is literally on its doorstep. Directions: When you arrive at Termini station, take the 'Linea A' metro towards Anagnina and hop off at the next stop - Vittorio Emmanuele station. Follow the exit marked P. Dante and once you emerge into the street exhausted, jet-lagged and disorientated, you'll see Hotel Napoleon rise in front of you like a welcome cup of hot tea. (We arrived at night, took the wrong exit and ended up on the other side of the park in a dimly-lit street that was covered in graffitti and decorated with loitering shadowy figures - not fun). Vittorio Emmanuele is a great location. One metro stop from Termini, on the line for major sites such as the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps and Vatican City, and within walking distance of most other tourist areas. We walked to the Colosseum in about 12-15 minutes and even managed to walk to the Spanish Steps in under an hour at a leisurely pace. Please note: traffic lights are only routinely obeyed by drivers so cross the roads at your peril. We unashamedly used a Roman woman and her child as a human shield as we negotiated a particularly hazardous 4 lane road. Location aside, Hotel Napoleon offers clean furnishings, a beautiful and relaxing middle floor lounge, generally good service and helpful staff. It is not an impersonal hotel, but certainly doesn't have the warmest feel. This didn't bother us as we were only there to rest and sleep, but I do feel a bit of envy reading reviews by travellers who managed to strike up great relationships with members of staff! Breakfast is between 7am-10am, with the usual continental fare of scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, bread rolls, cheese and cured meats. Cereal and fruit are also available, as well as sweet sponge tortes and iced croissants. Coffee and tea are served on seating, and the rest is self-service. Rooms: We booked a standard double room and it was SMALL. Adequate but a bit of a squeeze for those with big suitcases (as we did). The superior rooms are undoubtedly larger. There was a good-sized closet for hanging up clothes, an electronic safe, double doors which opened onto a small terrace with a view of the very bare, quite depressing courtyard below. Again, nothing grim, just a bit disappointing. The bathroom had no bath but the shower was great - plenty of hot water and the cubicle was spotless. Again, size was a problem. If you are over 5'5", you may find yourself banging your elbows when drying yourself or worse still, you may find yourself shimmying sideways in order to use the toilet. Our toilet was awkwardly recessed into a corner in such a way that when I sat down, my chin was inches away from the sink bowl. In fact, I was so tired after a long day's walking that I found myself simultaneously sitting on the toilet AND resting my head on the sink. I've never been able to do that before! There are no tea/coffee-making facilities which was another disappointment, although it is available at extra charge (or included in superior rooms). Our neighbour in the room next door enjoyed watching TV at 8pm every night, and we had the pleasure of listening to it alongside him whether we liked it or not. Either he had turned the volume up or our walls were too thin. What didn't help was that the TV is placed at the foot of the bed, and I presume his TV was directly against ours on the other side of the wall. With the rooms being so small, there is nowhere to escape TV noise. Incidentally, if you like firm beds you'll love this hotel. We are delicate little flowers and woke up with sore backs! The hotel restaurant offers typical Italian dishes with large portions. They request that you pre-book, but we asked for a last-minute meal and found the dining room to be almost empty. Service was erratic, but it was late and the staff were probably tired and eager to finish their shift. If this all sounds overly negative, please remember that we slept soundly, there was no street noise or loud traffic to disturb us and there is the welcome relief of an air-conditioning unit in the bedroom at the end of a long, hot day. The lounge is opulent and is extremely well-equipped with plenty of sofas and armchairs, a free internet access point, a large plasma TV, a piano (!) and plenty of multiple language newspapers to browse. Free Wi-Fi is available in the hotel, you simply need to ask the reception staff for your unique username and password. You can purchase metro and bus tickets and the Roma Pass at the hotel, as well as book tours and arrange bookings for restaurants, events etc. Elevators/lifts are small but there are plush carpeted stairs available for the exercise-inclined. Free wine-tasting and a selection of local produce (e.g. cheeses) are on offer every Friday evening. We didn't indulge, but we certainly heard much merriment from the lounge below! All in all, Hotel Napoleon was a great base for travel and offered us a clean, decent stay. Any problems or difficulties were swiftly dealt with and staff were courteous at every turn. I see it as a good 3-star hotel, masquerading as a glamorous 4-star plus establishment. In summary, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, though it (and it's high TripAdvisor rating) remains to me something of a curious enigma.

Reviews.Title: “old world, very small, good”
Reviews.Author: tojogger
Reviews.Content: location was very isolated at night. Hotel staff were friendly and tried to help where they can. The bathroom was very, very small, it was almost claustrophobic. The room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming, affordable base for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: dmwells
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival after an overseas flight we were met by a driver from the hotel. Hiring a van to get to and from the airport was more affordable than our family of five taking the train and much easier when exhausted! We were welcomed to the hotel by the very friendly front desk staff and able to move our bags into one of our two rooms. My biggest disappointment was not having the adjoining rooms we had been promised. The triple room for the kids was ample in space but the double was rather small, with a particularly small shower, an old fashioned hair dryer and very firm beds. We were able to sit comfortably in the large lounge area of the hotel, which also included a computer with free WiFi. Breakfast was provided and was excellent, offering lots of variety. The staff was very helpful providing us with local restaurant recommendations,as well as directions to an incredible gelato place. While the hotel was not quite in the centre of things, we easily walked everywhere, including the Vatican. There is a subway station very close to the hotel if needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel - there is so much to see and do in Rome that you spend very little time in your hotel room. We felt safe, welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to come back to.”
Reviews.Author: caraCorsham
Reviews.Content: We could hardly fault this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights a mixture of business and pleasure and were very glad we chose it with the help ot Trip Advisor. The wine evening on Friday is a generous touch.

Reviews.Title: “worst bed in 8 months of traveling in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtraveler60
Reviews.Content: ok hotel -- cute room -- bed absolutely awful -- 4 star?? don't understand the rating system -- better deals are out there...convenient to train station..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: Aidan5046
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and loved the hotel. It's a 5min walk from Termini Station or 1 min by Metro. A metro station is right outside the hotel so perfect for getting around. The staff were incredibly helpful and nice. On our 2nd day a rail strike changed our plans but the conceirge was only glad to help with planning our routes. The rooms and bathrooms were clean tidy and spacious enough for a short stay. Linen and towels changed daily and usually done when we were at breakfast. The breakfast itself is excellent with a fine selection of foods. The only downside from us was that it is a no cash hotel and any bar food or drinks are put on the bill. That's only a minor thing. Over all, we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people!!”
Reviews.Author: zazded
Reviews.Content: We are juste coming back from a week at Napoleon. The hotel is well located 10minutes walk from the colosseum. The metro station is front of the hotel. Metro tickets are cheap. 1 euro for 75minutes 4euros for a day or 16 euros for a week. The hotel is verry clean, people are so nice. they will do every thing they can to please you. You can reserve trip to naples and pompei with them. We did this and pompei is a place to see! You have wifi in the room and a computer you can use near the bar. The breakfest is really good and you have lots of things to eat. try the capuccino they are really good! The only negative thing we have to talk about is the wall are thin. So if you have noisy people beside your room it can be a problem. we call the reception and they did what they could to help us. So if you want good sleep bring earplugs. I have to say that we were at the first floor, above the kitchen. Maybe if you are on higher floor it wont be a problem. Overall we had a pretty good stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Fonzy2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last May. The location is very good, There is a metro station right outside. Breakfast was also very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had 2 rooms. One was very good but the other was small and right next to the elevator. It was very noisy. Overall it was a great experience in Rome, but try to avoid rooms next to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its rating”
Reviews.Author: Robannabid
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rome at the Hotel Napoleon. We chose it because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and found them to be very accurate. The hotel is clean, comfortable, very well located (Metro just outside the door, walking distance to many central locations including Colosseum and S Maria Maggiore) and provided a quiet haven from the busy-ness of the city. Teenage son esp. grateful for the free wi-fi.Breakfasts were substantial (and even accommodating for a 7 am trip departure), bar snacks good. Very impressed to receive a bottle of bubbly and glasses to celebrate my birthday (from my passport - from another guest who had a birthday the day before, we learned this is standard practice). The general level of English amongst the staff was impressive, and esp the helpful concierges. The Friday night drinks and nibbles have been cited in others' reviews and were clearly enjoyed by all the guests. As we had booked directly with the hotel for the week, we benefitted from a free transfer from the airport on arrival, and a free meal in the restaurant, both much appreciated. All in all, a most enjoyable week - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - we will always stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jonesy_boy1
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel is excellent. It is only 5 minutes walk from Termini (take the first exit from the station after getting of the train - don't go to the main exit!). When we arrived the Concierge was professional, welcoming and efficient, we were impressed. Our luggage was taken upstairs whilst we were shown the main areas of the hotel on our way to our rooms - very handy, in less than 5 minutes we knew our way around. The rooms are compact but very clean and comfortable and have all that you would need. They are so dark and quiet at night that a good sleep is guaranteed. The hotel is family run and all the staff are named in the brochure, they take a real pride in the Hotel and your stay is important to them. Before the rugby match the Manager came to talk to us in the bar and offered free 'refreshments' if Wales won and would double up if Italy won - he even wore a Welsh tie for the day and we got several "Iechyd da!" from the staff - really nice touches but always professional. The free Friday food / wine tasting was excellent and the wine flowed freely! We had a medical emergency during our stay, my wife had fractured her arm after the match (don't ask how!), we thought it was a sprain. At 2am the pain was too much and we needed to go to hospital. We went downstairs and the concierge was on hand to provide fantastic assistance - he arranged for a taxi to and from the hospital, to inform our friends if were late etc. as it was we got dealt with promptly and 2 hours later returned to the hotel where the concierge was waiting for us - we felt we were very fortunate to have such a good hotel and kind staff. We did not try the restaurant but I want to go back for more breakfast!! We ere advised of some local restaurants and they were excellent. The hotel is a stone's throw from the Coliseum and Termini. Lots of sights to see, restaurants and Irish bars close by. We walked almost everywhere but the hotel can provide day passes for the buses and trams. If you are new to Rome you may think the area of the hotel is run down - it's not, nearly all of Rome look like this and it is safe to walk the streets at night. When you get to the hotel and open the door you realise what a good choice you made, we are booking our 2013 trip to soon.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KentPalaceman
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a three night stay at the Napoleon. From the moment we were met at the airport we were made to feel so welcome. As for the Map the Concierge gave us, this should go down In history!! A simple colour coded guide to the Important sights of the city. Was amazing and made navigation so easy. All staff were very friendly and courteous. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice. Location was fine just close enough to the main city centre and a metro outside!! Had a meal In the restaurant which wasn't too bad, price and portions were good. All in all a very good hotel and should I go back to Rome this Is where I shall stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: int_traveler_1
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and a nice size. There was a group of students staying at the hotel the same time and made a lot of noise. Sadly, the rooms were not able to block out the noise. The breakfast was excellent. The staff was friendly. The location was decent. The hotel is located in a piazza (park square). The park looked abandoned as did most of the stores located in the square. There is not much to see or do in the square. However, within walking distance are restaurants. The hotel is located near public transportation and the Termini Station. Btw---please be careful of pickpockets. My group was approached my men asking us to sign petitions to combat drug use. The petition was attached to a clipboard. What the thieves do is they put the clipboard against you and distract you while they search your purse or pockets. please beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Annchalee
Reviews.Content: Hotel staffs are nice and friendly. Franco is very helpful. He recommended us to the best Gelato place in town and the restaurant he recommended on our last night stay was the best food I've never had. Breakfast is free and good selections. Every Friday, there is free wine tasting between 6:30-7:30 with cheese and cured meat. It was really nice to meet the owner Roberto and other guests. Hotel also provides free wifi. Hotel is right on Metro A very convenience to train station. It's walking distance to Colosuem and the park. We had good experience stay at Napoleon

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, central - great”
Reviews.Author: isa_ritha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, directly by a metro station. There are a vew nice restaurants in the area. The service was great - friendly, uncomplicated, courteous. You felt welcome in hotel napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Average service quality, decent loaction”
Reviews.Author: Praveenk2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Napoleon for 2 days during my honeymoon in June. As Rome was my first stop on my trip to Italy, I had asked for an airport transfer. My flight was delayed by an hour and the driver seemed unhappy about that fact!! The location is pretty decent, about a 10 min walk from the Coliseum and is right next to the metro station so accessibility is not an issue, although like most hotels in Rome, there is not much signage on the street. We had booked ourselves a superior room and had requested a bathtub but were given one without it. Upon asking for it they said that the room would be available on the next day. As we were unavailable till 2 the next afternoon they could not change our room. The concierge was pretty helpful aout most things and even helped us book our tour to the Vatican. All in all a decent hotel if you don't mind an average looking room with decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Staff and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: GRA34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a nine-day stay in Rome at the Napolean Hotel. This hotel was accommodating from the first day we arrived. Our package included transportation from the airport to the hotel. The person who picked us up was on time and waiting for us outside of baggage claim. It was nice to have someone at the airport at 8AM and not have to look for transportation into Rome. Every staff member that we encountered in this hotel was always ready to serve you with a smile on their face. Franco, at the concierge desk, was always a pleasure to deal with and always very helpful with any question you asked him. We had several dinners in the hotel restaurant and the food was always excellent whether you had a full course meal or something light to eat. My husband and I also enjoyed the Talk and Taste Wine Party -- what a great idea! It got both the staff and the hotel guests together over wine and hor d'oevres. We talked with Roberto, the General Manager of the hotel and he told us about how he got into the hotel business and other interesting facts about his family and the hotel in general. We also enjoyed a new member of the hotel staff, Frederico. He was being mentored in bar service at the hotel and he was a delight. Such a friendly young man..and a good bartender too! We had a Superior double room which was very spacious and always very clean! The location of the hotel is good -- right near the Metro for easy access to all of the major sites in Rome. Some might think that the area that the hotel is in is not the greatest because of all of the graffitti on the buildings but we walked to several restaurants in the area at night and never had a problem. It is no different than being in some areas of any metropolitan city -- you need to be aware of your surroundings wherever you go! All in all this a great hotel with a great staff in a fabulous city!

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DjsTrip
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel, in slightly sketchy neighborhood. The metro is literally right outside the door, but so are some unsavory characters, depending on the time of day. Food choices within walking distance are very limited. Staff was very helpful. Wifi is free in your room. Free breakfast included bacon and eggs. Overall, the hotel is a good value, I believe. If the convenience of the metro is a huge selling point for you, I would definitely recommend this hotel. Personally, I prefer a neighborhood with more charm. If you're just going for business or something, maybe it's a better choice. I think the high rating of this hotel set my expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: “Franco Concerige & Reberto Hotel Owner Can't do Enough for your stay”
Reviews.Author: gannonpb
