Reviews.Content: Dropped into this hotel after 12 years of staying there on our honeymoon and Franco and Roberto could not do enough for us we booked in immediately and were treated to constant friendly helpful staff with a relaxed atmosphere can not wait to revisit hopefully it won't take us another 12 years ... miss it already ... Thanks for a lovely stay

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: CreativeVoyager
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by accident and was delighted. It made for a wonderful stay in Rome. The staff was ready to accommodate needs from a soy cappuccino for breakfast to a tiny band-aid. The spacious sitting room made for chances to talk to other travelers. The head concierge, Franco, was the perfect host, tour guide and shopping advisor. It couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: joh22
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just back come back from a 4 day trip to Rome and stayed in this wonderful hotel. The service was just outstanding and I will be reccommending this hotel to anyone who will visit Rome. From the time we checked in, which was rather late, we were treated so well. We were taken to room and our luggage arrived two minutes later. Our room was very spacious and we had no faults what so ever. The hotel is just beside the Metro so we did not need to take a taxi, we simply got a bus outside Ciampino to Anagnina and then the metro there to the stop outside the hotel which is Vittorio Emanuelle 14th stop which cost a simple €2.20pps altogether from Ciampino airport. This was researched beforehand as friends of ours had paid €60.00 for a taxi from the airport to the city centre. How easy!! We walked everywhere,except the Vatican where we got the metro outside our hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and bars around within walking distance of the hotel. The reception in the hotel were so obliging and gave us all the infomaton we needed. I have never met such a nice organisation of staff. The bar staff, restaurant and reception are all top class. The wine tasting on the Friday evening was such a lovely touch and was very cosy. The receptionist gave us an invitation to attend on Thursday. The managers were there and asking questions about what we had seen and were genuinely very intereted. What a great idea!! We would like to thank you for a wonderful time and we had a fantastic stay. We highly recommend your hotel. Gillian

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family run bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: CruisingSwedes
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Napoleon which I booked based on TripAdvisor reviews and also after checking out their website. We stayed there before and after a cruise and had a rate of 159euros per night including breakfast. The hotel is family run and you can tell. It is dated, but we weren't looking for hip and happening. We wanted a good price, and a clean safe place. Here's an example of a family run hotel: when we asked about a casual restaurant to go to in the afternoon, the concierge walked us down the block and around the corner to it. He didn't just say, go out and make a left and a right....he walked us there. BTW the pizza place around the corner (go out and make a left and a right at the first corner, 3 or 4 doors down on the right) is great for a quick bit in the afternoon. There is also a great casual Italian restaurant 2 blocks away....we went for lunch one day AND for dinner - it was really good! We had the family size rooms, which have a large king, and then in a semi-separated room two twin beds. There is a large dressing/closet area, and a large clean bathroom. Everything was very clean. My only complaint is that they use way too much perfume in the rooms when cleaning - the cleaning products (if the scent came from that....it was so strong it was as if a bottle of perfume had been sprayed in every room) smell strong. When we got home our suitcases still smelled of the perfume thousands of miles away. The breakfast is a decent buffet, adequate. They serve free of charge hot chocolate, tea and coffee drinks, I think even cappucinos. You can order fresh squeezed orange juice as well. There is a bar in the upper lobby and a restaurant - both were empty, but we sat and had a nice quite drink. Free internet across from the bar too. There is a small grocery store around the corner too. We had hired a guide while in Rome and he told us that the neighborhood that the hotel is in is not safe at night as it is near the train station. That is something to keep in mind if you plan on being out and about at night walking. There were some homeless people sleeping on the corner. For the price I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent time at your hotel which made our stay very funny and for our baby too.”
Reviews.Author: ioannitsa
Reviews.Content: excellent, kind-hearted, gentle management & staff filed like home comfortable, very close to metro A++++ and to all sightseeing. In a very good location quiet. When we visit Rome again in the future for sure we will stay at same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Buck5208
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 travelling ( 2 adults and 2 children) and wanted somewhere nice to stay in Rome with a hotel that was family friendly as well. We found that the Napoleon Hotel was just great, convenient to train station and right at at a metro stop for travel around Rome. Staff were exceptionally friendly and gave very good and useful advice when requested. Additionally one of my children was a sick during out stay and the staff were exceptionally helpful and organised a doctor who came to the hotel very promptly, it was all done with a minimum of fuss. Very happy to recommend this hotel to other families travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: FandJ1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel this summer and had a wonderful time. The staff was very friendly , helpful and caring. They booked amazing local restaurants outside the touristic circuit and considering that most restaurants were closed in August, they did a fantastic job. Yes, the hotel (especially the common areas) is not new and would benefit a fresh coat of paint. However, the rooms are clean, have A/C (a must in Rome) and are affordable. It is not located in the heart of the City but it is easy to get by anywhere by public transportation. We highly recommend this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon Hotel was everything we read about....”
Reviews.Author: Travelingforfun039
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews before booking 3 nights for our family in July (high season) and World Cup. The accommodations were nice and the staff were excellent! The Concierge sent us to Tempio Di Mecenate Ristorante which was maybe 2-3 blocks away and it was a fantastic way to end our stay in Rome. Don't miss this local Favorite and be sure to go before 8:00pm!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall Experience. Great Staff, Amenities, and Location.”
Reviews.Author: jjr123
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, wife, and adult son) stayed at the Napoleon for 6 consecutive nights in the last week of Sep 2010. We highly recommend the Napoleon to all travellers to Rome. This was our first visit to Rome and our stay at the Napoleon certainly enhanced the experience. First, the entire staff is professional, skilled, and friendly. The staff speaks English very well, and is accommodating to English speaking guests. The staff will make you feel as if you are a member of the family and are alway ready to help with any of your questions or requests. The hotel itself is well kept and immaculately clean. Our room was larger than expected, nicely furnished, the beds were comfortable, and the air conditioner unit was new. The bathroom appeared to have been recently renovated with new tiles and plumbing fixtures. The neighborhood around the hotel is a mix of residential and commercial. There are at least 5 trattoria on the side streets around the hotel; we ate dinner at 4 of them, and all were excellent. There are also several good shops with pizza, pasta, baked goods and drinks in the area. Be sure to visit the best gelateria in Rome, Giovanni Fassi, just 3 blocks from the hotel on the other side of the park. We walked in the park every day, often in the evening, and never felt unsafe. The park is a gathering place for the local residents and has some interesting ancient ruins. The entire neighborhood seemed very safe with many people out walking. The metro stop just outside the hotel was a great convenience. The free wireless internet for all guests was another bonus. This is a great family run hotel with fine service where they make very guest feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly, comfortable hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: nrp0504
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a short two day break in Rome where we stayed at the Hotel Napoleon on Piazza Vittorio Emmanuele. This hotel is just a five minute metro ride from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountains and approximately 20 minutes from the Vatican. The hotel staff were excellent. Its a family run hotel and all the staff speak excellent English. The concierge staff were all very helpful and friendly and couldnt do enough to either advise or help us, in particular Roberto on our first day. They also held a wine tasting evening on the Friday so staff and guests could meet and we met the MD, who was also very friendly and keen to say that if we werent happy with anything to let him know and he would do his best to assist. The only negatives we have on this hotel was that there was some noise which could be heard from the room above us and there is a lack of English TV channels available on the TV in the room (only the business channel MSNBC) and a lack of English papers but we would highly recommend this hotel and its staff to any English speaking visitors to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrighw2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Hotel Napoleon. The room size and facilities were extremely good, the bar and lounge areas comfortable and welcoming. Free Internet access in the lounge was a particularly nice touch. The staff were very efficient and friendly, just ask and they will point you in the direction of several excellent restaurants a short stroll from the hotel. The main Metro line is directly outside the hotel, from where it's only a few stops to all the major attractions. All in all we couldn't have asked much more, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: David41571
Reviews.Content: We were still very surprised by our welcome and had a fantastic stay in this excellent hotel even though we had read all the great reviews. All the staff were very helpful, friendly and attentive. The concierge and reception were very efficient and met us at the door like old friends. We recommend the complimentary taste and talk party on friday evening. Marco a retired concierge kept us entertained all night. We will recommend to friends, thanks to Roberto and his team. The hotel is in a good location, a pleasnt walk to the Colloseum, with excellent links via the Metro station at the front door. As for Roma. The Roma Pass proved useful at the Colloseum to avoid a long queue. We used the packed buses, metro and saw numerous sights. The queue at the Vatican was long on Monday morning. The beggars and flower/umbrella/handbag/jewelry hawkers were a nusiance; but a firm "no" moved them on. Someone tried to scam us with asking directions, then give us presents, then asked for a gift in return of cash for fuel. We used Terravison buses from the Airport. Just OK. You can get 4 Euro tickets at the stop. We used Ryan Air Flights - felt a little like cattle, not a lot of communication and scrumming for seats ain't too pleasant, but reasonable value. No bag checks with us. All in all, an excellent trip..

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to the Other Great Reviews”
Reviews.Author: SmallFamilyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I can only say "I agree wholeheartedly" with the other favorable reviews posted. We booked a three-person room (king bed, plus one single), with a separate room with a single bed). Hotel is family-owned with obvious intent to keep quality-for-a-good-price. Found all concierges very helpful (some were superb; others very good), with excellent English. Staff was so kind as to provide a small breakfast for an early morning flight out, as well as recommend/arrange for a mini-van to airport with very short notice. We enjoyed a couple small trattorias in the area (Ponzi to the left down Via della Statuto); Morgana down Via Mercenate, across from Theatre Brancaccio). Walked to the Colosseum twice (also walkable to Domus Aurea); really appreciated the subway station right outside the door (on the "A" line accessible to Spanish Steps and Vatican). All taxi drivers knew the hotel (helps to identify location at Piazza Vittorio). Walking from Termini is possible for the more ambitious (if arriving by train). Concierge recommended picking up on/off tour bus at Termini. Fantastic gelateria up a block and to the right (Palazzo Del Freddo G. Fassi), on Via Principe Eugenio. Great for families. Lots of English-speaking visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: dprice70
Reviews.Content: We had booked a deluxe room directly with the hotel for 3 nights including airport pickup. When we arrived at the hotel around 11am the room was being cleaned. We waited a few minutes and went up the two elevators to a large room with a sitting area, bedroom and bath. Plenty of storage with coffee and tea service in the room. The included breakfast had hot and cold selections to cover any preferances. We used the hotels suggestions for meals and were very happy with each one. The area is not touristy and you feel like you are in a neighborhood. There is a lovely park and ruin across the street. Service was attentive and friendly. The metro is right outside the door but most of the sights are within walking distance. The hotel staff would lay out the best routes on the maps for us each day. We were invited to a wine tasting one evening and enjoyed a long chat with a gentleman that we later found out was the Hotel Director Roberto Cioce. To our suprise and delight he sent us sherry and cookies while we had dinner at the hotel. It is the unexpected gestures that really made the visit. We would recommend the hotel and will use then when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Leisure Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: auntiebev
Reviews.Content: I traveled with four of my family members to Rome recently, and we really enjoyed this hotel. I would highly recommend it for leisure travel. We were unanimous that we will stay at this hotel again when we return to the city. The rooms were very comfortable, the location was great for sightseers (walking distance to the Colosseum and Roman ruins), and we enjoyed the neighborhood, which is one of the city's less affluent but perfectly safe and with wonderful pizzerias and alimentaria in the surrounding area, and the best gelateria we found in all of Rome (Ornelli) two blocks away. We most highly recommend the little bakery with pizza just around the corner. We loved the food and the service of a very nice young man who is so proud of his store and his English. When you walk out of the hotel, turn left, then left at the first street you hit, and the store will be two or three doors down on the right. The thin-crust pizza was to-die-for, and the baked goods were fantastic... what a competent store in the North End of Boston tries to replicate. The staff of the hotel was also exceptional... very attentive and very helpful, with the exception of Mr. Lombardi, the concierge, who seemed to take a pissy pill every day before he came to work. After a week we could not dismiss it as one bad day. He always brushed us off when we sought assistance (and notwithstanding that we well-tipped the concierge desk throughout the week). He did not upset us or undermine our trip at all... he just stood out among an otherwise truly warm and wonderful group of people. If you are an American tourist expecting a Hilton or Marriott hotel, take note. We were a little nervous when we first arrived, as the arrival and hallway areas are what would best be called European shabby chic after we warmed up to the place. The hallways need new wallpaper or paint, and the molding is dated. But the rooms looked recently carpeted and the spreads, curtains, linens, towels, and upholstery were all up-to-date and very comfortable. Breakfast was wonderful and the common area with television and the bar were very comfortable and top-drawer. And the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “splendid service and good location”
Reviews.Author: Peterm030
Reviews.Content: the service provided by all the staff was excellent - rooms well presented - very clean and daily linen change - breakfast was spot on - buffet style - bacon scrambled egg - cold meats - fruit - sticky buns - toast etc - the friday wine tasting went down well - good wine and great oppurtunity to meet the staff from the Napoleon and mingle and chat with other guests - we booked a long weekend and part of the deal was to get collected by chaffeur from the airport in a merc limo "highley reccommended " we also received a complimentary bottle of champagen for my wife to celebrate her 50th - top tips - little coffee snack shop directley across the road from the hotel - coffee 1 euro and its really nice - you will pay much more for coffee thats not so good - make use of the metro rather than taxis you will save a small fortune - tickets for the metro from the concierge 1 euro "one way" and the Metro is right outside the hotel "one of the main reasons for booking" if you are fit and like to walk - the colosseum nd palantine hill are 10 mins walk and its a lovley walk - another 10 mins past the colosseum takes you past the roman forum to the Piazza Venezia - continue on for another 10 mins will take you to either the Pantheonor Trevi fountain - use the metro for St Peter,s and Vatican - and other sites - to get the most of the tours we booked with Viator - not cheap but worth it - skip the lines and ques - superb tour guides - we did the angels and demons - vatican museum sistine chapel st peters, and ancient rome colosseum "the dogs bollocks" - dining out its pot luck really use your judgement - albeit we did not use the hotel for a meal we wish we did -the feed back from guests who did were very complimentary - overall an excellent Hotel - Peter

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff makes you feel like being in home”
Reviews.Author: Rasha_10
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my family and my husbands’ family (9 adults and my infant), we all really enjoyed our stay in that wonderful & elegant hotel, its secret is in its helpful and friendly staff (especial thanks to peter & Franco), I was completely surprised especially with their welcome when we arrived and leaved, definitely if we visit Rome again we will go to that hotel without even thinking, I can't believe that there is some reviews against that staff, may be the only negative comment that I found there that walls are thin and you can hear what is in next room. Other than that everything is totally perfect and can't be better and again that' because of that friendly staff that makes you feel like being in your own home. also they have a wonderful small restaurant that offers very delicious varieties for dinner (thanks chef Omar) also it is in city center near to everything, sightseeing, shopping and you can reach all by metro which is next to the hotel and you can ask the concierge about anything and he will help you more than you can even imagine, rooms space were more than enough especially according to Europe standards, rooms and the first floor lounge are very cozy comfort & elegant....what else????

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its web site”
Reviews.Author: bezzaact
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't anything as nice as its web site indicates. It is in a very run down and quite dingy neighbourhood - on the Saturday night that we were there we couldn't find any nice restaurants open in the area. The foyer and public areas need redecorating. Our room was very small. It had a nice bathroom though. The staff pay lip service to being friendly but it felt a bit forced to me. Breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could be more positive”
Reviews.Author: dolomiter
Reviews.Content: Unlike some of the reviews we read before booking our trip to Rome, we found the service and accomodations unacceptable. Until this occasion, we had never encountered such a cold welcome. It only got worse. Our room was not ready so we were asked to come back in an hour. They wouln't even hold onto our luggage. Sadly, the room was not clean - at least not the what we are normally used to. Our disappointment did not last long as we left the next morning for a nearby and more suitable hotel (less expensive and very clean) recommended by the waiter of the restaurant we ate dinner at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Napolean Hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLady123
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our stay at your hotel. The front desk assistance was excellent and we especially appreciated the help from Franco Quirinis as well as from Roberto Lombardi. We found them to be very professional. They took care of every detail of our stay in Rome and made our anniversary very special. The room was spacious, and the hotel was very inviting (ask for room #318). From the time we made our reservation to the time we left, we had excellent communication with every one on the hotel team and we thank the manager, Roberto Cioce for that hospitality. We will return to your hotel when in Rome again and we will be sure to recommend your hotel to those we know. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: holidaysforwe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon for five nights in August. We travel a lot and can truly recommend this hotel for a clean, comfortable room with a good shower. However, what sets this hotel apart is that it is family owned and run - and it shows. The staff were friendly and helpful, and as a bonus, spoke English. They gave the impression that they enjoyed working there. For convenience the subway is at the door and the Colosseum is a 15 minute walk. We ate a couple of times at the restaurant. The food was excellent and there was a good selection of wine that was well priced. The choice at breakfast was varied with great service. A highlight of our stay was the wine and cheese evening conducted by Roberto. His enthusiasm and knowledge of the local products made this a memorable night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff, intimate hotel, clean and well appointed”
Reviews.Author: unawalsh
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed at the hotel most favourably and any requests we had were met with quickly and efficiently. The hotel is quiet and well located with good standard of cleanliness. staff are out of this world, from breakfast, to the reception to bar staff could not have been more courteous. Highly recommended. Una & Sean Walsh, Ireland visited Oct 2010

Reviews.Title: “Website pictures are not illustrative of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveldogs36
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in this 4 star rated hotel. While the website shows very nice rooms and common areas we found the hotel to be very tired, with visibly worn furniture in the common areas. It was a depressing start to our Rome visit. It appears they are trying to update the hotel because some parts have been re-done. Our room had a newer washroom while the rest of the room was drab with a dirty carpet and marked up walls The wardrobe smelled musty and we certainly would not hang our clothes in it. We tried to change our room but they were unable to accommodate this request. Our friends room was better with newer furniture, but it still was not four star quality - more like a basic 3 star. Now that we have explored Rome we realize there are much better areas to stay in that are more interesting and closer to more restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Services”
Reviews.Author: Kev_traveller
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel because it is walkable from Rome Termini station if you don't have too much luggage. Hotel was the very model of efficiency. 14 of us checked in with minimal fuss and the rooms were all fab. Nice bar & lounges and good spot for shops daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogerMilla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located next to the metro which enables you to get around the city quickly and conveniently. However it is not a very pretty area to walk around. Despite this it was in a sound location and was central to see all of the fantastic sights. Although the hotel lists itself as a 4 star it is more like a 3 star hotel. Our room was clean but was quite small. It had no view at all and actually had frosted glass in the windows due to a back street alley view. This was not stated on the description so we were very disappointed at staying in a cave! When requested to swap rooms no alternative was given apart from another room without a view. The frosted glass made the rooms feel very dark and dingy. Our room was also very noisy. We were located on the second floor next to a staffroom. Each morning we woke to the noise of showers running, toilets flushing etc and staff talking loudly (as if in our room) . The final straw for our stay at this hotel was the fact that a wedding party had booked into the hotel. Although not a problem generally the noise from the disco was horrendous. It might as well have been in our room. We did complain to the manager who couldn't understand why our room was so noisy. We could actually hear the jumping up and down of the party goers. We got very little sleep and was actually due to leave the next day which meant we were tired out for our journey home (3 hours max sleep). The manager did however not charge us for this night. If we could have moved we would have. The staff were all friendly and were happy to help. However if you want a hotel with a view and a peaceful stay then this hotel might not be for you. The breakfast was adequate but there was additional charges for some things such as orange juice. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: MaltaTeresa
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with my daughter and based on the reviews on tripadvisor opted to stay at the Hotel Napoleon. I really don't regret this for a minute.. I have never felt so welcomed at any hotel and I do a lot of travelling because of business trips. The minute we were picked up by the service that the hotel organized to the minute we checked out we were given nothing but the utmost attention. Everyone has a smile on his face and truly does his best to help you in any way possible. A special mention goes to Roberto Lombardi at the front desk who is a real 'simpaticone' as the Italians would say. There is a metro station right outside the hotel and if you need a taxi the staff will call one for you immediately. The breakfast served is very generous especially by Italian standards and we were even invited to a wine tasting evening on the Friday night which was a lovely touch. There also is free Wi-Fi in all the hotel. I am really looking forward to my next trip to Rome where I would definitely opt to stay at the Napoleon again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pjcbvsc
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel and can confim all the postive comments made in previous reviews. The advice about all aspects of local travel and sight seeing in Rome provided by the front desk staff was excellent. The pick up service from the airport was efficient and cost effective and took the stress out of negotiating our way the hotel while fatigued by a long flight. The room was small but clean and sufficient for our needs as we spent all day out seeing Rome. To compensate for the small room there is a spacious and comfortable guest lounge area. Breakfast was excellent -ask for Italian coffee if you prefer it.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Ambassadors”
Reviews.Author: Cobra53911
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at Hotel Napoleon on short notice...our previous confirmation was falsely confirmed...Peter not only secured our room on short notice, he was able to extend our stay. Peter's dilligence was much appreciated. Franco, however, was our greatest gift...he was able to decipher the intricacies of travel in Rome with his map and impeccable English...he also had great recommendations for parking our Fiat 5cc, as well as steering us towards the greatest gelato we will ever taste. This Hotel is our choice the next time we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel near a subway stop”
Reviews.Author: karenga65
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful during check in and our entire stay. The rooms were very typical of a EU hotel...small by American standards with a small bathroom. There was some noise in the hall that you could hear in the room in the morning which made sleeping somewhat difficult. There are not many restaurants nearby. The hotel is located very close to the subway stop, which is wonderful. Breakfast was included and was very nice. There is complimentary internet in the lounge, and they had a wine tasting on Friday evening which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: rrf-hn
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Napoleon for my Honeymoon stay in Rome, and my wife and I were completely amazed of what a QUALITY SERVICE the hotel has. By the way, THANK YOU FRANCO Y ROBERTO! First, as we arrived and let them know we were on our honeymoon they prepared a special gift for us (I won't say what it was; I don't want to spoil next honeymooners surprise). I visited two more cities, Barcelona and Venice, but nothing compared to the service we received in Rome. My wife and I had a tour planned with our very own plans and asked for assistance in the lobby, the guy in the lobby practically was our “tour guide specialist”, without any delay he started to describe everything I wanted to see, and drew different routes to take and go sightseeing, they even used a different set of markers so it could be clearer. They even helped us when Vueling Airlines lost our luggage, they repeatedly called the airline and where very diligent, they even called us to Venice after we left Rome, telling us that they couldn’t get in contact with them and were still worried for our belongings. I strongly recommend you stay at the Napoleon Hotel, especially if you’re seeking for great attention in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL ROME HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: FLA99
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel is a wonderful city location for visiting Rome. The subway is just outside the front door, the Termini terminal is one stop away, and the hotel is conveniently surrounded by restaurants and shops that it make a wonderful base for the visit. The staff was extremely helpful, particularly for first time visitors, and the recommendations and services were on the mark. We were a group of seven, and all were pleased with their accommodations. The included American breakfast was a big convenience, and the food was well prepared. We had dinner in the hotel the first day there (jet lag!) and were very happy with both the selection and quality of the food. One of the surprise bonuses was the park directly across the street-it was great to just go over and enjoy when you had more "touristing" than you could deal with-a great oasis in the busy city. We recommend it without reservation-it really was a wonderful experience. Derry & Peg Beck

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ajo_02
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome in September 2010. From the first minute you could feel the nice atmosphere. The staff was very kind and helpfull. Showed on a map the best shopping, tourist highlights, buses etc. I had a clean and nice singleroom, my friend the next room in the same floor, also ice and clean. The buffé-breakfast was a perfect start of the day. Hotel Napoleon is well located, only about 10 minutes from Colosseum and it is possible to walk all over the city. Bus-stop and Metro are also close.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: newexplorer29
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome, and was the best experience we could have hoped for. We had a transfer booked from the airport, was on time and very efficient, when we arrived at the hotel we were greeted straight away and the head concierge was very helpful and gave us a map of Rome with areas to see and highlighted best routes to take, the map was a fantastic tool while exploring rome, he was also was very helpful with booking restaurants and advice for best places to eat. It was my friends 40th birthday and on the day we were given a complementary bottle of bubbly delivered to the room, which was very nice and unexpected. The location of the hotel is good for the coluseum and there is a metro link a few metres from the hotel, although my advice is if you are able to walk around Rome and the weather is good take the advantage of the scenery and the beautiful architecture, in my experience the best way to experience Rome is on foot. The hotel isnt in the most beautiful place but its nice enough area and in a good enough location to get to places, although the vatican is about an hour walk away but the metro is right next to the hotel. Overall the stay was good and would recomend the hotel but it's not the cheapest hotel in Rome but neither the most expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dealindoc
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Only 50 meters from Metro. Great neighborhood. Rooms quiet, large and comfy. Concierge is Outstanding. Service and breakfast is fine. Not cheap

Reviews.Title: “Probably better hotels in this price range”
Reviews.Author: kl37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first night of our honeymoon. We were only in Rome for one night, and we were able to see the Colosseum, which is pretty close by. We were also able to walk to the Termini, which was not too far away. Other than that, it is not in a particularly nice area. Walking outside the hotel seems a bit dirty, and the restaurant that the staff recommended was not very good, and did not seem super authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Diner053
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and we stayed in three different hotels in three different parts of the country. I chose the hotels based on Trip Advisor reviews, along with several guidebooks. I have to admit, I was most worried about this one, after noting that most of the "better" hotels in Rome charge $400+ per night, more than we were willing to pay. The Hotel Napleon exceeded our expectations in every way! Our "Superior Double " room was VERY spacious, with a separate sitting area and a large bathroom. The bathtub with shower was a little tricky (esp. for us Americans used to our traditional showers) because the shower spray is in the middle of the tub instead of at the end. No view from our room, but this made for a very quiet and peaceful night's sleep. The hotel is perfectly located, just 10 minutes from the Colliseum and the metro stop is directly in front of the hotel. Any reviewers who describe the area as "sketchy" probably haven't been in too many cities. While not the most scenic part of town, we always felt perfectly safe and appreciated being in a quieter area, after the chaos of Rome. We found the included breakfast to be excellent---a huge selection of pastries, yogurt, cereal, meats, cheeses, eggs, bacon, and so on. The WiFi worked flawlessly (not true in the other hotels we stayed at). Easily the BEST part about the Hotel Napoleon, however, is definitely the staff. As others have described, this is a small family run hotel and the personal touch is apparent everywhere. Everyone we met, from the concierge to the front desk staff to the bartender and maids, was friendly and genuine and truly wanted to make our three night stay in Rome the best it could be. We were lucky enough to be there on a Friday night for the complimentary wine and cheese reception, and the hotel sent up a bottle of champagne to help us celebrate our anniversary. This is a fabulous hotel, well-priced, well located, and sincere in their desire to please their customers. I can't imagine why anyone would stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Small family run hotel, well run, staff could not do enough”
Reviews.Author: Utahresident
Reviews.Content: My two (2) sisters and I stayed four (4) nights at this small, family run hotel which is near a bus and metro stop which takes one to most of the tourist spots that everyone wants to see. The rooms were small (we asked for three single rooms), but very clean. The breakfast was more than sufficient. But the most important thing about this hotel was the staff. They were so friendly and helpful - went out of their way to mark maps for us every morning so that we could find our way around the city and to the destination that we sought. Nothing was too much effort for them. They truly made it a unforgetable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and fantastic location...”
Reviews.Author: Princess155002
Reviews.Content: When we go back to Rome we won't even look at any other Hotels. Hotel Napoleon is located less than ten minutes from the colliseum, the metro is ten steps from the hotel entrance, and the gelato across the street is excellant! Also the head concierge Franco, made our stay very special, he went the extra mile all the time, we thank him for making our stay very memorable! Thank you Hotel Napoleon for a fantastic time in Italy we look forward to returning soon. Dan and Fran

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, good service.”
Reviews.Author: BCRail6000
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to ancient part of Rome Good value, Good service - lounge service excellent, rooms comfortable

Reviews.Title: “great location, close to train station, sightseeing and metro”
Reviews.Author: LoraTraveling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 5-10min walking from Termini station or 1 metro stop. Close to Colosseum and other places; The subway takes you in 10 min or so to Vatican. While walking from Termini, the area is not that pleasant though. Breakfast OK, staff is friendly, you have a comp to use internet if you need it. In the room the TV had to be tuned and I didn't really watch (couldn't find CNN). The room was small but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fabRJ
Reviews.Content: It was my 3rd time in Rome and the first one at Napoleon. There´s no better cost benefit in this town. Great Staff, honest breakfast and central location. OK it´s not the most beautiful location on earth but it´s pretty close to everything. The room was spacious and comfortable with all the amenities one should need. Metro and buses at the door. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: 5492Cardinal
Reviews.Content: We had one night here passing through so admittedly not a very long impression but we won't be back. Our son who lived in Rome advised us not to walk there from Termini when we arrived about 10pm as the area between is 'dodgy' which we could see when we walked there in the morning when it was a pleasant 10 minute stroll. We arrived late due to plane delays and they did rustle up a salad of slippery ham, lettuce and tomato in the bar as there was no room service but surely they could have found some decent prosciutto or maozarella in Rome! Main impression is that all is very dark no natural light in lounge all very jaded and in need of refurb. Staff friendly enough and English speaking, many American guests. Our room was large but had closed electric blinds which when opened revealed the view straight into scruffy apartments/staff accommodation. Bed was comfortable but that was about all that was good. Breakfast 'American Buffet' it was billed as was the poorest I have seen and juice was charged extra! Really not worth the 5* price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and conveniently situated hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: SimonBolivarMayfield
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been in the same family for several generations and the excellent attention to detail and service reflects it. The rooms are decorated in keeping with the old fashion style of the hotel. If you want all the rooms to look alike this isn't for you. Twenty minutes walk from the Coliseum and, if you like walking, everywhere else in central Rome is comfortably walkable. The metro is right outside the door. The main station, by which we arrived from the airport is 5 mins away. Breakfast is adequate and, if you want to eat in the restaurant the prices were very resaonable. The staff, including the hands-on owner, all speak excellent english but were prepared to indulge my faltering italian. They helped with everything from metro tickets to restaurant advise and finding a deserving recipient for a spare rugby ticket. (It's easy to get to the stadium too) and they were very kind to our five year old son.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: david_bavin
Reviews.Content: I forgot to leave a feedback form at the hotel, but it would only have had praise on it. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, organised surprise anniversary flowers for my wife, and a bottle of bubbly. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfasts were good. Location good, easy walk to the coloseum etc. The main plus factor of this hotel is definitely the staff, they couldn't do more to help you, we were very impressed. Thank you for making our stay so welcoming

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to sights, but the neighborhood not so nice”
Reviews.Author: drozowski
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a super friendly family run hotel. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and kind. The breakfast was great and the dinner we had there was good too. The rooms were a bit older but still comfortable and large by EU standards. The AC even worked which is rare in Italy. The best part is the hotel is just steps from the metro stop. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “It is not often that all aspects of a hotel exceed your expectations”
Reviews.Author: richardrawlinson1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our fifth visit to Rome since 2005 and having been recommended the Napoleon for our first visit we have never wanted to stay anywhere else. The hotel is well located to see this wonderful city with many of the most renown sights within walking distance. The facilities are excellant but it is the friendliness of the staff in this private family run hotel that makes one's stay so enjoyable. The concierge staff are very knowlegable and will assist with all your requirements. The bar and restaurant staff offer a very efficient service and you room is more than often serviced whilst you are at breakfast. We would never use a hotel again if the facilities or service didn't meet our expectations but we have never had cause to have a moments doubt as to return to Hotel Napoleon each year. Incidentally their offer including transport to the hotel from the airport is well worth the value. If you require to eat out there are many good wine bars and restaurants locally. Roberto Cioce, Managing Director and his staff make you feel very welcome and treat you as if you were a guest in their home. Highly Recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel while stayine in Roma”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBakers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Hotel Napoleon and it was a wonderful experience! The staff if extremely helpful with information regarding all the sites to see in Rome, and providing maps with directions to each destination. The Colosseum, Palantine Hill, and the Roman Forum is within a 15 minute walk (which helps if you have eaten the gelato daily, as we did). lol. There is a Metro stop right out the front door, and Roberto will sell you the tickets at the reception desk. The Napoleon is in a quiet district, which is not the case if you want to stay near some of the main tourist attractions. Yet, all these sights are easily reached with the Metro system. We went to the wine reception and met many new friends. If you book for a least 6 nights, there is a package which includes private transportation from the airport, and dinner one evening. We look forward to returning to The Napoleon :) Rick and Sheryl Baker

Reviews.Title: “If you can't be home, this is where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: julienea
Reviews.Content: Franco the concierge was fantastic. He took care of many of the details a tourist does not know. Always warm and friendly. Hotel was clean, and food was very good. Rooms were spacious and beds were comfortable. Nice pillows too. No complaints about the hotel or staff in any way. I would highly recommend this hotel and their staff, and would definitely stay there again. No need to look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Is Where The Heart Is”
Reviews.Author: Muse4Life
Reviews.Content: Most reviews only brush the surface. The intention of this one is to give a deeper insight, so please forgive any hyperbole. If it’s a bit long winded sorry – what I have to say can’t be said in just a few short words. I'm biased, let's make that clear to begin with. I'm biased because I've stayed at the Napoleon several times and view the place as slightly more than *just* somewhere to sleep. And I’m biased because the management and staff are, by now, rather old friends, and both have done much to initiate and perpetuate the feelings of amity I have for them personally and respect for the commitment they put into the place. Admittedly, then, I'm not exactly without an axe to grind. But I bought and paid for the axe and feel justified in grinding it – hopefully you’ll find the results useful. The concierge staff – your first point of contact and the one you will have the most dealings with - are always full of smiles and help. Whether you need help with a route or a restaurant they tend to fall over themselves to be of service. If your bedding isn't to your liking, again, you just have to ask. They'll change your mattress or your pillows without a problem. And they'll do it with the same smile they bring to all their duties. They’ve nearly all been doing the job for years, and Franco, Peter, Roberto Lombardi, Fabio, Domeniko and Kristos {he’s the new guy and I have no idea whether or not I’ve spelled that correctly} are all politeness incarnate, even when faced with the most stupid of questioners {I have first hand experience, being just about the dumbest person I can think of}. Smiles and cheerfulness are a permanent feature of Napoleon staff. A further plus is the individuality, something indicated by many of the pastels and line drawings which hang on the hotel’s walls bearing the name “R. Cioce”. No one else will tell you this - least of all the hotel manager, whose work they are. Any of them would be worthy of sale. Instead, Roberto chooses to leave them on the hotel’s walls rather than put them into a gallery. Such modesty from a talented illustrator is as breathtaking as it is charming, and neatly sums up the personal touch which makes Hotel Napoleon and its management’s approach to business a breath of fresh air. Profit, yes. But not cheaply gained. The Cioce family, like their employees, earn every Euro by honest hard work and a slavish devotion to an ethic all too rare these days. Napoleon is an old hotel built in an old Palazzo. A huge part of the appeal is old world charm. Furniture in your room is more likely to be made out of hand finished wood than plastic. I think that's a good thing. But you can't shut out the 21st century altogether, and that's why the bathrooms are modern, the TV is digital and the aircon has a remote control. Several reviews lately have attempted to present a less than glowing impression of Piazza Vittorio and its surroundings, so I’ll place here a few words about the area. Hotel Napoleon stands on the Esquilino, one of the Seven Hills of Rome. Cicero and Tiberius both lived here, Maecenas built his famous Gardens on the hill’s slopes, and Julius Caesar lived just down the hill in the {in}famous Suburra. Neighbours don't get much better than that. And the National Museum of Rome is a couple of blocks away, built into what remains of the Baths of Diocletian. It should, therefore, be plainly apparent that the area is a very old one, rich in cultural and social history. This area has been built on and lived in for around 3,000 years. Yet it appears that some reviewers want it to be brand new. You can’t please some people, can you? The Colosseum is a gentle 15 minute walk away, through the winding paths of the Park of Trajan. If walking isn’t your thing there are buses and trams very close at hand. Across the road is a park, great for kids of all ages and home to a number of friendly Roman cats. Life outside the Napoleon - during the day at least - is a bustle of activity. There's a large market, bars, shops and restaurants {which tend to be much cheaper and more charming than those is Centro Storico}. Termini is just a few minutes' walk straight across the park, or one stop on the Metro. And the flower stalls dotted around the Piazza Vittorio are delightful. They seem to stay open all night and add more colour than these monochrome words can illustrate. At night it's quiet, and there are none of the sonic seepages which are an unavoidable feature of many hotels in the more immediately central part of Rome. A short walk down either Via Cavour of Via Nazionale brings you to either Via dei Fori Imperiali or Piazza Venezia and both are busy areas at any time of the day. So close, but so far away in terms of noise and crowds. If you don't want to go out you can eat or drink in. Both the restaurant and bar are priced to be competitive with local bars and restaurants , and the staff in both are a delight. If you choose to go out {I’d recommend that you do so, for although I’m passionate about this hotel I also love the area} I can personally attest to the quality of Al Cavallino Bianco, Trattorias Morgana, Monti and Vecchia Roma, all of which are {literally} just around the corner from Piazza Vittorio. And they’re just the tip of the iceberg. A few words about the safety of the neighbourhood at night. The two really important words are “No Problem”. It’s my custom on returning from an evening’s wanderings to pause for reflection and smoke a cigar before retiring for the night. The last time I did this was at around 1.15 AM this Monday. I’m not a man who enjoys fear and if Piazza Vittorio had any worrying aspects I certainly wouldn’t hang around it alone at night for any length of time. Put any worries raised here about personal safety out of your mind, they are utterly groundless. I feel safer in Piazza Vittorio at 1.15 in the morning than I do in my little English village {pop 300} at any time of the day. For sure there’s graffiti. But if graffiti is something which frightens you then you should avoid Rome altogether because you’ll see it everywhere. It’s part of Rome’s social history and has always been the Roman’s first choice when it comes to expression of discontent. You’ll find heaps of it at, say, Pompeii. Hotel Napoleon isn't a Radisson. It isn't a Hilton. It's a family run hotel and the emphasis is on personal service. In this it takes a pride, and I know something of the passion which goes into the running of it. But for all the big passion behind the scenes it's the little things - those little touches here and there {like the bottle of wine and the flowers left in our room on my wife's birthday the first time we stayed there} that will surprise you. They surprised me, so much that we kept coming back and have never been disappointed. If it sounds like the owner must be a friend of mine it's because he is, a close and much valued one. And that friendship was born of the impression I took away from my first visit – I simply loved the staff and the way the hotel was run. I booked a hotel. I got much, much more.

Reviews.Title: “Let me start by saying that the service...”
Reviews.Author: Bhakti_11
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the service at this hotel is fanastic. Absolutely lovely. Everyone In the staff was so friendly and welcoming. It was our honeymoon so the manage sent us a lovely bottle of champagne which was great. On checkout day, we left our luggage with then and went out, then came back at 2pm to pick up our luggage. It was nice to be able to leave our luggage while we got more sightseeing done. They were extrmely helpful and even got us a taxi to take to our next hotel from where we were starting our tour and the conceirge made sure that the cab driver knew where to go. Location is great, near markets and restaurants and right next door to the metro. Room was very clean and spacious. Plenty of room to place like 10 suitcases on the floor. Bathroom was small was not cramped, this is a standard room we stayed in. I am not fond of shower curtains which the shower/bath had. Also my rating for the room is based on my personal sense is space. The room had a window which looked onto nothing. Hence it was closed at all times and there wasn't much natural light. As such I felt a bit boxed in the room. Breakfast was lovely. One thing o found annoying was that I arranged for private transfer to the hotel from the airport. The car was a shuttle bus for me and my husband. Price was 48 euros. I though it was a bit pricey as I was under the impression that it would be nice sedan like private car. Also it's not the hotel's shuttle bus as I had to pay the driver directly in cash while I was aging thinking I'd be able to settle the bill with card at the hotel. When the driver gave me the receipt for 48 euros, I gave him a 50 euro note and he pocketed the entire money with no change of 2 euro. Now 2 euro to us is not much, but I was annoyed at the principal. I would be happy to tip the driver but it's my choice, the driver should have given me the change and then it's my choice to tip him. It is inappropriate of the driver to assume the tip with the money given so this is a complaint agaisnt the driver and not the hotel. I would recommend the hotel to friends and family as ery resonably priced in good location and excellent service where u are made to feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings, but overall good value”
Reviews.Author: asturias2905
Reviews.Content: We were a little dissapointed with the surroundings of the hotel. It appeared not to safe, after 2 days, we realized that it was ok. we had the transportation arranged from the airport, nice mercedes. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, especially signore roberto. the room was clean and we were able to rest nicely. the TV remote control did not work too well, but we did not care. we walked a lot, and the hotel is a little far from the popular monuments. The only thing i did not like at all was the breakfast, but that was just me. I did not like 90% of the things at the buffet. My wife liked more things though, Also, i have to say that the hotel staff was nice enough that we were able to left our 2 big suitcases at the hotel for 2 nights when we visited Vienna. Overall, I will come back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: blueeyesCoKerry
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Hotel Napoleon with our Family as we were getting married in Rome. From the initial reservation enquiry to the day we checked out everything about the Napoleon Hotel was extremely friendly, extremely courteous and extremely efficent. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to other travellers whatever their reason for travelling to Rome as a very warm welcome awaits...

Reviews.Title: “Return visit after 13 years - Still the same high standards”
Reviews.Author: OmaghCo.Tyrone
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in this hotel 13 years ago and were so impressed that we decided to use it again on our return visit to Rome for 7 nights. It certainly did not disappoint. We booked directly with the hotel and were given a free private transfer between the hotel and airport and also received a free meal in the restaurant for the stay of over 6 nights. The location is so convenient with a metro stop outside the front door. Also within easy walking distance to the colosseum. The staff at reception were very helpful. The food in the restaurant was excellent and reasonably priced as were the bar charges. Breakfast was adequate for Continental standards. We were able to attend their weekly evening of wine and food tasting and found this to be very gracious and enjoyable as it gave us an opportunity to meet and exchange ideas with other guests. Liked the standard room as it was spacious enough and had plenty of storage space and comfortable beds. Bathroom was spacious had a large shower with a proper shower door and was kept well serviced. Had no concerns about the area as it was vibrant and felt safe during the daytime however we usually made use of the metro if we went out at night and were able to arrive back just outside the front door. Had stayed in this hotel 13 years ago and were so impressed that we decided to use it again on our return visit to Rome for 7 nights. It certainly did not disappoint. We booked directly with the hotel and the stay of over 6 nights we were given a free private transfer between the hotel and airport and also received a free meal in the restaurant. The location is so convenient with a metro stop outside the front door. Also within easy walking distance to the colosseum. The staff at reception were very helpful especially when my husband dropped his camera and broke the lens attachment. They checked for a repair centre telephoned the shop and provided a print of how to get to the shop. The food in the restaurant was excellent well served and reasonably priced as were the bar charges. Breakfast was adequate for Continental standards. We were able to attend their weekly evening of wine and food tasting and found this to be very gracious and enjoyable as it gave us an opportunity to meet and exchange ideas with other guests. Liked the standard room we were given as it was spacious enough and had plenty of storage space and comfortable beds. Bathroom was spacious had a large shower with a proper shower door and was kept well serviced. Had no concerns about the vicinity as it was vibrant and felt safe during the daytime however we usually made use of the metro if we went out at night and were able to arrive back just outside the front door. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Forget The knockers Try a Traditional Friendly Family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harlequin45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Napoleon in July on the occasion of my wifes 60th birthday for eight nights, and found the charm of this hotel absolutely marvellous.The Superior room that we booked was clean and spacious serviced each day without any problems. The breakfast that is provided consists of hot and cold fare and is enough to suit the most fastidious tastes and on days when you need to leave early the kitchen can provide a packed breackfast, American coffee and tea are also available along with fruit juices. The Metro just outside the front door will take you to all the local attractions very easily, dont be affraid to use it the locals are very friendly and will help you if you ask, and tickets can be purchased from the concierge It will save your feet and a lot of time. The hotel is located in the old part of Rome don't confuse this with bad part of Rome there are plenty of restaurants in the area to eat at if these dont suit 10 minutes or 2 to 3 stops on the metro will put you at the spanish steps where there is an abundance of restaurants to suit every taste and budget. I would personaly like to thank Robert Cioce General Manager, Franco Quirinis Head Concierge & the staff of the hotel for there kindness during our stay also for the dinner & flowers presented for my wife's birthday and the loverly wine tasting evening that we had. If we decided to return to rome we would certainly stay at the napoleon hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - Ignore the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: HolidayObsessed84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a holiday in Italy and we spent 2 nights at the Napoleon Hotel and it was just fabulous! At the most it was a 15 minute walk from the main train station but there is a metro stop (A line) right outside the hotel - The hotel is also a 10/15 min walk to the Colosseum or a 5 min walk to S.M.Maggiore from which you can catch every hop on/off bus tour that Rome has to offer. The area around the hotel does infact look a tad seedy BUT I felt that Rome in general looked seedy - we walked back to the hotel late both nights and were never once bothered or frightened plus there are police everywhere in Rome The hotel is perhaps in need of some renovations or a lick of paint here and there but nothing major (like most other hotels) - The rooms are large (for european standards) and spotlessly clean, the hotel had free(and fast) wifi, a small bar and restaurant with lovely staff and offered a great and varied breakfast buffet, the concierge was brilliant - offering helpful suggestions, directions and booking everything from taxis to tables in restaurants! So glad we booked this hotel, great way to end our holiday - if we ever go back to Rome, I would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Always Happy Times!”
Reviews.Author: Goodluck_travelling
Reviews.Content: Just back from our stay at the Napoleon and our visit to Rome. This visit was for our 5th Wedding Anniversary. We had our wedding reception at the Napoleon and have been back many times. Again, we would highly recommend the hotel and we honestly can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: GRinCali
Reviews.Content: I had a 'superior room' - an upgrade. Frankly it was a big disappointment. The entire hotel is typical of what you find throughout Europe - old, shabby hotels in need of renovations. It is adequate however - not dirty, not distressing, but four star - give me a break. My stay started poorly. The promised airport pick-up wasn't there and when I called the hotel they said they didn't have a reservation for me and couldn't pick me up. So I took the train and dragged my luggage over there. Well they did have my reservation and offered a free dinner in the hotel to make up for it. Ha! They ruined my morning, I sure wasn't going to ruin an evening by eating in that place. As to the neighborhood - not attractive, nothing there to do. The Metro is right outside the door and it will take you to the Borghesi and the Spanish Steps but it doesn't serve the fun areas of Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori or the Pantheon. My summary - look, you can find better places than this. Not the worst, but you will definitely be disappointed if you go there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: freddu98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our friend stayed 3 nights at the supposedly four star Napoleon Hotel based on the positive reviews from TripAdvisor and the description/photos from the hotel's website. However we were shocked with what we experienced here and we are still confused about how these other reviews could be true. First off, the hotel is in a very bad area of Rome and it's scary to be outside even during the day time (this is coming from 3 New Yorkers who have seen it all). There's graffiti literally covering all the walls of the shops including one that said "Go Home Yankees" and the hotel is located right outside a sketchy looking park with many shady characters and no other tourists/touristy things to be found. In fact, we were jeered at with racial comments by several locals while getting off the subway at the hotel and feared for our lives (no joke, we made a run for it). We had some trouble finding the place so we called the hotel directly and the concierge did not speak enough English to tell us where to go. Luckily we still found our way despite this. When we got there, we waited 30 minutes to check in because there was only 1 concierge on duty even though a huge line had formed leading outside the door for people checking in. This 1 concierge was also responsible for checking guests out at the other concierge desk AND taking luggage up as there was no bell hop in sight either. Additionally, the hotel is in dire need of renovations. The whole place smells like cigarettes and is very old and outdated--the website photos are very misleading. Our room also had a musty odor. There was only a noisy wall A/C that seemed to die down in the early morning, no central air. The bathroom was clean but the shower would alternate from scalding hot water to freezing cold water every 5 seconds--what a way to end a hard day of sightseeing. Other than 1 evening shift concierge,the others were very rude to us. The first night we called down to the front desk and told them we wanted out. We were informed that we would have to wait until the morning because no one on at night knew exactly what the cancellation policy was but only that there would be a penalty for leaving early. We checked out and moved to another 4 star hotel for the same price in a better area where we had a wonderful stay. To their credit, they are indeed literally steps away from the metro (next to where a homeless man resides) and their Wi-fi is fast. They do have a great selection every morning for breakfast and the days we left too early to go they packed us a box to take with us which was kind of them and the rooms are larger than what you'd find in most European hotels. However, there are definitely better hotels elsewhere for the same price out there that are much SAFER, more modern, and cleaner with friendlier staff. At best, this is a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find ...”
Reviews.Author: sharonsumy
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor reviews, I booked this hotel for 4 of us travelling to Rome prior to a cruise. From the moment the driver picked us up at the airport, we knew we had chosen correctly. The staff is absolutely amazing. They could not be more helpful, with restaurant (and gelato) suggestions, directions, maps and a bouquet of flowers to make up for a very minor problem (and a mean MINOR PROBLEM) in one of our rooms. The location is excellent. A metro station is right out the front door. One stop and you're at the Termini Station, a hub in Rome. The Colosseum is only a 10-15 minute walk away. The rooms are all spacious, with modern bathrooms and we loved the fact that the rooms faced a courtyard instead of the busy, noisy street. We were able to sleep with the windows open and not hear a thing. Breakfast was everything you could ask for. Lovely breakfast room with linen service. A hot and cold buffet was fully stocked and if there was something you didn't see and needed, the staff was there to make it happen. There was even a computer with internet access available to all guests. I needed a charger for my camera one day and they quickly provided it. Their aim is definitely customer service and they deliver 110% each and every day. I will definitely come back to this hotel on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The most memorable experience due to exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: sunflowers15
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon was by far the most enjoyable visit we experienced on our Italy trip. From the time of arrival in the foyer we were welcomed like we were special. The rooms are furnished traditionally with antics comfortable quiet and pleasing to theeye.. It has a huge beautiful guest lounge where internet can be used or large Tv or simply read as it is quiet and serene. Breakfast is bountiful with a large selection of both hot and cold foods to choose from. WE chose to eat at the hotel resteraunt which is silver service at reasonable prices and delicious. Franco at reception was very helpful with his color coded map for easy guideance and access to all the attracions transport and shoppers delight streets. It is within 15min walk from central station or change trains to find yourself at the door. Highly reccommend. It leaves a smile on your face. Thanks Franco from the Palermo family [--]

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: WalesfanRhyl
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Rome and we knew the location from tripadvisor so weren't concerned about walking across the city to visit city sights. Although a reasonable fitness is required. For example,Trevi fountain approx 30mins and Spanish steps about 40. The underground station is right outside the hotel and is very easy to use and cheap at 1 euro per trip.A day ticket is available though but not sure of price.We were concerned about crime in the city and were warned to be vigilant(as any city).We were reassured as there is a very good police presence and we think this deters criminals from the main tourist areas.The Hotel could do with some areas being refurbed but on the whole a nice place to stay.The staff are very welcoming and helpful.The shower curtain is a slight gripe,our room 110, had a narrow bath so not much space to move if you are a large build.The bar prices are reasonable when compared to city bars/restaurents.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: cgdublin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and the staff were helpful and friendly. The airport pick up was great. The location beside a metro stop made getting around easy and the Colosseum is only a few minutes walk away. An optional wine tasting on Friday night was a very nice touch. The breakfast is very good with a fine selection of food. Room was quiet with good air conditioning but the TV was dated with poor channel choice. The hotel is not like a chain hotel but is family run and this shows in the friendliness of the staff. Happy to support a business of this type providing good jobs for good people. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Free Champagne”
Reviews.Author: PinoSpringTime
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival, my boyfriend and I were greeted with a complimentary bottle of champagne, all because we stated that it was our anniversary (and it actually was) when we booked the room! The room was a little pricey but close to a great gelato place and really close to the metro! The rooms were spacious and tht staff was friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Hotel, Very kind and friendly Hotel Staff:)”
Reviews.Author: panar66
Reviews.Content: I stayed that nice hotel from 1 st of Sep till 6 th of September. I really like to stay in this hotel, Firstly , all staff, especially staff in reception , are so friendly, very helpfull and kind gentlemen. One of them named Roberto helped us for anything such as booking for restaurant, cab . Hotel is very close to metro,you can use metro to go to various Rome touristic areas such as Spagna,Fonte di Trevi ,piazza poppollo,barberini,via nazioanale,republica,etc...and even you can walk to Colloseum by walking, it takes 15 minutes from the hotel. Only bad thing about our room is curtain in the bath that touching my body . It was terrible and annoying while you are in the bath. 1 st of sept. is my birthday and they served us a bottle of champaigne. It was so polite act. So, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Forza Napolepn Hotel :))))

Reviews.Title: “Very old Hotel and at a very ugly area...”
Reviews.Author: Barufrida
Reviews.Content: Very old Hotel and at a very ugly area. The location is not so bad because you have the Metro right in front and you can move around easily. It has free wifi which is really good. Do not spend your money here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumireland
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay in this wonderful hotel in the last six months. The staff are teriffic and extremely helpful. it is located approx. a ten minute walk from the Colosseum and right outside the Metro. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Personal, Friendly, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tastell
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed for four nights at the Hotel Napoleon with our two children, 17 and 20, on the recommendation of parents who stayed there thirty years ago! . The hotel has a "homely" feel and was well situated for our needs. It is walking distance to the Colosseum and Forum, many restaurants and also to the main train station where you can get open top bus tours. And not forgetting the (literally) few steps to the Metro station! (No more threatening than London, New York or Chicago undergrounds). Whilst the Hotel is in a quieter area than the main tourist attractions we found this a haven after busy, hot days of walking. Two words can sum up the Hotel staff in our opinion: Friendly and courteous. They were only too happy to provide us information on request. We particularly enjoyed the Friday evening invitation to wine tasting and nibbles and an opportunity to meet the staff and other guests and to swap stories. The rooms were comfortable, clean, quiet with good air-con (essential in August). If we have to find a criticism the hair dryer in the bathroom on the wall was a little old fashioned and difficult to use, but apart from this everything else was to a high standard. The breakfast buffet was very good. There quite literally was something for everyone! In conclusion, if you want a traditional, personal approach from a hotel, as opposed to an impersonal large chain hotel the Hotel Napoleon is the hotel for you. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good Average Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jnpaussies2010
Reviews.Content: Location: Good (with large bags can't walk to/from Rail Terminal) too many cobbles etc. Room: (Superior) Queen +sofa - Large for European standards. No view. Quiet & good. Service: Franco is THE best. Very helpful. (Night staff not so helpful or friendly) Value: Like all European Hotels - overpriced, but this is ok value. For: Franco's service /help is awesome , continental breakfast is good too. Against: Night staff, plastic cups and like all European Hotels the dreaded steps! (but a small lift after steps is available). Other: Book the airport pick up - fantastic! We arrived early morning and welcomed the room being available by 930am! (after a 14hr flight - VERY welcome! & Gr8 , friendly service always! (except the night staff). Check the Trattoria Pizzeria one block away - downstairs totally Italian restaurant - gr8 value and awesome local atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: skr410
Reviews.Content: Spent one week in Rome this August. Pleasantly surprised by the hospitality of this hotel. Nice and clean, well located next to metro station 15 min walk from Colosseum , very cordial staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: AnneAsh
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days in this hotel in July and were really impressed with the service we received. We arrived very early due to our flights and were not made to feel that we were a nuisance in any way whatsoever. We were shown into a tastefully decorated lounge with free wi fi and we were able to sit and relax while our room was very quickly made available to us. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. It is a very nice 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and with a metro station just over the road, it makes this an ideal hotel for exploring wonderful Rome. Any questions are answered most professionally by the desk staff and they will go out of their way to assist you and even walked with us to our taxi and waved us off. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and would not hesitate to return there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “While the rooms were spacious and very clean the area left us uneasy when coming home after dark.”
Reviews.Author: maggie057
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napoleon was an experience in contradictions. While the rooms were spacious and very clean the area around the hotel was run down and felt unsafe after dark.The constantly hot and cold showers with the shower curtain constanly blowing in on you made showering an adventure. The hotel staff were not overly helpful and tried very hard to keep up the appearances of a 4 star hotel by being condescending.The breakfast was very good but their restaurant left much to be desired.In another area the hotel would be passable, in it's present location I would give it a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm, perfect hosts, great base for ROME”
Reviews.Author: flower_rose38
Reviews.Content: We picked the Napoleon Hotel because of the reviews in Trip Advisor and am very glad we did. We were there for 6 nights. Even though it has not as much "sparkle" as the photos depict, the staff, and I mean all the staff from the cleaners, to the bar and restaurant staff, to the front desk concierge certainly made our holiday the best we have had. Nothing was any trouble and everyone spoke English to help us with our many questions and bookings of tours. Nothing was to much trouble. And every single person was so friendly and accommodating. We were invited to a wine tasting to meet and greet the other travellers on the Friday night with wine and meats and cheese for tastings - how wonderful! The rooms were a surprise with being larger than I thought. After being in a 4 star hotel in England the previous week we were pleasantly surprised with the size and space in our room and bathroom which was really lacking in England. Yes it was a walk to most of the historical sites around Rome - but the exercise was well worth it - we stumbled over things we didnt expect, and yes the metro is literally outside the door. The only downside we had was the bed was a tad hard and the pillows werent soft - but it was such a small negative to so many positives we overlooked that. The rooms were very quiet and very dark. Free Wi-Fi. Delicious breakfast each morning included in the price and the bar area a lovely place to unwind before the night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Day72
Reviews.Content: We spent two night at this lovely hotel as a start of our honeymoon in Italy. We have only just arrived and gotten our room when we had champagne and a lovely card sent to our room as a congratulation note on our wedding a couple of days before. This was just one of the very warm touches the hotel had to offered. Nothing to complain about, lovely rooms, excellent breakfast, great staff and beautiful hotel. We will most certain stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, AMAZING staff and 10/10 service!”
Reviews.Author: ShmooAUS
Reviews.Content: We found our way to the Napoleon for our honeymoon after many positive reviews on Tripadvisor. Having not been in Italy before, we were really depending on the reviews of others to help us with our choice. We were not disappointed at all. From the time we arrived, Mr Lombardi (the Concierge extrodionarre!) made us feel welcome and comfortable.
