Knowing that is was our honeymoon, when we got to our room, he had organised the most beautiful bunch of flowers for my wife and a card of congratulations on behalf of the hotel. The hotel itself is perfectly located with the front door 20 metres from the train subway (which is your gateway to Rome) and only a stones throw (1 stop i think) from the Colloseum. The room was large and spacious and whilst it wasn't the most modern hotel, it was certainly clean, well kept and comfortable. All of the staff were impeccable and you get the feeling that this is a "family owned" style of hotel with some staff I believe being there for over 20 years. Roberto Lombardi was the star of the show. His recommendations on restuarants were PHENOMENAL and based on what WE wanted, not what was in the interest of the hotel as is usually the case. My only regret is that it has taken me 8 months to write this review. If you're looking for a place to stay in Rome and especially if it's your first time, CHOOSE THE NAPOLEON!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin7979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon 7 nights in July 2010. Positive aspects: The staff was really helpful, kind and warm. They'll find anything you need and fast! They spoke very good english and one of the concierge is French. The hotel is located right in front of the metropolitana; The air conditionning works well enough, which is important when we're talking 40 degrees celsius before the humidex!! The deluxe room is of a good size considering this is Italy and it is quiet. We slept very well! The room was clean too. The breakfast is perfect and the restaurant serves good food at a reasonable price in the evening, Downsides The hotel is located at least at a 15 minute walk from the closest attractions of Rome. After a long day of walking all over the city in the heat, we didn't feel like walking some more to find a restaurant in a historical setting. We ended up taking the metro every evening... The neighborhood is fairly poor and many immigrants actually sleep in the park that is right in front of the hotel. I was afraid to walk there in the evening, but nothing happened and the concierge seemed to think it was safe. The furniture in the big lobby on the second floor could use some cleaning as it looks real tired. All in all, we had a great experience and exercised a lot with all the walking! The hotel isn't expensive and I guess that compensates for it being a bit far from the action.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: beverleysimmons
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel did not look quite as expected from the outside when we arrived, the room we had more than made up for it. We booked a triple room and we were given a large double room, with twin beds, and an adjoining room with a single bed, which was also very spacious, with more than enough storage space. There was also a very large, clean bathroom with a separate shower. My only criticism of the bathroom would be that the shower cubicle could have done with being a tad bigger - but that is a minor complaint - the water was always hot and the power was perfect. The hotel was perfectly situated for exploring the city, with an entrance to the Metro subway literally outside the hotel. The welcome from the staff was extremely friendly and they were always happy to oblige with any of our queries - nothing was too much trouble. They were also very helpful with giving advice about how find certain landmarks and attractions and the best way to travel there, and a map with directions on. It was also very handy that you could purchase tickets for the Metro and buses from reception. The breakfast choice was extensive and I couldn't think of anything that was missing,or that I desired, that wasn't available. Overall, it was an extremely pleasant place to stay and I would definitely stay there again should I return to Rome one day.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: soniagallantry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Napoleon Hotel Rome for our honeymoon and stayed for 5 days. We were greeted by friendly and very helpful staff, special Thanks to Franco and Peter on the main desks.They were always very helpful and knew anything you needed to know about Rome giving great directions and advice. Our room was tastefully decorated/clean and very spacious and on our arrival we found a bottle of champagne on ice! The location of the hotel was perfect, we were able to walk to most of the attactions otherwise we used the hop on hop off bus - perfect! The breakfast was plentyful and suited to all tastes and again the staff we so helpful. We took the Leonardo Express train from Fiumicino Airport to Termini Station then took a short 10 mins walk to the Hotel, very easy! Definately would stay there again and would highly recommend anyone to stay at the Napoleon! Many Thanks to them for making our Honeymoon perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Ami-in-Germany
Reviews.Content: The personnel was extremely helpful. We were staying at the hotel for 10 days so we qualified for their car and driver program. We were met at the airport and brought to the hotel in a large (European large is Mercedes or Audi 8), very clean and comfortable car. This was especially nice since it was our first visit to Rome and we needed to figure out the lay of the land even though we are experienced travelers. We compared the cost with a taxi and it was only a few Euros more(about 5 Euro). The staff at the hotel was able to arrange for this car and driver for our return to the airport - this time at our expense. At the suggestion of the consierge, we took a cab on Wednesday for our audience at the Vatican. This was a great idea since we were there by 8:30 am and were able to sit in the second row of the second section. The hotel is located right by a metro station. We were able to get around town very quickly and inexpensively for the rest of our trip. Our room was large compared to the hotel of our friends. Even though our room didn't have a view, we had an excellent stay - who wants to stay in the room anyway... We didn't eat at the restaurant but the pub food was excellent, especially the pizza diabolo! On Friday, the owners provided a wine and cheese evening. While this didn't substitute dinner, it was a very nice opportunity to sample differing foods and to meet the owners as well as the other guests. I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You can not got wrong staying at the Hotel Napoleon!”
Reviews.Author: DBUCHTA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in one other hotel in Rome. It was so bad I can't remember the name...However I will always remember Hotel Napoleon's name as the only place I will stay in Italy's most beautiful city. I chose the hotel for the fact that the Metro line has a stop right out the front door (and the photo on the website of the room). I can say that the plan worked out except for when we first arrived. We took the train to the termini with the idea we would easily get to the Hotel by the Metro. Problem was we had too much luggage. Dragging our luggage up and down the stairs in the Metro was dubbed the 'Death March'. We must have looked like desperate, sweaty criminals on the run when we arrived. My advice....take a taxi from the termini, it's 6-7 Euros plus 1 Euro for each piece of luggage. When we arrived Domenico greeted us like 5 star clients-Thanks Domenico! -And got us to our rooms post haste. A very strong porter took our luggage up. I'm sorry I can't remember the Porters name...but he gave us a short tour of the elevators, breakfast room and common areas on the way. Our first impression of the room, was it was extremely warm. Romans are very conscious of electrical use so the AC was off. Our Porter turned it on and showed us how to use the remote for the TV and AC. The AC worked quickly to cool the room. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room and the large, by European standards, bathroom and our balcony. The balcony had no view, but you have Rome to wander to satisfy all your viewing needs. The 4 marks instead of 5 for cleanliness is for the bed spread that needed a good cleaning. Our room- 505 was very quiet. A huge plus considering how loud traffic is in the city. Breakfast was better then most "Continentals" offered. The usual fruit, coffee, cereal, toast and pastry are available...however there were many lovely coffee cakes, fresh salad makings, cold cuts, cheese and scrambled eggs. Oh yes, Cappuccino and hot chocolate are available- no charge. By the way, we made a sandwich of the breakfast brioche and cold cuts that we ate on for a snack on the plane home. Mary is the crown jewel of the breakfast room, bar and restaurant. Everyday she greeted everyone who came into the breakfast room with a warm Buon Giorno! One day she served us breakfast, poured wine at a complimentary wine tasting and then served us dinner in the hotel restaurant. As a chef, I know and appreciate an employee who looks busy all the time and is actually doing something. Mary was flawless in her service in a way that was unobtrusive and professional. (None of the American crap where the server has a need to tell you their name) At the Friday evening wine tasting, Roberto the Manager, welcomed us in and spoke about his love of Ruffino wines. We had a some nice cheeses and salamis plus some crispy toasts with garlic and anchovy. That evening we found out the Hotel Napoleon is a family owned business. Ever so much more personal then the corporate run places where you feel like another number/person in line I HEARTILY recommend the Hotel Napoleon!!! Diane Buchta

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IschiaFischia
Reviews.Content: This is the second time stayed at the Napolean in Rome. We were there last year and we returned again this year. The location is great for getting around Rome. It's very close to Termini station and there is a Metro Entrance literally 3 meters from the front door of the hotel. One of the real highlights of this hotel is the head concierge, Franco. With France, it's basically like staying with your uncle in room. He is ready to help and serve you with all your needs. He booked great restaurants for us, gets us deals on Taxi services and is always a delight with our daughter. Another highlight of this hotel... the best ice cream shop is room is located less than 500 meters away... FASSI! The breakfast is very nice with a little bit for everybody and when you can't make the breakfast, they will even pack you a breakfast to go! The rooms are very clean and comfortable and include high speed internet access. The fastest wifi connection I experienced in Italy. I would and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service Perfected!”
Reviews.Author: EagleOfArgyle
Reviews.Content: I want to start by giving one particular employee of the Napoleon Hotel extremely high praise and a "Thank you". Mr Franco greeted us by coming from behind the desk and shaking and welcoming each member of my family by name. Even though we were tired and sweaty from a long, hot overnight train ride, he treated us like we were dignataries. EVERY request we had, from softer pillow and matress to directions and advice, he gave them with a smile and without delay. He is a tremendous asset to any hotel! Now, to the hotel itself. If you take the metro (Line A - Red) to the hotel, get off at the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele stop which is only one stop from the Roma Termini (main train station). After coming up the escalators and stairs, turn left and keep left every time there is a split in the underground hallway. That will bring you up to ground level about 20 feet or less from the hotel entrance! The surrounding area is not the best, but not horrible. Once you enter the double wooden French doors to the hotel, you will find Mr. Franco (smiling) hopefully and a wonderful hotel experience! It's beautiful! Your bags are taken to your room for you, there is a big lounge with a TV (in English), Internet access at a desk, large dining area where the wonderful included breakfast is served and a bar. The rooms have A/C and the outside noise is little to none. The rooms aren't huge, but definitely roomy enough to walk around comfortably as is the bath. We had 4 family members, so we had to book 2 rooms as most rooms in Europe that I found only had a max of 3 beds. The front reception will handle faxes and computer printing for you as well. For a hotel so close to many attractions, this hotel is priced very well according to my research. Mr. Franco and the others will help you find your way around the city. It is a very short walk to restaurants, shopping and the typical tourist attractions such as the Coloseum, Forum and Circus Maximus (what is left of it). There are street vendors and store shopping just outside of the hotel. The vendors will haggle if you like that challenge! Getting to the sites further out is quite easy using the Metro. There are only 2 lines and Line A gets you most places. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The Napoleon makes you feel like a part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DonMac55
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to have stayed at the Napoleon for twelve days in July, 2010. The service provided by the staff is first class. Having stayed for this extended period of time you are able to evaluate the commitment of the staff to their guests. I can truly say that they want your stay to be the best that it can be. From the cleanliness of the rooms, to the exceptional service provided by our concierge Franco, to the guest events hosted by the General Manager Roberto Cioce and the very good food service in the hotel, they made our vacation especially memorable. The hotel is located within walking distance to many of the major sites and has the added benefit of being less than twenty yards from the metro entrance. The Hotel is in the middle of a residential neighbourhood and commercial zone which gives you a taste of the daily life in Rome. There are four restaurants that we visited in this area and they were all very good. We also walked a great deal in the evening and never felt uncomfortable in our surroundings. Would we stay there again, absolutely. We would recommend the Napoleon to our friends without question. It is a rare occurrence that you come across a family run business such as this and you are made to feel "part of the family".

Reviews.Title: “Extremely considerate and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JJCI
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable with good public spaces. breakfast wsa buffet style and very good. Rooms were clean and well appointed although the rooms opened out into a falrly ordeinary lightwell. However the hotel came into it's own after my wife and I had a freak accident when walking through the park at teh Trajan's Baths one evening and a tree fell on us meaning that we had to be rushed to hospital for emeergency treatment for some serious cuts and bruises. On our return to the hotal they couldn't do enough for us. They allocated another room for us the next day so that we could stay at the hotel until our evening flight. They provided us with lunch and to cap it off they arranged a car to take us to the airport all at their expense. The staff were all concerned about our welfare and couldn't do enough for us. We'd definately recommend the quality of service to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service in a Very Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DaveWhe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in July for 2-3 days each time, once in a standard room and once in a superior room. Both rooms were well equipped with comfortable beds, TV, wall safe and modern well equipped bathrooms. All the staff have an excellent command of English and any request/advice/problems are met with a smile and efficiently dealt with even apparantly to the extent of changing your mattress if you find it too hard/soft,. It is a family run hotel and the managing director, Roberto Cioce, a most charming gentleman, came and spoke to all the guests who ate there in the evening. He regularly runs wine tasting sessions in the evenings, introducing guests to local wines with generous tastings of each wine and accompanied with canapes. We ate in the restaurant regularly in the evenings and the italian menu did not dissapoint. The complimentary american breakfast was also good. The location is convenient since the subway entrance is right opposite the front of the hotel. You could walk to the colliseum/forum in about 15 minutes and the train station in 10 minutes. The surrounding area has a mixture of mid level shops and bars/cafes. This hotel represents very good value for money and the level of care and service shown to the guests lift it's rating to excellent in my view. Well done Roberto and all your staff. David Wheaton, Perth, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great price.”
Reviews.Author: ssullydc99
Reviews.Content: When we first walked up to the hotel for our 5-night stay, we were nervous about the area. It seemed a bit shady. We checked in with the very friendly & helpful staff and made it up to our pretty big (for europe) room (#119). We immediately started looking online for hotels in other areas. We decided to give the Napoleon at least a day and stayed. We quickly realized that the area was not that bad. The graffiti is off-putting, but there is graffiti EVERYWHERE in Rome. There are homeless & gypsies everywhere in Rome. So, just deal with it. Our first night was Friday, so Roberto had a lovely wine reception and that really helped us enjoy our stay. The location is great because we had an easy walk to the Coliseum & Roman Forum. The Metro is right outside and easy to use to get almost anywhere you'd want to go. We are walkers, so we don't mind 10-12 miles per day of walking around a city like Rome. It's true there is no view, but if we wanted to sit in our hotel room and look out the window, we could've just bought a book about Rome and saved ourselves the trip. The staff was incredible, the breakfast was good, the bed could've been a bit more comfortable, but the room was fine. We had dinner at the Roma Antica down the street on the first night and the food was really good and pretty inexpensive. Other nights we ate closer to the Spanish Steps (Otello - Awesome. Ate there twice). Then some gelato and a 10 minute metro ride right to the hotel's door. We never felt unsafe, even when walking around our hotel at night (and we lived in West Philadelphia, we know what unsafe feels like!). I would stay in the Hotel Napoleon again. The price was comparable to a Suburban Marriott or Hilton in the states. Some of the complaints on this site are unfounded and, frankly, racist. If you're afraid of graffiti or non-white people, then you have bigger concerns than your hotel in Rome. When in Rome, don't miss the Borghese Gallery Museum in Villa Borghese (you MUST reserve your tickets in advance, you can't show up & walk in). Also, 5:30 pm every night on the right side of the bottom of the Spanish Steps is a free walking tour of the historical city centre. The tour guides work for tips and it was a great little walking tour. And don't miss Campo dei Fiori and Trastavere. Great little residential neighborhoods away from the tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel With Great Attention to Service Detail”
Reviews.Author: adammichael77
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel that my wife and I stayed at during our 3 week honeymoon throughout Europe. It had a great central location and was close the train station and their was a Metro stop right next to the hotel. This place is family run and the breakfast and service was superb. We definitely would like to tank "Franco" for his warm personality and recommendation for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: encino5_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy where we spent 6 nights at the Hotel Napoleon. We'd definitely return there. It's located a short walk from the Colosseum and the central train station, and many of the other major sites are walkable as well. There is also a Metro stop right outside the door, so getting to the Vatican was a breeze. The rooms are clean (perhaps the carpet and bedspreads could be updated), and there is a very nice lobby on the second floor where we hung out after a day in the city (with the hotel bar right off the lobby), with free internet. Best of all was the concierge Franco, who was always ready with excellent restaurant options, directions, and great service. It was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Wrong Location (Possibly)”
Reviews.Author: AndyW1021
Reviews.Content: This Hotel wasbooked as part of a package which included collection from the airport, The smartly dressed driver was waiting and drove us to the Hotel in his new spacious Mercedes. First impressions of the Hotel were not great, it is entered by a double door set in a block of shops which are shutterd at night in all their graffited glory. The staff on reception could not have been friendlier with warm hanshakes and it was like being greeted by long lost friends. The room was more than adequate for three adults with a double and two full sized single beds. The shower/bathroom was clean and spacious and well equipped with towels and toiletries and the room was always clean and tidy. Breakfast was on a buffet basis which wa more than adequate with pleasant staff on hand to serve hot drinks There is a communal bar and T.V lounge and internet access in addition to the T.V. in the room. The consierge went out of their way to be helpful looking up obscure places and printing maps if required. The main rail trminal is a 5 minute walk away and the subway ( which is safe) entrance about 20 feet from the front door. Although the area has an air of being a little run down we walked everywhere at all hours without the slightest concern. The only draw back to the hotel was the lack of any view to the outside.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect home when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sacul
Reviews.Content: We recently had the good fortune of staying at this wonderful hotel. Guided by previous Trip Advisor users we booked a three day stay to commence our holiday in Italy. The hotel was everything that we understood that we would find and more. We booked a package which included an airport pick up. The driver was awaiting our arrival and efficiently dove us to the hotel in a large, comfortable mini van. As described in other reviews the highlight of this hotel is the friendly, family run environment. Staff are eager to please, courteous and efficient. The included breakfast was of a high quality and was served by friendly staff. The room and all facilities met our very high standards for cleanliness. The location of the hotel is perfect with the subway entrance literally feet from the front door. One point that must be mentioned is that of the area that the hotel is located in. Some writers expressed concern about the neighbourhood. I can assure all that we went out at night on multiple occasions and walked to restaurants and even for a late night gelato and always felt safe. Also to clarify, this is not a new hotel and the furnishings are by no means elaborate. However, the beds are comfortable, the air conditioning works and we always had hot water in the shower. In addition, little touched such as the free computer for guest internet access was very much appreciated. All in all we can only give this hotel our highest rating and have no hesitation in recommending others to book here with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel in Rome at an amazing price!”
Reviews.Author: elsa9697
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we ever went to and trust me we have seen a lot of high end hotels and yet you don't pay a high end price for a room here! From the moment you step thru the door, the staff makes you feel right at home and the whole place feels like home from the incredible breakfast buffet where staff greets you with a huge smile and a friendly goodmorning and fast, fast service all the way to the reception desk where both gentlemen may as well be your friends....it was an amazing experience for us. Quiet rooms, very clean, all amenities including free wifi in the room, at a great price. No, they did not pay me to say this, and no I am not part of their staff. We are a Dutch-American couple with a 13 year old, we stayed for 6 nights and when in Rome, no doubt we will go right back to this hotel. Any other hotel just would not do that's how good they are! Milla grazie, Hotel Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “After traipsing through Europe, Hotel Napoleon was our favorite place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: poshi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon was a perfect end to our travel through Germany and Italy. The warmth of the staff, the attention to detail, the overwhelming attitude of excellent service was by far the best of all our hotels. We had great advice for restaurants, sightseeing, and managing the subway. Our personal favorite was Franco, who overdid himself with kindness and service. Please tell him HI from the Goodmans when you see him! Enjoy your stay at Hotel Napoleon!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: wolfman2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Napolean for 4 nights before going on a cruise. The hotel exceeded expectations in every way. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful. The breakfast was great, with many choices to please everyone. The location was perfect. We could walk to almost anywhere. The metro is right by the extrance to the hotel. Termini station was a 10 minute walk, so getting a bus to somewhere the metro did not get to was no problem. There were ample restaurants around, and the oldest and largest gelato place was less than a 5 minute walk. Who could ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and comfortable, but does not quite hit the key”
Reviews.Author: 2NO-mad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok for our trip in Rome prior to going to Sorrento. It is centrally located with the subway right at the door step. From there, it is quite easy to walk to the Colosseo and Forum Romano. The hotel is in an old building, so the structure is old, but well-kept. The only thing I can agree with the last reviewer's negative views is the size of the elevators: yes, they are quite small because they are basically antiques. But this didn't bother us at all. We were happy to take the very wide stairs whenever there was no need for an elevator, but taking the elevator was not a big deal; more like an "exotic" thing to do. Front-desk staff was not warm but professional and helped us with all information we needed, except when we wanted to buy train tickets to Napoli, one of the staff members we were consulting with tried to convince us to buy from an agent he knew, saying that buying at the station could be difficult. Being big city dwellers ourselves, we quickly found out the train station was at walking distance from the hotel and purchased our tickets right on spot in 5 minutes! This bothered us because it sounded as if he wanted to profit from our assumed naiveté. Food at breakfast was good, though not very Italian, more like American breakfast, but well-served. Staff at the restaurant was very helpful and truly friendly and helped us with anything for our 4-year old. One morning breakfast, though, the restaurant was extremely full and guests had to wait in line to be seated, so the restaurant size cannot accommodate a fully booked hotel. Rooms were simple and clean. Beds are not king-sized, but mattresses are comfortable. Slow internet was available in just one old computer that did not have connection to a printer. We stayed one more night at this hotel after returning from Sorrento to take our flight home, so we stayed in 2 different rooms and saw no difference in terms of comfort. We did check out on time, but our transportation to the airport arrived quite late and the only person at the front desk did not help us carry the luggage (the same guy who tried to sell us the train tickets)! We had paid the airport shuttle along with our hotel bill, but when we arrived at the airport, the driver demanded that we paid him! He was quite aggressive and rude and could not speak good English, but with my somewhat ok Italian, I explained we had already paid at the hotel, which he took as a lie and called the hotel from his cell phone. As he was talking to the hotel, we left against his will because we were already late for checking in due to his delay in arriving at the hotel. I'd say the service at Napoleon is not very standardized or consistent. I think it is one of those hotels that can afford, if you're lucky, a good stay or a not so pleasant one. It really depends on how relaxed you are. If you're willing to risk, I'd say it's a good stay without all the 5-star amenities for someone who will be spending whole days exploring the city, which is what we did. Why would you stay inside a hotel in Rome anyway, except for sleeping? In the end, I have to ask myself if I'd return. The answer is: I'd probably look for something else, but I suppose I can still recommend it to the relaxed ones.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Value with Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Brett513
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly and professional. Anything you needed help with such as tours, locations, maps, changing currency - they were on top of it. The location is not very inspiring, but it is one metro stop from Termini - which is important if you are traveling with luggage by train. If you have limited time and want to see all of Rome, staying near Termini makes it easy to get around. Dont walk from Termini to the hotel when you have luggage - take the metro towards Anagnina. Make sure you use the DANTE exit at the VICTORIA EMMANUEL stop off the metro - it comes our right in front of the hotel. The other exits will dump you out on a street that will make it hard to find the hotel due to some construction in the square. Breakfast was reasonably good - ask the servers for a Cappuccino there is no extra charge. W-fi is good and no charge either. The room itself was uninspiring, and fairly small - but that's what you get in this price range. Make sure you are on a good diet before you get in the shower stall - if you drop the soap you will have to leave the shower to be able to bend down to pick it up. The elevator is slow and very very small - we used the stairs. If you are on a limited budget, the hotel is fine, but if you have a few more dollars you could stay over near Piazza Navona, which is more exiting for dinning and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “STOP RIGHT NOW!”
Reviews.Author: jambar22
Reviews.Content: The 600 somewhat reviews MUST be from a staff member whose job it is to write a review every day because this hotel is a DUMP! When we first got to the hotel they booked us a room on the 2nd floor of which we needed to use not one, but TWO elevators that could literally fit only 3 people, to get to our room. The room was so filthy and moldy and teh bed was hard as nails so we immediately asked to switch. They switched us to a room on the 5th floor, which was less filthy but still a dump. The bed was like a cot and the pillows were flat. There was no water pressure in the shower and the AC worked minimally. The walls in this hotel are so thin that you could hear EVERYTHING from the nearby rooms and the hallway. Also, the door's second lock did not work so anyone from the hotel who had the key could get in if they wanted to while you were sleeping. They didn't of course but they could have. This was the WORST hotel I have ever stayed at and this made my trip to Italy horrendous. I do not know what the other reviewers are saying...I can't imagine that these positive reviews are real. Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: simms11
Reviews.Content: We stayed over on a Friday night before catching our Sat am flight back to the US. Since we stayed at the Artemide on Nazionale for the first part of our Rome trip, we were a little disappointed by the location and appearance but it worked out fine. Friday afternoon desk clerk was not friendly or helpful (7/23) but the man who took over later that night was great (I think he was a manager). He arranged for a taxi to the airport the next morning, $49 euro for 3 vs. est $45 cab but it was pre reserved and hassle free. He told us to get to the airport 4 hrs. early, 2 or 3 would have be fine but better safe .... I guess. Rooms are definitely tired but fine and the AC was very modern which is a big plus we found on our trip. Overall, I thought this was a great deal. The only drawback is the location which based on trip reports is not as dodgy as it looks.

Reviews.Title: “This was a nice find in Rome.....”
Reviews.Author: J_SIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Napoleon last week to attend a wedding. When we arrived the first impression from outside the hotel was not great BUT from the moment we entered the hotel and the immediate hospitality that was evident we were very pleased. And the initial welcome was not only at reception...it seems like all the staff are committed to making your stay a pleasure from the manager (especially the wine tasting on friday evening) to the bar staff and chamber maids. Nice example of the attention; my wife went for a siesta one afternoon and shortly thereafter I came up to the room. Not having a key I was about to knock on the door when the chamber maid who was in the hall stopped me and let me in with her key....so that I would not disturb my wife. That is attention. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: BuddysArmy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here (room 507) for 4 nights, and we were very impressed! -Great assortment for breakfast (even had a large selection of gluten-free items) -All staff spoke English -The front desk was very helpful with writing routes on large (easy to use) tourist maps -The metro is two steps out the front door (and very easy to use) -Quick walk from the Train Station (great when you are rolling luggage down the street) -The A/C was controllable by remote control and worked great -Thin screen TV gave more room to layout personals on counter -As non-Italian speaking, we were happy the tv channels provided CNN international -Iternet access was easy to login and fast (they also had a guest computer for anyone to use in sitting room) -The walk-out balcony (two chairs and a table) was large, but was way to humid and hot for us to enjoy -Close walk to some of the main attractions (Collesuem, Roman Forum) -Felt very safe in area -Very quiet -Loved the mini-fridge in room, as we brought some waters and sodas at local store -Rooms small as others have stated, but we felt the layout was used to its fullest potential -Bathroom was very new and beautiful -We already had tours booked, but the Lobby had current tours that they would have booked for you

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojozwp
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in one of what is becoming one of the less savoury areas of Rome. The hotel itself is clean and well attended. the park across the road is not so well preserved. We found the location ok, with the metro across the road and within walking distance to the colosseum. We were picked up from the airport by a driver, (which we paid extra). he spoke very little english and was not very forthcoming with information on the drive in. The rooms at the Hotel Napoleon are very tired and really need upgrading, but having said that were very clean and quiet. Internet access is an issue, with only one computer in the lounge. The dining is magnificent, with dinner and breakfast both fantastic. The dining and bar staff are fantastic and very friendly, perhaps the concierge and front desk staff could learn from them! Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality plus in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Overseas_Aussie
Reviews.Content: Near the termini station it is in a great location and very easy to get around Rome whether you walk or take the train. The staff at reception, the breakfast room and especially at the concierge desk went above the call to help us at anytime with any thing we wanted to know, especially the Concierge Roberto. Our upgraded superior double room was delightful, very clean & comfortable. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: Vladdhu
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to describe the level of attention that the staff gave us. The relation was very personal, we got to know a few of them well. One of them borrowed me a cd that I liked that he brought from his personal collection, just because I casually mentioned that I liked the music. The building is superb, easy access to metro, the lobby, the rooms, the restaurant were all absolutely excellent. I had a very comfortable feeling being in this hotel, it was like I was home. I have only appreciation and great thoughts for the owners and the staff, they are doing an exquisite job. If u are in Rome, stay at this hotel and will definitely come back another time.

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon has comfortable atmosphere and outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: tourists_06_2010
Reviews.Content: We would definitely go back! This hotel was a short walk from Termini Station and the subway was literally outside the front door. We could also walk to many local tourist sites. The atmosphere inside the hotel was friendly - nice lounge areas where guests congregated to watch FIFA world cup games and free internet was a great bonus. Rooms were clean and comfortable and ours faced a quiet courtyard. Beds in Europe tend to be firmer than North American mattesses, but we requested a pillow-top and staff was happy to accommodate immediately. The hotel dining room had good service and food was good, although we only ate dinner at the hotel once. Breakfast room was bright and cheerful and buffet offered great variety. Our only criticism was the coffee which was quite thick and black - we missed Tim Horton's. The staff were all very friendly. Front desk staff, in particular, are seasoned professionals and provided excellent suggestions with respect to local restaurants and walking routes that would take us to interesting venues. We have already recommended this hotel to our friends who are travelling to Rome next month! Jo Anne & Steve

Reviews.Title: “A lovely family owned hotel in a changing neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ERd0c
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Napolean for three nights in late June. Prior to our arrival, all our emails were answered promptly. We were met at the airport by a limosine arranged by the hotel. The staff could not have been friendlier - the concierge went overboard and even stayed late one day to help us. Language was not a problem. We met the owner at the Friday cocktail reception and he obviously is very proud of his family business. Most of the employees have been there for many years. The room was comfortable with a fair AC (we were there during a hot spell) and the bath was nice and well appointed. The room looked like it had not been redecorated in about 10 years but was very clean and the bed comfortable. My husband was pleased with the free WiFi. The room rates were reasonable in this expensive city. The subway was right outside the door. Breakfast was very good as were drinks in the bar. The only thing that was of concern was the changing neighborhood. Even one of the cab drivers commented that we should be "5 blocks away in a little nicer area." I did not feel unsafe, but we also did not walk around the neighborhood at night. Right now, the Hotel Napolean is holding its own in this increasingly immigrant neighborhood but I suspect that in 5 years this may not be the case.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: ToogoodTrip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our first visit to Rome. Our booking included a complimentary transfer from the airport and we travelled to the Napoleon in a very comfortable Mercedes. We had a friendly welcome from the Concierge Franco, checked in, and were shown to our room which was clean and airy with a good sized bathroom. The bed was comfortable with additional pillows and bath robes and slippers were provided. The breakfast was excellent and offered eggs, toast, assorted pastries, fruit, cereal, cheese etc. We had dinner a couple of evenings in the dining room and found the food and service excellent. Each Friday evening the owner, Roberto, hosts a wine and cheese reception for all the guests and this is his opportunity to personally greet his guests and explain a little about the hotel. He then took the time to go round and speak to everyone individually which was lovely. The front desk staff were amazing, Franco, Roberto (Concierge) and Peter (Check in) and each time we passed through we were greeted and asked if they could do anything to help. Franco and Roberto arranged our tours, provided maps and walking directions, gave us restaurant recommendations and generally provided the answer to every question we had. This was all done in an extremely friendly but professional manner. We cannot speak highly enough of these guys. We found each member of staff to have a great pride in the hotel and all were concerned with ensuring guests were well looked after – nothing was a bother. This was our first time in Rome but we intend to go back. Thank you to the Management and Staff at The Napoleon for a wonderful stay and for ensuring we left Rome with a very positive impression of the City and your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Napoleon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Montreal70
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome and we stayed at the Hotel Napoleon and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very nice, friendly, attentive to any of our requests and also very nice to our kids. Eveyone in the hotel always checked that we were doing fine. Every time we had a request they responded very quickly and we never had to ask twice for something. Our room was pretty spacious and very quiet. We also appreciated the air conditionning and the cleanliness of our room. The concierge was super nice and always helpful and gave very good advise about our itinerary. One night we had supper at their restaurant the food and service was fabulous. We would reccommend the Hotel Napoleon to anyone, great value.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at hotel Napoleon for 10 days...”
Reviews.Author: sueburf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Napoleon for 10 days in may 2010. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpfull. The complementary wine tastings on Friday nights is a nice touch. We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel with a metro line right outside the door”
Reviews.Author: unhappytaffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in June 2010 as the first part of our honeymoon. Our room I believe was one of the biggest with shabby chic furniture, we had no view to speak off but hey ho we were on our honeymoon. When we arrived we had a very warm and friendly welcome, my mum had arranged as a suprise for some champers and chocs to be delivered and the hotel then sent up some red roses. Unfortunatley whilst in Rome we were pick pocketed on the metro, we tried to report this to the police who weren't interested !! we then went back to the hotel for some help, whilst this probably happens all the time to tourists, I was kinda hoping for some sympathy :( the manager on reception shrugged his shoulders and said that we should of been more careful, I asked if there was anything he could do, he just pointed us in the direction of the internet, we manged to cancel all our cards and only lost 80 euros and a nice wallet. Whilst this incident had nothing to do with the hotel I did expect a litlle more help. It didnt spoil our honeymoon and we happily went on our way to Sorrento. Please please be careful when travelling on the metro suspect everyone and trust nobody. Overall this is a charming hotel that is a lot bigger than it looks, overall the staff are friendly, especially the swedish barmaid who makes a wicked brandy sour.

Reviews.Title: “Personal attentive service - don't miss this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kbadventure
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We felt like family from the moment we were welcomed by Franco. He escorted us to our room to freshen up and when we returned down stairs he had his map and highlighters ready to direct us to everywhere we wanted to go. He made dinner reservations for us, helped us get tickets printed for the Vatican, helped with the metro and helped us figure out the best way to get to the cruise terminal. At breakfast they helped us find safe foods for our daughter who has a severe peanut & tree nut allergy to eat each morning. Our room was incredible. The family room had separate bed for both of our children and they were thrilled! The welcome wine tasting was also fun! Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality plus!”
Reviews.Author: RocklandNewCityNY
Reviews.Content: Large room, very comfortable bed. Clean, well-lit, airconditioning, Large bathroom, very important to my husband. Desk service extremely helpful with maps, directions, taxis, etc. Large, lovely lounge area with computer access. Sufficient variety of breakfast foods. Near Metro stop. An excellent value for the money. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very clean ,spacious rooms and the staff were very helpful”
Reviews.Author: greyMontreal
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and very clean. The staff was very helpful. The hotel offered a full breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hosts, great accommodations, super location”
Reviews.Author: GL-NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel at the conclusion of our cruise to the Greek Isles. Our vacation could not have ended on a higher note. We had prearranged, through the hotel, a pick up from Civitavecchia since there were 6 of us traveling together. Everything could not have worked out better with the pick up. Upon arrival, the concierge was beyond accommodating and happy to help with all our questions and needs. In addition, the hotel was in a great location, in walking distance to everything. The rooms were large for European hotels rooms and the bathrooms were modern and clean. Just great all around. We would definitely recommend it to friends and stay there again. GL

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & great service”
Reviews.Author: bj105094
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay in Rome and loved every minute we stayed at the Napoleon Hotel. it is in a great location and very easy to get around Rome whether you walk or take the train. Easy access to and from the airport with the train. The hotel service was fantastic and there was nothing they would not do for you. You always felt like a welcomed guest with all of the staff. Friday night wine tasting is a must. The rooms were clean and quite spacious. The only fault were the tiny showers but from what I hear that is common for Rome. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would definately stay there again when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, great value, needs a bit of polishing.”
Reviews.Author: daniellescm
Reviews.Content: i would agree with most reviews here that recommend Hotel Napoleon as a reasonable choice in Rome, where hotel costs are astronomical. If you are prepared for a little walking, Hotel Napoleon is well-located for visiting a lot of the sites -- the little park on the way to the Colosseum is lovely. I didn't ever get very comfortable here, though. Some of the furniture is a little shabby (antique doesn't have to mean dilapidated) and a lot of the walls had marks on them from suitcases/furniture. And I know Rome is an old city with old plumbing, but it was impossible to take a shower without getting alternately scalded or frozen. Nothing major, but these things do draw your attention away fromt he positives. Breakfast and service were good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Rome if you want to feel at home, in a family run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Discerningtravel09
Reviews.Content: Free fast wireless internet and the staff are the best in the world. They will do ANYTHING to help you during your stay and are very kind and interested in you. The bar food is fantastic. Wine great. Bed very comfortable and bathroom high standard and well appointed. Very clean. Even the maids are extremely helpful and kind. Big advantage are the many lounge areas with comfy couches and armchairs where guests sit and chat. The decor may be a little "used" but its better than a 5 star Sheraton or Sofitel because the staff really care. The concierge is better than any hotel I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world and I have stayed in lots. One night I arrived back at midnight and had had no dinner and the barman made me a delicious toasted ham and cheese sandwich. You cannot go wrong. I had a big problem with a flight cancellation and the concierge went out of his way to help me until it was fully handled!!! They will also arrange a nice car to pick you up or take you to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: jparker65
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon is a great hotel. We stayed there for 4 nights in June and would happily stay at this hotel again. The location is good - 15 minute walk to the train termini and 10 minute walk to the Colloseum but still in a quiet area. The hotel restaurant is good and the breakfast outstanding. The staff are all very professional and very helpful. The hotel provides all of the services you would expect and all the facilities are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is too difficult at Hotel Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: Downunderone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for 4 nights from 25 April 2010. From the moment the driver -arranged by the hotel - picked us up at the airport everything was great. Arriving at the hotel at 7.00 am we were told our room "would be ready in a few minutes so please have some breakfast and it will be ready "- normal check in time was still 7 hours away! The staff at reception, the restaurant, the breakfast room and especially at the concierge desk went above the call to help us at anytime with any thing we wanted to know. Concierge Roberto even booked our Vatican tickets on his computer to save us time and money. The desk also had the Metro tickets (which can also be used on the buses)ready for guests. The breakfast is included and is tasty and plentiful although unchanging. The rooms are large by European standards and the bathrooms also sizable. The location gives easy access to the Metro, the Termini for all the buses and trains is only a pleasant 5-8 minute walk . Plenty of nice restaurants and a few little bars in which to watch the people go by. Only 15 minutes walk to the Colosseum and Palantine Hill. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great service--Not good breakfast--OK rooms‎”
Reviews.Author: Sinohe
Reviews.Content: The rooms were old and so its furniture. Maybe that was part of the theme(?), but I didn't expect it given the fours stars. The room itself (classic double) is really big, like a suit. The breakfast (which was included on the price) was not good at all, learning that the second day, I stick to jam and butter only. We also got free dinner for two, which was a great treat, the food was great, specially the spaghetti with meat sauce. Yum! The service was excellent. People were always smiling everywhere and very attentive and welcoming. BTW, the metro system in Rome are virtually useless, don't count much on the metro in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony5023
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at the Napoleon from 6/14/10-6/17/10. We worried and worried wheer the ehck we would stay in Rome (we woory too much) The hotel is fine. The rooms are small but all European rooms are small unless youfork over you life savings for a 5 star place, and even then they can be small. Its an easy walk to Termini train station and Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore. where you can get any of the open top tour busses. Also the Metro stop is 20 feet from thye front door (its easy to use don't be intimidated) The open top busses are an easy way to orient yourself to the city. Overall hotel was fine. We made our choice based 100% on trip advisor and since it helped us I figured I have to contribute something back. On a food note 2 great littel restaurants reasonably priced right near by. The Romantica and the Vecchio Roma. Food was great at both and reasonably priced. PS: I want to throw one rant in about all the crap you hear about pick pockets and the gypsys...its crap. Unless you are oblivious you should be fine. i worried myself crazy about it. Keep your wallet in your front pockets and if you have zippers on hiking pant pockets even better. If you've ever been to a big US city and you handled it you will be fine. Just be alert. I saw maybe 5 begging gypsies tops. Just use your head.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: LondonDaveBoy
Reviews.Content: Booked for three nights based on the trip advisor reviews and the thought that the hotel would overlook the piazza. Whilst the hotel is convenient for the metro the area is run down and the hotel has no rooms that overlook the square. I booked a single room at an average cost of 117 euros per night. The room was amoungst the tiniest I have ever stayed in (room 407). To give an idea of size the bathroom had only enough space for a corner cloakroom basin and the room was more like a (small) study. The TV reception was also extremly poor with no channels available to show the football World Cup (how could this be in Italy of all places). I immediately asked the assistant manager if I could change rooms only to be told that they would gladly put me in a double but unfortunatley they were fully booked. The following day I checked on the internet and found double rooms available! Breakfast is far from special. I havent seen tined fruit cocktail since the late 80's and no choice in type of yogurt with only three types of cereal. Fresh fuit juice(s) are now the norm in most 4star hotels, if you want fresh juice at the Napolean you are charged an extra three euros! On the plus side the rooms are very clean and the bed was comfy. The staff are friendly and the owner does appear to take pride in his hotel (if not the tined fruit cocktail). If you are a single traveller don't except a second rate room at this hotel there must be better elsewhere for the same money or less.

Reviews.Title: “Good loction for the train station, metro line, Colesseum, Roman Forum, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Firepig62
Reviews.Content: While the location is good, the friendliness of the staff, especially with the Friday night wine tasting, was exceptional. I especially enjoyed chatting with Mario. The overall service was excellent. When I go back to Rome I will stay at the Napoleon again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: whyte_10
Reviews.Content: We had several rooms for family who had travelled from Australia for our wedding. Both family and friends all loved the hotel and enjoyed meeting in the lovely lounge area where we could have a drink while we all got together. It is a very relaxed hotel and the staff are all smiles and very helpful. We walked from here to the coloseum which included grandparents and 3 prams, so it is a great location to access the sites. Lovely restaurants and sight seeing buses are a small walk away. If we return to Rome then we will definately book in again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely quiet, good location, take Pzza Dante exit.”
Reviews.Author: ArthurMF
Reviews.Content: As noted, this hotel is an amazing find given its location. Quiet and dark are my most important features after clean. This hotel had all 3. We stayed on the 5th floor and the room size (unlike the teensy elevators) was ample. The shower is meager, but acceptable. The bed was great. The room was quiet and dark. When you arrive by metro be sure to follow the signs to Pzza Dante, or just keep making left turns in the underground walkway. This will save you backtracking or searching. When you climb the steps, which can be very difficult if you have much luggage, the hotel will be just on your left. If you exit other places, you will need to search. (Make sure to reserve at Trattoria Vecchia Roma. You need a reservation. The food is very good and quite reasonable and staff friendly. It is one block away). Breakfast is excellent and the staff very helpful and they have a full supply of electrical converters. We paid $169 for room for 1 night. Great price. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend”
Reviews.Author: Dallk
Reviews.Content: From the tme we arrived we were greeted in a most welcome manner. Staff extremley friendly and courteous. Great location. Most enjoyable and had a wonderful stay. Can totally recommend Mark & Kerry

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pshepherd
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our brief 3 day stay in Rome so relaxing.We enjoyed the accommodations, small but very well maintained. Lovely clean linens every day. The staff made us feel at home and were very warm and friendly. Good location for folks traveling by trains. The great breakfast was a treat each morning. Dinner was gourmet too. The entire staff takes hospitality seriously.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED LOVED LOVED this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tmynatt
Reviews.Content: You can tell when entering the Hotel Napoleon that in the 1950s or 60s this place was posh and top of the line. The grandeur has faded a bit...but only a bit. Overall it is a fantastic and lovely place. We had 5 rooms with 14 people and the convenience of having the metro right at the front door to the hotel is just priceless. We arrived via EasyJet from Rome and used their car service for transport from the hotel straight to the front door of the hotel. Their car service was much cheaper than the Leonardo Express train from the hotel. It was also cheaper than the airport shuttlebus service which was 8 Euro per person. We had a Vatican Scavii Tour scheduled soon after landing and the Napoleon people had a little pizzeria around the corner waiting for our group for a quick lunch. The hotel even called ahead and had our pizzas ordered for us when we got there. The concierge even walked us to the front door of the pizzeria so we would not get lost or waste time. We bought all of our metro tickets from the front desk so we didn't have to waste time using the machines or ticket counters in the metro. They made several dinner reservations for us and gave us directions, they let us use their front desk computer/printer to checkin for our next flight and print 28 boarding passes. The rooms were comfortable and clean...not fancy but definitely larger than normal. The Air Condition worked great. The in-room wifi was free. The breakfast buffet was really big, varied, nicely laid out in a big organized dining room. The people here just bend over backwards to do anything possible to make your stay better. I've been to Rome several times and usually stay in the Camp dei Fiori or Piazza Navona area, but not anymore. It's the Hotel Napoleon for me for the rest of my travels to Rome. They were absolutely amazing, and I would give them 10 stars if I could!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: afslisboa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Napoleon Hotel in April, 2010, celebrating our wedding tenth anniversary . We were very wellcomed by all the staff, starting with the doormen, concierge, breakfast room staff and the manager, Mario, who hosted himself a wine proof. It is very pleasant to stak in Napoleon because they make us feel that we are guests in a family hotel and the really care. As soon as they discovered that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, they sent a bottle of champangne to our room. They were also always available to help us and the employees are fluent in English and also in our mother language, witch you do not fin often. Congratulation to all in the Napoleon Hotel for your daily performance and hope to get back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with great ambience”
Reviews.Author: statt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a 10 minute walk from Stazione and has a metro entrance right at the door. Our Superior Double was very spacious (by Roman standards), had a separate sitting room, and plenty of space for clothes. The breakfast was very good, with fresh juice available at a small extra cost. The only disappointment was the coffee served. Would like to see 'real' coffee on offer. The public rooms with free internet use were very comfortable and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place to stay whilst visiting Rome..!”
Reviews.Author: May065
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napoleon had many redeeming features not least the decor and the art on show. However, the main feature is probably the friendliness of the staff, who were always on hand when required and really pleasant to deal with. They advertise their buffet breakfasts and these certainly live up to your expectations with the variety and quality of food on offer. You could really go all day without eating again. Our room was perfect for our stay, even though we only booked a standard double, plenty of room, wardrobe space and we always returned each evening to fresh bed linen and towels etc. What more can we say, except, if you chose this hotel you will not be disappointed. We certainly hope to return one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly & Professional”
Reviews.Author: Australiansenroute
Reviews.Content: When in Rome - where do you chose to stay .... well if you have been before you might have such delightful memories that you would go no-where else. But for us it was not so and we decided to stay at The Hotel Napoleon. What a delight. Amongst the hustle and bustle of one of the most interesting cities of the world is a family run hotel that prides itself on integrity. From the minute you arrive you are guided and assisted by Franco. If there is to be a Concierge award it would surly go to this man. wow to get around, where best to eat etc.Thank you Franco. This of course would not be possible if it was not for the foundation members of this hotel. The Cloce family own this hotel and their representative is Roberto. We have never met a team so genuine and devoted. Thank you Roberto, your dedication to your patrons and staff is an inspiration. It goes without saying that the position of this hotel is excellent as it is opposite the metro. The price is without competition. The area is subjected to a bit of graffiti which was unsettling for me but we never felt compromised and found it perfectly situated. Of course you can stay closer to the centre but you will need to allow for treble the price!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back here!”
Reviews.Author: skinnspirit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Napoleon for five nights two weeks ago, with my nephew (his high school graduation gift--a trip to Italy). We loved the hotel! Clean, neat, great rooms, comfortable beds, cool a/c, free wifi, excellent breakfast, and marvelous service. The concierge desk was tremendously helpful with directions, hailing taxis, restaurant recommendations, Roma passes, and so on (thanks Franco, from the Kuruvillas!). Restaurants and grocery stores close by. And one cannot beat the proximity of the Metro station, literally at the doorstep of the hotel--very convenient (and this Metro station is only one stop from the Termini).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: jacjosef
Reviews.Content: Being a solo female traveller arriving in Rome I was immediately put at ease by the warm welcome by Francesco and his assistance with everything. It meant a lot to me .This hotel has a happy friendly atmosphere and old fashioned service . Mary in the breakfast room is a delight as are all the staff who will talk with and help you .There is also a computer free to use, relaxed comfortable lounge area and newspapers to read Thank you Hotel Napoleon!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Great people”
Reviews.Author: SCG1234
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome, so I cannot speak comparatively. On the plus side the room was clean, comfortable, quiet and fairly large and the bed with an excellent mattress. The free wi-fi worked perfectly, was fast and easy to access. The bathroom was also clean, large and modern with the exception of the shower which had plastic doors that did not contain the water to the interior of the shower. This would not be an issue, but the tile floors proved very slick when wet, so one needed to either lay out towels prior to showering or be prepared to wipe up quite a bit immediately after showering to prevent slipping. On the negative side, the room was a bit dark, dated and old. We were located in a poor spot along a back alley with a view of the fire escape and staff area. Since we did not spend much time in our room, this was not a big issue. Frank at the front desk was very helpful and friendly and treated us like old friends. Our host, Roberto was a real gem! He gave us an invaluable stop over tip (Orvieto) that proved one of our trip highlights! The Friday night wine and cheese tasting was lovely and encouraged guests to interact. The lounge areas are expansive and comfortable with a warm, inviting feel. The entire hotel is kept up well and is clean through out. The breakfast buffet provided expansive choices and the food was good quality as well. The one thing that could be done much better is the coffee – especially in Italy! We ended up going to the café next door for our morning cup as that served at breakfast was not passable. The location was very good with the Metro at the front door, Termini one stop away and the high points for sight seeing within 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: houseofno
Reviews.Content: I was overwhelmed when choosing a hotel for our stay in Rome. The Hotel Napoleon was a great find. It is a short walk away from the Colisseum and has a Metro stop right out front. The restaurant served excellent food and breakfast had a wide selection. The staff was fantastic. Our room was clean and comfortable and even had a small balcony. It was nice to be in an area amongst the locals, not in an area full of other hotels and tourists (and over-priced restaurants).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: SEG_Flyer
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my mom, and we stayed at Napoleon Hotel for 3 nights in May of 2010. We were completely satisfied with our stay. The staff was very helpful, always willing to give restaurant recommendations or help with any questions we had. It was a wonderful experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location plus friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: credible14U
Reviews.Content: A friendly and helpful concierge can make all the difference when staying at a hotel in a big city where you don't speak the language, there are tons of attractions to visit and you need all the help you can muster in getting from A to B. Seek out Francesco Quirinis, the hotel's veteran concierge of 25+ years. Called on to answer our innumerable questions, he went out of his way on every occasion to provide information and advice with a knowing smile. Plus, with a metro station right outside the front door and Rome's Termini rail station just 3 blocks away, you can get to and from the airport to the hotel for just 8 euros by taking the airport shuttle bus. Although the rooms are modest, the public areas are comfortable, tastefully decorated and the complimentary breakfast is nicely done. On your way to or from the Colosseum, just a pleasant 10-minute walk away, make sure you stop for lunch or dinner at the Trattoria Vecchia Roma just around the corner on Via Ferruccio. The pasta cooked in a large cheese round is alone worth the trip to the Eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cruisin2gether
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon the first week of May prior to a Med. cruise. The location is excellent, right next to a Metro stop, close to the train station and within walking distance (15 min.,) to the Coloseum. The staff was great! especially the conceirge, both early and late gentlemen. Always helpful with directions and places to eat that were actually good and reasonable. They also asked how we liked where they sent us and followed up on any issues. Breaksfast is included, american style. We had a room with a queen size bed that was confortable and the room size was all we needed. Washroom tub/shower equipped with toilet and bidet. You will get a kick out of the size of the elevators. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DrBishara
Reviews.Content: great hotel in perfect location. very clean hotel with very nice staff good and rich breakfast close to metro bus station and even u can walk to the old city cinter. we had a great time and we will stay there in every visit to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great staff, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: JaxNJ
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with terrific staff. Our room was spacious, very clean, and very nice. Breakfast was great, and the hotel has a bar and restaurant, which can be convenient. Yes, the metro is right out front, but the Rome metro isn't like Paris, London, or New York -- it is very limited. We had to take buses more than the metro. The bus stop is several blocks away, and while the street the Hotel Napolean is on is decent, the opposite side of the the square is graffiti riddled and felt not very safe. I did not feel comfortable walking back at night, but that might just be my discomfort and not indicative of the safety of the area. I'd very much recommend the hotel with the caveat that you should look at the location carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveling19
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great experience at the hotel the 4 nights we stayed. Great location, very close to public transportation (metro, bus route, and hop on-off bus stop), close to train termini, spacious and clean room and bathroom, excellent breakfast, friendly and helpful staff, the concierge went the extra mile to guide us and give us directions for tourist sites and local establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect 4-stars standard & service...just only 4 star price!”
Reviews.Author: Collector582
Reviews.Content: Big dissapointment based on Trip Advisor opinions & comments... Hotel not bad in itself however lack of willingness to help of staff and room standard for 165 EUR /night weal & poor. More details: STRENGHTS: Excellent place (communication system- entrance to tube opposite of hotel entrance), Nice lobby and bar, some staff members are helpfull and smiling WEAKNESSES: Furniture in rooms (old - non renovating), washroom - 2-3 *** hotel standard, average breakfast (definetely non 4 stars standard even in Italy), Arogant staff (Couldn't pay at 23:00 for stay instead of reception rush in the morning- "System is close" I've heard), No breakfast or single cofee before 7:00 AM possible so if you will have morning flight from Rome you will travel hungry!

Reviews.Title: “A little underwhelmed though would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TANDAS
Reviews.Content: I don't want this review to deter people from staying here, maybe just use this feedback as you need too. I'm also writing this on our last night staying here. We stayed here for part of our honeymoon and booked the Hotel Napoleon based on the popular reviews on Trip Advisor and the close proximity to Termini and Metro. We booked directly with the hotel and also had them arrange our airport transfer pickup on arrival - the whole process was really easy. The cost was also cheaper than using one of the online reservation websites. Unfortunately our flight from Istanbul to Roma was delayed and we arrived about midnight, around 1.5hrs later than expected. After collecting our luggage we were fairly exhausted and were looking forward to getting to the hotel and going to bed. Unfortunately we were greeted at the airport by no other than Mr Grumpy (you know that one from the Mr Men series!!). He was possibly the most grumpiest person I've ever come across in hospitality. He took my wife's luggage and grunted - kind of like a pig - then walked off to the transfer car. We were too exhausted to care so we tried to laugh it off and both agreed that whenever we saw Mr Grumpy around the hotel we would say "Hi, Mr Grumpy". And we did. Mr Grumpy. OK, so not the most pleasant welcome to Rome though we dealt with it and got over it fairly quickly. After checking in at 1.30am we got to our room. A pleasant surprise awaited - a nice bottle of Pinot Prosecco chilled on ice with two Champagne glasses and a card that read "Congratulations on your wedding, enjoy your stay in Roma". Perfect! This almost immediately made up for Mr Grumpy. Being so tired we put the Champagne in the fridge and went straight to bed and it kind of goes down hill from here. I think we were just unfortunate on our stay here though. From about 6.30am onwards we were awoken by the noise from other rooms. We stayed in room 219 which just may happen to be a particularly bad room for noise. We could hear people walking in their rooms above, kids talking, doors opening, showers running, things being dropped in the bathtub, toilets flushing and water running through the drainage system. It was seriously bad and I was totally shocked. Given the amount of positive and complimenting reviews for this hotel I am convinced that we just drew the short straw and managed to bag ourselves the worst room in the house. We persevered and by around 8.30am the noise had just about left the building. The shame about this is that the curtains and shutters are so good that the room is almost completely black when daylight arises - perfect for a sleep in - only you can't due to the noise!!! Anyway, after a few more hours sleep we finally arose at 11am. And missed breakfast. Two days in a row. The only other pitfall we experienced about Hotel Napoleon was the daily room cleaning. Overall the actual cleaning was fine and no problems. Though for some reason they missed taking out the used coffee and milk satchels and didn't replenish them either, for our entire stay. I found this a little odd and kind of annoying. The cleaners also left our empty champagne bottle and used champagne glasses lying around the room for the length of our stay. Lazy cleaners. Jealous, i'm sure. Other than a few small problems we really liked the hotel. Like all the other reviews here, the hotel really is a nice place. The staff (other than Mr Grumpy) are very nice, attentive and extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others, just use these words to your advantage and maybe you can snag a 5-Star stay for the price of a 3-Star hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shardock
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with a great location; a few blocks from Roma Termini train station, a few blocks from the Colosseum and just steps from the Underground Metro stop. The hotel staff is very friendly, very helpful and all speak very good English. My sister and I had a room with 2 double beds and it was quite large especially by European standards but I did pass by a room with a queen bed that was quite a bit smaller. The room didn't have much of a view but it was away from the street and was very quiet. It had heat and A/C, a window you can open for fresh air, a large in-room safe, mini-bar, telephone, TV, desk and a couple of chairs, free in-room WiFi and a free computer in the lounge/lobby. Save yourself some time and get the log-on and password from the Concierge first. The bathroom was very nice with heated towel racks. The pillows are a little flat but other than that, it was great. Lobby/lounge is very large and very beautiful and many guests sat there enjoying an evening drink and relaxing. The desk is maned 24 hours a day. The Concierge was extremely helpful with maps and short-cut directions and even called and confirmed our airport car service and they will print out your boarding passes for free. The hotel can arrange car service for you if you want. You can also exchange money for Euros at the hotel but their exchange rate is not good. There are 2 exchange houses right across the street from the main entrance to the Roma Termini train station. They are closed on Sundays. When you exchange money they usually give you large bills and we found that the hotel would gladly give us change in smaller Euros. The hotel has a very nice full bar that has a manager's happy hour on Friday evenings. The bar is open from 12 noon until 12 mid-night and serves salads, pizza, soups, lasagna, sandwiches, etc. Lunch prices ranged from 4.5 Euros to 8.5 Euros. They have a small dining room for dinner. We ate there several times and the food was excellent and reasonably priced, for Rome. Menu selections include chicken, veal, lasagna, pastas, appetizers, soups, salads, deserts, beef and fish. When we were there, prices ranged from 4.5 Euros for side dishes to 17.50 Euros for Fillet of Beef. Reservations are highly recommended due to the small size of the dining room. A very nice, large American buffet breakfast is served in the large breakfast room each morning. Selections included scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, bacon, cereals, bread, pasteries, yogurt, fruit, cheeses, meats, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. juices, tea and coffee. All of the service was excellent and all of the waiters/waitresses spoke very good English. An excellent choice for Rome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: scubajerr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located within easy walking distance to the train station. Staff was very helpful for dining recommendations and helpful hints while exploring Rome. The room was quite spacious and the housekeeping staff do a fine job of keeping the room clean. All and all ,well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Roman hospitality at its grandest”
Reviews.Author: 4inpanda
Reviews.Content: Warm, Friendly and welcoming. This grande hotel is situated 15mins from the colusseum and is so close to the metro you walk out the door and the entrance is 10 meters away. Train tickets available at reception. Roberto on the front desk helped us so well with our directions and gave us the address of a fantastic gelato bar near the trevi fountain. 150 flavours ! WOW. The staff Make this hotel. and it gives a true window into the Roman hospitality. Definately a place for a Roman Holiday that is not a huge chain that does not always have their hearts in it. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good food”
Reviews.Author: PiaT46
Reviews.Content: We staid in hotel Napoleon four days in the beginning of April. The location of the hotel was good, the room was tidy and the restaurant offered nice selection of meals and ice cream suitable for our 8 year old son. The personnel of the hotel was friendly. Breakfast was also very good. We can warmly recommend this hotel to the families travelling with small children.
