We bought Rome passes and used them for underground, busses and entrance to Colosseum and to see statue of Romulus and Remus in the museum. Our son will certainly go back to Rome some day, so positive was his first visit to that beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to be stranded if you are stranded in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GOGOGONE
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 days at the hotel at the beginning of April and another 5 towards the end of April when I was stranded due to the Icelandic volcano. The staff at the hotel are so very kind and helpful. I stayed in a good sized single room at the back of the hotel which were very quiet. Rooms from Floor 3 to 8 have small balconies. There is nothing to see but it is nice to be able to step outside. The hotel is next to Vittorio Emmanuelle Metro stop. It is not a long walk to Roma Termini either. There is a very good little restaurant two blocks away that the concierge recommended call Tempio Del Mercante ... great pizza, pasta and even good house wine. My only complaint is the coffee at breakfast is not very good. However there are a couple of inexpensive cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding April 6th”
Reviews.Author: KNOCKERK
Reviews.Content: Nicola & Tom would like to send our appreciation to all the staff of HOTEL NAPOLEON. We arrived at the hotel April 6th following our wedding at the Irish College, Roma and were warmly welcomed upon our arrival. The reception was welcoming to all our family and the management facilitated all our needs most professionally and with no issues. The meal for our wedding was beautiful. All our family thoroughly enjoyed the experience and the attention to detail was superb. We were very impressed with the flower arrangement that set the scene and the key rings that decorated the table so well. We would also like to sincerely thank the Manager for the most generous gifts; the beautiful dressing gowns, Champaign & flowers; it was much appreciated. HOTEL NAPOLEON has a very special place in our hearts and we look forward to returning some day. I wish HOTEL NAPOLEON every success for the future and once again thank them for providing us with a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff, good but not great location”
Reviews.Author: pbgalvin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days on a trip that also included Venice and Florence. This was the second-best hotel we stayed at (and the best for the price). Very nice hotel, free wifi even, and great, helpful staff. My Son had his 16th birthday while we were there, and the staff, via his passport, realized this and sent up a bottle of prosecco for him! The only downside was that the hotel is a bit on the outskirts of the historic downtown section. 15 minute walk to the Colosseum, but further to all other interesting sites. But the subway has a stop literally outside the door of the hotel. So we did a mix of walking, subway, and taxi to get to all the sites we wanted. So location not perfect but manageable. Plus the hotel is on a little park with some kid stuff to do. And I'm sure there are no better places for the price closer to "downtown". Overall and excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ace1307
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel based upon reviews read on TripAdvisor. We weren't disappointed. We booked through the hotel itself, which is recommended, as they have better deals, such as one that we got that included airport pickup in the price of the hotel. They were there on time to pick us up from the airport, even though our flight was later in arriving. The hotel staff was very friendly, and always quick to help out with directions. The room was clean, but smaller compared to American style hotels, which is to be expected. But there was enough room to put our bags. But if you are going to Rome, why does it matter how big the room is, so long as it is clean, comfortable, in a good location, and have good staff? It was a bonus that they had complimentary internet, which alot of places don't have, but you have to ask at the front desk for your password. Also, you get the splash page to signon again fairly frequently, but it is no matter, because the internet worked well. They also have a restaurant on site and breakfast had a lot of choices, from general Italian fare to American fare. They are also located only a 10 minute walk from the Colleseum, Palantine Hill and the Roman Forum, as well as Circus Maximus. In addition, they have a subway stop right outside the door of the hotel, which you can use to get around to any part of the city quickly, such as the Vatican. The staff at the hotel, as mentioned was very accommodating and helped us with our bags coming in to the hotel, as well as quickly obliged our inquiry into how to use the air conditioner, as a remote was needed. It took a bit, but they figured it out and it was easy to use. The rooms, for the most part were quiet, except the walls are a bit thin, but our neighbors were quiet enough so it wasn't an issue. Overall, a great place to stay, it was one less worry while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I am writing truth”
Reviews.Author: CAribUk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good....not the best... but for 140 ero for 2 person not bad for rome...area is not bad but there are some gipsy.. it is safe during the night you can go for a walk...15 min to walk from colosseum;) p.s Rome is very expensive, do not take the taxi during the night it will cost u 6 euro when you enter the car and every mile 3 more euro so for 1 mile is 9 euro

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: dougpaul
Reviews.Content: Our 5 days stay in Rome was very enjoyable. Napoleon Hotel is a great 4 star hotel situated in the heart of Rome. Service was excellent, The hotel Staff was extremely helpful & freindly. Hotel room very clean , specially the bathroom, though room could had been a little bigger. A wonderful Hotel situated very near of all the major sightseeing locations & very well runned. We will certainly be returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location.”
Reviews.Author: sully5live
Reviews.Content: We had three nights at the Napoleon in a family room. Excellent hotel, helpful staff, reasonable breakfast, good restaunt. Easy walking distance to Colleseum etc, right on the Metro line. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly staff, thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pepperbrick
Reviews.Content: This was a 3 night stay with our 2 children, 11 & 12 years. We chose this hotel from the Tripadvisor recommendations and because this was one of the few hotels with a decent rating that would accomodate 4 in one room. The room itself (101) had a double bed and 2 good sized singles. The bathroom had a (not quite full sized?) bath and a good shower. There was a new LCD TV with dozens of cable/satelite chanels but BBC world service being the only english speaking channel (fair enough - we weren't in England). The room looked out into an inner courtyard and this meant absolutely no noise from outside for a good nights sleep. We opted for the tea/coffee making facilities in the room for a few euros extra as this not usually provided in my previous experiences in Italian hotels. There is small bar which does basic pizzas and toasted sandwiches for a light snack from 1200-1900 and a restaurant which does a good menu if you like fairly basic but good quality dishes (as we do!) with a few more for the more fancy tastes. Breakfast was excellent with bacon & scrambled egg/fruit/cereals/pastries/cold meats all on offer and very nice. The Hotel is nicely furnished with comfortable lounge areas to watch large TV's and use the free desktop computer (free wi-fi is also available in every room). All the staff go out of their way to assist in every way possible and do go to the free wine tasting if you are there on a Friday - Franco, Roberto and the bar manager whos name escapes me particulary deserve a special mention. The location of the hotel is a plus and also the only downside. The metro is right outside the hotel and will take you to the Vatican, the furthest attraction in 15 minutes. There is also a stop at the Spanish Steps which is ideal for the Trevi Fountain and shopping area. The Colloseum is a 15 minute walk (uses Francos directions as it will take you through a nice park away from the traffic). Now the only downside. The hotel is in a large rectangle around a park and I think 3 of the sides have a collonade with shops and this could and should be a beautiful area. The fact is every wall and shop shutter is covered in graffiti, and there is usually a couple winos and other undesirables hanging around the square. This unsettled my wife and kids whilst walking past. In all fairness as soon as you walk a minute away or jump on the metro you are away from it. It wouldn't stop us staying here again but you ought to know if it would bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cummerstance
Reviews.Content: I wanted a four day break in Rome that didn't break the bank - and i looked at a lot of hotels on this and other sites for prices and location. You have a simple choice, pay a little extra for the convience of a hotel near all the main attractions and transport links or pay less for an outer location. We stayed for 4 nights, the cost was about £140 a night - a lot more than i at first was willing to pay, but judging by the reviews of all the plus and minuses of other hotels on this site i decided to pay the extra for the Napoleon and on the whole wasn't disappointed. The room wasn't the biggest (i can't judge on other hotels in Rome to compare this to as this is the first hotel i have ever stayed in, in Rome) but apparently this is normal, and with 20 million plus visitors a year to Rome you ARE in the tourist capital of the world. The area was fine, you are near the main railway/bus terminal (Termini) in Rome, i never felt unsafe, have a look on street view and you will see graffiti in the area but this is everywhere in Rome so don't look at this as being a negative for the area. If i went again or would avise family/friends i would recommend the hotel and or the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good services. Rooms renewal would be appreciable”
Reviews.Author: LanoDJ
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, literally in front of the metro station. Not in the best neighborhood of Rome, but major touristic attractions are in a 15 minutes walking range. Termini railstation can be easily reached by foot. Common areas are confortable and breakfast is really generous and varied. Rooms are clean, but maybe furnitures should be renewed. Standard beds could be a little too small if you are tall, don't know if king bed rooms are available.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: malteser10
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for 7 nights after choosing it for it's good ratings. the hotel met all our expectations...rooms were very clean and pleasant and the hotel is very conveniently located close to the metro and only 10 minutes away on foot from Colliseum. Above all the staff at the Napoleon is very friendly and always ready to help. They recommended a few good restaurants just minutes away and were always ready to advise us on places to visit and ways of getting to them. breakfast was also pleasant. This hotel is also child friendly...clean and comfortable cots were available and the children could play safely in the louge upstairs...they really enjoyed their stay. thanks to all and we definately recommend the Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: trinity751
Reviews.Content: I'm writing first a review, and I actually chose based on the previous reviews. I just want to confirm that the hotel is extremely well located for tourists (even if the neighborhood is not the most fancy of Rome). The tube is just 10 meters from the door. The staff is helpful and smiling. The breakfast buffet is above the average (And I'm traveling quite a lot on business). The colosseum is 15 minutes walking. Really we recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: travlgrl39
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Napoleon Hotel. The service is excellent. The staff is very friendly and eager to help. The rooms were extremely clean with all the latest amenities. We ate at 2 excellent restaurants recommended by the hotel that were just a block or so away. It is really convenient to have the metro right outside of the door as we were to able to purchase a daily 4 Euro ticket for unlimited rides for the day which allowed total flexibility to see the sights as we wished. It also has a nice bar area that we enjoyed after long days of walking. It is also extremely quiet at night which is just what we wanted!! Thanks for an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxoss
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 10 day trip to Italy, which began in Rome. I had read reviews of hotels for 9 months, and chose Napoleon for its location close to a metro and the consistently good comments about service. I could not have been happier with my choice. The hotel is lovely and charming. The neighborhood is not great, but not bad, either, And since the metro is literally just outside the front door, you can easily go to any neighborhood you choose. Our flight arrived one hour early in the morning, so we arrived at the hotel at 8am, not expecting to be able to check in. But, we were greeted warmly, and invited to have breakfast while our room was made ready for us. Breakfast was great, and the room availability was very much appreciated after our long journey. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and when we returned to the hotel at 5pm after a day of touring we were greeted with a nice card, and a bottle of prosecco. Our room was very nice, quiet, and the bed was comfortable. Our request for extra pillows was handled quickly. The staff were all very kind, welcoming, and helpful with directions and maps and suggestions. The only small negative is, as other reviewers have noted, that the shower curtain tries to cling to your body when you shower. But, this is a charming and hospitable hotel in a perfect location to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Tertitt69
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Eternal City, and I have stayed at another hotel on the two previous occasions. I was looking for something better this time and believe I have found it - the Napoleon has a good central location, right next to the metro and still just a stone's throw away from the exit of the part of Termini railway station where the airport express train stops. Having read many reviews and noticing the high rating this hotel enjoys at Tripadvisor, I decided to give it a go, and wasn't disappointed. The hotel as mentioned is close to Termini, although the walk from there to the hotel certainly isn't suitcase friendly - but most of Rome isn't. The location (Piazza Vittorio Emanuele II) is dominated by a park which is pleasant enough, and the hotel itself lies in a 19th century building. The arcades and general area around isn't the best, with some litter and uncleanliness existing, but then again this seems to be abundant in Rome. The hotel has a fairly small entrance, and the main foyer resembles more a narrow hallway, but there are two desks there, and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. Upon being handed the keys, the guy I talked to also showed me a map of Rome and circled around the hotel's location and the major sights, however he was so fast doing it that I didn't even have time to tell him I already knew all this since it was my third visit..but perhaps most their visitors are 'virgins' :) While the entrance may be small, there is a very large salon on the second level, where you will also find an internet station as well as the breakfast room, bar and restaurant. While according to the hotel's website the bar serves light snacks meals from 12 - 24, I experienced that it instead closed at 19, as the restaurant opened, but that you could still have items from the bar, only in your room (at extra room service charge). I therefore found the website information to be somewhat misleading, although it wasn't a major issue. Minibar prices are fairly ok, a 75 cl bottle of San Pellegrino - aque minerale naturale (frizzante) cost €1.50 which is what I would call a steal compared to the absolutely ridiculous minibar prices that usually greet me in my own country. The room is somewhat as I would expect in an old building and in a major city such as Rome - not particularly big, but still nicely refurbished. However, I am not sure if I would rate the room as 4 star on its own. The best thing about the rooms is that they face an inner courtyard, which makes it whisper quiet at night - really! And in Rome, that is hard to come by, I am sure. So although there is no view at all (4 metres to the local neighbour who will slam his window shut just as you open yours ;) I would certainly prefer it this way and be able to sleep with an open window at night, since it is too early for A/C season (in Italy). The bathroom is pretty good and seems to have somewhat heated tiles - at least they are not ice cold so they will not wake you fully up during a nightly toilet visit ;) The breakfast is exceptional when compared to other relatively modest Italian versions I have seen. There is cereals, normal bread, toast bread (and a toaster), eggs (but no egg cups?), scrambled eggs, bacon, various meats, cheeses, jams, honey, fruits, coffee and tea. A hot (or to be more precise - cold) tip is to visit the nearby Palazzo del Freddo - Italy's oldest ice cream parlour! It is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel, and they have 30+ variants - treat yourself to real Italian ice cream! While Rome is fairly negotiable on foot, the metro sometimes helps to save your feet, as hours on a lot of cobblestone wears you slowly down. This time I went a lot outside the city itself - to Via Appia Antica, the Aqueduct park and to Ostia Antica, and all are really great experiences in springtime - it is all green already and birdsong is abundant - and it makes for a good change from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. Rome can be rather taxing this way - I feel the traffic is worse than it used to be. And the litter on the streets. And tagging (not graffiti). And beggars. And pushy sellers. In fact, all of this will now result in me probably saying 'ciao Roma' instead of 'arrivederci'.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: PamelaandBarry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome -- on his third time, my tenth (I'm a Roman historian, so have spent lots of time there during my studies). This was our first time at the Hotel Napoleon and we were both delighted with the hotel, our rooms, the staff and service, etc. Our room: we had a room on the fifth floor with a comfortable bed and balcony; which myself as a smoker appreciated. The room itself was quite spacious and additional pillows easily available; it was extremely clean and very quiet. The bathroom was pretty good as well -- the shower had extremely good water pressure; the toiletries helpful and it was cleaned every day. I would agree that the shower curtain did have a mind of its own at times and it would have been nice to have a bathtub as well, especially after walking around Rome all day, but overall, definitely, excellent facilities both in the room and bathroom. Would have been nice to have a movie channel (even to purchase) as we relaxed in our room a few nights, but this is not a criticism, merely a comment/suggestion. We did have a minor problem with the wi-fi, but somebody came up to resolve almost immediately and there was a shared computer near the bar/restaurant, which was great (with FREE internet). Food: We ate in the hotel restaurant once, which was OK. The acoustics in the room meant we could hear everything on the other side of the room, but the staff were really friendly -- my steak was delicious and we enjoyed it. My husband mainly ate breakfast and he thought the bacon should be crisper and the eggs were somewhat runny, but I ate breakfast on the last morning and thought the eggs were ok, the bacon ok and the selection overall excellent, so this is really down to personal choice. The bar: We were invited to the wine tasting on the Friday night with one white and one red with light snacks; it was a really lovely chance to meet some of the staff and some of the other residents, so many thanks for the opportunity and much appreciated. The staff: ALL were excellent. Any problems (minor) were resolved quickly; they gave recommendations about a good steakhouse (Vito's near the Vatican, excellent) and other various bits and pieces. Our room, no matter how late we left in the afternoon (e.g. 2 or 3 (only 1 day...) was always cleaned whilst we were out with fresh towels every day, etc., and even cleaned up a mess in the bathroom the first morning when I struggled with the shower curtain (sorry about that, I did try to clean the water up....). An issue with somebody next door (playing a musical instrument) was also resolved immediately (if that couple is reading this, I wouldn't have minded if you had continued playing (at a lower level) but not answering the door when I knocked and then yelling at me when you finally did doesn't mean it's my fault - you caused the problem in the first place! ) and the staff member who called was extremely apologetic, but it was not his fault. I thought it was more than a 4-star for Rome, most definitely a 5-star and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff in hotel Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: mickeyBreda
Reviews.Content: We want to recommend this hotel in Rome. Nice staff. Location ideal for city and railway (termini).

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get to from the airport! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: FAHOGG
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here. The neighborhood looks a little run down, with graffiti all over the surrounding buildings, but inside the hotel it is all old-world charm. There is an interesting plaza, complete with ruins and a tiny kiddie amusement park, right across the street. Plenty of fun stuff to see and explore! We walked our feet off. The hotel is decorated with lots of old art and has an elegant and comfortable sitting room with big chairs. The hotel is only a few blocks from the train terminal, an easy trip from the airport on the Leonardo Express (11 euros, I think). We enjoyed the hotel's restaurant and bar. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous, and answered all our questions. They also arranged for a side trip to Pompeii for us. Although our room was small and the bathroom TINY, the bed was comfortable, and we were completely happy with it! Might not be right for everybody, but for a couple of fifty-somethings, who like to soak up atmosphere, it was great. .

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Rescue”
Reviews.Author: buggyc76
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the staff of this hotel. The airport (JFK) lost our luggage. When we checked in we mentioned that our luggage had been lost somewhere between JFK and Rome. The concierge, Frederico, asked for our claim which he photocopied & assured us he would handle, which he did! The concierge worked tirelessly to track it & next day our luggage was delivered to us in our room. Their staff will help you with all your travel needs from highlighting maps and explaining the metro (they even have metro tickets there for you at the front desk) to calling to reconfirm your tours. The food in the hotel restaurant is excellent, desserts fantastic and their free breakfast buffet is superb, I loved it! The rooms are the typical small European size, but they are beautiful, clean and have all that you need including a mini fridge for you to hide away leftover pizza, well, if you have leftovers :) I have recommended this hotel to my family and friends, and my parents are now planning a trip to Rome in November... and yes, they are absolutely booking the Napoleon. I forgot to mention the Metro entrance is literally right outside the door. Also, you can walk to the coliseum in ten minutes, so don't get too "metro-happy", you can walk to the Pantheon in 25-30 minutes to work off the gelato and cookies. What is great is that you are away from the tourist hotels, so the food and shops near the Napoleon have reasonable prices. There is a pharmacy a couple doors down and the Bank of Rome too, where I would use my ATM card to pull Euros directly from my American Bank account. Oh! And when we left Rome, we didn't depart until 6pm-ish, so the hotel held our luggage for no additional cost, so we could still wander about during the day. SO, you can galavant all day, and before heading home, metro back to the hotel, pop back up right by the hotel door, grab your luggage, and then have the concierge call you a taxi to the airport (it is too hard to use metro with luggage in tow). Now in reality, we popped back up from the metro, grabbed a gelato and then got the luggage, but you get the gist. I also recommend Dark Rome Tours, especially if you can get Valeria or Rachel as guides (two archaeologists). You can look up tours on [--], and don't miss out on the Crypts and Catacombs tour as well as their tour of the Coliseum. Also, a great place to eat dinner near the hotel is TRATTORIA VECCHIA ROMA on Via Ferruccio, a street behind the hotel in the direction of the Coliseum. It gets packed late in the evening full of locals, so go early. Finally, last bits of advice: you need good sneakers... don't buy food from street vendors... if you cannot live without soda, buy it at the little grocery/convenient stores and squirrel it away in your mini fridge... keep a pen handy... and have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best I experienced in Europe.”
Reviews.Author: nic680
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The hotel and rooms were the best I experienced in 9 weeks of travel in Europe. The staff in the bar and restaurant were lovely. They made the stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: dargonz1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Napoleon hotel and couldn't have been happier. This was our first trip to Europe and the staff at the Napoleon were first rate. The free breakfast buffet was varied and substantial and stayed open long enough for a few late mornings. The rooms and bathrooms were clean well appointed. We received a beautiful flower arangement upon arrival and a wine tasting experience was offered on one of our evenings. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LuvItaly10
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five (two teenagers) and loved the Napoleon Hotel. The rooms were very spacious and clean. We ate at the hotel dining room several nights and thoroughly enjoyed all our meals and service. It is only a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum and also there is a metro stop just outside the entrance to the hotel, most convenient to reach other historical areas! I can't say enough good things about Franco, the consierge at the front desk. He made our stay most enjoyable and we were treated with the utmost respect. I would definitely book again at the Napoleon. .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family retreat in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Stablino
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel for a family treat with the metro stop outside the door. All staff extremely helpful and breakfast was a lovely standard, relaxing and nice. Very quiet and peaceful with free internet access and WiFi. My daughter had her birthday whilst we were there and when we returned to the room there was a lovely gift from the hotel staff waiting for her. That made her day! Our triple room was a good size with the single bed in a separate area effectively amounting to another room. I would recommend this hotel. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGal9
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, metro stop outside the door, staff extremely helpful. The hotel is nicely decorated, bar has nice food, breakfast was lovely- standard but very nice. Would def recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: GytisN
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 4 days at this hotel. Hotel was nice and clean. Staff polite and helpful. We booked a superior room, so we had enough space. The high-speed wireless internet connection functioned perfectly and really was a high-speed. The hotel is at the walking distance from all the main places of interest in Rome. The entrance to metro is right next to the hotel (we found that very useful). Excellent value for the price. Overall we had a very pleasant stay in Rome. Thnk you!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: LAVATraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent our final vacation night in Rome at the Napoleon and discovered one of Rome's hidden gems. The staf was very engaging and accommodating. Arriving on a Friday afternoon, we were invited to attend that evening's Happy Hour referred to as "A Friendly Time", of wine tasting and local hors d'oeuvres. After a delicious lunch in the hotel restaurant we participated in the well-attended happy hour. Hosted by the gregarious staff of the Napoleon Hotel, the sommelier provided backgroun and history of the various wines served. The staff gave us detailed directions to our nightime destination and bent over backwards to accomodate our last-minute needs. The Napoleon Hotel is a great find for Rome, and reasonably priced as well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, location quite good”
Reviews.Author: Kerrycrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Napoleon for 4 nights based on brothers recommendation. Location was good, with most sights within 20 min walk. In rome, its hard not to walk with so many beautiful buildings to look at so make sure to bring walking shoes! Reserved a deluxe room with extra large bed. Room was spacious compared to other European hotels, bed was comfy. Staff were generally helpful and friendly. A bit disappointed with breakfast, mainly as we had been told that it was excellent. Usual breakfast buffet, would have liked nicer coffee. Overall good hotel, close to train station, metro and within walking to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: rystynen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon was really fantastic choice for a long weekend trip with two teenagers. The triple room was perfect, clean and very private. Everything worked like a dream. We especially enjoyed the lovely staff (Mary and Sarah) and very helpfull Concierge, who was able to help us with all the possible questions, that we had many. Location was very good, metro right by the door and it provided us very easy commute around the city. Excellent value, we all recommend! Thank you for making our visit so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Best service, great team”
Reviews.Author: LaurentiuMotoc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for celebrating my birthday and had the best time. The Concierge staff were polite, well-trained and respectful and also provided better tourist advises than my guide or travel agency (ask the reception for Mr. Franco). Being for the first time in Rome, the initial impression was important and this family-run hotel exceeded my expectations. I travel quite a lot and I'm not easy to satisfy, but on Napoleon I felt welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “We Love the Hotel Napoleon. The staff treat us like family.”
Reviews.Author: jilldamic
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I made a return trip the the Hotel Napoleon. The hotel is in a great location and the staff have helped us with any other plans we needed. The rooms are great and anything we needed was a phone call away. The manager, Roberto, and his staff are wonderful and we will stay there again. Jill D'Amico

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, high standard hotel, ideal for seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: andysw13
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Rome. The hotel made me very welcome, and the reception gave good advice on what to do and where to go. It is well situated near the station (with the train service to/from Fiumicino airport) and only some 15 minutes walk from the Colosseum; also next to a metro station with trains to other parts of the City and the Vatican. The bedroom was on the small side, but perfectly adequate. The hotel has elegantly furnished spacious lounges, a good bar, and provides excellent buffet breakfast. Very good value for money, I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with the hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: pashenka
Reviews.Content: How this hotel got into a top hundred hotels of Rome is beyond me. I had a single room which was the size of a walk-in closet, twin bed, and an old TV. It had a balcony facing somewhere on the back. $100 a night, and that was supposedly cheap. The room was pretty old and not renovated recently. The worst thing was the shower. It was so small that the shower curtain when closed touched every part of my body. I had to take a shower with an open curtain with water, of course, splashing everywhere. The front desk was moderately helpful. They found for me the locations where I could buy wind sim card and the schedule of trains, but they made sure I understand that they are doing me a favor. Restaurant recommendation was good one night, and very average the other time. Location is fine for me. However, some people might be a little spooked walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in every respect”
Reviews.Author: GilbertScotland
Reviews.Content: A group of 12 of us (male and female) stayed at the Napoleon for the 6 nations weekend of Italy v Scotland and it was an absolute delight . The Hotel facilities, food and location were all great as were the friendly staff.. All the main sights were within walking distance but the Metro station is right outside the entrance if this is your preference. The rooms were clean ,comfortable and quiet. We ate a couple of times in the Hotel restaurant and were not disappointed. Overall a great place to stay and very good value. We all agreed that we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing !”
Reviews.Author: phayaoThailand
Reviews.Content: I am writting this review from my Napoleon Hotel room on my second night here. I had prepared with great care my visit to Rome and I had chosen to stay in this hotel due to the reviews I had read in Tripadvisor. I thought that I had made the right choice within my limited budget, but I was wrong. First, I believed what the hotel says that pick-up at the airport was a courtesy if you book for three nights, IT IS NOT ! We had to pay €48 for the "courtesy". It is NOT mentioned in their site that you can ONLY avail of this "courtesy" if you book DIRECTLY with them and NOT if you do through Booking.com, as I did. Second, I had made clear through several emails that we wanted a room with TWO beds as we are two male friends but we were given a double bed room. Thankfully it was big enough to sleep the two together, but that was not what I clearly stated before. Third, the photos of the hotel, mainly the ones in their site, are very deceiving. One thinks it is an European 4 stars hotel but it is more a 2-3 stars. The room is very small for a 4 stars one and so the bathroom. Fourth, I had managed to get ONLY ONE non-Italian channel (BBC World) among the dozens of TV channels. This is a poor offer for a hotel used mainly by non-Italian guests. Fifth, breakfast is just average and we had to queu for some time to get a table.It is low season now, I can imagine how this can be when in high season. On the positive side I should say that the internet connection works very well in the room and that there is ONE free-to-use PC in the lounge. Also that it is very quiet, the heating and cleaning are good and there is an entrance to the Metro (very ugly in Rome) just ten steps in front of the hotel door. For the price I've paid (€323 for three nights) I think I should try another one next time.

Reviews.Title: “WonderfulStay”
Reviews.Author: rynldsjs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel after a 3 night stay,We found the Hotel to have a lovely atmosphere, The Bedrooms are very Clean and Comfortable our request for eatra Pillows was dealt with immediately, Invited to Wine Tasting with Local Dishes on Arrival very nice touch and enjoyable. Breakfast was very Good with excellent choice sets you up for day of sightseeing. All the staff from Front Desk to Maids were extremley friendly and Helpful would recommend the Hotel without hesitation and Look forward to returning, My Thanks to Mr Domenico Nelli and Staff for a Wonderful Stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfecto”
Reviews.Author: renton71
Reviews.Content: all the staff at your hotel was professional and friendly, specially the concierge signor roberto, who helped us organise the perfect two-day tour of rome. i would like you to let him know. without a doubt, when we go back to rome we will choose your hotel

Reviews.Title: “Exactly the right choice: ambience, staff, catering, facilities, location, value!”
Reviews.Author: aukland1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just right for us - it gave us the "home" we needed for our all too brief glimpse of ancient and present day Rome. We felt welcomed from the start, thanks both to the very friendly and helpful staff, and to the warm comfort of the hotel. The synopsis... -- Staff: courteous and attentive, with specific willing help on buses and trains, laptop charging and connection, specialty shops (for a camera item), eating in the hotel, and eating outside. -- The place: clean, comfortable and warm, with all the facilities we were looking for and no unwanted frills. The public areas were ones you'd want to use, including the pleasant bar and restaurant. -- The room: maybe a touch on the small side, but all we needed (although we could hear the youngsters in the next room). Everything in the bathroom worked. -- Location: on a pleasant square, with access under an arcade that kept the rain off. The metro was at the door, with connections everywhere. The walk to the ancient sites was easy and pleasing, and it was good to be a little away from the tourism glop. The nearby restaurants were good, and had local clientèle. A highlight was the manager's hour on Friday evening to offer guests wine and cheese and a chance to chat. That's not my kind of scene usually, but it worked well here. I've stayed in many hotels over the years, from the pretentious to the simple. The Napoleon strikes a happy balance, and I would certainly choose it again for another visit. I don't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, steps from the Metro.”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousBean
Reviews.Content: The front desk guys are extremely helpful, even made some dinner reservations for us. The bathrooms were newly remodeled, showers in Italy are very small though. You feel like you are striking a vogue while lathering up since you can't really move you're arms without feeling like a gorilla stuck in a birdcage. The bar was a nice place to wind down and have some drinks after a long day of sightseeing. I only wish we could have picked up the hotel and dropped it in a more desireable area of town, i.e. Spagna, Barberini, Lepanto. You can't really walk outside the hotel and find much to do in terms of shopping or eating. You pretty much have to hop on the Metro and go to a different neighborhood. The area is just a little more rundown that what we found elsewhere. Overall, our experience at this hotel was very positive, just the location is a bit of a disappointment. Be sure to ask for extra pillows upon arrival, the pillows are very flat and I woke up with a punding headache. After we got extra pillows, we slept fine. Free internet access in the lobby. Breakfast is nothing to write home about, consistently runny scrambled eggs, awful bacon, pastries were pretty tasty. You'll prbably go out and get breafast right after or have a very early lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not what I was looking for..”
Reviews.Author: arekwarzycha
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is a little bit old and its all style is weird. It is not a modern hotel but has an old-style idea. The room that I stayed was very small (reserved by internet) so I wanted to change and I did to a bigger one. The good thing was that the staff and especially the concierge was very helpful and nice. The room was clean, full mini-bar and nice bathroom. The problem with the room was the bad sound-proof rooms. In the morning we could hear people outside and water running from next door rooms. Another positive thing is that there was internet connection in the room for free. Generally I believe the price is at these levels because the hotel is in Rome, otherwise I believe that there is no chance this hotel would be so good. Also the metro station right at the hotel's entrance is very helpful to see all the landmarks in the city. I would only recommend to the people that like old-style hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Like Family”
Reviews.Author: Skygirl51
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Napoleon because of reviews I read about how nicely they treat those who choose to stay there. I was not disappointed - the men and women who work and run this establishment are just wonderful! They were helpful, courteous and generous with their time in answering all of our questions We arrived in the morning and we were checked right in which was a blessing after flying all night Our room was extremely pleasant and super clean The daily breakfast offered hot dishes (eggs, breakfast bacon) and lots of good bread, fruit, cereal, deli meats, cheese along with coffee, tea, even cappucino to my daughter's delight We also ate in the restaurant one night and it was delicious and comparable to similar places to eat if you are tired after a day out sightseeing in amazing Rome

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with impecable service.”
Reviews.Author: dutch09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing because of the staff. A family run hotel a ten minute walk from the Colosseum. I can't say enough good things about the service. The staff were so friendly and helpful. When you asked for your room key they knew what room you were staying in. They gave explicit instructions on how to get to the sights. They were so helpful with car transportation. My family and I stayed at their hotel for a few days and then were going on a Med cruise out of Rome. They brought us to the Port and picked us up after the cruise because we stayed at their hotel again. It was such a stress free stay. Plus the breakfast included was one of the best my husband and I eaten. We have traveled all over Europe because we are currently living here and have stayed in many hotels that have breakfast included. Hotel Napoleon is the best by far. We will definetly stay there again because we plan on visiting Rome again. You won't get better personal attention than at this hotel. I can't stress enough how wonderful the people are.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay while in rome”
Reviews.Author: Denise041
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for our 28th wedding anniversary. The management of the hotel made our celebration more special by having a bottle of Prosecco delivered to our room. We really appreciated this, it was a lovely gesture.The staff of the hotel were very pleasant and helpful, nothing was too much for them. They were always willing to give advice, on places to see, how to get there etc. We had a lovely big room with a separate seating area. Breakfast consisted of assorted cereals, juice, breads, cakes and hot food.The hotel was clean and warm. its location is only a few metres from the A metro line, very convenient for visiting all the sights, even the vatican city. The hotel sold day passes for the Metro/Bus/Tram for €4.00. We availed of the airport pick up service,driver waiting for us when we arrived at the airport, we were in our hotel room 30 minutes after landing at the airport. The hotel also arranged transport to the airport on the day of our departure. I highly recommend this hotel for value, comfort and friendliness. I hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Within close distance of transport to the beste sites of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hicks2
Reviews.Content: A good location if you are able to walk some. Metro station 1 min walk from the hotel door. 5 minute walk to the blue line "get on get off" bus. Some nice restaurants close by. We arrived on a Friday night and were invited to the Hotels 1st meet the manager drinks. A lovely suprise. Local wines and produce supplied for all guests. After meeting the manager and explaining we were on our 1 year anniversary, we left for dinner, came back to our room and found a lovely bottle of Prosecco with a nice note from the Manager. Talk about service. Breakfast was fabulous. Bacon, eggs, cereals, fruit, cakes, coffee, tea, juice enough to please most, except some whingy poms! Rooms clean, fresh and standard european size. Nice bathroom too.

Reviews.Title: “Great family run hotel with excellent service, they couldn't do enough!!”
Reviews.Author: ianonfire24
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. The service was excellent, the staff were always friendly, attentive and very helpful. I would reccomend taking their airport car service, this certainly got our break off to the best start, hassle free and very convenient, door to door!! The concierge was brilliant in reccomending every thing from restaurants to tours to hidden gems. Breakfast was lovely, lots of it, and again great staff. The Napoleon also has a restaurant which was still serving dinner when we arrived late from the airport. I would definitely reccomend the Napoleon as a great, value for money, base to see all the sights Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service. The only Hotel to stay at in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAngelaIreland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for Valentines Weekend. (We had stayed here 10 years previous and loved it then). First of all, regarding location: the metro stop for Vittorio Emanuele is about 20 feet from the front door, the Termini train station is 1 stop away, the Trevi Fountain, 3 stops, Spanish steps 4 stops, and St. Peters Square 7 stops (all on the same Red Metro line A) and the Colosseum is only 2 stops on the blue line (Line B). Secondly, the hotel is beautiful and very clean. The rooms were very big, ours had a balcony view and the staff just couldn't do enough for us. There is a nice bar and chill out area on the first floor, with free internet access and lovely paintings on the walls, a very relaxing atmosphere and nice and quiet. There is a buffet breakfast so you won't go hungry. We had the eggs / rashers / cereal / bread / yoghurts and fruit juices, but there is so much more to choose from. When they found out we were celebrating our 10th Wedding Anniversary, the surprised us with Champagne, and a cake with 10 candles. It's that little personal touch that makes the difference. The hotel is very quiet at night and we didn't hear the traffic so you'll get your nights sleep without any interruptions. I just wish there was a Hotel Napoleon in every European city that I visit. Michael Lynch

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: orls75
Reviews.Content: Staff were outstanding. They could not do enough for you. They were helpful, friendly and courteous at all times. They recommended restaurants that were exactly what we asked for without trying to make a buck or two. I hope people book here as its a great hotel that will serve all your needs while visiting Rome! Some rooms have shower curtains in the shower...lovely shower but not nice to have shower curtain attached to you...abit dated however some rooms had lovely glass doors....to sum it up thats the only negative thing one could say about this hotel! thanks for a great break !!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: curlyb83
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with my partner and extended family. perfect hotel stones throw away from metro line. Staff extremely helpful and kind. Breakfast also fantastic. Great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for sight seeing trip to heavenly Rome”
Reviews.Author: lumara
Reviews.Content: My friend and I gave our husbands a surprize Christmas present of 3 nights in Rome. Hotel Napoleon was booked having read previous reviews. We thought it was great although location not cental , it has a metro just outsdide the door. Spotless rooms, decent breakfast and obliging staff made for a pleasant stay as did the Friday invite for wine tasting. Only downside is ,not a great neighbourhood ,so it meant back to town for restaurants and night time strolls around Rome. Do order the hotel taxi service to and from the airport as it is good value if sharing with friends, 10 euro each.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mks10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel with my two children (8) (9) and we all agreed that the hotel was 'super' I picked it because of its location. Being close to the metro it was easy to go back to the hotel when the kids needed a break. What we experienced in addition to the convenient location was impeccable service and always super advice from the reception staff and owners. Its a familiy owned hotel and you really can notice the difference compared to staying at a well known chain hotel. If you visit Rome and want to feel like you are living in Rome then this is the place to stay where the furniture and decor is Italian. It is about a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum from the Hotel. There is a bakery around the corner for quick snacks for the kids. The metro line, in front of the hotel, takes you directly to the station by the Vatican Museum (then a 10 min walk), The main railstation (Termini) is one stop away. While discovering Rome, we were always were alble to find a bus that took us back to Termini. Bus 40 took us from the Vatican back to termini and bus 175 took us back from Trevi Fountain .One stop on the metro and we were back at the hotel- at the door! The Metro stops are not always practicle with kids in tow. About a10-15 minute walk away is a restaurant that serves pasta and pizza all day! Important because kids can't wait till 7-8pm to eat (normal eating time in Italy) When departing Rome, once again, one stop with the Metro and we were at Termini where we could catch the 'Leonardo Express' the train that takes you to and from Fiumicino Airport.One final comment from my kids about the hotel 'SUPER!'

Reviews.Title: “There are things only a family-run hotel can do - they do it!”
Reviews.Author: SteadyEddyDevon
Reviews.Content: A thoroughly enjoyable 5-day stay. The positive attitude and excellent service from staff was outstanding, especially dealing with small problems or needs (like missing breakfast due to time change). Clearly the result of good family management and happy employees. From a guest's point of view, a very well-run family hotel giving great value. The guest lounge and bar provided a very pleasant, quiet retreat for weary tourists. Not only do we strongly recommend Napoleon, but look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great food, impecable attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: miriambratislava
Reviews.Content: The hotel management staff surprised us with their attention to detail - for our birthday, we received flowers and champaigne in the room as compliments of the hotel management, which was a very nice addition to our already pleasant stay. The food at the breakfast bar has a variety of choices that any picky eater can choose from (I myself am a dairy-free individual). Ask for a renovated room - it is what a 4 star hotel is with all the perks (couch, nice bathroom, bathrobes, plazma tv, etc.). We truly enjoyed our 3 night stay at this hotel and would recommend this to anyone who likes the luxurious style for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the place- perfect in every respect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we could have hopes for during our one week in Rome- the best concierge staff we have encountered in the world (and we work in the industry!!), excellent clean rooms full of true Italian character. We can not speak highly enough of every aspect of this hotel- you will thoroughly enjoy your stay. Two steps from the metro and walking distance to all the major sites, excellent restaurant on site and more just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine Italian Charm with First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: flyingkiwi88
Reviews.Content: Thank you Tripadvisor - I am so pleased I found this hotel on your site and now is my chance to share with other readers. Hotel Napoleon is spacious and elegant with an old world charm and atmosphere and we very much enjoyed our 7 night stay here over Christmas. The hotel was just like their website and photos portrayed it. They have a lovely spacious lounge area with comfy armchairs, a computer for guest use (there is free wireless in the rooms if you bring a laptop), a charming bar for drinks and snacks and a nice restaurant for dinner (we enjoyed both!). The breakfast room is elegant too with a lovely buffet selection to choose from - there is something to appeal to everyone and they serve teas and special coffees made to order. Our room was lovely and a decent size and looked like the 'yellow' one on the website with a modern roomy tiled bathroom,. Do ask for extra pillows though and they will immediately bring them up. The hotel hosts a weekly wine and canapes evening where staff and guests can mingle and chat. This was held on Christmas Eve (although usually a Friday I think) and we found it a lot of fun. I thought the location was great and we felt safe walking around the area, even at night when we were dining in local restaurants. The metro is right outside the front door and on the best line to get around Rome. Termini Staion is 5 min walk if you want the trains or buses and the Coliseum is an easy 10/15 min walk so all in all, very central and easy to get from here to see everything Rome offers. We booked online with the hotel and took the long-stay package. This meant a complimentary airport pick up on arrival and a comlimentary dinner in the hotel one evening - 3 choices each are free and you pay for extra choices plus drinks so these are both very good inclusions - the hotel is excellent value and is altogether a much better experience than what we've encountered in higher priced hotels. Full marks need to go to all the staff - service is top notch here. They are all very polite, friendly and helpful with information and in particular Franco and Roberto on the Concierge Desk and Sarah in the Restaurant/Bar. We threw our coins in the Trevi Fountain (twice to be sure!) so thank you Hotel Napoleon for an amazing stay - we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great to be honest!”
Reviews.Author: lovetrips51
Reviews.Content: Ermmm...there's not really much to say about this hotel. Yes ok, it was clean, and errr thats about it. I was terribly disappointed with the rooms, they're OK but nothing like they appeared on the website. The website is very misleading. Its located near to the Colosseum, but the actual area that the hotel is in isn't particularly nice. It is rather old-fashioned and quite depressing - if I dare to say it. I took my boyfriend for his birthday and was embarrassed as I thought the 4 star hotel i saw on the website would be lovely - unfortuantely not. Go here if you just want a cheap get away, you dont mind walking and your not fussed about a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: florence022
Reviews.Content: This hotel is family owned. There is a consiere that is a cut above...Franco. The staff is wonderful. Hotel gives the extras. Owner, Roberto, had a Xmas Eve party with winetasting and "tastes of Italy" food. Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuff97
Reviews.Content: Really convenient location. Metro is just outside the door and under cover of canopy and you can connect to the airport without ever going outside. Fare is 1 Euro to the terminal and 12 Euros to the airport on the express train which is extremely convenient and fast (30 minutes). Hotel staff and concierge are very helpful with information on Rome, restaurants close by, and any other request you may have. You can buy metro tickets at the hotel and exchange foreign currency at an acceptable rate with no additional fees. However, use American Express Credit Card to pay for gifts, hotel rooms, food and other expenses where possible because the exchange rate is much better than converting to Euros, and American Express does not charge a transaction fee. Rooms are spacious (by European standards), quiet and comfortable with a private bath (an American staple) complete with bidet. The hotel provides toiletries such as bath soap and shampoo along with a hair dryer in the bathroom. However, do ask for extra bed pillows! There is a small (22"?) flat panel TV bedside, but don't expect a lot of English channels (anywhere in Italy!) The breakfast is very good and the staff attentive, but expect a similar menu every day. This, too, is standard in most of Italy. The hotel staff will meet you at the airport (no extra charge) on arrival which is extremely convenient, especially if you've arrived from overseas and are tired from the flight. The hotel manager, Roberto Cioce, made arrangements for an early check-in as our 11 hour flight arrived at 7:30 am and we were completely exhausted. We were treated to breakfast while the staff prepared a room for us, customer service that is unmatched in the larger, chain hotels. TO NOTE OUR EXPERIENCE: Staying in the "mom & pops" in Italy will afford you personalized service that is unmatched in the larger chain hotels, which are popping up all over Italy and forcing the smaller hotels out of business. We found that hotels like the Napoleon superb in quality and service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, Great Location, Hope to return soon!”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Bartley
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed here at the end of November, we had travelled for her birthday and although the holiday got off to a bad start (baggage handlers strike in the airport ment one of our bags never arrived!) the hotel soon put that right by delivering a bottle of champagne to the room after our arrival to wish a happy birthday and to welcome us. The room was above average size for Italy and for the price we paid. The staff were very helpful and friendly, breakfast was excellent and the location a few steps from the metro was excellent. When I go back to Rome which will hopefully be sooner rather than later I definately hope to stay here again. Peter, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “At last. Service - the way i remember it - 1st class!!!”
Reviews.Author: j11myc
Reviews.Content: A hotel that prides itself on family ownership and quality service. We stayed Friday to Monday (4 - 7th Dec). Our rooms were ready and waiting, even on an early arrival. Nothing is to much trouble for any of the staff. Breakfast is great - with eggs and bacon, fruit, pastries, juices etc etc. The local area is OK and we found one or two nice bars and restaurants. Its not a bad area to base yourself as the metro station outside can whisk you off to the Vatican in 15 mins at a cost of €1 each. You can even buy your tickets in the hotel. A really nice bottle of wine in the bar can be had for about €13. Thanks for a great weekend and a great experience - Rome was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent. I would manage hotel the same :)”
Reviews.Author: Simutis
Reviews.Content: Exellent hotel. When booking hotel I wrote a mark that it is after mariage vocation. So.. we found fresh flovers and a bottle of chanpagne. Perfect location - metro in front of the entrance of hotel. Perfect apartments - beter than fotos. Staff - exelent. So one of the greatest hotels I have seen. Recomend with pleasure and it is not the advertisment :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a pre Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Portglenone
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a large group of family and friends for a couple of nights before our Rome based cruise. This is a great hotel, ideal for walking or the metro and it has a very friendly and helpful staff and a breakfast to set you up for the day.. We considered many other hotels and we were very pleased with our choice and look forward to staying there again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, PERFECT for exploring Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Watsonsmom37
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Napoleon in Rome, we had a wonderful time. The hotel is quite charming and the location is absolutely perfect for visiting Rome. The metro stop is quite literally two steps away from the front door. Using the metro you can get anywhere very easily. Additionally, you can take a nice 10 MIN stroll and reach the Colosseum by passing through a lovely park and some nice residential neighborhoods, this route by the way, brings you over a hill and allows you a spectacular view of the ruins (we happened to catch them at sunset on a cloudy day.. WOW!) The B-fest was outstanding with wide selection of items and delicious coffee. The staff, as others have mentioned was polite and helpful they seemed to go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. Our room was spotless and a decent size for an European city hotel (great water pressure which I really care about).. our view left a little to be desired, being an inner courtyard, but it was quiet as heck, and who goes to Rome to sit in your room and look out the window anyway?? Another big plus was the free high speed WiFi, since sadly, we both had to check in with our office on a daily basis.. this was easy to connect to, fast and flawless! Some people have questioned the neighborhood, but this was my second trip to Rome and I thought this neighborhood was terrific! I felt extremely safe OH and here is a little tip.. there are vendors in the streets outside that sell everyday items for really good prices (a lot of the actual citizens of Rome shop here).. instead of paying for hotel laundry service, we went out and bought 4 pairs each of socks for 2 EUROS!!! That is a good deal! If I get back to Rome I will absolutely stay at Hotel Napoleon again!!! No question!

Reviews.Title: “Completly satisfied guest”
Reviews.Author: rogerscarina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for exploring Rome, just a couple of blocks from Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica, ten minutes (walk) from San Giovanni in Laterano and about twenty minutes from the Colosseum, The metro is just outside the front door for further sight seeing. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a "Superior Room" which had ample room and a large very comfortable bed and quiet, good sized bathroom with bath/shower and was cleaned daily including fresh towels as required, The breakfast was very good as where the the meals served in the restaurant. Some reviews have commented on the area this hotel is situated in, I found it to be safe (day or night) and clean, some traffic grime and graffiti but that is to be expected and the locals just go about their business it is actually a busy shopping area during the day with some very reasonable snack bars. The only fault I can think of was the view or lack of, you look out to an alley way between another high rise block but that is fairly typical in city hotels. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. If like me you scanned the internet to you are blue in the face reading reviews just book it you will not find much better in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and very homely.”
Reviews.Author: happycouple090
Reviews.Content: We returned to Rome for our tenth wedding anniversary to the hotel that we stayed in when we got married. This was the Napoleon hotel.It was even better than we expected. The interior seemed to have been renovated and cleanliness second to none. We were made very welcome by management and staff.The room we stayed in was lovely and peaceful with no exterior noise. After arrival we had some food delivered to our room which was excellant ,also free internet use. The breakfast was also excellant with massive selection. Staff were also very helpful with information for people visiting Rome. We would like to say a big thank you to the management and we would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: jane667
Reviews.Content: Worth booking taxi from airport as our flight arrived at 8.15pm. Dropped our bags and concierge recommended us to a charming restaurant just around the corner. Staff were very helpful and friendly . Enjoyed the drinks evening on Friday chatted to other guests and staff. Breakfast to last you all day

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: larryduke
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is one of many small hotels in Rome, not only is it beautiful, but it excels in service and helpful hints and reservations of many tours and activities. While there we wanted to spend a day in Venice. The hotel picked and reserved a hotel for us on short notice that was also beautiful and right on top of the Venice Canals. The rates were competitive. We were cheerfully picked up at the airport, even though we were late in arriving, and taken to our hotel. It is close to the Colosseum and other sights. The Metro is very near and shopping is right outside the entrance to the hotel. The rooms go from small to large depending upon your needs and very beautiful. The staff does a great job in daily cleaning. The only thing I would change was the Television programs. I would add a couple more english speaking channels for those of us who do not speak Italian. The staff were cheerful and very helpful whenever we needed anything. For a small hotel, this is one of the best in my opinion. I can truly say our stay was very enjoyable and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MusicMomSoCal
Reviews.Content: Immaculately clean, very friendly and helpful staff; wonderful buffet breakfast. Hotel Napoleon far exceeded our expectations and a wonderful value for the money. Just steps away from the Metro, all of Rome is just minutes away. Since the Hotel Napoleon is just outside of the city center, the hotel is quite and peaceful at night. I highly recommend the Cafe Romantikka for dinner (recommended by the Concierge) which is just around the corner. It was absolutely wonderful for our first meal in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly flawless!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristophoros
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one evening at the end of October 2009, and had a nearly flawless experience. First, let me mention all the pro's: the location of this hotel to the train that runs from the airport and the metro is incredible. It took me roughly 5-10 minutes to walk to the train that runs to the airport and only 5 seconds to reach the steps of the metro station. Sure, as some of the previous reviews have pointed out, it isn't in the most luxurious area of Rome... but, Rome has graffiti and broken beers bottle on side streets just like any major city in the world. Speaking as a frequent world traveler (over 40+ countries visited), I think this should be expected (it might go without saying, but some negative reviews, like the one below me from Kansas might not have been anywhere but Hawaii). I walked from the hotel back to the airport-train station at 5am in the pitch black, and didn't confront any uncomfortable situations. I also managed to hit some major attractions from this location... I took the train from the vicinity of the hotel to Bascilica di San Pietro/ Octaviano for 1 Euro, and saw the Vatican, Castle of Saint Angelo, Palazzo Pamphilj, Pantheon, and Coliseum (among other sites) on the walk back to the hotel, which took about 4-5 hours. The hotel staff helped in giving me great directions. From the moment I walked in the door, I was greeted with the utmost level of hospitality, and felt the family-like atmosphere I've always envisioned of Italian culture. I found the room to be quaint, with a very comfortable bed (topped with a robe and slippers), a nice bathroom, a view of the adjacent building (which was nice to me, as it gave an authentic, Italian feel), a little flat screen TV, small fridge, and a coffee machine/table, and so on. In the evening, a complimentary "wine-tasting and appetizer" experience was offered in the bar area for an hour (I believe this is done every Friday). Tons of the hotel gusts showed up, as well as the hotel manager - who gave a short speech about the hotel and wine. The "wine-tasting and appetizers" turned out to be very tasty, and lasted longer than advertised, with several glasses and appetizer trays being replenished. ('ve attached pictures from both the room and wine-tasting event). As for the complimentary breakfast buffet, I cannot comment as I had to leave the hotel for my flight before it started. There was also an elegant lounge with complimentary Wi-Fi and one computer for free internet use. The nearby streets offered some great bargains (tables with purses, clothing, etc), as well as a couple fairly inexpensive eateries. The negatives are minute, if there are any: when I woke up at 5am, I could clearly hear other plumbing systems in the hotel sporadically going off…. but this didn’t interrupt my sleep. At the same time, considering that most of the architectural structures in Rome are quite old, this should probably be expected at most places. The price was a little high for the value, but this is mostly due to the devaluation of the US Dollar. I’m trying to think of any other negatives, but I cannot think of any more. So, I’ll end my review here. I hope you find it useful, and wish you a splendid time in Rome: Paesi che vai, usanze che trovi... When in Rome, do as the Romans do... just be careful not to mistake Roman Catholicism as the Ancient Church.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great staff and service!!”
Reviews.Author: MEJANEE
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 staying for two nights before a cruise. We found this place to be very nice with great personal service and a good location. The breakfast was good and in a very pleasant room, The bedroom was not large but large enough for our needs. The bathroom was very clean .Our window faced the inner courtyard which some people didnt like but we found it to be quaint. (I didnt come to europe expecting the same things we have in NJ!. My feeling is "when in rome". I didnt want a super modern hotel. I wanted a european feel and we had it here. The public rooms where spacious and very clean. It was also very quiet in the midst of a busy city. Nice to come home to after an exhausting day. The staff catered to our every need. They arranged every transfer we needed. They gave us tickets to whatever we needed at the front desk.They referred us to a nice restaurant nearby. Our rooms where ready early when we arrived. My favorite thing was the 1hr cocktail party on Friday in the small but very cozy ,and classy bar area . It included appetizers and wine and then at the end the owner came out and made a very nice speech showing his appreciation for the patrons staying with them. I thought it was a nice gesture .As for the area..it was fine. My friend and walked all over it , not once did feel threatened by anyone. The colosseum was a 10 min walk and train station was across the street.I would highly recommend this hotel. Trip Advisor was right on the mark. Also take note...the owner reads these reviews and occasionally comments on them so you know they are very aware of what we say here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place to enjoy Rome”
Reviews.Author: ChristieKansas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. We chose it based on great reviews from Trip Advisor and we are very sorry that we took advice from this travel site. The hotel is located near the train station which is convenient, but the neighborhood is deteriorating with the huge influx of transient immigrants and restaurants and businesses have chosen to leave or close. The hotel rooms were very very small and the bed was like sleeping on plywood. The hotel staff is very courteous and helpful but their kindness just couldn't overcome the uncomfortable accomodations. There are very few restaurants within walking distance and the cab drivers are rip-off artists. If you want to really enjoy Rome stay away from this area of Rome. It looks like it is a central location but it really isn't. On a positive note the breakfast was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable sanctuary”
Reviews.Author: macca99
Reviews.Content: Three of us arrived late evening with a booking for 2 single rooms. Although the hotel was fully booked rooms were sorted for us for our 3 nights without any fuss. This typified the quality of service in this comfortable family hotel. The rooms are nothing special but there is wifi, a (small) lift, a really cozy well run bar and excellent friendly service. Outside it is Rome - frenetic, grubby, noisy. Inside all is calm and ordered. It is also only about 500m from Termini, or at least the platform for the airport train, the other platforms are a few hundred metres further on. And close to San Lorenzo, where one can eat well in the absence of tourists. Hard to imagine a hotel that better combines convenience and comfort at this price in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Lucybelle1
Reviews.Content: We had two great nights there. The rooms were nice (I got an upgraded room when I booked it) but the bathrooms was small. The bidet was talking a fair share of the bathroom and I would have loved having a "real" shower instead of it. The location was great, just 10 minutes fast walk to the Colosseum and the Metro (Vittorio Emmanuelle) was 10 meters away. We had free internet (and Wi-Fi) in the main floor (not in the rooms) and the restaurant was OK. The staff was very helpful and let us check in at our arrival (9:30 AM) instead of the customary 14:00. They also offered us to have breakfast before going sightseeing on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and service we had throughout our trip”
Reviews.Author: Chantelle87
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, beautiful large clean rooms, lovely set out and interiors throughout the hotel. Breakfast was included and was so good, large variety. The location was central. The staff were impeccable and offered great advice and were in general very helpful. This hotel went above my expectations for the price we payed. I will definitely stay at Hotel Napoleon next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best personal service i have ever had and great location”
Reviews.Author: princesslubes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a few nights and i must say we have travelled and stayed in many great hotels but the service we received in this one was outstanding. we were put in the apartment which was a massive room on its own floor, the room wasn't the most modern but it was comfortable and very clean and had everything that we needed. The reception staff helped us in many ways, one night we wanted to eat in the hotel restaurant and it was unfortunately closed so once we left our room to find somewhere else the main guy on reception stopped us and recommended a lovely little typical Italian restuarant nearby, and when we got there it became apparant that he had rang up in the meantime to reserve us a table which we thought was a very kind gesture. In addtion the hotel has a metro stop straight outside its doors which is so easy to use and has stops to all the main sights including the Vatican the Spanish steps and the Trevi fountain to name a few. The hotel was a 10 minute walk to the Colleseum and the Roman Forum. All in all this is an excellant hotel both for location and for the great service given by the staff, nothing is too much trouble for them and they genuinely go out there way to help you make the most out of a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in Italy and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: PerrisianDreamer
Reviews.Content: You MUST first remember this is Roma! City is over 2000 years old and most hotels are converted over the years. UNLIKE other countries (mine included... USA) they do not tear down the old to put up NEW... they preserve history and upgrade the interior. The breakfast is European and of the 5 hotels we stayed in the only one to serve good HOT food. If you ask they graciously make your eggs and bacon your way... Some people just don't ask. Our room was clean and maid serve did a great job daily. It was quiet and within walking distance to the Colosseo, Metro and other attractions. The staff were all very helpful with our questions. When you go to another country YOU should know their language... they DONT have to know yours BUT Hotel Napoleon provides lots of info in English and most of the staff attempts to understand your request!! Enjoy!! Ask the staff for my email... I will gladly help you with additional questions.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: orchid7_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel based on a recommendation by a friend and we were not disappointed. Location was brilliant, we used the metro a bit but spent most of the time walking. The room was comfortable, bathroom was a good size, lounge was spacious and the hotel restaurant served excellent food. The breakfast buffet has a good and wide selection of food. The hotel were very helpful by recommending a nearby restaurant and booked a reservation on our behalf at the RomAntica. We visited Rome for my partners 30th birthday but did not tell anyone the reason for the trip, the hotel worked it out when they saw our passports as we were checking in and on his birthday, they sent a bottle of champagne or Italian equivalent to our room as a surprise which was a lovely gift. We would stay at the hotel again if we were to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “not a good place to bring your children...”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsCAustralia
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this hotel gets a good rating, maybe most of the hotels in Rome are terrible, but I have to advise a few things to the following travellers: Please reconsider your decision and I suggest you NOT to choose this hotel-- IF you are travelling with your kids; It is a bit embarrassing for me to say, but you can pretty much hear everything from your next door (including their early morning love-making and even the bed shaking noise) The wall must be too thin. IF you are a non-smoker; The hotel has changed to a non-smoking hotel but you can still smell the smoke through the carpet and even bed sheets, it is really bad for someone who doesn't smoke. IF you like going out at night; It loactes at a pretty rough and at night, you may not feel safe to go out. IF you have sensitive skin type or have dust-mite allergy; The bed sheets are not very high quality and it will make your skin itchy.
