The carpets and bed cover are old and dusty, if you are allergy to dust-mites, then it will be very hard for you.(I'm a victim, I took allergy pills and still get terrible rash and itchy legs, have to knock myself off with some alcohol to sleep) If you have a bda back; the metress is not so good, if you are lighter than your partner, then the matress will be higher on your side. There is only one layer of sheet over the matress, so it is very unconfortable. IF you are tall and large built, the shower is tiny and very silly with the shower curtains. If you use the shower curtain, it keeps sticking to your skin as the area is very small. (I'm only 160 cm tall and my dress size is XS, i found it is tiny for me) If you don't, then the water goes all over the place... Howerer, if you have to stay at this hotel, eg. work arrangement etc. I suggest you prepare a few things: 1, a quit as they don't have one 2, some shampoo as they don't supply as well 3, sleeping pills (noise may prevent you from sleeping) 4, a kettle if you like a hot drink in the room as they don't have one as well 5, perhaps you don't want to open the curtains/windows as the view is pretty depressing (a very poor neibourhood and old buildings) 6, don't pay for their buffet breakfast, it is very ordinary and the bread/cakes are not fresh and the fruits are old as well. They have a little restaurent in the hotel, but the food is pretty average and the waitress doesn't speak English. (Not very friendly as well) There is only one good thing about this hotel is a guy worked at the front desk, who gives you a map of rome and help you with some information about sight-seeing. He speaks good English and very helpful. The rest of the staff are pretty ordinery and not willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were right - fabulous staff, great service, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathy_7050
Reviews.Content: I selected the Napoleon for our short stay in Rome based on tripadvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. Our expectations were low after the unhelpful staff, prison cell like room and exhorbitant prices we'd encountered in Venice. Hotel Napoleon was the perfect antidote. While the location is not the most chic in Rome, the hotel is centrally located, directly opposite a metro station and a short walk from the termini. A number of good restaurants are closeby. The hotel lives up to its 4 star rating (particularly for a European hotel), with spacious lobby, lounges and rooms. Bathroom was modern, large and clean. We were on a short timeline to fit in our sightseeing and the hotel staff were very helpful in making it all happen. Nothing was too much trouble to organise. The only thing we found that needed maintenance was the piano in the lounge which needed a tune. We'd be more than happy to stay at Hotel Napoleon in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarciajsR
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 40th Birthday Trip for my daughter to Rome. It turned out to be wonderful. The location is good as you can walk to many sites, or if needed, the Metro is litterally right outside their front door, a nice feature when you are two woman alone. The rooms are attractive and comfortable. The morning buffet breakfast is more than adaquate..watch out for the bakery as it was just too good. As we stayed seven nights we recieved a dinner in the restaurant and limo service from the airport, nice additions. But best of all the staff is exceptional. They are so helpful and make you feel they are glad you are there. Several good restaurants are close by. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous combination to celebrate my birthday, Rome and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DurhamTraveller030
Reviews.Content: On my birthday we decided on a visit to Rome for three days in early October. Everything was perfect - the weather was hot and sunny, Rome was magnificent and to cap it all the hotel Napoleon was the icing on the cake! Close to the Termini and 10 minutes walk to the Forum, the hotel was unassuming from the exterior but the interior was lovely. Our room was perhaps a little small, but extremely clean and well decorated, and importantly very quiet and with a nice feel about it. Indeed the whole hotel had a great ambiance, with the lounge a place to relax in as was the bar. All of the staff, from the top to bottom were friendly and helpful, and somehow gave the impression of being friends rather than aloof staff. The prices for meals and drinks were reasonable and it was pleasant to stay in the bar after a long day. I have no hesitation in recommending it, in fact I already have, and have only good memories of my time in Rome, except that I'm a year older!

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon staff were amazing.. thanks for making our stay so enjoyable..”
Reviews.Author: SapperJ
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Napoleon and were greeted by very friendly reception. We stayed three nights in September, unfortunately I was not well. Management organised a doctor which was much appreciated and went out of their way to help. After visiting Paris and Venice, we returned in October and it was a pleasure to spent another four nights at the Napoleon. The hotel is centrally located, close to the metro and bus service plus has small cafes close by. We spent hours researching accomodation options prior to our trip to Rome and what interested us most, were the comments of staff attitudes at hotels. The Napoleon staff were, it seemed, outstanding and now we can say we totally agree. The Napoleon Hotel management and staff have to be commended for their outstanding service. Although the rooms were in need of a little modernisation, they were very clean and what they lacked was more than made up for by the helpful and friendly attitude of the staff. Breakfast was included with the room rate and it was great. I would glady recommend the Napoleon Hotel as a family hotel for all to stay at if you wish to enjoy a true Italian experience. I have heard there is to be some modernisation of the rooms while trying to maintain the style and atmosphere of the hotel. We would very much love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Lineside
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in Rome with 2 old friends (3 ladies just a bit over 60!), and we really enjoyed the Napoleon Hotel. Everything inside was very smart, and there was a great attention to detail: even a tiny jotting pad with pencil beside the telephone. The staff were extremely polite but not intrusive, and helpful when we needed it. The breakfast was the usual mix of catering for different nationalities, scrambled eggs and bacon, cake, fruit, yoghurt, ham and cheese.... mmmm. Having made a horribly early start with a cheap airline, we spent the first afternoon on a sight-seeing open-top bus to get our bearings. They leave from outside the Termini station, just one stop on the metro which is just a few steps outside the hotel. An all day ticket is 4 Euro. We were then glad to eat in the hotel's restaurant on our first night, and enjoyed it very much. There are also some good places to eat very nearby, if you look out for them in daylight! The area at first glance is a little tired, but we always felt safe, and found some local shops and cafes that were good value. (Don't forget to take a corkscrew, Italian wines don't come in screwtop bottles). On our last night there was an interesting concert in the Piazza outside the hotel, but as our room faced onto an inside courtyard, we never heard a thing later!

Reviews.Title: “All things considered, a good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JayCeeDanville_PA
Reviews.Content: The first thing you realize when you search for hotels in the city of Rome is that the prices are outrageous. We picked the Hotel Napoleon based on Trip Advisor ratings and the fact that the price was reasonable (not Cheap). The hotel is near the Central Rail Terminal, and has a Metro (subway) station very close by. The staff is professional and very helpful. The questions they have heard thousands of times they still answer respectfully. The rooms are modest, but adequate, and very quiet (every room faces a courtyard, not the street. Breakfast (included in the price) is an expansive buffet, which can easily be your main meal of the day. There is nothing to criticize, and recommendation is given without reservation

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaks12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 12 years ago when we were in Rome on Honeymoon, we returned last weekend. We had a fabulous time on both occasions. The hotel is fantastic; the staff are so helpful, friendly and courteous. They make you feel welcome and do everything they can to make your stay pleasant. We mentioned we were previously there on Honeymoon and found a bottle of sparkling wine in our room! Our room was spacious, clean and had everything we required. Having the Metro stop located outside the hotel entrance is a real bonus in getting around. There are not a lot of restaurants within the immediate location of the hotel, but less than 5 mins walk brings you to a lovely area up by the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore and a nice walk onwards to the Forum and Colosseum. Certainly I could not say anything negative about this hotel. It is fantastic!.

Reviews.Title: “The Whole Deal at Napoleon!”
Reviews.Author: pstrode
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Napoleon in September. They picked us up at the airport with a sign with our name on it (for a fee, but well worth it after a long flight from the US!). The staff was professional, exchanged dollars for euros at a reasonable rate, had a 24 hr concierge who helped us book a tour of the Vatican/Sistene Chapel (for the next day!) and with every question, e.g., restaurants, banks, sights. Our room was roomy, with free wireless internet in the room and a refrigerator big enough to store a bottle of wine. The metro was literally outside the door as was the bus stop to allow easy access to many of the key sights of Rome. We also walked the half hour to the Colisseum one day. Each nite, we relaxed in the bar with a glass of wine and friendly staff. We stayed at 4 other hotels around Italy - none topped the service, comfort and convenience of the Napoleon - we would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Italy”
Reviews.Author: ttf0525
Reviews.Content: My and I cruised the Western Mediterranean with three other couples. We flew from Chicago to Rome and spent two nights in Rome before boarding our ship in Venice. Rome is so beautiful and quite fascinating. During our two night stay in Rome we stayed at the Hotel Napoleon. It's a very nice quaint hotel steps away from the subway and less than a mile from the main train station. The hotel staff and management were excellent; extremely friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again. We had the opportunity to tour the Coliseum, Roman Ruins, The Forum, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, The Borghese museum and the most impressing Vatican City. Everything was fascinating and amazing history. If anyone is contemplating going to Italy I would highly recommend Rome. Our travel agent arranged the tours for us. If you haven't been to Rome before it's a must that you schedule tours. The tour guides were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The Napoleon Hotel is a Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful three night stay at the Napoleon Hotel. The people there are outstanding in all aspects. The breakfast is the best, the location is great, the room ultra clean, and the staff is so helpful and respectable. It is an experience you shouldn't miss. We love Rome, and hope to return, but only if we can stay at the Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: savtashira
Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at the Napoleon Hotel. As every coin has two sides, there are pros and cons to every hotel. The Napoleon is indeed a lovely choice for accommodation. Franco, at the reception, was wonderful He was very informative and helpful in attending to all my questions. He called the airlines three times to make sure my flight was on time and the driver he arranged for me was there half hour early. It was also impressive that he always addressed me by name and knew what my room number was. The Coliseum is a short walk away though easily maneuvered streets My room was very small, albeit complete with every amenity possible. WIFI was a pleasing perk. In my room, no less. It was a bit disconcerting to shower with the curtain constantly sticking to me. But, how long does it take to shower, this was a minor discomfort. The bed was very comfortable, and a second pillow was immediately brought to my room The air conditioner was the quietest I've every heard. Even though I closed it in the morning, the staff always had it turned on when I returned in the evening. The decoration of the room was classic and very very pleasing. Desk and armoir, examples of Italian furnishings expected at a good 4* hotel. Lots of lovely prints on the walls and the whole decor well planned and coordinated. Breakfast left nothing to be desired. Cappuccino upon request was delightful. The fresh fruits and veggies a pleasant addition to the usual plethora of sweets I encountered in all my hotels and B&B's in Sicily. Service was prompt and always with a smile.Everything was fresh and appealing With the entrance to the Metro directly in front of the hotel, I could easily get to the 'center' of the city at night. Unfortunately, eating places in Piazza Emanuele Vittoria leave much to be desired. But taking the M to other places was so easy. As a single woman traveling, I was a bit intimidated by the neighbourhood, but upon Franco's encouragement, I did venture after dark and never experienced anything unpleasant.(my first venture all alone in Rome) The whole area is filled with small shops selling reasonably priced clothing and shoes from China. This seems to be THE Chinatown of Rome. It had some Chinese grocery stores comparable to anything in Vancouver. Of course no review is complete without mentioning the price. Very reasonable. Considering the perks of the hotel - WIFI and great breakfast, - a true deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great value!”
Reviews.Author: MOmom_8
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old daughter and I stayed at the Napoleon Hotel for three nights following a guided tour. We were very happy with this choice. My daughter thought that it was probably one of the nicest hotels of our budget-minded trip and we loved the expansive and delicious complimentary breakfast. The location was close to many attractions and the convenient metro station made others easy to get to as well.There is a bank machine right around the corner as well as several little grocery stores.The staff is extremely professional; the desk managers looked like bankers!! Our room was small but comfortable and clean with a large (for a downtown hotel) bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadianwendy
Reviews.Content: Like many Canadian girls I grew up in the 50’s and 60’s watching Three Coins in the Fountain, Ben Hur, Roman Holiday and the Agony and the Ecstasy. I fell in love with the romance of Rome, the Pieta and the Trevi Fountain when I was just twelve. I finally arrived in Rome in my late fifties so you can imagine the anticipation and high expectations I had cultivated during the decades I waited. I wanted magic and the The Napoleon Hotel did not disappoint! In fact, the staff made my trip one of the most memorable experiences of my life. From the moment I walked in to the hotel and heard Franco, the head Concierge, say, “Ms. _______, welcome to the Napoleon and welcome to Rome”, I knew it was the perfect beginning to a great adventure. The hotel is just 10 steps from a Metro station and travelling from there is fast, efficient, economic and safe. The neighbourhood was quaint and calm and Sue and I had no reservations about walking through it at late hours. The rooms were cozy and immaculate. The grand staircase was splendid with its red velvet carpets as were the impeccably clean marble floors and pale yellow and white décor. There was no request to large or small: attention to detail was focused on by every staff member, no matter the hour. The hotel is charming and appreciated by staff and guests alike. Enchanting characteristics such as the grand circular staircase, splendid with its red velvet carpets, impeccably clean marble floors and pale yellow and white décor, fresh pink roses in many of the common rooms, the grand piano cherished and previously owned by the founder, freshly made café lattes accompanying an amazing breakfast, maps with perfect directions, and a caring and knowledgeable concierge staff made for an outstanding stay. They will do just about anything to make your stay memorable. I had asked if the concierge could book train tickets on our behalf for three different destinations and I later found out he was taking his own personal time to pick up the tickets for us from the train station. We started our Italian adventure at the Napoleon in Rome and went on to Venice and Florence. When we returned to the Napoleon days later we felt like we were coming home. We were welcomed back with open arms and the staff were truly interested in hearing if we enjoyed our side-trips. From the moment we entered this lovely, family run establishment we felt safe, respected, cared for and wanted. I have never heard of a hotel inviting guests to a free wine and cheese tasting – no strings attached, they weren’t selling anything, just welcoming everyone to the hotel and Rome and thanking us for choosing their establishment and sharing that they were honoured to be able to help us have the perfect vacation. All refreshments were free and many staff came and individually welcomed their guests. A retired concierge came to the event each Friday and I believe that says a lot about the type of people who own and provide service in this special hotel - it was like family coming home for a celebration. When staff like and respect each other and treat each other as family, that carries over and guests are afforded the same qualities. The Cioci family have somehow managed to maintain old world qualities with dignity, honesty, caring, and kindness. I have never stayed at such an enchanting hotel before and I am sure I never will again. (Except if the coins I tossed in to the Trevi Fountain help my wish come true and I will once again stay at the Napoleon Hotel in

Reviews.Title: “pleasant”
Reviews.Author: petathens
Reviews.Content: Nice convenient location right next to the metro station 4 stops away from Piazza di Spania. Very polite staff, completely innovated bathrooms and romantic rooms. Recommended for young couples whom they don’t mind to walk or use the metro to get to the historic center and the busy fashion streets.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: imjwm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the month of September traveling in Europe, and our five days in Rome at the end of our tour was much anticipated. We had never been to Rome before and speak no Italian. The staff at the Napoleon Hotel could not have been more friendly or helpful. We were welcomed, greeted by name each time we passed the lobby desk, and were given helpful advise and directions. Our room looked just as pictured on the hotel's web site, and the lobby area was comfortable and lovely. We enjoyed the full breakfast buffet each morning, including hot coffee and foamed milk brought to our table. The delightful park just in front of the hotel was an unexpected plus. There is a Metro stop just outside the entry door to the hotel, and we used this very convenient transportation to get everywhere in Rome in minutes. We never felt unsafe walking in the vicinity in the daytime or at night. Overall, our stay at the Napoleon is one of many happy memories.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel in Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: roundtheworld4me
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night before joining a tour that went around Europe. I picked this hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor and its apparent good Location. How wrong I was about the location. The area is filthy and doesn't seem that safe. There is nothing at all that is worth doing or seeing nearby. I walked to the Colosseum which took about 10-15 minutes - once I was there I wished I was staying in a better area. The Hotel is self was decent enough. Staff were quite good overall - apart from one on the front desk who had a very abrupt manner and wasn't very welcoming - but apart from him the staff were nice. Inside the hotel has a nice feel to it and is well presented and clean. The rooms seem a little dated however. The T.V. was tiny and picture quality was poor. The furniture had seen better days. I had a single room and the size was fine except for the bathroom which felt extremely cramped inside. I ate at the restaurant and had a very good lasagna for dinner - it would probably be one of the best I've had anywhere in the world. I also had a couple of beers at the bar after-wards. I met a nice British couple there and overall I enjoyed the atmosphere of the place. Overall the hotel is fine on a whole, but location is very important to me and thus I wouldn't stay in this hotel again purely because of the area that it is in.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: YoungLadyUk
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at Hotel Napoleon 8 years ago. We returned to Rome this year bringing other family members who had not visited before. We were truly delighted to find that the Hotel had not changed. The staff were as we remembered them. The welcome was extremely friendly and there was no fault to be found with the hotel at any time. We would not hesitate to return here again, and we know that our other family members also echo this sentiment. An excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Check location before booking!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kpod76
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews...big mistake!!! Yes it is close to the termini/metro BUT it is in the worst neighbourhood in Rome....To the point where we felt unsafe to go out at night. The area (Monte/Esquinith) does not have that beautiful "italian" feel, rather a seedy, cheap and trashy atmosphere. If you book somewhere closer to the city either at Trevi, Tridente, central (basically anywhere BUT here) you will have no need to use any public transport as all the major sights are in very close walking distance PLUS the evenings are fantastic wandering around Rome having coffee, drinks, seeing Trevi fountian at night without feeling like you're going to get mugged. If you stayed at Naploean you would not be able to do this and safely walk home, and getting a train would not be pleasant either.....pay the little bit extra and stay in town. In relation to the hotel we booked for 4 nights but after the first night asked to check out so we could stay in the 'real' rome area. Previous reviews have raved about the friendliness of staff however this could not be further from the truth.....on arrival we were greeted with "Passports please". No bonjour, hello or friendliness. Then we met the rudess of all the staff, Michele the porter who grunted at us most days or just completly ignored us for some unknown reason. We are both very quiet but friendly Australians and tried our best to be friendly however the ONLY nice member of staff we encountered was a pretty blonde woman who served breakfast. She was very cheerful and welcomed us to breakfast and did her best to make us feel like guests. In relation to the actual hotel the breakfast is fine, lounge area, internet etc fine, bathrooms have been renovated but rooms are still very small, tired and have very hard beds and pillows. The hotel caters for older, tour group type travellers who dont care about accomodation and just use the hotel as a base (even though it is miles from anywhere good). Do yourself a favour and book in town where you will have a choice of hundreds of beautiful cafes, bars, resturants, sights and lovely italian people. We ended staying at Hotel Homs (In tridente) who felt sorry for us and gave us their rooftop suite overlooking the Spanish Steps in the heart of Rome for just a fraction more than Napoleon the dump. Our biggest regret is not researching the suburbs properly, even lonleyplanet advised NOT to stay where Naploeon is situated. Overall would not stay here again even it were free!!! (P.S. There is NO good cafes, shops, sights etc in this area and NO actual italians if you get the drift..)

Reviews.Title: “The Absolutely Best Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: spacedebris
Reviews.Content: We now judge all hotels against this hotel. Service is friendly and flawless. Employees have been there forever and will gladly (not reluctantly) help you find anything you need during your stay (restaurants, transportation, the best bus tours, sight-seeing, beauty shops, clothing stores, spas). The staff is universally polite and charming. They do not knock on your door at 8:30 in the morning to service the room. I know I'm gushing, but we are going back to Rome in December for Christmas and New Years, and we get to stay there again. The hotel is four generations worth of service and professionalism. The breakfasts are superb and the dinners lovely. Incredibly good value and always highly rated by other travelers. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akdaley2003
Reviews.Content: There is one word to describe the Hotel Napoleon in Rome: Splendid. My wife and I traveled to Rome from September 13th to the 20th, and could not have been happier with our selection of Hotel Napoleon. While I’m sure some of the more negative reviews of the hotel may be true (nobody is perfect), I honestly believe (1) any negative reviews are grossly exaggerated; and/or (2) the person writing it is writing about the wrong hotel. For ease of breaking down the positives and negatives of the hotel, please read the following: Positives 1. Staff – Everyone and I mean everyone from the Managing Director (Robert Cioce) to the Concierge (Franco Quirinis) to the Bartender (Simone Simeoni) to the Porters are very friendly, helpful, and concerned that your stay at their hotel is enjoyable, comfortable, and relaxing. Very quick and efficient check-in and check-out. 2. Location (also see negative #1) – Walk outside about 10 feet and you are at the Metro. During the day you are within walking distance to the Coliseum, St. Mary’s (Papal Basilica), St. Johns (Papal Basilica), Ancient Rome, etc. etc. etc. Also there are several small stores near the hotel (you can buy water, beer, wine, fruit, etc. – very cheap). 3. The Bar – Reasonable Prices. Very Reasonable Prices, with a good selection of cocktails, snacks, lite meals, and desserts. 4. Wine Tasting – On Friday nights, the hotel offers a free wine tasting of good local wines. These will not be the best wines ever, but they are good and FREE. Also, Robert Cioce, Managing Director, joins the guest for the tasting, and gives a brief intro to each of the wines. He also makes an effort to meet and greet all their guests that are present. The Wine tasting was a very enjoyable, welcoming experience – definitely sets this hotel apart from other hotels I have been to (including hotels with free happy hours for executive, reward member guests). 5. Free Breakfast – Not the best breakfast ever – but good and FREE. 6. Quick Room Turnover – Room turnover took around five minutes, and was never poorly performed. 7. Free Wi-Fi (wireless internet) is offered throughout the hotel, and in the lobby. Also in the lobby, if you do not feel like dragging your computer around the globe – is a general use computer for all guests (just remember it is for everyone – so share). 8. Restaurant at the Hotel Napoleon – Good food, charming setting, good service, reasonable prices. Definitely plan on having dinner in the hotel at least one night while in Rome. Negatives (and some suggestions) 1. Location (also see positive #2) – The areas surrounding the hotel are a little sketchy at night, but still within safe walking distance to several good restaurants (and/or the metro) 2. TV Channels (Suggestion) – In-room English Speaking channels = 0. The good news? You are in Rome! If you can not find something to do – ask the concierge. The bad news? Normally by 9pm you are exhausted, and having a TV movie channel to watch and unwind would have made our stay even better. No a big negative, but an areas of suggest improvement. 3. Tours Offerings (Suggestion) – The concierge books tours through a somewhat more expensive tour agency. While the prices are not outrageous compared to vendors in Rome. Booking online prior to arriving in Rome is cheaper. Worst comes to worst, book your tours online in Rome – using the Hotel’s free Wi-Fi (and Computer) Overall, both my wife and I were very happy with our selection of the Hotel Napoleon. As with any trip, your level of enjoyment depends on several factors including not just where you go, but also where you stay as well as your level of involvement. With the Hotel Napoleon and the City of Rome you already have two of these three criteria covered – the rest is up to you. ENJOY! Helpful Hints 1. Facebook – Not sure how much longer the hotel will be offering this, but if you become a fan of the hotel on Facebook prior to your trip, you can print and present a coupon which will get you a free bottle of sparking wine brought to your room. 2. Metro – For 16 Euro – you get unlimited trips for 7 days. Pending where you stay in Rome this could be a great value. If you stay at the Hotel Napoleon – it will save you tons of money on cabs, buses, etc. Also, because of the way the subway ticket machines are made, you really only need 1 ticket for two people. Just make sure you use the same machine, and use the same ticket over and over. (NOTE the Metro closes at 1130pm on Weekdays and 1230am on Saturdays). 3. 530 – Great time to go anywhere in Rome. My wife and I were able to get immediately into St. Peters at 530 and had 2 hrs of viewing time – with only a limited number of other tourists to deal with. 4. Pizza d’ Isla – Pizzeria - by the Vatican – Great Value – Huge Meals - great food. Cheap/good wine. Look it up on-line before going and GO. 5. Get ready to Walk. The cheapest and easiest way to see Rome is to walk. The Hotel Napoleon offers free maps (which come with the tours offered by the concierge) which are very accurate and helpful. Get one and plan on using the metro stops as your stopping points. 6. Stores by the Hotel. When leaving the hotel for whatever reason stores (i.e. for water, snacks, wine) are much cheaper to the right (i.e. $0.75 for a bottle of water compared to $2.50 – convert into Euros). 7. Coffee Americano – Note a big espresso drinker? They have coffee Americano at the hotel – free at breakfast, cheap thereafter.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Panny12
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Napoleon. The staff were all marvelous and very welcoming. They would cater to every need and were extremely helpful in providing directions and recommending places to see and eat. Breakfast each day was a nice bonus and I was surprised by the selection on offer (bacon, eggs, toast, pastry, fruit, etc.) - it was nice not having to worry about where to go each morning. The rooms, especially the bathroom, were quite small - I'm used to North American style hotel rooms - but cozy and comfortable. My only complaint was the walls were quite thin - having a quiet conversation late at night back to Australia seemed to bother the guest next to me. It's location is a little out of the way from the major tourist locations (not a bad thing it's nice and quiet!) but it's only a short walk to the majority of the sights (15 min. to Colloseum, 5 min. to Saint Mary Major Basilica) and the Metro is at your doorstep (only a few stops to the Vatican, Piazza del Popolo, etc.). It's also only a short walk the Termini. Overall, the hotel was quaint and elegant. The little touches made my stay quite enjoyable. The Friday evening wine tasting was wonderful and after a short while staff seem to now you by name. Would definetly stay at the Hotel Napoleon again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KilleenIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel on our recent visit to Rome to celebrate our Wedding. This is an excellent Hotel who pay special attention to customer care and satisfaction. The hotel is very well located with the Metro close by. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Food is available most of the day in the Bar on the 1st Floor. The restaurant serves very good food, in fact we had our wedding meal in the restaurant and it was excellent. Simeoni and all restaurant staff on duty that night did everything to make our dining very special. Breakfast consisted of a varied selection of hot and cold food and again was very good. I would like to pay special compliement to the following staff members. Franco and Roberto in Concierge was very helpfully with all our bookings and queries and were very courteous and friendly at all times. Peter in Reception was also very couteous and attentive. I would also like to compliment Marta who was very helpfully in her assistance with all our bookings and queries prior to visit to Rome. Our visit in Rome was enhanced by our stay at the Napoleon Hotel. All in all this is very good hotel and would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: edp33
Reviews.Content: I have just come back after having stayed for a week in Rome with my partner. Hotel Napoleon were very good and gave us a free taxi from the Airport to the Hotel, cost was around 50 Euro on the way back, so quite a saving! As other reviews have said the hotel is within walking distance of the Colosseum. Also the Basilica di San Maria is close by and amazing inside. For other parts of Rome, i.e. Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain it is a longer walk and using the Metro is recommended, the entrance to the Vittorio Emanuele is just outside the hotel. The Metro only costs 1 Euro for a one way trip which is amazing value and although very crowded is easy to use with the main sites of Rome all within 6 stops from the hotel metro and just 2 lines so it is easy to get around without having to refer to the underground maps. Service at the hotel certainly matched the 4* rating of the hotel. Bed sheets and towels were changed everyday. Room was a good size with a large bed. There was a bit of noise from the rooms opposite when people checked in, but apart from that the room was quite enough. The staff were very helpful and pleasent. They have tear away maps on reception to help you find your way around Rome and are happy to help give directions for your day out. The restaurant food was very good both the light meals menu and the main menu. You have to book the restaurant though as it is often full every night. If you want to go out for a meal then the choice of restaurants did seem a bit limited in the area, but we did find a very good one near the Termini station. Because we were staying for a week, the Hotel gave us a free meal one night of the week, you need to inform the staff that you are using it otherwise they will write out a bill and have to cancel it as some other guests found out. The free meal is very generous and includes starter, main course and desert and side courses, the only thing we had to pay for was the drinks. Breakfast was good and offered a wide range, Bacon and scrambled eggs, toast, ham and cheeses, cereal, and cornetto which seems to be a croissant with a cream/jam filling. Also provided fruit juice and very good coffee. With regard to nearby shops, there is a good clothes shop with reasonable prices 2 doors down from the hotel and an ATM machine within 100 yards of the hotel. Overall we had a very good stay and can see why the hotel is recommended so highly on this site. We would certainly consider staying at the same hotel next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, easy and well located”
Reviews.Author: TeebooTed
Reviews.Content: very helpful staff and the "3 night stay with hotel pick up" was a great deal. The driver was waiting for us, the check in and concierge were friendly, and the room was clean and a good size for Rome. The hotel is an easy walk to the Colosseum, the main train station and a whole stack of other sites. There is an underground metro station right out front and many restaurants in short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MrsfussyUk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated adjacent to the Metro Station which we used every day. You can buy an all day travel ticket from the Hotel for 4 euros per adult (children travel free). The Hotel staff were extremely helpful in providing maps and the best route to find all usual tourist sites either by walking or by metro / bus. The Colluseum is a 10 minute walk away though a park. The Hotel rooms were serviced every day and were exceptionally clean and comfortable. The rooms are air conditioned which we were very grateful for during our stay as it was so hot. The only downside was our room didn't have any tea/coffee making facilities in the room but room service is available 24 hours and there is a bar. All staff were very child friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was superb and there is a wide choice. There is a park opposite the Hotel which has some play equipment that could come in handy to keep the children entertained. This is an excellent Hotel, as a fussy traveller myself, I would heartily recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a family visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cormoran67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice one week apart in two different rooms. Both were spacious familly rooms (actually a double room separated by a curtain with a double and two single beds. Our first room was perfect, but the second had a couple minor faults - a less efficint air conditioner and a problem with the hot water looked after by the attentive staff. Very professional conscierge and desk staff, a very large and attractive lounge. We took advantage of the prebooked service to and from the airport. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Collesium and on a direct subway line to the Vatican. The hotel is on a square that has seen better days, somewhat deserted at night, but we had no qualms about returning on foot at night. All in all a good well run hotel for a nice Roman holiday .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: GabRyan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Napoleon on our honeymoon, and were extremely happy with the hotel and staff. They knew ahead of time that we were coming on our honeymoon and made arrangements for a bottle of champagne and bouquet of flowers waiting for us when we got to our room. All the staff were very pleasant and receptive, and we couldn't have asked for a better experience at the Hotel Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “SIX STAR -GREAT STAFF- 3 STAR - MEDIOCRE FACILITY”
Reviews.Author: Pierre-Falcao
Reviews.Content: the staff was the most pleasant part of my stay.......they are magnificent....Mr. Franco is the best......the hotel is old and needs to be refreshed......carpets dirty.....hallways poorly lit...wallpaper peeling....bathrooms and furniture require makeover...breakfast spartan...seems like the owners are milking what once was a cash cow.....however very little milk left....and a delightful staff is not sufficient compensation....

Reviews.Title: “NICE WELCOME TO EUROPE”
Reviews.Author: YaniGonzalez
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Europe for my first time and it was our 10th wedding anniversary. He picked Rome since it has all the historic sites and the Vatican. Not knowing in which hotel we were going to stay, we picked the Napoleon and do not regret it at all. We were going to just stay 2 nights at the Napoleon and stayed instead 7 nights. The location was perfect with all kind of restaurants and shopping places around, the personnel is excellent always with a nice smile on their faces to help and provide guidance of the city tours, shopping places, etc. If I were to go to Rome again, I will not doubt stay again at the Napoleon Hotel. We loved the wine tasting we were invited to. Good job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel will re visit next year”
Reviews.Author: CotswoldsMum
Reviews.Content: We were a mother and daughter having a short holiday together and can’t praise this hotel and staff enough from our arrival to our departure we had a fabulous time hotel location was perfect and the help the staff gave us about were to go was nothing but excellent. Breakfast was varied and plenty of it also had a lovely diner in hotel restaurant ,room was very clean and roomy , I can say about this hotel but we will return and I would recommend anyone to book this hotel. Thank you all for such a lovely holiday see you soon Ann Harris and Caroline Joel England

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train station, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicagochick72
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Napoleon before heading to Venice. THe hotel was very well situated to get to and from the train station. It is across from a pretty park and a handful of nice restaurants were around the corner. Only negative is its not in the heart of Rome and the area felt a little seedy. Aside from that, good service - and the bartender was terrific. Sent us to a amazing restaurant, Mondi, around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Federalhillgirl
Reviews.Content: I will be reiterating much of the great things others have said about their experience at this hotel. We stayed here Aug 30, 2009 - Sept 6, 2009. In one word Fantastic. LOCATION: It is not located in a touristy area, but that is something I like. The metro is literally steps from the entrance to the hotel, but you can also walk to the Colosseum, Forum, Spanish Steps, etc. SERVICE: Excellent! Friendly service. Sara a server and bartender was always charming and witty. And there are no words for Franco - super helpful, super friendly and a true professional. ROOM: we splurged for a Superior Room and were very happy with the size and amenities. We were there during the "heat wave" and did have an issue with the air conditioner (water/condensation was leaking) but was fixed immediately upon notifying maintenance. We also found our toilet pressure to be low at times, but manageable. The shower pressure was excellent. The hair dryer was dreadful. The hotel is charming and clean. Would definitely stay here again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and inviting place to stay”
Reviews.Author: voyageur08
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome at the Napoleon. As other reviewers have mentioned, the staff are first-rate: knowledgable, helpful and thoroughly professional. Although our room was fairly small, it was comfortable, air-conditioned, had a mini bar and a good-sized bathroom with a large shower. The public spaces are large and inviting. The Metro entrance right outside the front door makes getting around easy, and it's close to Termini station if you want to catch a train or a city bus. If you're there on a Friday, take in the manager's reception in the bar, with complimentary Italian wines and hors d'oeuvre. It's very enjoyable and a chance to chat with some of the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great service, clean hotel with wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: USAmka
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not in the popular centro storico area, it is conveniently located near the entrance of a metro. The coliseum and the palatine, forum are easy walking distance. We even walked sometimes to the Spanish steps, Pantheon and then took the metro on our way back. The breakfast was excellent. It gets you ready for a full day of sightseeing. The staff are very helpful and the management works hard to keep up the their standards of customer service. I have been to many expensive hotels for business travel - but the staff of this hotel are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: PaddyB57
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent our 26th wedding anniversary there and we enjoyed it immensely, all the staff were very friendly and helpful, the food in the restaurant was superb, the location was just right for us as the metro station is just outside the front door, when we go back to Rome we will be heading for the Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice familiar place”
Reviews.Author: expataecl
Reviews.Content: My family and the grandfather spent here a long weekend in July and I had actually found the place through tripadvisor. We had some problem at the check-in, since we had booked two rooms, a suite and a twin, and insisted ,that since they did not have connecting rooms, they are at least in the same floor and as close as possible. They said there was some problem and that the rooms are in the different floors, and that should not be a problem. Well, I´m the one running stairs up and down for the needs of a youngster and a grandfather, so I clearly stated that for me it is a problem and showed them an email, where they have confirmed me same floor rooms. But without any larger hassle, they upgraded the other room and we were able to stay in the same floor, problem solved! The rooms were OK, except with no view (looking the inner yard), but after all we did came here to visit Rome, not to stay in the hotel. And overall , the price-quality ratio is quite at the point. We really enjoyed the metro station right at the front: no hassle for looking a taxi for 5 persons, but fast and easy and cheap (plus for children exiting) transportation to everywhere. Once we took the tourist bus from vatican area just for fun, and got out at Termini, and five minutes later, we were back at the hotel. And anyway, it was 10-15 minutes (14 euro) taxiride to most of the nice dinner places, and a taxi for five was called by the hotel. One morning I walked with the children to Colosseum for an Ice cream, and it took us 15 minutes, so I was quite surprised how close to everything we actually were. Everybody here mentions the breakfast, which I personnally did not found anything spectular, I guess because of the bread, but the plus was that there were vegetables for my morning sandwich. We found the hotel having its own flaire, typical italian, with friendly personnel and good location for our needs. Even though I usually like somewhat more luxury, we were very happy with this place, and I could consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cembc99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here in June and we found this to be a very nice hotel and a great value. Our room was a decent size but with no view and the lounge was huge and inviting. The staff were very nice and friendly. We both would recommend it, and would definitely return. The reason why I give this 4 stars and not 5 is location. The hotel is very near to Termini which is great if you are traveling by train, but in general is not an area with much to wander around and see. It just isn't a really nice part of Rome, that would make you want to walk out and wander around. And, there are very few quality restaurants nearby. That said, the hotel is literally in front of a metro stop. So it is a good base to see Rome because the metro is very convenient, and it is air conditioned which can be a relief from the brutal heat. One last thing...don't take the packages from the front desk, like the 30 or 40 euro vatican papal audience tour. You can get tickets to this for free from the church Santa Susana, and the metro is very quick and cheaper. Packages like that are a waste of money. But, do let the front desk reserve things for free, like the Villa Borghese. That was really helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 12try
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights in Mid August with my wife and parents in law. I have to say that the quality of the welcome and the service we received during our stay was better than anything I have ever experienced in many years of travelling. We had requested dinner upon our arrival and despite the fact that we did not arrive until 10.15 pm the restraurant and kitchen facilitated an excellent and relaxed meal despite the fact that clearly they had stayed open just for us. Amin the waiter was very professional and to top it all off they provided us with Comp "spakling wine" as a gift for my in laws anniversary. The reception area is nothing special but on the first floor there is a comfortable and relaxing lounge and bar area. On the Friday night the owner treated all the guests to an informal wine and cheese reception and made a point of talking to all the guests and it was a pleasant and appreciated gesture. All the staff we met were effecient and friendly - Sarah and Amin being the most worthy of mention. The hotel organised taxis for us upon arrival at the airport and going to the airport. They arrived as arranged. The bedrooms were comfortable quiet with good air con which was important in high 30's heat. The hotel is beside a metro station that takes you to the spanish steps or st Peters and the Colleseum is a 15/20 minute walk. The immeadiate area is quiet but we walked to colleseum area for dinner/drinks on the other evenings. In summary if you are mid budget and want something comfortable but more friendly than the large chain type hotels I could not recommend this hotel highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service, decadent rooms with an appalling view.”
Reviews.Author: davibar
Reviews.Content: The only two good things about this hotel are its location and its breakfast. I spent there four nights in total: one alone, three with my girlfriend. On the night I spent alone, I stayed in a tiny single room with an appalling interior view. The next day, I went to the reception to ask for the key to the double room where I would stay with my girlfriend, so that I could transfer my luggage from one room to the other. I took my heavy suitcase and five minutes later I was back in the single room to fetch the rest of my stuff. I found the door open, a cleaning lady on all fours wiping the bathroom floor and the room completely empty. I asked her what she was doing there and where my things were and she told me that, as she had seen me go out with my suitcase, she thought I had left, so she put everything she found in the garbage, including a bag with about fifteen different new clothes. She told me she was extremely sorry, but the reception hadn't informed her I was only changing rooms and not leaving for good and that it was quite "usual" to find bags full of clothes that people didn't want to take back home. At the end, she managed to separate my clothes from the rest of the bathroom rubbish she had put together and finally gave everything back to me. The double room was a little bit more spacious, but the bathroom had three problems: the toilet was located in front of an incredibly small shower (no bathtub!), and so there was no space for the legs when sitting down. Secondly, there was a leak, and I found a huge puddle of water on the floor when I came back from the first afternoon out. Thirdly, there was absolutely no pressure at all in the flush, which obviously had embarrassing consequences. The first problem had no solution, the second was resolved one day later and the third was not resolved at all. I had explained at the reception that I was going to pick up my girlfriend at the train station and that I wanted the pressure problem to be solved by the time I came back. When I did, the problem hadn't been dealt with yet. The porter who took her suitcase up was informed of the problem and for 15 minutes he tried to fix it while we were there, taking up our scarce time in Rome. He didn't manage and he promised he would try again later. When he left, we finally went to get ready and we left the room. At night, when we came back, the problem hadn't been solved and several utensils were scattered around the dirty floor. The rooms, besides, were extremely old-fashioned and uncomfortable, in desperate need of total refurbishment. Maybe this was my unlucky week, but I will not even consider going back to Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to explore a very beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: CrosstreesJB
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Friday and were able to check in to our room straight away which was a great start to the weekend. The room was spacious enough for two and both room and bathroom were spotless. The a/c was very welcome after a day exploring the city in the August heat. The location of the hotel is ideal with access to metro on your front door literally and the Termino which is the citys main rail station 10 mins walk away. Some of Romes biggest sights are also within a short walking distance of the hotel and with a decent map and comfortable shoes you can explore Romes gems at your own pace. As well as dining in the hotel which was very nice, we ate in L'Angleto Ristorante in Piazza Rondarini near the Pantheon which I can highly recommend for anyone looking for a nice meal. We did the Collosseum/Roman Forum tour with Carrani Tour company and unfortunately this was not good. This was due to no a/c on the bus in furness like temperatures and a guide who repeated the limited information he had on the fabulous location we were visiting in a different form minute by minute. I would suggest people visit by themselves and buy the handheld audio guides at each venue. We used these following our tour guide experience to great success.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Staff, Wonderful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: CoClareEnnis
Reviews.Content: To Marta and all the staff of the Hotel Napoleon Myself and my wife want to thank you and all the staff for helping to make our wedding on the 17th of July a very special day. Everything was perfect the flowers, food, wine, music and the service from the staff was the best we have ever experienced. All of the guests enjoyed the reception and said the staff were so friendly and helpful and many people said it was the best night they ever had.Marta, you were a great help to both of us and we always felt confident that the wedding would be wonderful with your help.The Napoleon is a great hotel with great staff and we will always remember how wonderful our wedding was thanks to you and the staff. We will definitely be back to the hotel next year for our anniversary. Sincerely, Gerard and Rosaleen Holloway

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home to me”
Reviews.Author: Blanche42
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the excellent reviews it receives on this site. Everyone who works there is courteous, efficient and helpful. Special thanks to Roberto, a conceirge. He was able to answer all my questions and arrange tours and transfers for us very well. The lounge is a great area to meet other guests for a drink or just to talk about your day. The free internet is a bonus. There are several good restaurants near by and the hotel restaurant serves wonderful food as well. Try the lasagna. I had it 3 times. Around the corner there is a large gelateria that serves many flavours of gelato. Have one every day! The buffet breakfast that is included with your room provides lots of choice. There are always scrambled eggs and a delious bacon. You can even order a cafe latte. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: John-TravelAgent
Reviews.Content: Great location , exceptional and helpful staff. This hotel was recommended to me by a friend. And I would have no hesitation in recommending to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, great location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Paul_from_Belfast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 4 nights at Hotel Napoleon. Having arrived very late it was nice to be greeted by a cheerful and very helpful consierge. In fact all staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and well furnished with air conditioning (very welcome in the August heat!) and a great powerful shower. The hotel restaurant/bar is great value for money (we dined there on 2 of our four nights at the hotel) and was as good as, if not better than many of the local restaurants. The hotel is extremely well placed for exploring Rome with a tube station on its doorstep and the Coloseum just a 10 minute walk away! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend the Napoleon Hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NapoleonNetherlands
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an 8 day trip to Rome -- staying at the Napoleon during my visit. We liked the hotel very much. Helpfull en frendly staff. The hotel chamber and bathroom are good and clean . Each day the linnen is changed. The surved a very good breakfast like in the Netherlands. A recommendation is certainly the restaurant in the hotel. We have because of this complete fine summon have in Rome! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel, but very, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: SingerEsq
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews on this website as well as another. The neighborhood in which it is located is not the best, but the front door is literally steps away from the Metro. You can get virtually anywhere from there, and in the August heat, it was better to be underground than on top of it. Our room was smallish, but ready at 11:00 a.m. and spic and span clean, and the bathroom virtually brand new and very nice. Insulated windows made the room QUIET and the A/C was GREAT! Best we had in Italy. Roberto, the manager, could not have been nicer. We even saw him in the Metro one day and he shouted out to us, wanting to make sure we were coming to his Friday night reception / wine tasting, which was an unexpected treat. He really goes out of his way to make your stay enjoyable. The staff will do anything for you if you ask nicely. Breakfast is simple, but tasty with some hot items. Common area was very nice for early morning finishing up a last minute work project while partner was sleeping. Free WiFi is greatly appreciated. There is also a computer there for common use if you do not bring your own for checking e-mails and such. All in all, a great place for a few nights in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world that we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: bjg1804
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 119 and, unlike some other reviews on here, we personally thought that the room was of a good size and certainly not dark at all. It was very clean and the air conditioning was very quiet. Yes, you can hear it a little bit when it is turned on but we easily slept all night with it on - and was very welcome during our stay what with the very warm Italian weather in August! The free internet connection was very quick wireless broadband and easy to connect to using the user name and password provided by the hotel. It was my wifes birthday during our stay and the hotel had obviously noted her date of birth when we booked originally and made a point of wishing her a happy birthday when we returned to the hotel in the evening. Then about 5 minutes after returning to our room, there was a knock at the door and we were greeted by a member of the staff holding a complimentary bottle of champagne and a note from the manager wishing my wife a happy birthday. Now that's service! Every member of staff was attentive and friendly at all times. Hotel Napoleon helped to make our trip a memorable experience and we would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really Excellent family Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WonstonMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for the last week of May for our 25th wedding Anniversary. The hotel was extremely well placed for visiting Rome with a tube station on its doorstep. The staff were very pleasant and helpful - one gave us a suggested walking tour along the Tiber which enabled us to see may sights we would otherwise have missed. Very convenient for the railway station to the airport. Will definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality 5 stars is not enough”
Reviews.Author: reelfine
Reviews.Content: I highly recomend staying at this hotel,the location is close to the metro the staff is always there to help with directions. the service and food is also very good. We would stay in this hotel again . The four sisters

Reviews.Title: “Napleon was Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jbama174
Reviews.Content: I am from Florence, Alabama and my wife and I stayed at the hotel. It was fine, the staff was great, very helpful and they understand English. The rooms are fine, get a superior room, it is a little bigger and the bathrooms are great. The water pressure is great, cold airconditoners. We stayed in Room 315. Great Breakfast, Free. Internet free, and the metro is right in front of the hotel underground. Very easy to get from place to place. The front staff greeting you are super. The only thing is bring your Euro from USA. Our money here is weak and you dont get much in Italy for it. Make sure you bring a calling card to call back to the USA. Cell phones do not work. Verizon. NO. but the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in as good spot!”
Reviews.Author: Katrinalort63
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed in on our 'Italian Road Trip' and we were not disappointed. Its in a great spot for sight seeing, many places are reachable by foot, if not the metro is close by and cheap We had a superior room that had a separate seating area, it was spacious and clean, although the view was a bit naff! Communal areas were comfortable. The staff were friendly and attentive, especially Sarah. Breakfast was superb and catered for people with wheat intolerance. The 'light' menu was great value, the same prices as local restaurants. This hotel made our stay in Rome memorable for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: MrLonandB
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an 8 day trip to Rome -- staying at the Napoleon during my visit. Hotels in Europe tend to opt for the smaller sized accomodations as compared to those in the U.S. and we could probably pick and choose as to which hotel has a bit bigger room; beds; showers; elevators and the like as there are pluses and minuses to all. With that understood, having an accomodating staff at the hotel is what is most important to me and the staff at Napoleon are extremely professional, very helpful and courteous as well. When you're visiting a place for the first time and are unsure about which restaurants are the best for your money; which places you should or shouldn't visit, etc., having a helpful staff to arrange things for you or make reservations that you need and the like...is very important in my opinion. The staff at Napoleon will take care of your needs and are very friendly folks. The hotel itself is very clean -- aged, but clean. The rooms are again, a bit smaller than what you might be used to if you're from the U.S., but they are spacious and comfortable enough. Besides, when you're visiting Rome...how much time are you going to actually spend in the room? Their restaurant and breakfast bar are very good with top-notch waiters as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Will definately come back”
Reviews.Author: sunshine123423
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my 11 year old son and we really enjoyed our stay at the Napoleon in Rome. The hotel picked us up at the airport free of charge which is a huge savings! I had no problems with the hotel at all. The staff members were nice and helped you with anything you needed. The room we were is what big enough for the both of us and very quiet. The food the hotel served in their restaurant was really good and we ordered room service another night which was convenient. The breakfast was just fine for us...you can't make everyone happy. Also, there was a great little pizza shop about a block away we ate at one night. They had an internet station that you can get on which was really convenient for looking up sights or comparing tours at your leisure. The HUGE plus to this hotel is that the metro is right outside the front door and it gets you to almost every attraction you wish to see. We bought a tourist pass for 4-5 Euros which had unlimited use for three days. If this is your first trip to Rome or looking for the best way to use your time buy the Rick Steves travel book on Rome. Inside he tells you about all the sitseeing spots and which metro stops to get off on. We had three nights in Rome and wished our stay was longer!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: RockyShore
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have mentioned the central location, the access to wonderful hotel meals, the comfy rooms, the welcoming decor of Napoleon Hotel I agree wholeheartetdly. I have to add that our stay was truly memorable because of Franco, the concierge. When we arrived we told him that my husband's back pack went missing - and it held all of his medications for our 2 week trip! Franco immediately took us under his wing. He navigated us quickly through what would have been frustrating negotiations in view of our lack of fluent Italian - and helped us replace his medications within the hour. He was always at the ready to provide a suggestion for a perfect dinner, a short cut to a tourist site or an attentive ear to listen our travel adventures. Because of Franco - this hotel truly gets a 5 star rating from us!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable rooms, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sandlewoodgunsmoke
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Napoleon for 1 week. We arrived on Friday night. We appreciated being met by your driver which was free of charge. We checked in and were able to have a meal which was very welcoming. The room was spaceous clean and very comfortable. The food was excellent and lots of choice. The resturant was very cosy. A beautiful bouquet of cream roses was very much appreciated. We picked your hotel from the brochure the Irish College sent me. Our wedding day was 7th July. Our guests arrived on Sunday evening and were transported from the airport to the hotel and again a very welcome meal was enjoyed. we very much appreciated the champagne reception you laid on when we returned after the wedding and the table was beautifully decorated and the meal was superb. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Kabir and his staff. It made our wedding very special and we will never forget the wonderful week we spent in the Napoleon. It is also very convenient to the Metro. Thank you all most sincerely and we hope to revisit Rome again and will certainly be staying at Napoleon. Our guests were most impressed.

Reviews.Title: “super friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: cambs_traveller61
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four nights at this hotel. Other reviewers have noted that the location is not in a prime tourist area, and some reviewers have said that they felt unsafe at night, we must agree that the location is not the best, but not once did we feel unsafe, rather that we were living in a working part of the city and not a tourist part. This does have the advantage that you could purchase bottled water from the local shops for 50c/ 500ml rather than the 2.50 euro more typically charged in the tourist areas. The staff are universally extremely helpful, with particular praise going to the two daytime concierges who helped us organise various trips. The two rooms we had were clean and attractive, full of old fashioned, but functional furniture. The bathrooms were both modern, possibly recently refurbished. Both rooms were quite spacious, but neither had any view to speak of, as they overlooked a small courtyard, but they were both very quiet. The breakfast included in the price was not the best we have experienced, but was more than adequate, while the food we had from the bar was very good indeed, and at a reasonable price. We did not try the restaurant in the evening. The hotel is not particularly close to any tourist areas, but there is a very pleasant 20 minute walk through a park to the Colosseum, and the metro is only 10m away from the hotel entrance and is very cheap to use, when compared with London overall, a very good experience and thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Home”
Reviews.Author: nmills
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Napoleon Hotel is an experience my mom and I would never forget traveling from the U.S. Virgin Islands. From our shuttle service to our last night we enjoyed our stay. The staff are very helpful with assisting in find places to visit, currency exchange, and anything you can think of. Breakfast every morning gave every guest a good start for the day to tours in Rome. I will always return to Napoleon Hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jjefferson
Reviews.Content: My wife , my teenage son and I stayed 5 nights at the Napoleon. The location was great and although the area can seem unattractive at night, we never felt any safety concerns, especially since a car of Carabinieri (national police) was parked every night in front of the park accross from the hotel. We are good walkers so we did not use the nearby metro station and were able to reach all major sites. The hotel is close to Colosseum, Roman Forum; other sites can be reached on foot if you don't mind walking a bit more , for example Villa Borghese, Piazza di Spagna, Vatican. Hotel staff made our stay really enjoyable and they made you feel welcome and part of the family. The room was small by North American standards, but everything was very clean and the bathroom was a good size. I found out after our stay that the hotel offers beds of different levels of firmness, which can be a good thing, if you have a sensittive back like me. We had a quiet room and had no problem with outdoor or indoor noise, The buffet breakfast is not superlative, but plentiful with enough selection to satisfy most visitors. We dined 3 times at the Hotel restaurant and the food was good and reasonably priced- the staff again very friendly and helpul with the little touches that enhance the occasion: complimentary desert wine and biscotti afte the meal. This hotel is a great value and the staff really makes a difference. I would return to this hotel if I ever have the opportunity to return to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Total excellence - convenience, staff, accommodation, food, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: LiffeyBW
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon is a fine example of city centre hotel. First impressions are important and the friendly appoach of the Reception staff and the ambience of the lounge was impressive. Of course proximity to the metro and withing reasonable walking distance of key historic sites were a major advantage. Accommodation was fine for my wife and self, clean, aircon etc and well maintained. Meals in the hotel were of a high standard, particularly the breakfast choice and also at dinner in the dining room. Above all the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff will be remebered, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, GREAT SERVICE, GREAT PEOPLE”
Reviews.Author: taylinYork
Reviews.Content: I travelled wth my mother, so quite daunting, two females in a major city alone. Our fears were dispelled when we arrived at the Hotel Napoleon by train from Leanardo Di Vinci Airport. A short walk to the hotel, easy check in with a friendly and very helpful welcome. Room good size with everything you needed. Metro station to all major sights 5 paces from the hotels front door and a 24 hour English speaking reception who help with train tickets, places to eat and anything else you need. Buffet breakfast was varied and plentiful with items varying from cereal, fruit juices, pastries, cakes, meats, cheese, bread and a hot selection. Great location slightly away from the noisy centre but good for a great nights sleep. Would definatley return!

Reviews.Title: “great service, location and comfortable, friendly environment”
Reviews.Author: wgbj
Reviews.Content: Upon first arrival at night the location was questionable. Once daylight hit, we were thrilled with the ambiance, location, access to the metro and sites and restaurants. The rooms were roomy enough- we had two teenage children with us, and kept very clean. The breakfast was good and we enjoyed a delicious dinner at the hotel the last evening. Loved the wine tasting and service in the bar area. Also, a great social area with computer access which was important to the teenagers. Staff was wonderful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: holek
Reviews.Content: We chose Napoleon based on reviews here and were not disappointed. The front desk is friendly (and speaks enough English). They picked us up for free by van (a/c non-functional) from FCO airport because of a 3-day reservation (see their website--the driver spoke no English, and did not believe in loading or unloading luggage). The room and deskspace a little limited by US standards, but the wardrobe (with the programmable lockbox within) and several items of furniture had keys, and could be locked. Bathroom was clean and the supplies fine (Europeans do not believe in washcloths, and the hand towels are usually thin. They also do not believe in oversupplying towels. There was one of each for each of us). The days we were there were not exceptionally hot, so the meager output of the A/c was adequate. The greatest advantage of the hotel is proximity to the Metro. The breakfast was definitely much more than basic although not top tier. The coffee is brought to the table (enough for 2 cups), and tasted like instant which it does in most places. Mini-bar rates were reasonable compared to airport prices and some other hotels we stayed at. They have Metro tickets at the desk if you need them. We never felt any safety concerns. For something I needed printed, I sent the .pdf by email to the front desk and they had it printed and ready for me (so interpret the 'business center' accordingly). I also had wireless internet 24 hours without additional charge, a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, small room, not so central, pretty good service, solid 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Pangea_Quest
Reviews.Content: The hotlel is not bad – good deal (Eur 180/night), but the room is small and the location is not very central (and not a particularly nice area). It’s right next to a subway station, which is good, but the subway doesn’t go to most of the key sites in the center of the old city. The rooms are on the small side of the European scale. The service was pretty good, particularly from the young guy (Stephan) at the concierage desk. He helped us book bus tickets to Sorrento online and was generally very helpful. We were on our honeymoon, so they gave us a bottle of sparkling wine on our fist day – very thoughtful. Breakfast was incluced, but was pretty bad. Eat elsewere (remember that the point of the trip is to enjoy the sights and the food, not to eat bad food for free). Overall, the hotel was a good 4 star – all my complaints are basically what you trade in for a lower price. PS: to get to Trastevere on the first day, we tried the bus – it took 15 minites to walk to the train station (where the bus was) and another 20 minutes waiting to get on the bus – not recommended. It’s much better to spend the money and take a taxi (would be about Eur 20). We ended up taking the subway where possible. Where not possible, we took the taxi (it took Eur 15 just to get to Piazza Navona, which was not that far).

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: patwong03
Reviews.Content: Pro - Clean hotel with a restaurant. Metro station is literally right downstairs with easy access. Con - Hotel is right by a park and it's very quiet/dead at night. No restaurants/bars are opened late at night in the area. No internet service (although there is a wi-fi computer, stress only ONE in the common area). The only good thing about this hotel is that it's VERY close to a metro station, which doesn't help since the metro shuts down at 11:30pm every day (12:30am on Saturdays). Recommend another hotel at another location.

Reviews.Title: “special trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: sirjohnson
Reviews.Content: I was given 3 days in Rome as a 65th birthday present from my daughter and son in law. WOW! what a present it was. My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Napoleon,what a hotel it is, the staff were absolutley brilliant .From the time that we were picked up in a limousine to the time that we left we were treated with the utmost curtesy, special thanks to Mr Roberto Lombardi and the waiters and waitresses and all other staff to numerous to mention, who made this trip a memorable one, we cant wait to go back for a second visit hopefully next year 2010. John & Sonia Rasmussen Cardiff, South Wales, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on good hotel in great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: MARSPEC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after arriving in Rome without a reservation. Front door somewhat lost among the storefronts, I passes it by my first time by. However from accross the street in the square it becomes appararent that this is a large majestic hotel despite the diminuative front entrance and lobby. A walk to the second floor reveals a very pleasant old world lobby/lounge complete with vintage artwork. I found guests in the lounge chatting about their experiences in Rome on a regular basis, it is a relaxing atmoshpere that encourages the guests to chat. The clientele seems to be mostly British & American tourists. Roberto Lombardi was the concierge on duty when I arrived unnanounced he was able to provide a room at a fair price and the service was great. He was able to magically create a parking space and find a carpark, a good dinner recommendation and suggested a great late night walk to the Colloseum. He and all of the staff here really went out of their way to be helpful. The shower was tiny, but the room was comfortable, the price was right. Internet was slow but FREE and breakfast was decent and included. This hotel is good, and the price and service are great. I give the Hotel Napoleon five stars even though it is not five star by American standards, the combination of good service and value in central Rome earn it my five star recommendation. You could only do better at 3 to 5 times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Already missing it!”
Reviews.Author: Skolix
Reviews.Content: Room --> By European and/or Roman standards, the "superior double" room that we (me, my wife and our 7-year-old boy) booked, is one of the most generous in terms of free space, never felt "tight" while we were all together in the room, it was always a pleasure returning back to our base after a long day of walking and sightseeing. Big spacious bathroom with bathtub, not the usual claustrophobic shower cabins that an adult can barely stand in.
