In addition, our room was VERY quite, something that counts a lot when all you want is a good night's sleep in order to wake up in the morning fresh and ready for a new day in Rome (that was because the hotel rooms face the backyard, which is nothing more than some other building's back, but again, when travelling I gladly exchange the lack of view with a priceless serene night. Staff --> EVERYBODY was very polite and ready to help whatever the problem/need was, very friendly, kind of a "family" atmosphere and at the same time very professional staff. The room was booked several months before and every little detail was taken care of exactly as promised in the initial emails that we exchanged with the hotel management (for example, the car that, when leaving, would carry as from the hotel to the Fumicino airport was fixed in February, when we booked the room, at a certain price for the morning of the 22nd of June and it was right there waiting for us!) Location --> What can I say? The Metro station is at the doorstep of the hotel, we could not ask for anything more since we had only 3 days available to see as much of Rome as we could. Some previous reviewers mentioned that they spotted a few "suspicious" guys on the nearby area but, hey, we are talking about the metro of a big metropolis, it's no different than any other similar place. At no moment we felt uncomfortable or unsafe. Another big plus was the fact that round the corner there were two trattorias (neighborhood restaurants) with very good food and extremely reasonable prices, a big advantage especially on Sundays when most of the downtown restaurants are closed. Other --> Restaurant, bar (with small/light dinner) and a cozy leaving room with TV and an Internet spot were all operating/in order, just keep in mind that we are not talking about anything fancy or gourmet considering the food, it is just an effortless solution when you are too tired to get out and start looking for a restaurant. All-in-all --> MUCH better than expected, great value for money, if I return to Rome I would definitely stay at the Napoleon again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Us Like Family”
Reviews.Author: seagulls17
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Rome for the first time for 2 nights after a cruise. From the booking, to the check-in and during the stay, the service was impeccable. Domenico, Roberto and Frank treated us as family. They told us our room would be ready early when we booked, and it was ready when we arrived at 11am. We spent a little more for the superior room, and it was worth it. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good. And you just had to walk out the hotel and there was the entrance to the subway--one euro to the Vatican. Highly recommend this hotel if you are sight-seeing Rome. Joe & Michele, New Jersey, USA

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: waykon
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Rome the Hotel Napoleon proved to be a most memorable and pleasant experience! The hotel management and staff were extremely friendly and helpful and in my opinion “First Class”!! Our double room was pleasantly larger than we had expected and very clean and quiet. We couldn’t have asked for a better breakfast that is included with your stay I might add and the dining room is spacious and beautiful. We had dinner at the Hotel one evening and the menu was superb! As this was our first visit to Rome we wanted to see all the sites and the location of the hotel was perfect for all our sight seeing adventures. Access to the underground Metro is literally right outside the front door of the hotel. If you prefer to walk the Colosseum and Roman Forum for example are an easy 20 – 25 minute walk from the hotel as well. We felt very safe walking around the area of the hotel even when we came in late at night. All in all I would say we couldn’t have had a better experience and would highly recommend the Hotel Napoleon to anyone looking for a truly wonderful Roma accommodation destination. Thank you again to the management and staff of the Hotel Napoleon…well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “thank you Roberto”
Reviews.Author: Beachdeac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is all the things mentioned below. A great value in Rome and safe, clean and not too far from the action (close to the Metro). But for the four of us (two couples) it was Roberto, the concierge, who made our Roman stay so very pleasant. He was helpful, sent us to good restaurants, handled shipping some gifts home for us (the only ones that have made it so far). He also paired us up with the Green Line Tour (GLT), one of the 'hop on/hop off' buses that hit all the tourist spots. Their service (GLT) was rerrible. They did not honor thier schedule and actually made us get off an hour early a good half mile from the hotel. When we shared this word with Roberto, he apologized and refunded our money immediatetly. Grazie! Several folk have complained about the neighborhood where this hotel is, but we never felt threatened in any way. There was a fine OVS department store in the same building, a normal police presence, a nice park across the street. All in all, it was afine place to stay in Rome. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: dhroadie
Reviews.Content: Even though I arrived not long before midnight, the checkin staff were wonderful and seemed genuinely pleased to see me. The two nights I stayed were lovely - the room had everything I needed and the bathroom was clean with good water pressure. However, the standout feature of the Napoleon for me was its staff. Nothing was too much trouble, from organising me a restaurant (Romantica - fantastic) to instructions on how to get around, using the Metro and where to go for the best shopping. I'd definitely return. It wasn't a cheap place...the location, food and room were great but it's really worth paying that little bit extra to know you'll be looked after by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Berkshiregal56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel for 3 nights at the end of May. We were extremely pleased with our accommodations. The room was very nicely decorated and fairly roomy. The bathroom had a good, albiet small shower. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 a.m., after traveling through the night and were pleasantly surprised to hear that we could get into our room, as well as have some breakfast. The hotel is conveniently located and the metro stop is right outside the front door. The park across from the hotel was a lovely, cool spot to relax in the heat of the afternoon. The staff is excellent. The concierge, Franco, was especially helpful. We really enjoyed the get together that the hotel hosts every Friday evening. We ate the hotel one evening and the food was excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the special way we were treated by the staff, at the Hotel Napoleon. I would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I'll return again....”
Reviews.Author: Camgral
Reviews.Content: My third visit to Hotel Napolean, this time I stayed at the Napolean with my teenage grandaughters - the service was wonderful, the staff so charmingly helpful. We had everything we wished for, nothing was too much trouble. The Napolean is an oasis of calm to return to after an exciting day in Rome, well placed near the metro for easy access yet within walking distance of the Colessuem. I would not consider staying anywhere else in Rome! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Our Golden anniversary dream”
Reviews.Author: chateau19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our Golden Anniversary here having chosen this hotel on the internet. The reviews we read were so true and we were not disappointed. More so,we were treated to a bouquet and champagne by the manager,his staff were superb in the attention we received,our thanks especially to Sarah and Mary for their service .the hotel lived up to it's reputation,location re metro,shopping,sights all within walking distance. Our thanks again for an unforgettable experiance in Rome. Jim and Lila,Limavady,N.Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Choice”
Reviews.Author: bleeb58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Napolean for four nights in May 2009. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the concierge, Roberto Lombardi. He was always eager to help us , and even called a local restaurant to book a table for us when the kitchen was down one night. The room was small by U.S. standards, but apparently large by European standards, and was always very clean. The bar / wait staff was also very friendly, and the prices very reasonable, especially for a Hotel. One server, Sarah Wennstrom, fluent in 3 or 4 languages, was extremely accomodating and personable. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of the Coliseum and the Forum, and there is a Metro entrance right outside the door. Overall, I would rate this hotel as a very good value, in light of the proximity to ancient Rome and the excellant service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, homely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollandOrange
Reviews.Content: The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpfull in every way. We had the feeling that we were at home with the personal attention and attention to details. Thanks to everyone at The Napoleon our stay in Rome was unforgettable and we would definately recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Has Flaws”
Reviews.Author: notherdayanothercity
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel based on the reviews that were on tripadvisor. Firstly the Hotel is a good location, just one stop from the termeni, and we lived on the metro! There is never one too far away! The hotel itself is very pleasent. The lounge area is lovely, but our "suite" wasnt as good as I expected, the place is fairly old. and could do with a freshing up, but for the price I couldn of expected more. Breakfast, Waitress, Bar and Porter staff are lovely, but I never met the famous "Marco" when I was there. I had seen his picture on this website, and he wasnt there anytime I was. The other fella is nice, young fella. However I was disappointed in a very rude receptionist. On every occasion when we meet him he was not particularly friendly. As others have said, the area is a view of "Real Rome", and we did see one or two homeless people hanging around the hotel. but I never felt unsafe. Few points for the hotel, Breakfast isnt great, and it would be nice to have a few more english speaking channels rather than the depressing news!

Reviews.Title: “ecxellent coice in small money”
Reviews.Author: ortashk
Reviews.Content: me and my lovely wife atayed in this hotel in dec. 2008 and it was great. location- outside the hotel there is a subway station. u can go with it everywhere in rome. just a few minutes to the most popular tourist place. the stuff- was great. the bell boys were very nice, friendly and helpful. every time we nedded they explained us where to go, give us map, told whuch subway to takk etc. and everithing with smile. because it was our anniveseray day the hotel gave us a suie; bottelle of wine and special towels free of charge. the breakfst was a little beat poor but as i know it was not poor more than any other hotek in the same class in rome. i realy recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jjlh
Reviews.Content: My husband, 17 year old daughter, and I have just returned from an 8 day stay at the Napoleon Hotel (May 19-27, 2009). This was our second trip to Rome, but our first stay at this hotel. We now consider this hotel our “home in Rome” and will always stay here on return trips to Rome. The hotel is located in a working-class, non-touristy neighborhood with good restaurants (RomAntica) and gelato (Il Palazzo del Freddo) nearby. We never felt unsafe in this area, even when returning on the Metro very late at night or when taking an evening stroll. The Metro is literally a few steps from the front door of the hotel, making it very easy to get around Rome and to the train station. The hotel is clean, furnished with antiques, and decorated in the lavish Italian style. Another plus: the common areas and guest rooms are very quiet. The guest rooms face an interior courtyard so one does not have to deal with the usual city/traffic noise that you find in other hotels in a large city. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable with a great terrace that overlooked the courtyard. It was quite pleasant to sit on the terrace after a busy day of sightseeing and enjoy a glass of wine. The rooms are also equipped with free Wi-Fi. This was a nice feature for my daughter with her iPod, allowing her to keep in touch with her friends via email. The hotel staff members are fine examples of great customer service in action. It seems that they all enjoy their jobs and truly care about the comfort of their guests. The housekeepers were friendly and kept our room spotless, providing fresh linens every day. The restaurant staff at breakfast kept everything tidy and addressed our every need. We did not eat dinner at the hotel restaurant but the daily breakfast was wonderful: items included traditional European breakfast items, American eggs and bacon, as well as fruits, vegetables, and heavenly Italian pastries. It was all fresh and delicious. The gentlemen who staff the concierge and reception desks speak excellent English and were most helpful and attentive to any need or question we had. There is a wonderful wine reception on Friday evenings where you can meet other guests as well as spend time getting to know the hotel staff. We had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Roberto Cioce, the general manager of the hotel, and were able to spend time getting to know him during our stay at the hotel. After our time with Mr. Cioce, it was quite apparent to us that his passion for excellence and service is what fuels his staff to do such an amazing job. Mr. Cioce worked with us prior to our arrival and continued working on our behalf after we arrived to arrange an important educational experience for our daughter. At times, it seemed like this opportunity would not come to fruition, but Mr. Cioce persisted and he was able to arrange an amazing experience for our daughter. We had a wonderful vacation in Rome, in large part due to our stay at the Napoleon Hotel and the excellent staff who treated us liked welcomed friends. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a friendly, peaceful oasis in the midst of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service,shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: GaryCopford
Reviews.Content: First I have to say that the service was first class, in fact one of the best I have ever had. Nothing was to much trouble for any of the staff and Franco was on of the best concierge that I have come across. The hotel public areas were of good quality and very comfortable. The Breakfast bar was spacious and bright. Only let down here was the cold Bacon and dripping in fat. Coming to our room it was classed as Superior but sad to say for a 4 Star hotel this was way off the mark. The room looked tired, no Tea or Coffee facilities, very old TV with volume problems, and furniture that must be a lot older than me and thats saying something. On the postive side I did speak to some other guests and It seems some of theres had been refurbished. No resturant during stay only light snacks from the bar, bad for a 4 star hotel. Overall for over £200 a night was it worth it?? just, because it's Rome and the costs are high. Would I stay there again probebly not as I would stay outside and visit Rome. One thing that does stick out though is the service!! Thanks again Franco and the team.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, very friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rogerdodger8
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review for TripAdvisor, but I decided to break my trend with this hotel, because it's an amazing place to stay. First off, we came really early (8am) because we only had 2 days there. All the other hotels I have been to pretty much tell you to check in later, but they had a room ready for us right away! The breakfast is also really good -- tremendous quality, great selection. I'm not much of a breakfast person, but I broke my habit to eat theirs. The location is very good -- walking distance from the train station, and RIGHT next to the metro. The front desk and concierge are VERY receptive to you. They are aware of all your needs and make sure they do everything to make your stay fantastic. One of them even told me some fun facts about my last name that I never knew before... I thought that was pretty cool. The rooms are a good size and at a great value, considering the tremendous quality of them. I felt very welcomed here and, if I ever go back to Rome, I would for sure stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ptero
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in early May. The hotel is very conveniently located - right next to the metro station. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean. We came back late night (past 10pm) several times and felt quite safe. Will certainly stay in this hotel next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from a wedding and 5 nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lol96
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 5 night stay in Rome (May 2009) and got married in the Irish College while there. A great city , lots to see and do, great weather and lovely food. Had a wonderful stay in the Hotel Napoleon and Roberto on the front desk was fantastic rustling up a wedding bouquet when Marco florist let me down.The cars arranged through the hotel were punctual and the hotel location was very convenient, right beside the metro and a short walk from the Colosseum. The wedding in the Irish college was lovely and the restaurant they recommended very good as was their recommended photographer. The Napoleon house keeping staff were very unobtrusive, the buffet breakfast good and the small restaurant and bar food adequate after getting in on a late flight. We would definitely recommend Rome and the Hotel Napoleon and hope to visit the great city again in the future. L (Ireland)

Reviews.Title: “I miss the breakfast at Napoleon. Thank you for the good time!”
Reviews.Author: androgyny
Reviews.Content: The staffs are so friendly essp Fabio and Simone and the others as well. Just the right location to the ancient Roma. Me and a mate had such a great time in Roma, partly because of staying at this hotel. So easy to get around, informations are always available and accurate. So thank you. We shall return again soon. So see ya. xoxo The Blonde & The Brunette.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here When Visting Rome......”
Reviews.Author: hipswich
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napolon is another great pick from TripAdvisor. Metro is just at the door, nice park across the street, 10 minute walk to the Coliseum and 15 minutes to ancient Rome. If you are taking a side trip like we did it's an easy walk to the train station. Our room opened to inside court was which was very quiet. They added two cots which converted it nicely into a quad. Room and bathroom was very clean. Well decorated and nice little bar on mezzanine. We stayed on the 5th floor which requires an elevator ride. If you are claustrophobic like me you may want to walk but I got used to it. We stayed for three days then one more day. There are many great places to eat within a 10 minute walk. The service was excellent. Breakfast was plentiful (even American scrambled eggs and bacon). We would stay here again an recommend it to anyone traveling to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: nreynol
Reviews.Content: Service was friendly, courteous, efficient from all members of staff. Situated with easy Metro access, a park to sit out in. Ordinary shops, bars and restaurants nearby. This is not the Ritz but neither are the prices. Other poeple selected this Hotel and I was n't too sure about it but when I called by phone to confirm the reservation my hopes began to rise. Then, when the collection at the airport went smoothly and with the reception we recived upon arrivial I knew this was going to be a positive experience - and so! it was.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: DCCwalker
Reviews.Content: Step outside the Napolean Hotel and the Metro station is right there. Plus, across the street is a delightful park if you just want to sit and enjoy the air and greenery. The hotel staff was so courteous and helpful with all of our needs; and in addition to a very nice breakfast buffet, on Friday evening they offer an opportunity to meet the staff and fellow guests along with complementary wine and treats. My husband and I had only intended to stay a few minutes, but we became so engaged in delightful conversations that we stayed and stayed. Our room was simple but completely clean; a little small but we had not opted for one of the more expensive rooms. Because the train station is only one Metro stop away and the amount of money that the hotel's fantastic location can save its guests on expensive taxis, we will simply upgrade to a larger room on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here to experience the true Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vilbeler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Napoleon for 8 nights in May 2009 - and enjoyed every minute of it! The biggest advantages of its location are the nearby metro (right in front of the entrance) and the neighbourhood, in which you can find lots of good restaurants, a famous "gelateria" and experience the true "dolce vita" among Romans - not tourists. The cheap metro tickets (€1) allow you to travel around Rome for 75 minutes - but it only takes you approx. 10 minutes to the most famous spots, e.g. the Spanish Steps. If you don't want to use the Metro, you can walk to the Colosseum and the Forum Romanum within 20 minutes! The staff of the Hotel are all extremely friendly and helpful (if you need a transport to the airport or have questions about other spots, don't hesitate to ask them). The breakfast buffet offers you a wide range of choice from scrambled ham and eggs over differents pastries to cereals. The rooms are cleaned daily, and the bed linen and towels are also changed on a daily basis. A big advantage of the rooms facing the interiour court is the silence during nighttime: you can sleep with your windows open ( if you don't like the air conditioner) and you don't hear any noise from the streets. And after a day of walking around Rome to see all the famous sights, you are very grateful if you can go to sleep in a clean and quiet room, knowing you're well taken care off in this fantastic hotel! Don't miss the Friday night wine tasting - it is a good opportunity to get in touch with other hotel guests and the hotel staff. Mr Cioce, the manager, is also present at these occasions - and he's pleased to share his knowledge on wine with every guest. There is no doubt: if we go to Rome again, the Napoleon will be our first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding venue”
Reviews.Author: Carrie62Rice
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from getting married in Rome, & we stayed & had our reception in the Napoleon hotel. We had a fantastic time & I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone, whether it be for a wedding or just a get-away! The staff are all very friendly & the concierge were always very helpful. Marta, who organised the reception was wonderful, anything we needed she was able to advise us on. The banquet hall was made out beautifully for us, & the food, amazing, not one of our guests complained about the food, or the wine for that matter!! We set up our ipod for music after the meal, they left their sound system ready for us, don't think they were expecting the party they got though :-) The situation of the hotel is in a bit of a run down area, but never once did I feel unsafe. The park across the road from it was luvly, we strolled through there a number of times to get the baby to sleep! We had 1 complaint about our room, and that was you could hear next doors toilet flushing, but that's it! We were upgraded as we were having our reception there, which had great space. Some of our guests rooms were small, but not tiny, when you go to an ancient city you don't go to stay in your room all day! Though they did feel that they should have got more for their money! All rooms were made up each day with fresh towels & bedding. Each morning we filled up on breakfast, a good selection of bread, croissants, eggs, bacon, fruit & yougurt, cold ham & cheese. We had snacks from the bar during the day, but mostly ate out elsewhere in the evening as there are so many nice places to eat! The Metro is right outside the door, but we walked everywhere as we had our little girl in a buggy! Everything is within walking distance, once you don't mind a good walk! If you get tired you can always pop in to get a glass of wine & a rest :-) Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay & would definitely return to the hotel, make sure you stay on a Friday night for the wine tasting evening, a very personal touch from the hotels owner!

Reviews.Title: “Ten out of Ten”
Reviews.Author: texarkana336
Reviews.Content: Thankyou Tripadviser, We never stay anywhere now without first checking out the hotel on tripadviser. How many hotels in the past have we read the brochure and found it to be a dirty run down hotel. But not anymore!!!!!!!! This hotel was first class, if you dont like this hotel then you nead your head examined. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The room was large and in a spotless condition. And the breakfast was just what you needed to start a long day of touring. Thankyou Hotel Napolen and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: LaylaChicago
Reviews.Content: I was compelled to write a review on our stay at the Hotel Napoleon after reading a negative review posted May 19, 2009. I stayed with my fiance and our two friends at this hotel for 9 nights in late March/early April. I felt the negative comments this traveller posted were unjust and entirely false. Throughout our 9 night stay, every person on the staff was very friendly, our room was cleaned daily and the bathroom left spotless, and the common areas and bathroom were always spotless. The location is perfectly situated to a metro stop which made for getting around the city very easy. The Colosseum/Palatine Hill/Roman Forum are all within walking distance. We took several walks in the area where the hotel is located and were never accosted by beggars or salesmen selling their goods. I felt safe in the area. The rates at the hotel were very reasonable and they also provided a nice breakfast each morning and even gave us a bagged meal to take with us on our early flight home. They have a lovely wine/appetizer tasting every Friday evening where all the guests can mingle. Again, we stayed here for 9 full nights and never regreted our decision to stay at the Hotel Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Queit, friendly and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eboyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon for a long weekend and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The area is quiet (not to be underestimated in Rome), the staff are very friendly (the Friday evening drinks with the staff is genuine and a great idea) and the location with a Metro station literally a few steps away ideal. For those couple of people that have given very negative reviews please bear in mind - this is Rome, not the US. Have you compared this hotel with others in Rome rather than in other countries? It's an ancient city not a modern metropolis. Wake up and smell the coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel, there are many better alternatives”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJerry1379
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel through Expedia for the night of May 17th. We were looking for a simple, affordable hotel located close to the metro for our final night in Italy. The pictures on the internet (especially on Expedia) are completely inaccurate and false advertising. The lobby and entrance way are very ugly and the rooms equally outdated, dirty, and visually unappealing. This hotel is in dire need of a complete retrofit. The location around the hotel is littered with graffiti, smells like Kabob restaurants, and they have many beggers and sales man selling you stuff aggresively on the street. We ended up cancelling our reservation through Expedia and they actually honored our request and gave us a full refund. I will post the pictures documenting all this as soon as possible to prevent future travellers from making the same mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon – improvements required”
Reviews.Author: alment
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers and just came back from a week stay at the Napoleon. The hotel had some good points but unfortunately some key areas require improvement. On the plus side, all the staff was extremely polite and helpful. They were also very accommodating at the front desk if you needed to print something or require information on tourist attractions. However, we were provided with wrong directions and were sent to the completely wrong area of town after asking for the shopping mall Porta di Roma. As a result, we were out a couple of Euros but most importantly we wasted some 3 precious hours of our last day in Rome because of the wrong information we were given. The breakfast had some pretty good variety and was nice. A bouquet of roses for our 15th anniversary was a nice touch. The location is probably its best asset since the Metro is right outside. On the negative side, the washroom is very small with a narrow bath tub and no counter space; only a small shelf over the bidet. This aside, the biggest problem with the room was its cleanliness, or lack of. The washroom was mouldy and the room was filthy. There were a film of dust on every piece of furniture and many stains on the carpet throughout the room. In fact, we did not even unpack our suitcases and always wore slippers in the room. The furniture was also very dated and shows significant wear and tear and there was quite a funky smell in the room which was not pleasant at all and quite a turn off. I have a bunch of pictures of the room; you can send me a note if you want to see them. Room cleaning was very poor as well as they seem to only make up the bed and replace the towels otherwise the bathroom was untouched and this became a hygiene issue. Shortly after arriving I was disappointed with the cleanness of the room and actually went to the front desk to see if we were in a “renovated room” and was told we were. If that was the case, I surely would not have wanted to see the rooms that had yet to be renovated! This hotel is in need of renovations and a good cleanup and would surely be a good find upon completion.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyRosie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six night stay at the Napoleon Hotel. We had a very enjoyable stay. The rooms are big and clean. As other reviewers have stated, the beds and pillows are hard but after a long day of sightseeing I had no trouble falling asleep. Our room had no view but since we left the hotel early each morning and didn't get back till after dark we didn't care. I originally booked a room (chain hotel) near Via Veneto and the price per night was more than double the Napoleon. I'm glad I changed my reservation! The Metro station is steps from the hotel. You can get to all of the major sites within minutes. (the A line trains arrive every 3 minutes). The area is not "touristy" so if you want to feel like a local, this is a very good area. It is true that at night the stores are closed so the area seems desolete, but we did not feel unsafe. We ate at local restauants and found the prices and the food much better. The hotel was very quiet. We met people staying at other hotels who complained that their hotels were very noisy (street noise and from other guests) . We were able to sleep peacefully through the night. The hotel staff for the most part were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was satisfying and offered many choices. I usually had juice, coffee, a hard boiled egg, a roll ( or pastry) and yogurt. My husband preferred making a sandwich of cold cuts. The hotel uses linens on the breakfast tables and the wait staff changes the linens after each guest leaves. What a treat to start the day at a freshly set table! If I am ever lucky enough to visit Rome again, I would not hesitate to stay at the Napoleon Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and best breakfast in town!”
Reviews.Author: Satu68
Reviews.Content: Having been to several good (mainly four stars) hotels in Rome, I must say that this is the best stay so far in terms of value for money. Service was incredibly nice, breakfast was very good and in general the hotel facilities and room were well above standard. The only minus is that this hotel is located slightly aside from the center, as it takes about half an hour - twenty minutes by foot. However, subway station is next to the hotel, and a taxi ride from/to the Spanish Steps takes no more than eight euros. The hotel is located in a middle of some cheap shopping facilities.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for comfort in Rome”
Reviews.Author: stevietampa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Napoleon in Rome Italy from April 28 - May 6, 2009. I loved the hotel and staff and highly recommend it. The location is perfect, right outside the Metro station, one stop from the main Termini station. This makes for very easy travelling throughout the city or to other parts of Italy. The hotel had spacious rooms, especially for Europe. The beds were comfy and the shower was awesome, hot and powerful. It was very quiet at night, no problems sleeping. The morning complimentary breakfast provided a great variety, the pastries and cheese were delicious. The staff was more than accomodating. The Friday night complimentary wine tasting was a treat, the red wine was very good. We stayed a long time, so we received complimentary transfer from the airport on arrival to the hotel which was great after a tiring overnight flight. Also, we had dinner in the hotel restaurant one night and enjoyed that, very nice dinner. The concierges Roberto, Franco, and Fabio were very helpful, I felt like they really cared that our stay was great. It was also a treat to meet Mr. Cioce, he really cares that people are having a good stay. The two times I requested service, they request was met immediately with a smile. They were helpful with suggestions and arranging day trips. Some people have commented on the location, but we found it perfect. There are several great restaurants nearby and really good gelato. The amazing church Santa Maria Maggiore is just a few blocks away if you want to experience a convienent mass during your busy stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Lavande
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a single occupancy room on the 4th floor. The breatfast was generous, the room very clean and most of the staff was friendly and helpful. The Metro station is right outside the hotel. Two issues - the first was that the shower was very small and really should have a glass door installed on it, because the way the shower floor is built, it's impossible for a larger amount of water NOT to spill onto the floor. The other issue was strange and confusing elevators. You can't just take one elevator up from the lobby to the room.

Reviews.Title: “I will never return to this heinously over-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinnichio
Reviews.Content: The reason I booked this hotel was due to the good reviews which I read on this site. I honestly don’t know what planet these reviewers are from. I think that this hotel was heinously over priced. It is true that the hotel is conveniently situated right next to a metro station which is great because, trust me, you don’t want to hang about in this area for too long! There are a lot of unsavoury characters who lurk around outside the station in the evening. There is a park across the road from the hotel. It seems to be quite a popular hang out for drunks, vagrants and various other men who enjoy leering at young women. I felt extremely unsafe and uncomfortable. I would not recommend this hotel, particularly if you are a young woman travelling alone. In my opinion, the area surrounding the hotel was an absolute ghetto. It is dilapidated, filthy and covered in graffiti. The hotel was very clean, particularly the bathrooms. The style of the hotel reminded me of my great grandmother’s house. I’m sure that she would have loved the garish patterned fabrics, bric-a-brac furniture and wall-mounted pictures depicting cats and kittens. The pillows in the bedroom were rock solid. We had to ask the concierge for others which were a little softer. I don’t understand why softer pillows weren’t in the room in the first place. I am sure that almost all their guests must request them. There was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which I found unusual for a 4 star hotel. The hairdryer was a Health & Safety Inspector’s worst nightmare. It was wall-mounted in the bathroom and looked like an industrial vacuum. The handle of the hairdryer becomes extremely hot after just a few minutes of use. I had to wrap a towel around it to save my hand from burning. If you do decide to stay at this hotel, then please take your own hairdryer rather than use their wall-mounted monstrosity! The food in the hotel was absolutely appalling. I ordered a salmon sandwich. There seemed to be more margarine on the bread that there was salmon. One salmon sandwich and a handful of iceberg lettuce cost 7 euros! I don’t understand how they can justify charging that. The service was excruciatingly slow. Even though we were the only people in the restaurant, we waited 20 minutes for a sandwich. That being said, the breakfast at the hotel was fairly good. They offer a wide selection in the buffet. My only complaint was that both the orange juice and the fruit salad were not fresh (they use diluted orange juice and tinned fruit salad). I think that for the exorbitantly high price you are paying them, they could at least stretch to using fresh produce. The Concierge, Franco, was very helpful and courteous. However, one of the other Concierges was unbelievably rude to me and my partner. We asked to buy two metro tickets. These cost 4 euros each. I gave him a 20 euro note (as I did not have any smaller bills). He angrily stated that he did not have any change and snapped that he “did not have time for this”. So, we had to wait until Franco returned to reception to give us our change. I would recommend that you purchase your metro passes from the machines at the station as they are the same price. Overall, I was very disappointed and I don’t think that I received good value for money. I will never return to this grossly over-priced hotel and I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome; Staff is very helpful”
Reviews.Author: aet09
Reviews.Content: I booked the Napoleon Hotel after reading reviews on CitySearch. I honestly did not know what to expect. I was blown away by the service and the dedication of the staff here. And, what hotel has free wi-fi in the rooms; I was hard pressed to find that in Rome! In particular, Franco was incredible. I am a young girl who was traveling alone and he made sure to recommend all the best places for me to go. He was so helpful! He looked out for me and made sure that I had the best experience possible; he recommended restaurants, travel routes, major sites, etc. On my last day (a Sunday), I realized I had forgotten to buy postcards. Franco sent me to the corner coffee shop and had them give me a few postcards for free. It was such a nice touch at the end of the trip. Another nice touch is the wine tasting they have on Friday nights. In sum, I would absolutely stay here again! The neighborhood quiets down at night, but that is nice because one of the most frequent complaints about hotels in Rome is that they are too loud. Thanks for the amazing stay and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AnnKBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews, we paid for a 'superior' room. The room we were given looked EXACTLY like the 'double' room as shown on the hotel's own website. We complained to 3 different members of staff that we thought we had been put in the wrong room, but they weren't interested. One member of staff replied (when I said the rooms didn't look anything like the superior room on the internet) something along the lines of.....'well a new car never looks as good as in the magazines'! We paid over £800 for 5 nights at the Napoleon, and wont be going again. There are lots of other hotels at a similar price nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: BalkanShark
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the Napoleon. The building has a superb location, being near major sites and next to the metro, but there was no noise or other problems normally found in Rome's downtown hotels. The building has a luster from a bygone era, presenting an old world ambience. Yet, the hotel was modern and fully remodeled. But, the item that stands out the most was its service from the management and the dedicated concierge staff. We regularly peppered them with questions and requests, whether in person or by phone, and the hotel staff always handled it courteously and capably. We especially appreciated the complimentary wine tasting, which was excellent. While it may be weird staying in Rome in a hotel dedicated to the French conquerer, you will be happy that you did.

Reviews.Title: “Also good for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Tony095
Reviews.Content: Just finished my second trip to Rome (total of three weeks). I picked Hotel Napoleon based on other travelers' reviews, and was not disappointed. The staff is incredibly dedicated to the enjoyment of its guests from the included/ample breakfast to the bar that closes late. For the business traveler, the wireless internet is fast and free. Mr. Cioce hosts a wine tasting on Friday evenings. Much of the senior staff is also present at this social gathering and actively engages in conversation with the guests. It provides the solo business traveler the opportunity to meet other guests, and for all guests to learn from each other what they find interesting in Rome. The rooms are quite comfortable for the price range, and are kept very clean. The salon outside of the bar is quite spacious and comfortable. Although the hotel is not in a traditionally touristic area, the Line A metro stairs are literally twenty paces from the Front door. It is very convenient to move about the city and return to this location without unnecessary walking. I look forward to many more visits to this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasan hotel with an excellent service”
Reviews.Author: allenDetroit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Napoleon 7 nights during our first visit to Rome and Italy. Everything was perfect. Location, just outside of the metro station, close to all buses stops, Termini rail station, 15 minutes walk to the ancient Rome attractions The room and bathroom were large and very clean. Breakfast was excellent, food in the restaurant was good. But besides of all of it, we were very impressed with the service in the hotel Napoleon. All staff members, (our special thanks to Franco), were very nice, pleasant, professional and warm. They picked us at the airport, they helped us with booking our tours in Rome and outside of Rome,all of their advises were very good, they always were very helpful and professional. We will recommend this hotel to our friends and hope to stay there again in a future. Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel that doesn't forget its guests.”
Reviews.Author: CHdCs
Reviews.Content: We rounded off our Europe trip here, in busy Rome, and stayed for 6 days in this large hotel which just oozes life from its staff and guests. The day we arrived and walked through the door from the busy street, we were met with a huge Buon giorno! from the smiling and ever-so-wonderful Franco. He helped us get sorted and checked-in. All the other places we stayed at were more boutique-style accommodation, so going from those to this large hotel which was full of guests all milling around and socialising was a bit of a change in pace for us. The room was a typical hotel room. It was of a satisfactory size and was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was roomy. The breakfast they have for guests in the mornings are extensive and we were spoilt for choice. They had everything! The food at the restaurant was wonderful and well priced. We spent most nights having dinner in the hotel restaurant as we had tried some other places around which did not compare to the hotel restaurant's level of service nor the quality of food. The bar was a lovely place to relax and socialise with other guests. We were lucky enough to be staying at the hotel when they had their wine and nibbles night, which is put on by the owner of the hotel. This is definitely an occasion one should experience if their length of stay allows it. The wine and nibbles are great and you get to meet not only other guests but some of the hotel staff too. It is definitely a nice way to get to know the people that greet you when you sit down for breakfast, or as you come in through the door from being out all day. Roberto, the owner, also comes along to meet the hotel guests but the greatest thing is to see how proud he feels of his staff and his hotel. It is clear that the people that work there consider each other as family. The most memorable thing for me during our stay at this hotel was definitely the staff. They seem to get on so well with each other and genuinely care about each other and the guests that stay there. It is not typically like a large hotel where people are only there to do their jobs, these people really talk to you - from the person that greets you at the desk knowing what room key to grab from the shelf before you even get to say hello ... to the lady that remembers exactly how you like your coffee even though there are 30 other people in the room! Rome was a wonderful place to finish off our trip, and this hotel was a wonderful place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: CameronDelaware
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy with my family. Staff was extremely courteous and friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was excellent with a Metro stop locating directly outside the hotel. The concierge, Franco, was extremely helpful. He was very courteous and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - perfect for family break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Phil25
Reviews.Content: It was our anniversiary, we had never been to Italy and my brief was to find a hotel in Rome, preferably 4 star but still reasonably priced, near to the main attractions and station that could accommodate 2 adults and 2 children in a decent room. I am very pleased to say that the Napoleon fitted this brief absolutely perfectly and offered lots more besides... The location was perfect - just under 10 minutes walk from the main railway station, just over 10 minutes walk to the Colosseum and a further 5 - 10 minutes walk to most of the other main attractions. We happily walked everywhere (with 2 small children) with the exception of the Vatican City which being the other side of the river was slightly too far. But just across the pavement from the hotel entrance is the metro which quickly takes you to a station just 5 minutes walk from the Vatican. The area itself was absolutely fine - no worse than anywhere else in Rome with a nice square just over the road. We had a great welcome on our arrival, there was a bunch of flowers in the room and a chilled bottle of Italian sparkling wine was brought up with a note to celebrate our anniversiary. The room was large - split in two with a dividing curtain with the double bed on one side and the children's two singles on the other. The bathroom was clean and modern with plenty of toiletries. There was a fridge/minabar with plenly of space for storing your own water etc. and the TV had four English language channels, BBC world, Sky and two American ones. The room also overlooked an internal courtyard which was great as there was no noise and the windows could be left open for air (there was also air conditioning if required.) Breakfast was a fantastic selection of the usual juice, cereal, fruits, rolls, cold cheeses and meats but also hot bacon, scrambled eggs and beans plus the biggest choice of cakes imaginable. On top of this, on Easter Sunday, there was an addition "traditional Italian Easter" selection of breads, cakes, salami and mini Easter eggs for the children which the waiters also brought round and offered. On arrival we were offered tea, any type of coffee we wanted (we had capuccio and latte) or hot chocolate (which the kids loved). There is a bar offering light meals throughout the day and a restaurant offering more elaborate meals in the evening. We had a bar meal the first evening and ate in the restaurant on the last night and the food was reasonably priced and as good as any we had anywhere else in Italy. And we were offered a glass of complimentary desert wine and biscuits afterwards! There is a large comfortable lounge with a desk and computer with free internet access in one corner. Although well used we had no problem getting on it most times we wanted to. On the Thursday night (normally Fridays but changed due to Good Friday) the hotel Manager hosted a local wine and food tasting session which we really enjoyed (the salami being the best I've ever had) and the kids were well looked after getting their own basket of crisps and choice of soft drinks. There were a very large range of people staying, older and younger couples and families of many nationalities. The staff were all extemely friendly and helpful and most could speak very good English - would particularly mention Franco for the patient way he dealt with our queries on reception and Simone for the effortless way he served us in the bar in the evening and then at breakfast the next morning! Overall a fantastic stay - I have stayed at many hotels and would rate it one of the best; my wife said it was definitely the best hotel she had ever stayed at and we would certainly be back if/when we are ever in Rome again. The best rates we could find were on the hotels own website (where they have special offers) and booking there also meant a virtually instant personal confirmation. For customer care and value for money I think the Napolean would be very, very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Wins the Day”
Reviews.Author: ERaphael
Reviews.Content: Airport pickup & being greeted by the concierge was a nice touch. Truly, Franco (I believe was his name) makes up for some of the smaller things that might have been more troubling had the service not been so excellent. Both Franco and the other gentleman (older) were wonderful. Franco, in particular, seems to go out of his way to make guests feel welcome. I can't say enough about how wonderful the service was at this level! The younger concierge was mostly fine except he didn't bother with coffee and croissants for our early morning departure (we didn't ask for this service but were told the evening before that we would receive it). The morning we left, he was smoking outside the entrance doors. The smokey air then made its way up the stairwell and into the lounge. Slightly distasteful, in my opinion. I'm also not sure about his English, as we thought there was a slight discrepancy with our bill and never really felt that was resolved. In addition to that, when we asked if the cost of the transfer had been included on the bill, he had said yes. Except when we arrived at the airport with the driver demanded 50 euros. We didn't see the charge on the bill - though we couldn't make sense of it, as there was a dinner charge on there that shouldn't have been. That's our fault for not clearing it up before we left though. Incidentally, not a friendly driver. There's a language barrier, but friendliness crosses all languages. I don't need effusive gestures of good will and friendliness, but some basic courtesy wouldn't go amiss. The service overall was outstanding. The Friday evening wine tasting was really a nice touch. All of the other staff were cordial and went out of their way to be helpful. The housekeeping staff on our floor were also exceptionally nice. We did not love the location of the hotel. The surrounding neighborhood is not my favorite in Rome; however, you are only steps to the metro which will take you anywhere you want to go in Rome. It's also quite close to Termini. (You can decide for yourself whether that is a pro or a con...for me it is a con because they neighborhood is sort of dodgy.) Still, being steps from the metro was incredibly convenient and almost makes up for the other negative aspects of the location. There are several nice, little places closeby to eat...but you'll probably want to go farther afield for nicer dining experiences. Our room was very clean and well kept. Our view was out onto other buildings, but it was very quiet (the quietest hotel I've stayed at in Italy, in fact). But, as others have noted, the walls are thin...even to the point where you can hear words of conversations...television...people putting clothes on hangers. One time I woke up and asked if someone was in our closet...it was our neighbor in his own closet, but I could have sworn it was in our room. Despite this, I slept well at the hotel for the most part. External city noise, or construction have blighted all of my other stays in Italy...there was none of that here. I found the mattresses and pillows to be comfortable, too, and I'm picky. I was really comfortable in our room and outside of the occasional noisy neighbor within the hotel, I really liked our room. The lounges and the bar are very comfortable and nice. It's very convenient to be able to use the Internet in the lounge; however, if you don't bring your own computer, good luck. I had to check emails in the morning or daytime hours, as the computer was always occupied from early evening until quite late at night. I wouldn't call that a negative though, as it was just nice to be able to use the computer at all and I didn't have a problem accessing the Internet during "off" times when others were out sightseeing, etc. I'd say Napolean Hotel is a safe pick. The surrounding neighborhood leaves something to be desired, but you can quickly connect to anywhere in the city - or the rest of Europe - from this location. And, Franco and most of the other hotel staff are second to none in terms of hospitality...which will go a long way toward making your stay a happy, comfortable one! I would have given full marks for service had it not been for the issues with check out, etc. on the morning we left...unfortunately, that did put a slight damper on our overall impression of the hotel. Oh, we ate at the hotel twice. Once: pizza. Not good. Second time: at the restaurant. Very good fish & ravioli. Service was incredibly slow though. There was a very large party dining at the same time as us and we found the service to be rather inattentive as they were occupied with the large group. The discrepancy in our bill was that it showed three meals when we had only eaten two there. Again, our fault for not clearing it up before leaving. Overall, I would probably recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: WorkToTravel75
Reviews.Content: Mr. Cioce and his staff should be commended for their outstanding service. I particularly want to recognize Franco, Roland, Michele, Piero & Sarah for their services and advice on our stay in Rome. ALL of the staff whether we had contact with them or not made our stay memorable. We were a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum; Metro right in front of the hotel; hop off/on buses a few blocks away. Thanks to Virgin Vacations for setting it up!

Reviews.Title: “Todo fantastico -- it was all fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: UKTexas
Reviews.Content: I did not know Rome well at all - and could only go by reviews and information on the Internet. - and was fortunate enough to come across Hotel Nepolean. This was a family holiday and I needed 2 rooms. The price of the room,- great value, the location - perfect, the food - good and affordable. The staff made the stay extra special - as the service and attention we recieved was beyond my expectations (especially after just leaving Bangkok). Stefano was extremely helpful and patient and we hope to see him again as we will go back to this hotel. The rooms are acceptable and clean - but if you have rowdy kids - the walls are a little thin. My husband and I travel extensively on business and pleasure and we definately recommend this hotel for convenience and value - and the extreme pleasure of the hospitality you will recieve as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “DEDICATED SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: kalekr
Reviews.Content: To a first time visitor traveling on his/her own, Rome can be overwhelming. The first place to start in evaluating this hotel is the concierge service... each person at the concierge desk was most helpful but Franco Q. was superb; he was a "friend" as well as a "professional" who truly looked out for our well-being. He helped us with the Metro which is right outside the door of the hotel, booked a tour, a concert, had metro tickets, made a gallery reservation and advised us not to take a certain tour thus saving us $150. The room met our needs, good storage space for two people and the private bath was quite adequate. There were lovely areas to just sit and relax; there was a large screen TV in one of the lounge areas. It has a bar and light lunch menu plus a restaurante. The food was quite good with very friendly service; the prices were typical so we ate all of our meals at the hotel. The breakfast (included) was one of the best buffet breakfasts I've ever had traveling in Europe. One limitation was that there was only one computer; there should have been at least two. This hotel is family friendly and children inevitably want to use the computer. (I not sure two computers would solve the problem of computer access). Above all, this hotel's greatest feature is its personable staff... A+.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitsno9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned today from a 4 day break in Rome to celebrate our 30th anniversary. We decided on this hotel because of previous reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. As previously mentioned the hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly and were always on hand to assist whenever needed. On our anniversary we were kindly presented with complimentary flowers and wine, most unexpected and gratefully received (thank you very much). The room was very comfortable, clean and spacious. It was also quiet with no traffic noise (we had the windows open at night) but there was no view as you over look a courtyard. The Hotel has a lovely lounge area, where you can relax with a coffee. Breakfast is the usual continental fayre, buffet style. It was the same everyday but there was a lot of variety to choose from. The hotel restaurant was also very good. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to my friends and family. Some of the comments mention that the hotel is in a seedy area and not central. I have to admit that this nearly stopped us booking this hotel but in our experience, once we accepted that it seemed normal for young people to "hang around" in the streets chatting, we became more confident and traveled around at night on the streets and metro with no problems. Rome does have a problem with graffiti but it is everywhere not just around the hotel. There is a metro station just outside the entrance to the hotel and for 1 euro you can travel anywhere by metro or bus for 75mins or 24 hours for 4 euro. We also got the City Sight Seeing bus tour for 12 euros each and it lasted 48 hours. We therefore used this to hop on and off over 2 days to see all the sights. Obviously, there are numerous sights to see in Rome and all are not to be missed. However, just a couple of things we discovered, one was the baths (Terme di Caracalla), they are not central but are well worth a visit, my husband and I were quite astounded as to how big and well preserved they were - a pleasant surprise. Another surprise was the roof top view from the Vittoriano building we stumbled across this. It does cost 7 euros but some say it is a better and more central view of Rome than the view from the dome of St Peter's Basilica. For those with a problem with heights and walking up loads of steps (I am one of those and took a lot of persuasion) it isn't too scary, there is a lift right to the top and once I had recovered from the lift journey I felt quite comfortable looking at the view and walking around. Of course Rome like all European cities I would imagine is quite expensive at the moment due to the exchange rate of the pound, on average we spent 45 euro on a meal for two including drinks. I think that is it except that you must stop at every given opportunity for an ice cream to die for!

Reviews.Title: ““The Hotel Napoleon was an excellent choice for us.”
Reviews.Author: vacationers000
Reviews.Content: “The Hotel Napoleon was an excellent choice for us. The metro is right outside the door. We were able to walk to the coliseum and restaurants and easily managed to travel on the bus or metro to all parts of the city. The hotel staff was extremely accommodating. Travel from the airport to the hotel was part of our package and a wonderful plus, we wouldn’t have been able to manage our luggage and tired selves from the airport thru the trains and mass transit. They also arrange our travel back to the airport with great efficiency and made everything very easy. The breakfast buffet was very good and had a variety of foods to choice from. The room was larger than I was expecting for a European hotel; comfortable, nice bathroom facility, plenty of closet space for our luggage, etc. We found the hotel to be a great value and would recommend this hotel to friends and family. Thank you to the staff at the Napoleon! Hope to see you again!!”

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ,wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: bt511
Reviews.Content: great hotel,we stayed here monday to friday,so missed out on the wine tasting etc.We got a room change with just a requestThe staff here are very friendly and ever helpful. Sara does not speak 101 languages,but her presence really lights up the place where ever you meet her .We took the train into Rome ,but the taxi on the return journey,and for a few euros more I would reccommend doing both trips by taxi,if you can.We got good value for the hoho rome bus at the station tourist office,a good way to see the city over two days.Thank you to Franco and his staff.If I should be fortunate to go back to Rome the Hotel Napoleon would be my choice .

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review - Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Pynewacket
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to have some good and bad points. Therefore I rate this hotel as average... First the good points... A reasonably priced hotel. I really enjoyed the wine tasting they host on Friday afternoon. The hotel owner/general manager was charming and it the type of welcoming atmosphere you would expect from a family run hotel. The breakfast was great, lovely waitstaff and wonderful selection (fruits, cereals, pastries, meats and cheeses, all types of coffees... etc.). Some other good points... Hotel had charming lobby with convenient/quaint hotel bar with friendly barstaff, selection of international newspapers, a small charming park/square across the street, convenient subway station right outside, and the desk staff/concierge can be charming and helpful but this depends on who you approach and what you are asking for (they are especially helpful for sightseeing information). Now the bad points... "NO" seems to be the hotel's favorite word. This is a no frills hotel. It has no view, no courtyard, and no extras from what I already mentioned. Also, don't expect any of your requests to be heard. We were there for 4 nights/5 days and we were put in what I think was the worse room in the hotel - 1st floor, dark, corner room, next to a utility room, window view of a brick wall, and NOISY (you could hear everything from our room - hotel staff, people in the hallway, people from the building next door.. etc.). When asked if we could move to a different room - we were told NO and that was all they had available (which I knew to be untrue). The room had no light and the air was stagnant which was made worse by the air con/ventilation not working - when we asked if they could do something about fixing it we were once again told "No". I would think that if you had guests paying for 4 nights, you would want to keep them satisfied but this just was not our experience. Also, take my advice and don't ask the front desk for restaurant suggestions. We were referred to an overpriced restaurant that served the worse Italian food I have ever tasted. During our stay, we actually found a much more elegant , family-owned restaurant with excellent food that actually cost 20% less than the one we were sent to - so you are better off finding a restaurant on your own. The only other bad points that I have to add is that although the hotel interior is charming it needs to be refreshed - its showing some wear and tear and it can be a walk to the major sites (I prefer to be in the heart of it). I loved Italy and plan on returning for another visit - Unfortunately I don't think we will be staying back at the Napoleon. Only because I am willing to pay more to get the extras I expect from a hotel - a spectacular room with a view, a courtyard or roof terrace, in the heart of major sites... etc. But I would suggest this hotel for people who want clean, charming hotel and some nice added extras without breaking the bank. I guess it all comes down to what you can live with...

Reviews.Title: “A birthday gift to myself - one of the best of my lifetime”
Reviews.Author: RNSANE
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Napoleon, a 64th birthday celebration at the start of a 12-day Mediterranean cruise, was exceptional. The personal touches were amazing and are the reason I am returning to celebrate my birthday this year. After a LONG flight from CA, we were picked up at the airport and allowed an early check in. A beautiful bouquet of flowers welcomed us to our lovely room and we immediately opened the chilled champagne that was waiting. On Friday evening, there was a delightful wine tasting in the bar area, attended by the hotel management - who made us feel like guests in their own home. That's how it felt thoughout our stay...like we were family. Our concierge, Franco, was probably the most excellent I have meant in over half a century of travel. Roberto Cioce, the manager, and Domenico Nelli, the assistant manager, were most pleasant and helpful and their management syle was reflected in all the staff. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the breakfasts very ample and the staff attentive. We had one dinner in the restaurant and that was excellent. The hotel made arrangements for airport transfers and also transfers to and from the cruise port at Civetivecchia. Let me be clear, this is not a big hotel like a Hyatt or Hilton but if you are looking for a charming property with old world hospitality, the Hotel Napoleon is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: CMS4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were with my 10 year old and 22 year old children visiting Rome for the weekend. The Napoleon is clean, well staffed and managed, and in a good location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality in Rome Italy!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dladomirak
Reviews.Content: Much love and thanks to all of the people at this amazing lovely little Hotel. I feel like I have a family in Rome waiting for me when I return to The Napoleon. Thank you Franco, Roberto, Claudio and darling Simion. And of course the other wonderful staff members who made our stay there delightful!!! You treated us like "Royalty". We loved the location, the food ,the rooms, ect.. My sisters and I had a fantastic time and we are planning on returning this time with husbands and kids!!!! Again thank you and see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Lizbeth123
Reviews.Content: All the reviews were extremely helpful in my decision to book this hotel. The staff was excellent. Franco was so very helpful with all our questions about what to do in Rome. Sarah was excellent in attending our needs at the bar and breakfast. All staff were very attentive to our needs. Made you feel at home. The location is excellent. 10 steps to the metro entrance. Which we used alot. Hotel offers a wonderful map. Use it. Rooms were nice, very clean and very quiet. Pillows hard. Should of asked for feather ones. You can. The sitting area for drinks is fantastic. Large comfy chairs. Just what you need at the end of the day. Breakfast was excellent with a very large selection including hot choices. We used the hotel transportation. Very convenient. Hotel had free WiFi. I booked directly from their website and got a fantastic deal. The only negative would be the dinner we had. Dinner food was just ok could have been our choices. Service was great. I will diffently saty again. Have Franco direct you to the Best Gelato in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsLFC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location as the Metro - the main way to get around Rome - is right on its doorstep. Literally. 15 mins walk from the Colosseum was fantastic and it meant many sights were within walking distance or accessible from the metro. The staff were great - looked after our key whenever we went out, provided us with a map of Rome & the main sights to see. We went for 5 nights - Thurs to Tues & on the Fri the hotel held a small wine-tasting night with salamis, cheese, chorizo & other small bites. There were always snacks on the bar which helped fill that gap before going out for food & they were always helpful & accommodating, fixing a light-bulb immediately once reported. The rooms were clean, a little small but no problem. The rooms were also quiet except ours was right next to the service lift so was occasionally woken earlier than would have liked! The bed & pillows were very firm, too firm for me I would normally say but after each full day's sight-seeing it was not a problem! The only bad thing I would say about the hotel is that the restaurant has rubbish food (we ate there the first night), although they did provide us with complimentary desert wine & biscotti - delicious! Buffet breakfast fine & usual stuff you get in Europe. Water not hot enough for tea though! Relatively close to the hotel are 2 places we ate twice - Hostaria Isidoro and Trattoria Luzzi, both off Via dei San Giovanni which leads to the colosseum. Hostaria Isisoro: Recommended in a travel guide this place was cosy and for some, romantic. The service was great and the food delicious. Price-wise cheap to medium, depending on the courses. Local wine here also good. Heading in direction of colosseum from hotel, take first left off Via Labicana (by San Clemente - go there it's well worth the 3 euros to see the underground churches too!), turn left and a few yards up on the left. Trattoria Luzzi: Stumbled across this on a corner off Via dei San Giovanni. Turn left off Via Labicana by San Clemente, turn right onto San Giovanni & look out for the green trattoria/ pizzeria sign on a corner of a side street on the left. Gets very busy and some queing but full of locals & tourists alike, good home cooking. Great wood burning ovened pizza & pasta. Cheap as chips this place. Not so great on service - one night perfect but another 20mins between my dish & my husbands but the food was freshly made (including the pasta), and the atmosphere & price was well worth it! Note - no pizza at lunchtimes! Travel to the hotel - from Fiumicino airport get Leonardo Express 12 euros nonstop to Termin, Line A metro 1 stop to Vittorio Emanuale. Watch out, long walk on walk-escalators underground from termini train station to termini metro. We got 7-day metro from a machine for about 16 euros so did not need to queue for any biglietti (tickets) and could get on & off as many times/stops as we liked. You can do similar 3 day etc. Other advice - watch out for flower sellers in the main tourist traps, they try to give you a rose as a gift, then say have some more etc, they sometimes leave you alone so you think it is a gift then they follow you to ask for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Ray-Eire
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel which met all expectations; we book a superior double directly from the Website ([--]) which had the best prices available. Now this is not a 4 star hotel and the rooms are slightly dated but are clean comfortable and if you need anything just ask, they’ll bend over backwards to accommodate you. The hotel is well located about a 10 Minute walk or one stop by the Metro from the Termini (Central Rail station) which has train’s to and from the Airport every 30 to 40 minutes. I would suggest arranging a pick up and drop off to and from the airport with the hotel, it’s only €40 per trip and it means no hassle or worries with transfers. It’s only a 10 minute walk to the Coliseum and 15 to 20 to any where else. I would suggest getting a map at the front desk and just walk the city. The hotel staff are great, really nice and friendly, Sarah in the bar speaks about 101 languages and is so nice the Head Concierge: Franco Quirinis has all the answers just ask him anything and he’ll sort it out. Couldn’t have asked for more but just to remember don’t expect the Ritz it’s a hotel in the centre of one of the oldest cities in Europe so it’s not going to be a brand new building and this is the cases for nearly all the city centre hotels. For Value for money you won’t go wrong. Thanks to all at the Napoleon for being part of a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, welcoming family-run hotel - one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Denise_and_DavidUk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Rome staying at the Hotel Napolean in Piazza Vittorio Emanuele. My choice of this hotel was based almost entirely on reading previous reviews on Tripadvisor. I have only praise to add! In fact we met one person there on their third trip to this hotel. We had a fantastic trip to a fantastic city in a fantastic hotel. Location – right next to the Metro and within walking distance of the Colloseum – ideal. The area is a little run down but we never felt unsafe. Staff –couldn’t do enough for us from checking in to checking out. Both consierge had a magical talent with a highlighter and a map of Rome. Get your Metro day tickets from them and save the hassle of a queue. Everyone had a smile on their face, and the one time we returned to our room and found no towels gave them the opportunity to demonstrate how fast their service was. Room – we stayed in a superior double. It was large, well appointed, clean,warm and the bed was large and comfortable. Slippers and dressing gowns were a welcome part of the package. Public rooms – lovely huge armchairs and a drink from the bar were just right after a long day walking up and down all those marble steps! Restaurant and Light service – Light meals available all day with a separate evening A La Carte restaurant. The food was delightful, well cooked, well presented and competitively priced. We spoke to people at the airport on our way home that had really been caught out by tourist trap eating. We ate fillet steaks for £15 and wine by the bottle at £14. We really enjoyed the friday night cocktail event, meeting Roberto and his team. There were nice wines and food and an opportunity to talk to other visitors Tips for Rome visitors 1 – The Leonardo Express from Fumicino airport costs 11€ each BUT you MUST validate these tickets in yellow machines on the platform. We didn’t and the guard fined us 25€ each – welcome to Rome – hubby was not happy and we were not the only ones in the carriage to be fined. 2 – Don’t eat anywhere unless the price is printed on the menu. We stopped for a beer and a coffee not far from the Spanish Steps – it cost us 18€ (beer 13€ and small coffee 5€) 3 – Guides bother you all the time touting for business. It annoys me; they mainly promise you can beat the queues. We signed up with one outside the Colloseum. The guide didn’t arrive for 15mins and the queue had gone – although saying that she had interesting things to say – my advice is just be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service with a personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: Annette_8
Reviews.Content: After much research and emailing we finally decided on the Napoleon. My concern generally was about the area because off some general comments on trip advisor forums. However after many emails to Roberto I knew we should stay there. Robertos responses were always very prompt and detailed and you got the feeling that they genuinely wanted you to stay. We arrived and there were beautiful fresh flowers in our room and feather pillows awaiting us. The gentlemen on the front dest were unbelieveably helpful and always went out of there way with suggestions and directions with not only us, but other guests that were staying. This is so important when you are a stranger to the country and dont speak the language. The Friday night cocktail event was also a lovely touch with nice wines and food offering and an opportunity to talk to other visitors . It was also a nice change to have free internet access and also a very generous buffet breakfast. My daughter and I walked back to the hotel from the Spanish Steps on Saturday night at around 8pm and while there were not that many people about the area we felt totally safe, so the general feel of the area was not a concern at all. I was also able to negotiate a vey good deal with Roberto rather than go through the various agents. So thank you to Roberto and his wonderful staff that made our flying visit to Rome such a success and we would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: spooh29
Reviews.Content: Having read all - yes ALL - of the reviews on here, we felt confident that the Napoleon was the right choice and we weren't disappointed. It had quite a plush feel to it but was very comfortable and welcoming. The staff were all very friendly, more so the bar & restaurant staff. Although the concierge and reception staff were polite enough, they weren't as friendly as some others have mentioned on here. The room was nice - big by European standards. Would be tempted to upgrade to a superior room and would definitely request a bath next time - we did a lot of walking and could have benefited from a good soak! Breakfast was brilliant.
