Husband is really fussy but was delighted at the choice. We attended the welcome session on the Friday night which was nice. The metro was so handy and we used it to head up Trevi Foundation, Spanish Steps direction. The rest of the time we just walked down towards to the Coliseum end of Rome and often wandered up to Pantheon or Piazza Navona area for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money. Delivered everything they promised.”
Reviews.Author: gingerice
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night say at this hotel. I took MONTHS to decide on a hotel. I spent lots of time on this site reading reviews. This hotel provided me what I needed - Free Breakfast, Free Wi-Fi and close to the metro. We took the Express train from the Airport, and then took the metro one stop down to the Hotel Napoleon. The metro is right outside the door. Room was a little larger than expected, and the TV had more channels in English than expected. Bathroom was smaller, but I had a tub to soak my feet. I was happy. I don't really believe this is a tourist type neighborhood, but we felt safe. We ate dinner in the neighborhood one night, in the hotel one night and in other areas the other nights. The prices in the restaurant, bar and for room service were very resonable. We had to leave to catch our flight before breakfast opened on monday, and the hotel opened the breakfast room early for us. Breakfast was the typical European breakfast and included Bacon and hot eggs. The Friday night "meet the manager" reception was nice with free wine and snacks. This is a TRUE family run hotel. The manager was glad to have our business. I caution the North American readers to remember that this is NOT a hotel in the United States. It might not seem as nice as your typical chain hotel, but it's a great find for a hotel in Italy. I can't even begin to to tell you how happy we were with the customer service. The walls are a little thin, and you can hear some of the action around you and above you. Wi-Fi was free, and the signal was great. It was really fast. This is a great find for a tourist wishing to hit all the sites and stay in a convenient area. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “helpful friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: fishtank5
Reviews.Content: Just back from long weekend (27th Feb to 2nd Mar) in Rome. Hotel Napoleon is in a good location close to many tourist attractions and with the added bonus of having a metro stop outside the front door. Every staff member i met were helpful and friendly. The twin room that i stayed in was clean and comfortable and a good size. it had plenty of character with a few old pieces of really beautiful furniture. The lobby area is a good size with big comfy couches. The buffet breakfast had a great selection every morning. Overall its a great base to explore Rome and very good value if booked thru the hotels own website.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie Mille!”
Reviews.Author: mogs138
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on a recommendation from a friend & after checking it out on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. We were collected from the airport on arrival and brought to the hotel where we were welcomed with a bottle of Procesco from the manager to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary! We went down to the bar for the Friday night get-together with the manager & met 2 lovely couples in the bar and then the manager Roberto Cioce came over to speak with us. We had a great chat about the weekend's rugby games & had 5 of the 6 nations represented (Irish, Welsh, French, English & of course Italian!) for a toast to a good weekend! It was a lovely welcome to the hotel & started off our long weekend on a perfect note. The breakfast was plentiful, with a good selection & the staff were all friendly & efficient without being intrusive. The location of the hotel was perfect with the metro station right outside the door. It's about a 10-15min walk to the colesseum, 5 mins to the Termini & the metro line goes straight to the Vatican - which is the only place we used it for as we walked everywhere else. The room & bathroom were spotlessly clean. We would stay here again with no hesitation & would like to extend our thanks to the very welcoming manager Roberto Cioce, the ever helpful Roberto Lombari on the concierge desk & to all the staff we met. Grazie Mille!

Reviews.Title: “Great place near the Coloseum!”
Reviews.Author: sussalito
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Napoleon for 3 weeks last June. I went out to Rome to visit my sister who was attending the American University of Rome and took a lot of time reading reviews and checking out mulitiple hotels before I picked Napoleon thanks to trip advisor. The hotel is nice and on a quiet strip. The rooms are average for Italy and are clean. The hotel staff is very pleasant and helpful. I had arranaged for a driver to pick me up at the airport and even though a tour was not part of the pick up service the driver happily showed me around some of the sights as well as gave me some pointers on some Italian vocabulary. I had arranged for a twin room for my first two weeks of stay and then an upgrade the third week when my mother came out. At check in the manager upgraded my room from the start at no extra charge so that I would not have to change rooms mid stay. Over the three weeks I got to know the staff at the hotel pretty well and each was always pleasant. They were very helpful in a stressful situation in which I had to take my sister to the local hospital (they made sure to speak with the Taxi driver when he arrived to translate). The hotel does have free wifi from your room but make sure to get a password from the front desk, and the rooms have air conditioning. They also have a complimentary breakfast each morning with a decent selection. I also found it very helpful that the rooms have a safe and when you went out for the day you could leave your room key at the front desk. They hotel is walking distance from the Coloseum as long as you dont mind walking up hill to get back to the hotel. For the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps it is best to take the bus or a Taxi. You can get to each by walking but it is a rather long walk. I enjoyed my staff at Napoleon and will most likely be visiting Italy again next June. I plan on staying at Napoleon once again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay in this friendly hotel with helpful staff and great food”
Reviews.Author: Oobertom
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Napoleon for 4 nights whilst we explored Rome. We had a great time. I cannot speak highly enough about the staff, from the moment we arrived they did everything possible to make our stay perfect. The hotel was brilliantly located, we walked to the Colloseum in less than ten minutes and visited all the major tourist attractions, barring the Vatican, by foot. There is a Metro station literally opposite the hotel so even when we did opt for public transport it was not any hassle to find. We ate in the hotel restaurant twice during our stay and both times the food was excellent. The bar lounge area is extremely roomy with big comfy arm chairs set in small groups. The room itself was very clean with a nice big bed, minibar and tv. It was nicely decorated and had everything we needed. The bathroom had everything you'd expect. The was the occasional noise from outside the room as other reviewers have stated but nothing that disturbed us at all. Overall I cannot find any area to criticise this hotel. The staff made us feel like royalty from start to finish and I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and relatives. If I visited Rome again I would certainly stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a family-owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: JidThorax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week here on our first visit to Rome. We selected it on the basis of the very favorable reviews the hotel has received on TripAdvisor, but I was somewhat puzzled by the absence of reviews in most travel books. I'm still not sure why it's not written up more, but I think that the positive reviews it gets here are very well deserved. The Napoleon is a family-run hotel, and while that in itself doesn't guarantee particularly good service, the owners and staff clearly do care very much about their guests. Everyone was extremely attentive, and the owners demonstrated their concern by sending e-mails both before and after our stay, and by hosting a very nice wine-and-cheese event in the bar (which I understand they do every week). We only ate in the hotel restaurant once, but the food was well-prepared and moderately priced. We found the breakfast buffet to be just right, providing more than enough choice for us without being excessive (and thereby raising the room rates). This being a mid-range hotel in an older building--are there any buildings in central Rome less than 75 years old?--the rooms may not be up to Hilton standards. They are clean, and the bathrooms are quite modern, but they are not as sound-proofed as they might be, and the standard rooms are really quite small. The common areas are surprisingly spacious and well-appointed, although the (retrofitted?) elevators/lifts are tiny. Taking everything into account, the Napoleon probably rates about a 4.5 out of 5, rather than 5 out of 5. Rated strictly on appearances and physical attributes, it may not even reach 4 out of 5, but the care and concern demonstrated by the management and staff push my rating right up to 5. I highly recommend the Hotel Napoleon. Here are a few tips that could be useful in planning a stay at the Napoleon: - Book through the hotel website directly, rather than Expedia, Hotels.com, etc. We got a much better deal this way: www.napoleon.it; - Splurge and go for the Superior room. Whether or not it's worth it is naturally subjective, but I recommend it; - If you arrive in Rome from Fiumicino, you can take the train to Termini station and the Metro to the door of the hotel for a total of €12. but DON'T consider it unless you're able to negotiate a couple flights of steps in the Metro; - You really can walk to most of the key places in Rome from the hotel, but you'll probably wear yourself out doing it. If you don't want to use taxis, buy a bus map from a newstand, since the Roman bus system is totally inscrutable to the newcomer. Yet the Metro is somewhat limited in its destinations. Moreover, while reasonably safe, it's insanely crowded most of the time. Both the buses and Metro are €1 a trip, or €4 a day, which is very economical, but the buses are the better bet. Several useful lines stop at Santa Maria Maggiore, two or three blocks from the hotel; - The entire staff deserve generous tips--really--but DON'T wait until you check out, thinking that you'll add a tip to your final bill. For some reason, the hotel has no way to handle this, full stop. So if you don't want to leave feeling like you've stiffed all those helpful people, you'll have to tip as you go.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: Ksam007
Reviews.Content: When I say diamond in the rough I mean that I would consider the area in which this hotel is based (reasonably close to the train station) to be less than salubrious but the location (in terms of being central and having access to all areas) was great, I wouldnt have any issues walking in the area at any hour and the hotel had a great attitude towards customer service. I have travelled a fair bit in my day and I dont get upset when say a shower curtain fails down or the water isnt quite hot enough, etc. What I do value is a good customer focused service and this hotel has it right. Very helpful staff (particularly the guys on the desk - for giving directions, advise, arranging dinners, etc). We were invited to a wine tasting session in the bar on the Friday night which was good fun. The manager was there and made a point of talking to everyone (genuinely and having a laugh). I got the impression from him and his staff that there is enormous pride in the place and the service they provide. We were over for an international rugby match and were all invited back for a drink in the hotel the following evening after the game (the first round on the management, the second aswell if Italy won - that case of drink was safe). Rooms were comfortable (maybe a bit on the small side but clean and adequate). We had anything we needed and the location give us a great start getting to the sights each morning. The food (breakfast and we had dinner there one evening) was good and the bar area and lounge was a nice place to relax if you had a tiring day. I thanked the concierge for all his help when leaving and was happy to have the feedback and asked that if I was happy with the place perhaps I would write a review for them (as they hold tripadvisor influence in high regard and keep an eye on it themselves). I have never left a review for anywhere before (despite having travelled through a fair bit of Europe, a lot of asia, america, australia, africa, etc) but then I've never been asked before. The very fact that I was asked to me was an indication of the pride, enthusiasm and motivation that the staff here had for betterment, feedback and future business. I'd go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff BUT - we felt they tried to cheat us.”
Reviews.Author: Highastan
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and staff BUT - we felt they tried to cheat us. In October 2008 we booked 2 superior rooms for 5 nights in February 2009. We chose this hotel because the Hotel web site said the extra large superior rooms had lounge and sleeping areas seperated by a curtain. This was ideal as our husbands like to sleep late and we like to get up early without disturbing them. When we arrived the rooms were smaller than expected and had no seperated areas. As we'd booked such a long time ago we thought maybe we'd made a mistake and at the earliest opportunity checked the web site to find we were correct and the rooms were of a lower standard than expected. The sunny courtyard views were non existent, ours was of a huge ugly fire escape. We asked the front desk about the room and he didn't seem suprised and told us to speak to the concierge the next morning which we did. He first told us the rooms were superior but then admitted they were standard and agreed that we would be charged the standard rate only, a difference of 15 Euros a night. He was abrupt and offered no apology or explanation. We would have preferred to pay the full rate and have the correct room but we are fairly laid back people and decided not to let it spoil our holiday. When we paid our bill at the end the Manager/Owner was on the desk and said we shouldn't have the discount because the rooms were superior. He then saw our bill had already been adjusted and so we paid the agreed discounted rate. He was rude when we asked to see the calculations and said it wasn't complicated although he had to use a calculator himself to check it. He insulted our intelligence and what annoyed us what that if we hadn't said anything they would have charged us the full rate anyway so we felt they were prepared to cheat guests rather than admit they'd made a mistake on our booking. In all other respects the Hotel is lovely, one of the few to have a lounge, bar and restaurant with room service too. The employees were polite and friendly and made us feel very welcome, and the rooms were always beautifully cleaned each day. We asked for feather pillows and they were provided immediately. All the room have wireless internet and there was a huge choice of breakfast dishes. If we didn't feel so distrustful of the owners we would stay here every time but after our experience we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - very central”
Reviews.Author: BrianSOSullivan
Reviews.Content: My fiancee Mary and I stayed in this hitel for 5 days. This hotel is in a very central location. There is a metro from right outside the front door. We arrived in to Ciampino airport and got a bust to anangnina the first stop on the metro line a. The bus only cost 1.20. when we got to Anaganina we got on the metro and got off at the vittoria Emannualle stop, when you exit for Machiavelli St you will see the hotel on the left hand side. All the hotel staff were very nice and were very helpful. The room was small enough and the bathroom didnt have a bath. We had an enjoyable stay in this hotel. It is only about a ten minute walk to the coloseeum. It is also close to Santa Maggiore. There are a few irish bars near by, the fiddlers elbow is probably the best. The food in the restaurant was always nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikTbilisi
Reviews.Content: We have spent 10 fantastic days in Napoleon Hotel. Hotel is located at the heart of the Rome. All major historic monuments are only several minutes of walking time. Fantastic service, enthusiastic staff (especially concierge service) and price is also very affordable. Definitely we would recommend this hotel to everyone who visits Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon - an exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: CESDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Napoleon in Rome for a week from 13 January. It was our fifth visit to Rome and by far our best. We found the staff exceptional; they were courteous, friendly and extremely helpful. When we mentioned a minor problem with our room and it was not possible to fix it we were immediately invited to change rooms which we did. We enjoyed the peace and quiet at night and were never disturbed by the sound of traffic. The Hotel Restaurant was excellent; the food was good, well presented, professionally served and competitively priced. The light meals in the Bar were of equal standard and having this facility in the Hotel meant that it was not necessary to go out in the evening except when we really wanted to do so and then we went to a good local restaurant recommended by the concierge. We are so pleased to have found a Hotel in Rome which we can recommend without hesitation and to which we will certainly return. C&ES, Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: dcccork
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights in this hotel. Most of the staff were ok especially the bar and dining room staff, but this fantastic concierge some people have mentioned must have been on holidays. We always felt as if we had interupted something important. The room are tired and don't have tea/coffee making facilities (a first for me in all my travels). however if you are looking for rock hard pillows and beds you are in for a real treat. If your stay includes a Friday night you will get a very nice invitation to sample Italian wine and food and "mingle" with the management in the bar. Perhaps the word mingle comes from the Latin word mingalatus (to ignore). I heard lots people remark how rude it was to be ignored by the management and i'm sure it did much more harm than good. The management either have to work on this or give it up. The hotel is not in a very good part of the city for walking at night, plenty of people hanging around on corners and graffiti everywhere, having said that ,its ok because there is very little to do locally anyway. Good points ........ it is close to the metro. If you want an average hotel with an average staff , close to a metro and you are not fussy about the rooms or the area, then this will do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DNP2112
Reviews.Content: I booked with Hotel Napoleon through Gate 1 Travel after reviewing many hotels they suggested. The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating or nice. They were available whenever we needed help or suggestions. Our room was kept very clean, comfortable and was appointed with everything we needed, especially high speed internet. The breakfast provided each morning had an adequate selection of hot and cold breakfast foods, including espressos, cappuccinos and lattes. We especially enjoyed the salon and lounge area in the late afternoon. The location of the hotel seemed a little seedy at first, however, my husband and I felt comfortable walking around and through the neighborhood at night. The hotel's location is a lovely 20 minute walk to the Coloseum and Forum. It is also very convenient to the A line of the metro, which we used almost everyday. If you are considering a hotel, I would strongly suggest you consider this hotel. It is a very nice hotel in a colorful neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MerseyCouple
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a fantastic stay in Rome just before Christmas celebrating my wifes birthday. This is a lovely hotel in an excellent central location. I cannot say enough about the staff who are all extremely friendly and helpful and did everything to ensure we had a memorable stay. The food is excellent and we really enjoyed our wine tasting evening in the hotel bar! We found the hotel to have a very relaxing atmosphere which is just what is required after a day shopping and sight seeing. Another real plus is how quiet it is in the hotel you will not think for one minute you are in such a bustling city. The only negative comment we would have is not about the hotel but regarding the awful amount of graffiti Rome suffers from. The authorities need to get a grip of the idiots who are doing their best to spoil a beautiful city.Thanks to all at the Napoleon and we hope to see you again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NaplesPaul
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from Train Station and central to all the major sights. Hotel staff were extremely efficient and friendly whilst the hotel itself is tastefully decorated with a peaceful atmosphere. My wife and I intend to return soon. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Conciege in the Business”
Reviews.Author: tcgoesch
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napoleon is a great place to stay and tour Rome's many sites. The subway station entrance is located directly in front of the hotel. The rooms are well maintained and of adequate size to be comfortable. A great breakfast buffet is provided each morning. The hotel has a small bar and restaurant that provide great value meals and a place to relax after a long day of sightseeing. The best part of the Napoleon is the staff, especially concierge Roberto Lombardi. He could not do enough for us. He made great local restaurant picks for us.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific hotel, unbelievable staff!”
Reviews.Author: JLove2512
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon is one of those hotels that cannot be overrated. No matter what you think you might experience when booking this hotel, you'll be impressed. I stayed in this hotel with my daughter for her graduation present and it was absolutely amazing. From the welcome drinks, roses in the room to the spacious room, awesome breakfast and lovely staff, we couldnt have asked for more. The price was WELL WORTH IT and this is the best way to spend a vacation in Rome. One of the, if not THE, most amazing hotel we stayed in. The service here was the best of any hotel we stayed in. So friendly. Restaurant was amazing and the location was unbeatable. very close to vatican city too.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OHaras4
Reviews.Content: All the staff at the hotel made our stay in Rome thoroughly enjoyable. Travelling alone with my son, I felt safe and comfortable at all times. The hotel is full of art work and the decor was very welcoming. This hotel is very professionally run, but you also get the added benefits of it being a family owned hotel. Kabir and his staff inthe kitchen bent over backwards to accommodate my food allergies (gluten). The food was excellent - breakfast was the best we had in Europe. They even made sure we had a breakfast bag to take with us on our 4.30am check out! And when they say that you have access to wireless internet in your room - you actually do! All the conceierge were extremely helpful and gave great directions and tips to enable you to enjoy sightseeing. I would highly recommend this hotel (and have)!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome stay here”
Reviews.Author: Juzpudz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location within walking distance to the colseum. The underground rail network is located directly outside the hotel and provides excellent access to all major attractions in Rome. All of the staff made us feel welcome and right at home and were extremely helpful. For example, they confirmed our tour bookings for us as we cannot speak Italian. We liked how we saw the same familiar, friendly faces everyday. The room was spacious and well maintained, making our stay in this hotel a very comfortable and enjoyable one. This was our first visit to Rome and this hotel and the staff helped to ensure our trip was filled with many great memories. They left us with a very good impression and we would definately stay in this hotel again. A very special thank you to all of the staff at the Hotel Napleon - you truly made our stay in Rome a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon was great!”
Reviews.Author: Go_USC
Reviews.Content: Our family of 10 consisted of 5 adults, one 75, and 5 children from 5 to14 years, and we booked 4 rooms close together. The rooms were spacious, well decorated, quiet, and beds were comfortable. All the staff were so accommodating, helpful and gracious. We arrived via Alitalia about noon from California. Interests lie in getting settled, a brief walk around the area, an early dinner and an early bedtime to be ready for our private tours the next day to the Vatican. The dining room was not open that early, but they quickly made a table for us in the bar and served us dinner - which was great. Breakfasts were wonderful as well and something for every picky appetite in a lovely setting. A review I had read about the Hotel prior to booking was based on these attributes and it more than lived up to them and then some. From the front desk to the room they were there to meet our every need in the most pleasant manner. Heartily recommend this hotel and would book there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous italian charm.. loved it”
Reviews.Author: blueadriver
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews, having been to rome before, (we ended up in a rather small hotel previously,) but this time we took our 10 year old. Hotel was fab, the staff so friendly, from booking in to leaving, it was my husbands birthday the day we arrived and after going out for a wander, came back to a bottle of proscecco chilling in our room with compliments of the management... very thoughtful, food at the hotel good really reasonable in price, mini bar cheap for a hotel. in all a really good price. The friday evening party is cheese and wine and italian nibbles and was really good, the owner / manager gives a little speech welcoming everyone to his hotel and as a wow factor ... makes his own olive oil it tastes amazing. Its the little touches with the napeleon that makes the difference, i would def stay there next time in rome. The area is really good for resturants, ignore what some people say about the termini area, its cheap and safe, we walked around with a child... no problems, to be honest felt more stressed at the spanish steps with the hawkers trying to flog their tat. Great place to eat is called condor, real family feel very italian, and at the end of the day thats what you go to rome for. If you want to feel "at home" eat and drink at the tourist spots .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Travelers52
Reviews.Content: Hooray to all those positive reviews we saw on Trip Advisor! Once again they were right. Our 5 night stay in this hotel was terrific! The staff was friendly and cheerful - especially the front desk staff - so very helpful with questions. They picked us up at the airport at 7 am and while we ate breakfast, our bags were brought up to the room. The soup we had in the bar/restaurant late one night for dinner was the best vegetable soup we have ever eaten! We had one of the bigger rooms in the hotel and it was more than enough room for 2 people and could easily accomodate a family of 4. They were clean however the bed was a bit too firm for my wife. The location was the best and with the metro just steps from the front door, you could go anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great helpful staff, good food”
Reviews.Author: wilman1
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Expedia. When we arrived at the hotel, was somewhat disappointed. It was late afternoon, and there are shops in the four buildings surrounding a park across from the hotel. There is alot a graffiti in Rome, which we noticed on the steel gates on the stores which were mostly closed. The next morning I went outside and found the area to be better than what I originally thought. The rooms were small and clean. They looked more luxurious on the Expedia website. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They actually opened for breakfast fifteen minutes earlier than scheduled since we had a tour operator pick us up early in the morning. The food at the hotel was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Fownes
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for week in Rome to celebrate my wife’s birthday purely on the basis that my late Father was a great expert on Napoleon. The choice proved more than happy. As one who spent many years travelling, I cannot speak too highly of the Hotel Napoleon and in particular of its staff. One really does feel that nothing is too much trouble for them. Part of the deal was for a car to meet us at the airport, which takes much of the anxiety out of arrival. All the staff greet one with a smile whenever they pass and - strangely affecting in this mechanical age - the concierge effortlessly calls one by name as one leaves and collects one’s key. The Hotel Napoleon is not part of an impersonal chain; it's a single hotel, owned and run by a family and it feels like it. There is no hint of standard furnishings or fittings or decorations. The staff are not shipped in and out from central casting. In each lift there is a pictorial staff list showing each member from the director to the porters, which suggests a happy ship with a low staff turnover. There is none of the condescension that often haunts the service offered by the grander hotels. The public rooms are spacious and welcoming and beautifully furnished. The bedrooms, I guess, are all individually furnished in domestic style. Ours had, amongst other things, a writing desk with a folding top and a three door free-standing wardrobe. The television was adequate and polyglot (if you are seriously watching TV in Rome, something is wrong somewhere). The breakfast buffet was extensive and catered for all tastes, mine included. As for value, well, nothing is worth the money, but this is close to it. I came away from Rome a happier if poorer man without the slightest complaint and looking forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Precious Wedding Memories.”
Reviews.Author: ShellyRIreland
Reviews.Content: Precious Wedding Memories Would I recommend this hotel – Absolutely! Did you receive excellent service – The Service is unbeatable. Would I recommend this Hotel for A Wedding – We got supreme service! Will I stay at the Napoleon Hotel again- We are currently planning our return. Is this the Best Hotel you have ever stayed in – Yes, without a doubt, and here’s why We got married in Rome on Sept 01st 2008, and thanks to the kindness & service we received from the Management & Staff at The Napoleon Hotel it was the Best time of our lives. The Napoleon Hotel became a “Home from Home” for us our family & friends. Our 34 guests all stayed at this hotel to celebrate our Special Day. The Hotel took care of our every need. Everything was organised for us, from the moment that we arrived to the Hotel by courtesy Airport pick up, we were warmly welcomed by Roberto the Manager who assured us all would be perfect for the Big Day, and he wasn't wrong, It was spectacular! When we arrived to our Nuptial suite we were welcomed by a beautiful bouquet of fresh flowers, with a Bottle of Champagne chilling for us. It was just amazing. Our guests also received continuous first class service, from individual courtesy airport collection, to excellent accommodation & central location, with the metro outside your door step, our guests had the freedom to Roam around Rome, they received sound tourist advice & transport tips, moreover, any special Dietary requirements were prepared & catered for. It was great peace of mind for both us & our guests, we were all overwhelmed by the service, it was second to none. My Family & friends would highly recommend this Hotel they are still raving about the Hotel & their stay in Rome. On the days leading up to our Wedding, Martha the Hotels Wedding coordinator helped to arrange all our Wedding Reception plans, and without hesitation she had organised everything for us, from the Table Flower arrangements to the Wedding Bouquets, menu design, table layout, the banquet & reception preparation, Jazz Band & afters music was booked & confirmed, Hairdresser & Make up appointments were also confirmed, she even pre-ordered our cake weeks in advance, a fabulous 3 Tier cake which surpassed any expectations that we had & it tasted as delicious as it looked! Everything was chosen to match our Wedding colours; even the iced flowers on the caked matched the Bridal flower bouquets. It was spectacular; all was perfect right down to the very last detail. The Restaurant & Bar staff also provided excellent service, they even pre-order favourite foods & beverages for some of our guests. Moreover, all our requirements were catered for. I have to state from the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated like Royalty, it was remarkable from begin to end. Needless to say, the Napoleon comes first for Luxury & Top class Service, without a doubt, the Napoleon is the Finest Hotel we have ever stayed in, the Management & Staff will go above & beyond to meet & satisfy you’re every need. We cannot wait to return here again & relive the magic! Thank you all so very very much, we hope to see you all soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon Completed our Visit to Rome :)”
Reviews.Author: alicha
Reviews.Content: Having weeded through so many reviews on tripadvisor its obvious to see why this hotel impresses. From its great location, metro outside the door (A line), or 10/15 walk from Termini, with lots of moderately priced restaurants and bars in the locale, to staff who take genuine pride in their job, to a warm and welcoming interior, it would be hard to beat this hotel. Honestly, in this fast paced world where the customer service standards have fallen in the hospitality industry, its so refreshing to see that the management of this hotel strive to give each and every guest a memorable stay. Fancy this......staff who make eye contact, share a warm smile, offer a greeting each time you/they pass by, seem happy in their job - don't see much of this anymore. Hotel was impecably clean, even the guest bathroom in the lounge was hard to beat! You can tell the owners employ the very best here, no short cuts. Breakfast is a buffet offering cheeses & meats, cereals, yogurts, juices, scrambled eggs and bacon, delicious breads and assorted cakes and pastries. Choice of types of coffee and teas. Bar is very well stocked with top quality spirits and wines and very well priced. To reach hotel from Termini, take the A metroline one stop or take a pleasant 15 minute walk. The metros cost €1 per person for upto 75 minutes of travel or €4 for a day. Hotel Napoleon is a 5 minute walk from the coliseum. We spent Sat & Sun walking Rome visit sites, hoping on and off the metro when tiring. On another note wouldn't be bothered taking a taxi from ciampino airport - take a shuttle bus for €11 return into Termini, a 40 minute journey, we used www.sitbusshuttle.com - no need to book online just buy ticket at desk in arrivals or pay staff member at stop #3 outside arrivals terminal. Lots of people use the train and metro combination, cheaper but takes longer. In less than 48 hours one can litterally achieve a huge amount of sight seeing, the Vatican Museum/St Peter's including climbing the Dome, Coliseum and Forum, Trevi Fountain, Panetheon and Spanish steps can all be covered, and that includes plenty of cappuchino stops!! Dining out in Rome doesn't have to be expensive - there are literally hundreds and hundreds of great places, the fun is checking them out. For the best galati (ice cream) a stop at Blue Ice Cream is a must, my mouth is watering at the memories. They are dotted around Rome central, we visited the one at Campi Di Fiori, which is great spot for street entertainment while sipping a nice wine, eating delicious ice cream and great markets oh and lovely shops. Well having thrown our coins into the Trevi Fountain wishing a return, we look forward to returning to Rome and Hotel Napoleon in the neat future. Enjoy your stay - you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LarryMarak
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier here. Quiet location, excellent in hotel restaurant with reasonable prices and great cooking. Metro right outside the entrance for quick transport anywhere. Very friendly and helpful staff. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Rosiebabes
Reviews.Content: We had not been to Rome before and the choice of hotel was 'pot luck', but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Hotel located right on the Metro line, but central enough to walk everywhere if you felt the need. Rooms were very comfortable, quiet and clean. But what made the stay exceptional for us was the quality of the staff. Each and every one of them was attentive, courteous, friendly and incredibly helpful. We would definitely use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend in Rome”
Reviews.Author: joeslater
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and pleasant staff. Location beside metro, giving easy access to the rest of the city. Excellent food, quiet rooms and first class service. Hope to return to Rome soon and I will use the same hotel.”

Reviews.Title: “Far Beyond my speciations !!!!”
Reviews.Author: CGil
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights (Octuber 16 to 21) and I just want to say that the Hotel and the Staff exceeded all my speciation. My Room was a Single room but by far had all the ingredients to make my stance there singular. there is an air conditioner a large cabinet and the bathroom has all the commodities like in a five star hotel. The room has also a little balcony looking to the interior of the hotel. But the most impressive thing was the personalized service of Mr. Roberto Lombardi, he is and extraordinary concierge, he made me feel like in my home. The detail of the lunch pack to go, and the professional limo to the airport. The Friday night event was an extraordinary opportunity to meet people and to make new friends from around the world. I do not had the opportunity to meet Mr. Roberto Cioce but maybe the next time. The first floor lounge has one computer with fast internet connection as a complemetary service and a large space to relax near to the bar. The Metro is a few steps just in front the Hotel. The Buffet Breakfast has all the variety and ingredients to satisfy the most exigent paladar. The hot chocolate is excellent !. I Am from Mexico and I have had the opportunity to stay 8 times in Europe and in many hotels of 4 and 5 stars but by far the service and the personalized attention of this staff it is one of the best I ever had. For sure this will be my Hotel in Rome in the near future. Thanks again Roberto and enjoy the wine. Carlos

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKatie
Reviews.Content: In early October I spent 5 days in Rome. I was on my own and was looking for a friendly and well located hotel and the Napoleon Hotel on the Victor Emmanuel square was the perfect choice!. From the moment I walked in I felt at home. I was warmly received and ,though early, the hotel was able to put me in my rome within 10 minutes. Well located the hotel is within 5 minutes of the Termini ( main train and bus station) and 5 minutes of the Coloseum and there is a metro stop right outside the door. I was especially appreciative of the guidance I received from the front desk dynamos ( note Francesco and Peter are worth their weight in gold).! I also liked the area - vibrant and full of outdoor sales venues- it is not upscale but it is a safe and lively neighbourhood with mutiple Italian, Chinese and Indian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: GuidoMiller
Reviews.Content: In August of this year, my family and I stayed at the Napoleon for two nights. I would recommend the Napoleon (and have done) to anyone who wants to visit Rome; its central location (near to the Terminus and the Coliseum) is very convenient, the rooms we stayed in (I have 5 children and we required 2 rooms) were very comfortable and the hotel staff were, perhaps, the friendliest, most helpful and welcoming staff of any hotel I've ever visited (and believe me, I've been in a lot of hotels!) When I return to Rome in the future, I will definitely be staying at the Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JohnandLouise_8
Reviews.Content: What can I say, The Best Hotel in Rome. We had our wedding reception here on the 22nd of September 2008, and I can tell you it was perfect, thank you Roberto, Marta and all the staff for organising our perfect day.Marta thank you for all your organising and making it all perfect on the day the perfect wedding planner. The majority of our guests stayed in the Napoleon along with us and I must say thank you to Domineco and Peter for all your patience and kindness when making reservations. To Franco and all the other staff, thank you for making us all feel so welcome you most definitely made us all feel at home. Roberto you have a beautiful hotel and the most friendly and efficient staff we have had the pleasure to meet we will recommend your hotel to all our friends and family and to any couples out there looking for a hotel and reception venue the Napoleon is it. Thank you all and we hope to return to the Napoleon soon. John and Louise McLaughlin.

Reviews.Title: “Where I stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticFellow
Reviews.Content: Whenever I visit Rome I stay here - it's next to an A line Metro stop, a short walk from Termini (the main rail station), so the location is perfect (about 3 stops or so to the Trevi fountain!). The staff are always great: courteous and helpful. On my last visit I even had wifi in my room. The last room i had was tiny (esp. the bathroom), but clean and well equipped and it was nice and quiet. The breakfast buffet is great with a wide choice. No complaints from me - I'll be staying there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RussoTBurlingtonWI
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a three night stay in Rome Italy at the Hotel Napoleon. The room was very spacious with a separate sitting area. The bathroom had a full size bathtub with shower. The room and the hotel were very clean at all times. A very nice buffet breakfast in the morning. The hotel staff were extremely polite and very very helpful. I spent weeks reading reviews and searching for the right hotel to stay at and I definitely would stay at Hotel Napoleon again. It's location is very good also, just a short walk away from the Colosseum and the Forum, the entrance to the metro is just a few yards away from the front door. I can't rave enough about the staff, they speak excellant English. A special thanks to Franco for his great directions and map that made getting around Rome a breeze. Arrivederci Roma until we meet again. Teri Russo

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: Abergavennyboy
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Rome in September and had the most wonderful time.The Hotel Napoeon is a beautiful old hotel about 10 minutes walk from the main railway station and about the same distance from the colisseum.It is spotlessly clean and the staff are simply wonderful. Nothing is too much trouble, they are courteous, friendly, welcoming but at the same time efficient and professional. There is a small cosy bar with dining room attached, which produces delicious Italian food at very reasonable prices.There is also a very impressive wine list with many regional favourites. Our bedroom was large and spacious and , again,spotlessly clean. The Metro station is right outside the hotel entrance,which makes getting about Rome a simple matter.If you want to eat outside there hotel,ther are plenty of good restaurants nearby.We would recommend the Tattoria Morgana,or a bit more up-market, Trattoria Monti, which is simply fabulous. All in all a wonderful time and thank you Hotel Napoleon staff, Peter, Franco, Domenico and Piero. And an especial thank you to the owner Roberto Cioce who made our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: NavanAine
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the most friendly, courtious and helpful staff I have ever come accross in all my years of travelling. There will be no need for me to seek alternative Hotel accomidation for my next visit to Rome. It was an absolute pleasure, Thank You.”

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Napoleon!!”
Reviews.Author: jawsbad
Reviews.Content: I have never been one to write reviews but Hotel Napoleon deserves an outstanding one. From the time we were picked up at the airport till the moment of departure, we received first class service. Hotel Napoleon is situated directly in front of a Metro stop which was invaluable when trying to see as much of the glorious sights of Rome as possible in a short period of time. The hotel was a quiet haven to return to after a long day. The room and bath were quiet, very clean and comfortable. A mini-fridge in the room was an added plus. The breakfast buffet was extensive and served in a lovely room by an attentive wait staff. The public rooms are beautifully decorated and a lovely place to spend some time at the end of the day. Everyone on the staff at Hotel Napoleon gave us service on a personal level that was above and beyond. Any need was immediately addressed. Our thanks to all at Hotel Napoleon for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucky1509
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our wedding in Rome where we stayed at The Napoleon Hotel. The hotel had been recommended to us but even so it exceeded our expectations in so many ways but none other than the excellent, friendly staff. In particulare Roberto was outstanding in his efforts to make our stay stress free and enjoyable. From the time we arrived they made us feel very special by sending a bottle of champagne to our room. They even organised a beautiful car to the church for our wedding and organised transport for our 12 guests. During our stay no question was unanswerable, they went out of their way to be helpful. The location of the hotel was very good, the metro is just outside the front door which makes all the sites of Rome accessible in a short time. We have no hesitation in receommending this hotel with their exellent staff (particularly Roberto) that make the stay so pleasant. Thanks again for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the staff”
Reviews.Author: Mychelle22
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon is superbly located at Vittorio Emanuel ll which is just a metro station away from the Termini Station on line A. The hotel is just outside the exit of the metro station which is so convenient when carrying luggage. The location is also very quiet at night. Robert and its staff at the reception were very professional and helpful. They spoke perfect French and English. Our room was huge with an adjoining room. The furniture and decoration could use some upgrading but the extra space in the bedrooms and bathroom made up for that. The hot and cold buffet breakfast was very good and served in a beautiful room. Internet access was free. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I strongly recommend it. Mychelle/Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Hotel Napoleon, Rome Italy”
Reviews.Author: ilope03
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon is located across the Piazza Vittorio Emanuele II, 105, 00185 Roma (RM), Italy. Great service, small but cozy clean room, a bit noisy at times during early morning hours, however the staff service were superb. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable of tourist attractions and local wineries. My wife and I certainly plan on returning to this hotel, centric to several historical Rome attractions. IL

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: spunkisColumbia_MD
Reviews.Content: Our group of 2 couples stayed here 4 nights and enjoyed our stay immensely. The location is directly next to a Rome metro stop and it's only a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum. The rooms are reasonably sized and very quiet. Best feature of the hotel was the outstanding service provided by the staff, who couldn't do enough to provide us with travel tips and make phone calls to confirm our airport shuttle. The ample American style breakfast (free) and decor were terrific. We'd definitely stay there again. We took advantage of their airport pickup special and it worked great.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but just one thing to be aware of if travelling with older people”
Reviews.Author: SiobhanEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Napoleon Hotel with my mother in September. The room was pleasant, the staff fantastic (kind, helpful and fun)with nice additional touches such as hosting a canapes and wine evening for guests. However, just one word of warning... although close to the Colesseum, the hotel is located in the local 'china town' district, with a lot of cheap and cheerful discount shops and a few spray painted walls. Whilst still a nice part of town and in my opinion ideal for a holiday in Rome ie. busy, close to a lot of attractions as well as on the Metro line and perfectly safe, my mother who is 71 (and your typical Daily Mail reader) was convinced that it wasn't a good area and didn't want to go out locally to eat in the evening . Whilst the area was pleasant and safe, I would advise if you are travelling with anyone older who is of a similar disposition to go for a hotel in a more obvious tourist area around the Pantheon/Trevi Fountain Area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Woodenshoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Napoleon for 3 nights. Our stay was a very pleasant one. The rooms are very clean and the hotel does a great job in giving the guests service at a very high level. We enjoyed the breakfast ( lots of choises for everyone) and had an excellent diner in their restaurant. The hotel is is situated on walking distance of many highlights of Rome. The hotel provides a transfer from the airport if you book at least 3 nights. We would recommand this hotel to you. Jan and Boukje

Reviews.Title: “The Friendly Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: JoyMorgan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our third stay at the Napoleon, and once again it was superb. From the minute we arrived at the airport, to be greeted by a friendly taxi driver (ok he can't speak English, but that doesn't matter) to the time we left we were treated like Royalty. All the staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable, and nothing was too much trouble. Altogether a wonderful hotel and we can't wait to go back in March for the Rugby.

Reviews.Title: “Miss Marple would love this place”
Reviews.Author: Durhamguy
Reviews.Content: Well considering all of the other glowing reviews on here I am wondering whether I stayed at another Napoleon Hotel ! The hotel is a nice and comfortable establishment but nothing special and perhaps more 3 star than 4 star. My room was fine and clean and of a traditional size for an old building. The furniture was a bit dated as was the shower in my bathroom. As for the bathroom it was small and crammed with all of the usual convenience's. So much so it could be a hazard for anyone slightly overweight, they could easily become wedged between the huge washbasin and shower cubicle and need to be freed by the Roman fire brigade. The rest of the hotel is clean and has a historical ambience so much so the BBC could easily film here another series of Miss Marple or anything else from the 1950's. Loaction wise the Hotel is a good choice, indeed there is a Metro station outside which is ideal for getting around this great city. The general area around the hotel is not as beautiful as other area's of Rome but neither is it a slum area as other contributors have implied. As for the staff well with the exception of a very helpful and cheerful Swedish girl who worked at breakfast time I found none of the other staff to be exceptionally friendly or helpfull. Indeed one of the barman seemed to be happier one night rearranging bottles than serving his customers. Perhaps you need to tip to obtain such great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: TravelCouple11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Napoleon Hotel in Sept. and it was a very good experience. All three managers at the front desk were extremely helpful in giving us maps and directions on how to get to various sights. They even sell the Metro train tickets at the desk which is very convenient. They also convert your money to euros for you at the front desk if you'd like, and the rate was decent and saves you the hassle of trying to figure out where to go to convert money. (There is a bank nearby but they charge a commission so it comes out to the same thing). The Metro is right outside the hotel, making it very easy to travel within Rome and back to your hotel with no difficulty. The breakfast was good, a mix of eggs, fruits, breads, meats, tea/coffee, everything you can ask for in a breakfast buffet! The room was comfortable and had all the necessities. There is also a computer with free internet in their lounge for anyone wishing to check email. They also have a free wireless connection which came in handy with my iTouch device. My wife had some juice spilled on her shirt and we used their cleaning service, and they removed the stains completely and had it back to us in 24 hours. I had accidentally left my jacket on the seat in the dining area after dinner one night, and the staff (I beleive it was Amin) was courteous to find out who it belonged to, and called our room to let us know. The hotel is in a busy area. We preferred this because we felt safer than being in a secluded location. There were always people and cars on the street outside. Overall we truly enjoyed staying here. The staff is excellent and the breakfast/dinner is great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidays010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel with family for a wedding in Rome - on arriving I was very impressed with the staff they were so homely and helpful. The hotel itself was lovely, very comfortable and cosy. The underground was right outside the door and you get could to all the tourist locations within minutes for approx €1. The Colllisium was approx 10 minute walk from the Hotel. The food was lovely and very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this hotel if visiting Rome and would stay again if when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: JohnMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon Hotel for 6 nights recently at the height of the tourist season. From start to finish the staff were nothing but polite, friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient to explore all the sights of central Rome. However the district is not exactly upmarket - but instead, very real and down to earth. Lots of Chinese and Indian restaurants around and the hotel is quite close to the main Termini train station. The food in their small restaurant/ bar was delicious and the place cosy. We really like the wine tasting event they held for the guests while we were there. Maybe more social events for guests could be hosted? The room was a decent size and well stocked except they need to provide tissues and more rubbish bins in the room which are basic must haves for 4 star hotels. It is also not clear how to dial and reach various hotel departments using the phone provided. Wireless connection from the room was good. It would have been more helpful if the bathrooms provided a pull out washing line like most other hotels do, in order for one to hang up one's washing to dry. Other than that, the decor of the hotel definitely needs updating. A good value hotel and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, quiet hotel, loved the whole experience”
Reviews.Author: Crew-Sing
Reviews.Content: Only back from this lovely hotel and felt I had to write and say what a great experience I had there. The Metro was literally just outside the door, and good bus routes to all the sites within a few minutes walk. It is also very convenient for the main Termini in Rome. The room was quiet, very clean and nicely furnished. There were well appointed public areas with comfy sofas and internet access, a bar for snacks and a restaurant. The bar was very reasonably priced. There was a breakfast room with a good selection of hot and cold food, cereals, pastries etc. My one comment about the hot food was, it quickly became cold....the lids were never put on the containers, however this could be easily sorted. The staff were all exceptionally helpful, but have to give a special mention to Francesco Quirinis the concierge who went out of his way to make our stay special. He drew maps, gave directions, recommended restaurants and made reservations..... definitely added to a great experience and I would be very happy to stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Napoleon!”
Reviews.Author: KagsGreenock
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day trip to Rome, staying at the lovely Napoleon Hotel. We were greeted on arrival with a bottle of champagne in our room, when the staff noted it was an anniversary trip, giving a nice touch to the start of our holiday. We'd booked a superior double room, which comprised of a living area, bedroom and bathroom, with TV, minibar, and air-con. The room was of an excellent standard, and very clean. All other areas within the Hotel - lounges, bar, etc were also very clean and comfortable. Booking breakfast was an excellent idea - a wide and varied spread was put on each morning to suit all tastes, and really set you up for a day's sightseeing! And if there's something you fancy that's not on the menu, the staff are only too willing to try and accommodate. The hotel is ideally situated for public transport - a metro stop virtually right outside the front door, with only one stop to the main Termini Station. This main LineA takes you near to all the major attractions. You can actually walk to the Termini from the hotel too, and make use of the open top tour buses as another option. All in all, we had a fantastic time in Rome, although the weather was very hot even in September! We'd have no hesitation in staying at the Napoleon again, if we're fortunate to return to Rome in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Sameh_Riad
Reviews.Content: The Hotels Location is amazing. There is a metro stop right in front which you can take to all site seeings, and can walk to more near by but less know sites. But don't be fooled by the picture posted in Hotels.com as the hotel HAS NO VIEW to the garden. The two concierges were amazingly helpful, but the old guy at the reception is so rude. DONOT take the Rome by night tour if it is raining. And you don't really need to take the Colosseum tour, you can do that on your own. The must take tour is the Vatican tour.

Reviews.Title: “The Napoleon, a home-away-from-home”
Reviews.Author: wanderde
Reviews.Content: I took my 15 year old granddaughter to Rome, and the Napoleon was our home-away-from-home. The hotel was safe for two women traveling alone. The upstairs lounge area was protected—no one could get past the desk people on duty. I could let my granddaughter indulge in “Facebook” late at night at the computer which was provided in the lounge area. The metro right outside the door of the hotel was an efficient (and cool) way of traveling around Rome. We each bought a Metro pass and popped in and out of the hotel for a siesta during the hottest part of the day—and then we were out again. Franco helped guide us with infinite patience for every pesty question we asked. He pulled out a new map and marked every place with a highlighter, accurately recording every bus or train. Ease of getting to sites is the hallmark of a great location—and the Napoleon provided this ease. We went to Rome on the spur of the moment, so we did not have time to preplan. Franco took care of us in the planning division. His advice was terrific. When we came in at night, tired from climbing steps (I am 70) and keeping up with a teen, the restaurant was open for either a simple pizza (too big for one person) or an elegant meal. We ate there often at night, and I was surprised at how little well priced the meals were. We loved walking in the neighborhood. The blocks around the Napoleon are covered with porticoes with Roman arches and there are loads of banks, street vendors, pizza places, and ice cream shops. Finding a restaurant is not a problem in this area. You could get your water and snacks at a little grocery story around the corner. Saturday is a day for a street antique/junk sale. There is a prak across from the hotel that offers, in season, programs of music. Great fun! We were within walking distance to Santa Maria Maggiore Church. Our favorite ice cream place was on the corner across from the church. Across the street from the church is a large supermarket. I would use this hotel again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “great walks”
Reviews.Author: bubsies
Reviews.Content: Just got back from five days in Rome at this hotel. My husband and I spent our honeymoon there 27 years ago. We had a fabulous time then and an even better time now. Franco and Pascale are really great people. Franco will help you with anything - just ask. We had a triple room 515 as our son came with us. Plenty of room, very clean all mod cons. Breakfast really good buffet to suit all, just ask for any drink you like. Take good walking shoes as most sights you can walk to. The metro is brilliant just one euro anywhere. Get a map from reception. Lots of restaurants nearby just turn left out of the Hotel and left again. The coffee shop left out of the hotel sells good food and coffee. The little bar across the road is good to chill and have a beer. The open top buses are good and give you a real feel that you have seen most of Rome. When you arrive at the airport get a taxi outside the terminal for 40 euros We will definately be visiting again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: dc2008England
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome, whether for the first time or for a return visit. The location is good, with the metro just outside and only a short walk to the colliseum. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff were very helpful and the management's attention to detail for our very large party was second to none. Our party of 25 people were celebrating two "special" birthdays. We had our birthday meal in the hotel, and the food was cooked to perfection. Keeping a party of 25 happy at all times is a tall order, but we managed it with no problem at all. First class. I'd definitely go back again. DC England

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Declan_Flanagan
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. The service they provided throughout our stay was first class. The location of your hotel, next to a Metro stop and a short walk from the Colosseum, was also a great help. I would highly recommend your hotel to a friend and will stay in your hotel if I ever visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JeanNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Italy and the warm welcome we received at the Napoleon (after flying all night) started the trip off on a very positive note. My daughter and I felt very safe and secure even though we were alone in a new city. Compared to similarly priced hotels in Paris and London, the Napoleon was a much nicer facility -- I thought it was a great value. All of the staff were helpful and friendly, especially the concierges, Franco and Rolando. We will definitely stay at the Napoleon again the next time we are lucky enough to be in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Willsons
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after seeing it advertised on TV's "The Travel Bug". A central 4 star hotel, however would not exactly say that this is a 4 star, (glad we never booked a 3 star) the towels on the first day were dirty and our room lacked any character, was simply dull. However front desk staff were very helpful, although they did tell us that the tour we had booked to Naples was not as good as there one, surprisingly! The area is a little run down as well. The hotel restaurant served 'FROZEN' pizza and was very disappointing. We would not stay here again if we ever came back to Rome would head for the Travestere' area as the restaurants and atmosphere were so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: beesknees8
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel was great. The room we stayed in was small but nice and clean. The breakfast was delicious, and the staff was great. We stayed there 6 nights. The location was pretty good, there is a subway stop right outside ( but be careful the subway in Rome closes earlier than I expected it to!) The Colosseum and Roman Forum are in walking distance. To my surprise everything in Rome was pretty close, we could have walked everywhere, even though it looks like miles on the map. The central terminal in Rome is also close- only one stop on the subway or a short walk. There is a grocery store down the street, and right across from the street from a large park where there where always people lying in the sun, great for a picnic! Our stay was over my birthday and came back to a bottle of champagne! It was a nice surprise! On Fridays the hotel hosts a wine tasting that we attended and met the owner of the hotel who seemed like a very nice man. We also ate at the restaurant which was a disappointment, I wouldn't recommend it. I though the Napoleon Hotel was great and would recommend it to friends and family. Its very clean and the people are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Staff”
Reviews.Author: vietdiaspora
Reviews.Content: The pick-up driver from the airport (Franco ?) made us feel right at home for our first trip to Roma. As he passed each monument/historical site, he gave us a brief description or a quick historical fact. In fact, we got a free orientation of Roma. The bellhop was attentive but not at all pushy. The staff at the reception desk is good except for Mr. Peter Gasperi who was a little abrupt and not as courteous as the rest of the hotel staff. The wait staff at all dining areas is very professional, helpful and courteous. The waiters and waitresses remember that my wife likes to drink cappuccino for breakfast after the 1st day so she was very happy to see a cup ready at our table less than 2 minutes after we sat down. The following concierge staff is superior in comparison to those in larger American chain-hotels: Mr. Franco Quirinis, Mr. Roberto Lombardi & Mr. Roland Floquet. They are very attentive, professional and friendly. As the matter of fact, they arranged for 2 early breakfasts (prior to opening time) prior to us being picked-up by the tour company for 2 excursions to Florence and Pompeii. In brief, the concierge staff is Hotel Napoleon's biggest asset.

Reviews.Title: “Great small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcilinois
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon hotel in Rome is a real gem, a real value for the money. While there we met three guest who picked the Napoleon from internet comments and who were all extremely pleased with their find. The desk staff led by Franco is charming. They will try to help you out anyway they can. They will try to solve problems for you. Although the neighborhood is not adjacent to the major attractions, but it is within 1.0 miles of the coliseum, it is adjacent to a metro station, which for 1.0 euro, will take you to the Spanish steps or to the Vatican. The advantage of being just of the main tourist area is that you can find good neighborhood restaurants that are at least 30% cheaper than what you find just 0.5 mile away on the main tourist path. The Main train station/Termini is a short walk away. Finally, the rooms are nice sized and the bathrooms are actually large for a European hotel. Breakfast is good with lots of variety. In short, this is an excellent value smaller hotel which puts a premium on great service. A credit goes to the management who post pictures of all the staff in the elevator and puts their guests first! I can highly recommend the Napoleon hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel well situated near the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: ParryFamily
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well situated next to the metro which is handy for trips to the Vatican and only a 10 minute walk to the Coliseum. We had two family rooms during our visit, the first was a bit small for the three of us but was OK. Because of a problem with the air condition the Hotel promptly moved us to a larger family room which was quite spacious. Both rooms were very clean and well presented as was the rest of the hotel. We stayed on a bed breakfast tariff, which was served as a buffet and was more than adequate for our needs. We only eat in once during our stay as there are a number of restaurants dotted around the area. Although the area does feel a bit run down I didn’t feel at all threatened. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful with visits. Overall I would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome with or without children.

Reviews.Title: “E#njoyed the Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: CIOToronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to my expectations. The staff were very warm and welcoming. The location with a Metro stop in front of it was ideal for accessing the sights. I will return to this hotel on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star by any stretch of the imagination”
Reviews.Author: Wagamama13
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to Rome. We stayed at the Napoleon to attend a family wedding. All other members of the party were staying at this hotel, so we had no choice in the matter. The location is great and the guys at the front desk are very helpful and the breakfast was grand. But the rooms are small and in need of a revamp. The elevator is tiny and hard to manoeuvre with a pushchair. There was no air-conditioning in the lobby seating area, which was a pity. We also had plumbing problems and our loo kept blocking repeatedly. The bathroom was a major disappointment overall. I personally wouldn't stay in the Napoleon again, as I don't think it represents value for money at all. I would rate the hotel a 3*, no more.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended by a friend”
Reviews.Author: siobhanmccluskey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend and the recommendation was sound. For our first trip to Rome we stayed in this hotel and we could not have asked for a better introduction to the hospitality and beauty of Rome. From the moment we were collected at the airport to the moment we left the management and staff were fantastic. Any question about Rome sightseeing, shopping or entertainment can be answered by the staff. The hotel has the atmosphere of a small family run hotel, which is lovely after the hustle and bustle of Rome. Don't be put off by the location or the entrance - much of Rome is similar. The location of the hotel is wonderful - the metro line A stop is right outside the hotel, the main train station is only 1 stop on the metro and the Coliseum is a 10 minute stroll (through a lovely park). The food in the restaurant is lovely (though I recommend eating in as many restaurants as possible - it is Rome after all) The breakfast is filling and there is plenty of choice. The hotel has a lovely day room in which to relax and enjoy a drink after a hard days sightseeing. Our room was lovely - comfortable beds and kept clean, no view that I can comment on though as we were at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cr0berts
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay in Rome. We enjoyed our stay at the Napoleon. The hotel is in a quiet location and is very traditional with some beautiful artwork. It is very clean and the rooms are functional and have everything you need. We stayed with our 7 year old son and it was fine. There is a park opposite which is good for children but shuts at about 9.00 (ish) as there is an open air cinema there. It is nice with park and room to play he had fun showing the Italian children his diablo! The area is okay we felt safe however wouldnt like to be there without my husband. Probably the only down side is the area as it seems a little run down but has everything close by and there are some restaurants close by. It is very close to the colloseum which we visited every day and was the main reason we went. The staff are friendly and assisted us when we asked. Breakfast was absolutely fantastic. All in all we enjoyed the hotel it was our first time in Italy and we would return to the hotel. Dont know if it is permanent but the metro shuts early so makes it a bit difficult to go anywhere too far in the evening unless you get taxis but then becomes expensive. A tip for families with young children make sure you go to the Explora which is a museum dedicated to children (you cant go in unless you have a child!) It is non profit making and is on Via Flaminia 82 close to Piazza del Popolo. It is absolutely fantastic one of the best places we have taken our son, he loved it. Loved Rome and enjoyed the hotel especially the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PlanetJLM
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff really made for a great stay. There's a metro station right in front of the hotel which is extremely helpful. The staff made me feel at home and didn't mind my constant questions for directions. They just gave me very helpful, detailed directions. Buy your metro tickets at the hotel, and you can exchange your money to euros there too. There's free breakfast every morning as well as free internet access if you don't have a laptop. The only drawback was the tiny (and I mean tiny) shower, otherwise the room was great, big for European hotels. And as most European hotels I've stayed at, there's no clock in the room. What's up with that?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: cpartridge
Reviews.Content: Central location, convenient to many attractions. Located very close to metro station for those sites too far to walk. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. They all seemed genuinely interested in making us fell welcome on our first trip to Europe. Very nice, quiet rooms and a very good restaurant. (You must also try Pizza Yok just down the street from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Treated like family”
Reviews.Author: lyndooch
Reviews.Content: This is very late in coming but none the least very important to us. Upon arriving in Rome very late one night for our first time we were greeted and welcomed by the most , courteous & professional team at your Hotel. I felt like family, thanks to Francesco & Roberto the Concierges. My husband & I do not speak Italian and did not have a tour guide they we're extremely helpful, especially when they tried to connect me with my family in Casino. We feel your Hotel & especially the Concierges made us feel more at home then any other other hotel that we stayed at in Italy. We really did feel like family!

Reviews.Title: “Geoge”
Reviews.Author: Georgz21
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed 4 nigths in the triple room. Very good service in hotel. Cosy restaurant with reasonable prices. Only minus sides from our point of view were lack of fresh juice on the breakfast table and a bit too hard beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: casualtravlas
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 weeks in europe and would rate Hotel Napolen as the hotel with the most helpful staff out of all the hotels we stayed at. The accomodation itself was neat and quiet, and the breakfast was much better than any other hotel offering throughout Italy. Much more than just bread and croissants.Franco and Roberto,the 2 duty concierge's we met were not only informative with suggestions on how we should attack Rome but they were also interested in making our stay enjoyable. We also had the pleasure of meeting the owner Roberto Cioce who invited us and some other guests to a wine tasting evening. His family has a long history with the hotel, and so for him it is more than just a job. The location was also good, the metro stop right at the front door certainly made getting into the city centre very easy, not that it was much of a walk anyway. There was also a nice park directly across from the hotel with a small arcade and planty of room to kick a ball with the kids. Most of the innner city hotels had nothing like this. It is also located closer to areas where the locals shop and eat so if you stay here spend some time exploring the area around the hotel. If more of the hotels we stayed at were like Napolean it would have made our trip across europe even better!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: westinbayhsore
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff. Located right next to metro, 4 stops from spanish steps. Excellent value. Great food, we used restaurant in evening twice (lunch is OKish), cheap drinks, good air-con, comfortable beds - important after long walks. Within waliking distance to Colosseum. Tips -buy metro tickets at hotel, ask reception for map and where to go, queue for vatican in afternoon (queues shorterI, go off beaten track one day (you will see many more things not in guide books), don;t use the tour guides at vatican (you get in quicker but have no time to amble around at your own pace), ask hotel to book taxi to airport (35 euros). Use Ryanair ONLY IF you want CHEAP. If you want more than cheap e.g. orderly queuing, nice staff, reclining seat, quick check-in, then avoid Ryanair. They are very good with CHEAP. REMEMBER the 15kg bag allowance. If not you WILL get caught. People all over the place emptying cases into carry-on luggage at Rome and East Midlands.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: twotwoz
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. The staff are genuinely friendly and happy to answer any questions. The rooms are comfy and have a decent sized shower! The food available is good and very reasonably priced. We ate there 4 out of 5 nights. After being on holiday for 5 weeks, we actually spent most of our time in the bar or the lounge.
