Every night you would the lounge would be filled with guests. It was lovely meeting someone new each night as we enjoyed a wine and watched Euro 2008 on the tv. It's right on top of the metro system and is 3 blocks and 1 park from the Termini. I would definately suggest catching the train to the airport instead of getting a transfer. It takes 2 mins to Termini station, change over to the airport line and 30 mins later your at the airport. Our bus transfer took us over an hour and cost a fortune compared to a train ticket. Thank you to Sarah for directing us to the sunday markets. It truly was an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I have stayed at in terms of the friendly atmosphere and”
Reviews.Author: Del77
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strenght of the reviews on the trip advisor website. Abosolutely briliant. Great staff, food, accessibility to the metro. Even a complimentary bottle of Champers for my wifes birthday. "chin chin to Roberto and the friendly staff" Home from home if you ask me. You'll love it, I know we did

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: usbchinita
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel could not have been better! The Metro was right outside of the hotel. The Coliseum was 15 minutes away on foot. It was also within walking distance to a lot of regular shops, super markets and local boutiques etc. One thing I would like to point out was how amazing Franco the Concierge was. He always greeted us with a smile. One our first day, he draw a map for us of the metro lines, all the major sites, AND how to get back to the hotel by different bus lines! He was always available to help us with any question we would have, and would go the extra miles to get what we needed. Franco also invited us to a free wine and cheese event that was offered by the hotel on our last night there, what a great way to end a great trip! I wanted to give Franco a little something to show our appreciation, but didn't get to because he wasn't there when we left at 6 in the morning the next day. Oh, one last thing, the hotel even packed us breakfast because we were leaving so early in the morning! Would def. recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, model hotel”
Reviews.Author: duxford01
Reviews.Content: From the moment we first contacted the hotel their standards of service and attention to detail shone through. We visited Rome to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and the champagne and flowers I ordered for our arrival came with the compliments of the hotel which was a really nice touch.. My wife has special dietary requirements as she suffers from Coeliac disease which were catered for with subtlety and professionalism. The breakfast room is large, warm and inviting, the staff friendly and accommodating. The restaurant, accessed through the well stocked bar, is smaller but equally cheery with a comprehensive menu, excellent wine list and knowledgable staff. The public rooms are large and well furnished, impressive whilst not intimidating. The room was large, well furnished, air conditioned and clean with both the towels and bed linen changed daily. We had a superior room which was really a junior suite with a sitting room separated from the bedroom by a double doorway hung with drapes and an en-suite bathroom with bath and shower. The hotel is a comfortable 20 minute walk from the colloseum but as the forum and other monuments are beyond this walking times can easily rack up, The very postive upside to this is that it must be the quietest city hotel we've ever stayed in. There was NO traffic or other kind of noise at night which meant you're guaranteed a good nights sleep every night.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sportsworld
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome the moment we arrived at the hotel. The staff were very friendly. Its a very nice hotel and I would stay there again, and recommend it to friends. Breakfast was very good and lots of food to choose from. The hotel was not noisy either, considering its beside a busy road. Not bad location either for shopping or buses.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: IdSouthYorks
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here 15-18 June 2008.The reception & conciege staff were polite & helpful.Our bedroom & bathroom were clean,comfortable & spacious for a city centre hotel.Breakfast was a buffet with a wide choice of food.We asked for a late check-out (6.00 pm)which was given at no extra charge.The lounge is grand in size & style.All the staff spoke good English. ID,South Yorks.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma!!”
Reviews.Author: lillaprinsessan
Reviews.Content: I just want to tell everyone to go to Rome, a lovley city!! I stayed at the Napoleon Hotel, an excellent place to stay when you visit Rome because of the location of the hotel. It's close to everything, and the underground is only a few meters away. The rooms was nice and clean and the staff were really helpful and friendly. And the food...mmmm...I love italian food. Is there anything better than to have a nice italian dinner in real italian surroundings?? Overall I'm really pleased with my stay at the Napoleon Hotel a couple of days in May this year, and will soon book another flight here from Sweden so I can go back!! I give this hotel 5 out of 5 !!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: siamesecat33
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay in this hotel. The room was large and clean and although it did not benefit from a lovely view there was a balcony. The hotel provided a great breakfast and coffee to die for!! The hotel is within easy reach of the metro service however there is no noise as such. The A line takes you across the city (eg vatican) There is a little bar in the hotel and they also do snacks etc. The management is friendly and staff attentive. They are very happy to book cabs etc to make your transport easier. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and the hotel was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ac1510
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was in a great location, with great staff and clean quiet rooms. The staff will go out of their way to help you make your stay that much more pleasant. The breakfast was good and you had a good choice. The eggs were a bit cold but sufficient. They will also bring you espresso at breakfast if you ask for it. The location is great and I always felt safe walking around the hotel at night. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Bunkerbuster
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Napoleon for a trip to Rome on the Britsh Airways website. I was travelling alone. I am 6 feet 2 inches tall. When I checked in because I was travelling alone whey tried to put me into a room with a 6 foot single bed. The room might have been modern in 1940. Needless to say I returned immediately to reception and demanded a double room. After being told the hotel was full, I was rather more assertive. Eventually they put me in a double room. Hot and somewhat annoyed by this point, I went to the double room. Shabby. The bathroom was unfeasibly small, the shower no more than 2 feet wide and a pathetic dribble. The toilets in this place are the very old fashioned European kind with the little shelf that your deposits sit on (and it didn't flush properly) and it stank the tiny place out such that I was physically sick. Welcome to the Napoleon. The pluses - the bed was confortable, the air conditioning worked, the staff are generally very friendly and the barman made me an unorthodox but very satisfactory cosmopolitan. Breakfast was fine. All in all, the problems I encountered were partly because I booked this through BA and partly because the hotel is very old fashioned and shabby. With the best will in the world, I certainly, 100%, would never stay here again, but if you have a strong stomach and don't mind staying somewhere that should have been demolished and rebuilt or at least completely gutted and refurbed some time ago, then you might like it. I doubt it, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: REALNICE
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with an excellent location. It is within walking distance from the train station, but the metro is right outside the door of the hotel so it is easy access to all the sights in Rome. Friendly and helpful staff. We arrived early morning and they stored our luggage and when we returned the luggage had been taken to our room. We stayed 3 nights and were invited to the wine tasting one evening and the general manager and other hotel staff talked with us . This really added a personal touch. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: xinix
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel is, as has been mentioned here many times, a very lovely hotel! All the staff are very nice and helpful indeed! The location is great, with the metro just outside and the Colosseum only a 10 minute walk away. Once you are there, all the other great sights are also within walking distance. On Sunday we were very tired from walking around all day and wanted to take the metro back to the hotel, but it had already stopped, on sunday they stop at 10 pm ... so we had to walk, but it was a lovely evening and we were in Rome, so we didn't mind much, but you might want to keep that in mind. We stayed here 4 days, from May 23 to May 26. On arrival we were taken to our room and our suitcase was brought up a little later. We received an invitation for that same evening to have some wine and food and get to know the staff. We did not go because we went into the city and it was such a lovely day (the weather was great!!) that we decided to stay there and have dinner on one of the lovely squares. At reception a staffmember, I think it was Roberto or maybe Franco, gave us a map of the city and with different colours marked all the places we wanted to see, the roads to walk there and the metrostops along the way. We only had 4 days and this saved us so much time as we didn't need to look for directions. This is just one example of how kind and helpful the staff are. We only booked breakfast so I can't say anything about dinner but the breakfast was very tasteful and had everything you could want: all kinds of bread, toast, cheeses, cerials, juices, coffee and tea, eggs, and much more. The room was not very big but it was clean and you are only there to sleep so who needs a big room? :-) The whole place had a great atmosfere and I can't mention it enough: the staff were above standard! We had a great time and Rome is a very lovely city, too bad we only had 4 days ... but we will be back!! So for now ciao Roma and ciao Napoleon Hotel, because we will definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Special!”
Reviews.Author: mscrosswi
Reviews.Content: I know it is hard to give a hotel in this price range a top rating but Hotel Naploeon deserves it. What makes this hotel special is the way the people that work there truly care about making their guests happy.Our 3 room party checked in at 1030am (after an overnight flight from the US) a time when most European hotels will not let you check in. We were enthusiastically greeted, and told that while not all rooms were available, one was and they would immediately take all our bags there and give us the opportunity to freshen up. The porter was charming and definitiely not hustling for a tip, but of course, being American we gave him one anyway. Concierge Francesco (Franco) immediately got us on our way, showing us how to do everything from riding the Metro (and Hotel Napoleon is well located to the Metro and Termini Station), to where to go window shopping. He was wonderful as he answered questions from us, other guests, and fielded phone calls. He genuinely wanted us to love his city. We happened to be there on Friday evening when they have their wine tasting (believe it or not it's free) from 630pm to 730 pm (which lasted until after 800 pm). We engaged in great discussion with Francesco and then the Managing Director Roberto. We heard great stories about their life at the hotel. The hotel has been owned by Roberto's family for 36 years. Francesco is a relative newbie as he has only been there for 29 years. Roberto found out that my wife liked olive oil from Italy and believe it or not (you cannot make this stuff up) 3 bottles of olive oil pressed at Roberto's home were delivered to us upon check out. If you want to stay at a resonably priced, well located hotel that is run by people that love the hotel business and care about their guests then this is your place. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly staff and good service”
Reviews.Author: hebegebees
Reviews.Content: Went early May for 3 days. Great hotel with old-fashioned feel and good old-fashioned service values. Clean comfortable room. Breakfast was included and was all you can eat buffet style with good choice. Reception always helpful with supplying maps/directions and very friendly. Central location ideal for doing the sites and easy trip from the airport. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel in Rome !”
Reviews.Author: vegaslvr2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two week visit to Rome, and we could not have been happier than to have selected the Hotel Napoleon to stay at. I cannot say enough about the professionalism, helpfulness and genuine friendliness of the staff. I would particularly like to single out Francesco and Roberto as two of the very best concierge in any city we have traveled to. They took care of whatever we needed and their efforts were very much appreciated. Thank you both ! The hotel is located in a wonderful area, very close to the Colliseum, Forum and Santa Maria Maggiore. The Metro line is right outside the door for easy transport to almost any sight in Rome, and the Train Station for trips outside of Rome is about five minutes away by foot, or one metro stop away. The location simply could not have been better. The hotel was very quiet and allowed for very peaceful nights. I simply do not agree with any review that says the location was not good. It was perfect. My husband and I had a superior double room and it was extremely large, comfortable, and clean. Our room had a television, its own remote control air-conditioning unit, and a refrigrator, which made keeping snacks very convenient. Everything in our room was in working order and we had clean sheets and towels every day. Something that doesn't necessarily happen in other hotels. The bathroom was large with a big tub with shower, sink, toilet, bidet, good lighting, a wall mounted hairdryer, and a good selection of toiletries were also provided. A Buffet breakfast was included in the price of our room and it was quite lovely. There was a nice selection of cereal, hard boiled or scrambled eggs, bacon, cold cuts, cheeses, yogurt, fresh fruit, breads, pastries, juices, coffees and teas. We ate our breakfast every morning at the hotel and were never disappointed. The restaurant in the hotel was also very good and there was also a light menu available all day. The staff in the dining rooms were extremely efficient and very friendly. Other travelers we spoke with stated, their hotels either didn't offer breakfast or offered a very limited service of bread and pastries with coffee. So it was great to have the wondefful breakfasts we had every day. The hotel also offered free internet and wi-fi access which was really marvelous. We spoked with several other travelers in Rome whose hotels either didn't provide internet access, or that charged almost $40.00 a day for service. We loved this feature of the hotel, as it made our stay much more pleasant being able to stay in contact with our offices and our friends and family. We cannot say enough about all of the wonderful aspects of the Hotel Napoleon and would urge all travelers to Rome to stay here as you will definitely not be disappointed. As for my husband and I, when we return to Rome, we will definitely stay at the Hotel Napoleon again and again as we truly enjoyed our visit to Rome, and the hotel and its staff were a major part of the reason we enjoyed ourselves so much.. By the way, all of the photos on the hotel website are absolutely true, the rooms and common areas look just as they are pictured. Travelers can rest assured that they will not encounter any unpleasant surprises.

Reviews.Title: “great bargain”
Reviews.Author: tuxch
Reviews.Content: They had a car pick us up at the airport and deliver us to the front door(50 euro). Franco the front desk man was exceptional, he greeted us and made a map route for our daily sightseeing trips.Contrary to what others might say the hotel is a ten minute walk from the Coleseum and Nero's House. The Metro ten feet from the door takes you to all the others. In fact we walked back from the Vatican in forty minutes. The food in the dining room was very good and we had no complaints. The breakfast was typical for Italy and was also very good. If you wanty a full Irish breakfast go to Ireland not Italy. I met the owner at a free wine tasting and he was a gentleman and very engaging as were all the staff. We stayed there five nights and the room was adequate, while not big. We also walked around the square at night and it was fine -no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Could not reccomend it highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: SupersaintDublin
Reviews.Content: We cannot reccomend the Hotel Napoleon highly enough. We stayed there for three nights in April and the staff in this beautiful hotel made our stay most enjoyable. The hotel is in a great location and we found it so easy to get to all the sights. The room was a great size and very comfortable and most importantly, extremely clean. We forgot to bring an adaptor with us and the consierge gave us one for the duration of our stay. The breakfast was most enjoyable and there was a great choice to suit most tastes. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we were made to feel most welcome. It is clear to see that the staff really do care that you enjoy your trip to the fabulous city of Roma. An especially nice touch was extending us the use of their courtesy car and driver to bring us to the train station on our departure. We will definitely return to stay with them again. Dave & Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon Hotel , Roma Stay”
Reviews.Author: ljmidlo
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Napoleon Hotel in Rome, Italy was great. It is a small hotel with a concern for its guest's happiness. The manager, Roberto Cioce and staff, go above and beyond to make all their guests feel welcome, including free internet access, a delicious breakfast. Cabs were called, tour reservations made and confirmed in the blink of an eye. My birthday and one of my traveling companion's birthday occurred the week we were in Rome. The manager presented each of us with a bottle of champagne for celebration on our birthday. They listened attentively to know about our birthdays. It's location, near the ruins of Ancient Rome, makes it easy to walk to many scenic sites, such as the Coleseum and Forum. When I'm in Rome again, the Napoleon Hotel will be where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlieandMac
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel within easy walking distance of the colosseum and othe antiquities. Right next to the Metro. The thing that sticks out about this hotel were the staff - they could not have been more friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. The inclusive breakfast was not just a piece of sad ham on a dried roll, but offered a good selection including bacon and excellent scambled eggs. The hotel was clean and well appointed with a pleasant sitting/bar area. The reason I have not given it 5 stars is that the en-suite shower-room was the smallest I have ever encountered. For anyone not so agile it would have been awkward to negotiate. We both felt safe walking out at night and encountered no problems. A great hotel, would stay there again. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Girlgolfpro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a winner. Not only is the staff welcoming and efficient, the location being about 10 steps from a metro stop can't be beat. The food and service in both the bar and restaurant was very good and the prices were quite reasonable, for Rome in particular and Italy in general. This was important to us because after a long day of sightseeing you don't always want to go out again for dinner. The concierges were excellent in reserving tickets and providing directions. Don't miss the Borghese Gallery. Also, wander into any church that is open. You will see the most amazing sights!

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect HOTEL. Don't look any further”
Reviews.Author: NaturalNawlins
Reviews.Content: That’s right don’t look any further. Normally it takes me forever reading reviews to find the perfect hotel. Well this time all my reading paid off. What makes this hotel so great? THE STAFF. If it were not for the staff at this hotel, it would be just another clean, comfortable hotel. The manager Roberto knows what he's doing and he does it well. We visited the hotel during the week of our 5th Wedding Anniversary, the manager sent a complimentary bottle of champagne to the room which was very thoughtful and appreciated. Also we had trouble accessing the internet with our PC, once again Roberto came to our rescue and had his tech take a look at our PC. We had a problem with our Wi-Fi card and he allowed us to use the hotels card during our visit. The service at the Hotel Napoleon is the best I’ve ever had in Europe. Franco the Concierge was great. He was always available with directions and advice on touring the city. Not only did he give us a map, but he gave us a color coded map one color for walking, one for bus routes and another color for streets to shop. Upon arrival we asked the concierge desk to contact a place we wanted to visit the next day and inquire about an English speaking tour guide, while we were in the bar eating a light meal we received a phone call with all the information we needed for our tour. The next morning we had a taxi waiting to take us to our destination. Now for the hotel. Great location, short walk to Coliseum, across the sidewalk to train station. Although there are many great restaurants in the area, the food at the hotel was delicious and reasonably priced. Complimentary breakfast was tasty and plentiful: bacon, cold meats, fruit, pastries, toast, eggs (scrambled and boiled), cereal, juices, etc. Mini bar prices in the room were comparable to prices in local stores. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Great shower pressure and ample hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saerwhit
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Wonderful staff! Very clean. Access to metro at entrance. Staff was very friendly, helpful and accomodating. Breakfast was great - large selection of breakfast foods - restaurant was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights and can honestly say that this was one of our best hotel experiences in any city. The hotel's biggest asset is its staff who are, without exception, courteous, helpful and friendly - and very professional. Public spaces are spacious and elegant, with lots of comfortable sofas - a great space to relax and unwind. There is a very good restaurant and cozy bar. These are for residents only so it does feel as if you are in a private club. This is great for women guests, families and anyone travelling alone The hotel is in a working part of the city and we had some initial reservations about access to the main sights. This was never a problem. Public transport is on the doorstep and we were within walking distance of the Colisseum and Santa Maria Maggiore. We had lots of help from hotel staff with directions and the best bus routes. This hotel is great value for money compared to other 4 star hotels we considered and offers good added value - our rate included airport transfer and there is free Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 15hockey
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the centre of Rome. The staff were highly professional and extremely helpful throughout our stay. The location of the hotel is brilliant - the entrance to the metro subway is literally opposite the front door and the station itself is less than five minutes away. The Colosseum is less than ten minnutes walk away, as are the other main attractions of Rome. There are several shops and restaurants nearby and at all times we felt that the area was safe to be in. The rooms are a reasonable size and were clean and well cared for. The views from the window were limiting, but as we didn't spend much time in the room (too much to see and do), this wasn't a problem. Would definitely recommend them and would happily stay there again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnysofine
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Napoleon were exceptional. Kabir went out of his way to make us feel welcome and the concierges were always helpful. The small jewel of a restaurant serves very high quality food and the service was splendid. My husband and I enjoyed our stay. Room and bath were spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon the Great”
Reviews.Author: Paulo59
Reviews.Content: What can I say except, Fantastic! We had three nights at the Napoleon, from the moment we entered the hotel until the moment we left the staff were wonderful. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast staff cheerful and efficient., bar staff eager to please. Everything you could want from a hotel without the feeling it was done for appearances. All the staff seemed pleased to have you there and genuinely pleased to help. The hotel is quite grand without being intimidating. The rooms are smart and spotless, fresh bed linen and towels everyday. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Loved Napoleon Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AttilaTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Rome during the 2nd week of March. The hotel was nice, had a very good breakfast and conveniently served lunch and dinner if you wanted to stay in. However, there were plenty of nice restaurants within walking distance, both cafe/pizzeria and finer dining. The hotel's concierge was superb; there could not have been more helpful or pleasant service anywhere (and I've been known to be picky about service). The location was unbelievably convenient. The A-line Metro station Vittorio Emanuele was accessible right outside the hotel's front door and was one stop away from the main Termini station. This made getting around Rome very easy -- especially with a week-long Metro pass that also included rides on city buses, too. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Napoleon Hotel- A Roman Victory”
Reviews.Author: StAlbansExplorer
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Hotel Napoleon in March. Before we even got there, we had made some enquiries to the hotel by email. Their General Manager, Mr Cioce, had personally replied very promptly and helpfully. The hotel is conveniently located, extremely clean, tastefully decorated and appointed and comfortable. But above all, we were most impressed by the genuine, friendly,helpful and welcoming nature of all the staff -most notably the Concierge, Roberto Lombardi. We would recommend this hotel to all our friends and to anyone planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Faces in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Grumpomcchief
Reviews.Content: We had decided to watch Scotland play Italy at Rugby in the final match of the 6 nations but thought we would tack a few days on before and after the match. We spent in total 6 days in The Napoleon and would return to this Hotel again and again. The Management and staff could not have been more helpful to us and in fact Mr Cioce the General Manager even specially organised for our party to watch the other Rugby matches on the Hotel Main TV when we returned from our match. We all had a great party watching these which helped us recover from the defeat by Italy. Room was very comfortable as was the bed and the range and quality of food on offer was first class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: wannypooh
Reviews.Content: Young Couple (aged 25-28)... We stayed in Hotel Napoleon in March, we were over for a wedding & the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. They also spoke English which was great, and if there was anywhere we wanted to go, they were only to willing to help us, they had their own maps with different colours of highlighters for the different things ie. tourist attraction, shopping!! :) Hotel Location was right by the Metro, within walking distance of the Colleseum & right by the weekend markets. Breakfast was served from 7-10am & was perfect, there was a large selection of fruit/bread/bacon/eggs etc rather than just bread that other hotels would offer. Rooms were very clean & adequate (most rooms in rome are quite small), there was a selection of drinks in the mini bar, reasonably priced & clean towels every day which we loved. There was a computer (with internet access) in the main sitting area that was free to use any time you wanted. All in all, a fantastic stay was had, we really appreciated the courtesy of the staff, there were other members of the wedding party staying in the hotel, one of which celebrated her birthday, the hotel staff provided her with a bottle of champagne courtesy of them & without anyone saying anything. There is two excellent restaurants on the right hand side as you leave the hotel... it was two blocks over... fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “very convenient,clean and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Lorcan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days. It was very convenient - the metro is just outside and it is only one stop from Termini (the main hub station). Buses run nearby also. It is within walking distance 10-20 minutes from a lot of sights.The breakfast is excellent and is in a nice dining room. There is a large sitting area with tv and internet beside a cosy bar. The reception staff are very nice and helpful. The bedrooms are small as is the ensuite but it is clean and newly decorated. There is a fridge in the room with a mini bar - but ours was not working. We never mentioned it to them as we did not need it. The rooms are quiet because they face onto an internal 'courtyard' area. The square outside has a lot of immigrants and it seems to be an area for chinese shops. This seems to be located on the other side of the square rather than the side the hotel is on. It is a very safe area to walk around at night. I would have no difficulty recommending this hotel and given the convenience to the metro - I am thinking of going back with my mum later this year.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kempjlmc2
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just stayed at this Hotel for our weekend break to Rome. Having stayed at many hotels across the world, I'd thought we had already experianced the best. However, we have nothing but praise for The Napolean. The staff were helpful and friendly whilst delivering first class service, nothing was too much trouble. Our room and the hotel interior were to the highest standard. The Restaurant and food was superb and good value. The hotel location is within easy travelling of all of the cities attractions either on foot or by Metro. Within hours we had relaxed into a comfortable and enjoyable holiday mood. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at Napoleon!”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia-London-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Napoleon for a weekend in February, and it was a very pleasant stay. The staff at the hotel are really friendly and helpful. The rooms were big, but more importantly very clean! It was easy to get around Rome, as there was an underground station right in front of the hotel. Next time I'm in Rome I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: npsOslo
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome in February 2008 on a short vacation with the family. The Napoleon reflected nice a location (close to metro, well known hotel by the cabdrivers), nice and helpful staff - also towards children, clean and adequate rooms, well organized embellishment etc. Situated close to the Colosseo - and the Maria Church is only a small walk away. Overrall a very nice classic Italian Hotel. Best Regards Nils Petter Stensrud Norway

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday break”
Reviews.Author: midget73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 5 very pleasant days in mid February staying in the Napolean and the service we recieved by all the staff couldn't have been better. We were greeted at the door by name as as well as a smile soon as the car stopped at the hotel (they included the very prompt airport transfer as part of the service) and throughout our stay nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The hotels position in relation to the centre of Rome was good and having access to the metro immediately outside of the hotel was a real bonus. The hotels location does look very diferent in the evening when the shutters go, evening window gazing is not something I would reccomend in this area. We thought the hotel provided really good value for money and the cost and quality of food in the retaurant was very reasonable and this also applied to the bar. There are a couple of resaurants arround the corner which provided excellent altrenatives to eating in. As we arrived on valentines day, they moved their normal Friday wine tasting meet and greet session to mark the romatic day. Which was a really nice way to start our break but the staff didnt exactly encourage intermingling with the rest of the guests which would have helped to relax the event a lttle more. Roberto was on hand to introduce himself to those who attended and what made our stay even more special was when he found out it was my birthday the following day, we recieved a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine and two deserts from the restuarant in our room just before dinner. A really nice touch and was much appreciated and is something which would not have happened in a hotel chain The weather was cold but sunny and the rooms whilst not having a fantastic view where warm, clean and the bed was comfortable but I would take issue with the antique furniture descrption. We also had a superior room which is larger but I would suggest that the hotel is more a 3* plus rather than a 4*. Its not a room or a hotel which you would spend alot of time in due to its limited access to windows and position within the building but this is not alot different from many city hotels, but as a base to tour from it was fine. The computer which is available for guests decided to not connect with the internet whilst we were there which was unfortunate but not a disaster. The booking was all done via the web and any email communiction with the hotel resulted in a prompt response and Roberto and his staff did all that we asked for and more. No hestitation in going back although we may want to get a little closer to the centre but that would be at a higher cost. All in all we had a very good break in Rome but you do need good walking shoes

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Plans”
Reviews.Author: IrelandWedding
Reviews.Content: My Fiancée & I stayed at the Napoleon Hotel for a Weekend on Jan 24th - 27th. I am more than pleased to say that we had such a fabulous time, this was our 2nd trip to Rome & this time it was even more enjoyable than our first experience, and this is thanks to Roberto Cioce the Hotel Manager & he's very professional staff at this Hotel. The hotel is just magnificent & we have never experienced such incredible service before. It was so lovely to see real friendliness & good service from all the Staff at the hotel. We were so well looked after each & everyday, the staff could not do enough for us, everything was taken care of, from Airport pick up on arrival, to concierge, to a non stop service with a genuine real smile was show to us at all times. This was generosity & professionalism at its best. The kind of service you expect but never get, until to stay at the Napoleon, that is. The food is so fresh & tastes of Italy; we dinned at the Restaurant every evening & experienced dining of a real Italian style & kind. Breakfast is served as a buffet style, with such a huge variety that suits all appetites, the food ranges from hot, to cold food & even a selection of fresh pastries to choice from. It was quite difficult to beat this Hotel for value, service, and comfort, we felt it was just like a Home form Home. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in & as we are extremely fussy! We are so pleased with this hotel we have booked it for our wedding reception, as we have no doubt in know that both our guest & us will be well looked after & treated the bets for such as important day. This Hotel is an absolute must, we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Would Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: A friend and I shared a twin room at the Napoleon for six nights in February, 2008, and we were very pleased. The location is terrific: easy access to the Metro (literally just outside the door) and the Termini train station (just a few blocks away). There are many sites of interest within walking distance as well -- most notably, the Colosseum. I've seen other reviewers express concern about the neighborhood near the Termini, but we walked there numerous times and never felt insecure. Sure, there's graffiti and some homeless people, but you'll find that all over a City of this size. The Hotel's courtesy airport pickup was a nice treat upon our arrival (a bonus for stays of 3 nights or more). But returning to the airport via the express train from the Termini was also quite easy -- buy your train ticket at the self-service machines in the Termini, for 11 Euros each. Our room was immaculately clean, and the bathroom was much larger than I'd expected, with a big tub/shower and a built-in hair dryer. There was plenty of closet space, cozy radiator heat (including a separate unit in the bathroom), extra blankets, and an in-room safe -- as well as a mini-bar and TV that we never used. Given the orientation of the building, we never heard any street noise from our room. We did frequently hear late-night, "through the wall" conversations from inconsiderate neighbors, but it was never bad enough to cause me to lodge a complaint. The breakfast buffet was terrific, with a big variety of food items (pastries, yogurt, cereals, fruit, toast, eggs, etc) along with juices, coffee, tea, and milk. We'd fill up every morning and often didn't really need lunch. We also had dinner there on two occasions and enjoyed it; however, the main dining room was closed on at least two evenings during our stay, resulting in limited menu options. The hotel has WiFi, and a workstation for internet access in the lobby. The lobby/lounge area is huge, and full of comfy furniture, although we were seldom around to make use of it. The staff at the Napoleon is wonderful -- friendly, gracious, and accommodating. I give them an A+. This hotel is a great choice for a reasonable, convenient, and comfortable accommodation in Rome, and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Napoleon makes stay in Rome all the more pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MichelleTheHague
Reviews.Content: As a journalist from Holland I travel to many places for my work so I know a lot about hotels. When I visited Rome I stayed at the Hotel Napoleon. From the moment I was picked up from the airport till the moment I left, my stay was absolutely enjoyable. The thing that stood out most to me was the way the staff made you feel at home. There was just an extremely good vibe amongst everyone. The hotel was lovely in decor and my room oozed relaxation and luxery. But the best (and most surprising) part of the room was the peace and quiet. As the rooms were situated at the back of the hotel, there was no noise like traffic to keep you from sleeping. The location seems a little off centre but there is a metrostation literally a few feet from the hotel and the Colosseum was just a ten minute walk away. If you plan to stay at the Hotel Napoleon I would like to give you a tip: eat at their restaurant! Every plate I ate was beautiful, my favorite being beef in green pepper sauce and of course the various pasta's. I have stayed in many hotels and I can honestly stay, I can absolutely recommend this hotel. Your stay in Rome will be all the more enjoyable if you stay at the Napoleon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: OneTrip
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Napoleon service staff were outstanding as well as accomodating during our stay. Especially for non-Europeans on vacation, Roberto and Franco were extremely helpful with any assistance and provided excellent recommendations during our 3 night stay. The hotel is only about 15 minute walk from Ancient Rome. Access to the Metro literally steps from the front door. Too save money, you should take the Metro from the Airport to the Hotel. Also, using the Metro is safe, convienent and inexpensive. The shuttle to the hotel was about 40 minutes. This is a 3 Star European Style Hotel, older, charming and clean with both knowledgeable and helpful service staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay as a base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: DaveK47
Reviews.Content: A friendly bilingual staff who made you feel that nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were spotless and kept that way for my 4 day stay. The bar facilities and the dining facilities were of an excellent standard and the general feeling for the hotel was that the staff cared for their customers. The situation of the hotel is very good for exploring Rome. The terminus for rail and buses is easily walkable or one stop on the Metro which is right outside the hotel. All things considered it was a good place to find and recommended by a resident of Rome itself. Dave. Twyford, Berkshire, England

Reviews.Title: “NBapoleon the Best”
Reviews.Author: Lateren
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Napoleon 7 times. Since she passed away in 2006 I went there alone in 2007. Our experience at the hotel was absolutely fantastic. This seems like an exaggeration, but never the less it is true. We have been to Italy on tours and have stayed at some modern hotels and some bad , at times much newer than the Napoleon. We could not have been more pleased at the hotel. All the staff and management were extremely helpful, accommodating, and very friendly. The Friday wine parties were not at any other hotel we stayed at in Europe. The location of the hotel is very good, within walking distance of many historic sights and the subway at the front door. She and I have stayed in every type of room that the hotel has and have always found it clean and comfortable. I have recommended this hotel to many of our personal friends and even strangers ( through our travel agents other clients.) The resturants near the hotel are neighbor type and serve excellent food. In short, this hotel is the best, none finer.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: romaIreland
Reviews.Content: Well, we haven't stayed in every hotel in Italy, but we have stayed in quite a few, and found Napoleon to be the friendliest and most helpful so far. The location is near Terminii, and the metro is literally outside the door. The room was large by Italian standards. I got the impression that many of the guests had been there before, which is a very good sign. Roberto (manager) and his staff will ensure you have a warm welcome, and we hope to return to the Napoleon when we are again in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. We liked this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNestTravelers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Napoleon was part of a great deal we got from Air France. It was everything we hoped it would be: fantastic location; old world charm; sumptuous buffet breakfast; quiet (if small) room with amazingly good mattress on the bed; up-to-date bathroom, and a beautiful, large lounge for meeting and chatting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Winter Break”
Reviews.Author: WelshmanAbergavenny
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4th visit to Rome, and funnily enough our 4th visit to the hotel Napoleon! From the moment you are met at the airport, through the most efficient and courteous check in service I have ever encountered at any city centre hotel, to the excellent bar and restaurant service, it is impossible to find fault. We had a beautiful, clean and spacious room on the second floor, which suited our needs perfectly. The ambience and decor of the lounge area, which contains some beautiful antiques, all added to another restful enjoyable stay. Some people seem not to like the location of the hotel, but we find absolutely no problem whatsoever. Certainly it is a cosmopolitan area, but that all adds to the enjoyment. We freely wandered around at night, without feeling threatened in any way. The metro station is right outside, and the termini a 5 to 10minute stroll away. Sights such as the Colosseum, San Giovanni In Laterano and San Clemente are all short walks away. The service at the hotel just gets better and better, and friendly, knowledgeable staff are always on hand to help with any query, however large or small. It is probably not fair to single out staff, but Franco, Peter, Domenico, Piero and Kabir all deserve special mention, and if they can't help you Mr Cioce the owner is always willing to give advice. In short I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any one seeking a holiday to remember in Rome and we will certainly be returning in 2008. Thank you Hotel Napoleon. Brian and Joy

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: caffeinecarol
Reviews.Content: December 2007 My family traveled to Rome for Christmas to visit our son. We were met at the airport by a driver from The Napoleon, which made it very convenient for us. Our rooms were ready upon our arrival, the room was very clean and the bed linens crisp. The Napoleon is very convenient : the Metro entrance is steps from the entrance, the breakfast ( included) is in a lovely room and has a large variety to choose from. The hotel's bar / dining has very good food, and one of my favorite parts was having an afternoon cappucino and relaxing in the comfortable lounge between outings. The restaurant staff members were the nicest people.The hotel staff was very welcoming and the atmosphere is very relaxing. The reception staff cheerfully took care of any request . The hot water supply for bathing was somewhat diminished on some days, which is the only improvement I would request. We will return to the Napoleon in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & clean!!”
Reviews.Author: bdstb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and had the best service we rec'd throughout our entire trip in Europe. Roberto at the concierge went above and beyond anything we could ask for in order to accomodate us and make us feel welcomed. He arranged for all activities during our trip and quickly worked on any help we needed. He even allowed us to leave our bags after we had checked out in order to make a quick trip down to Naples! I can't say enough about the service he provided and it just added to the experience at the Napoleon. It's not the greatest neighborhood in the world but I would go back again simply due to the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: timheuer
Reviews.Content: as a frequent traveler in the US i am biased as to the typical american hotel. this was my first time abroad and i was surprised at the size of the rooms. but the hotel napoleon was not any smaller/larger than the previous rooms we had in venice and florence. the room was clean and had a private bathroom. the concierge staff was nice. we really liked the hotel having a lounge area where we could sit and talk at the end of the day. the location of the hotel left something to be desired. on one hand it was right next to the metro which was extremely helpful, but it did feel like it wasn't in the best part of rome...however i didn't see many better parts :-). while i liked having the free internet, i hated having to ask for an hour logon. if it is free, just make it free. it made it inconvenient to keep asking for a logon and we felt that the concierge staff didn't like we kept asking...even though it was a free service. overall it was okay, but on my experience and average stay. nothing extraordinary, but clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: osumike33
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the Napoleon, and I thought it was better than the last time which was quite a few years ago. If you start with the presumption that there are NO bargains in Rome (or Italy, for that matter, especially if you're paying with USD) and just go with the experience, you're much better off. The staff is super friendly and accommodating all the way from Mr. Cioce, the General Manager, to the housekeeping staff. The food I thought was great (though, the scrambled eggs could use a little something), the restaurant and bar very cozy. The room was very large, though I believe mine was larger than many, and spotless. The hotel is not located in the middle of the tourist area, but you're a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum and the Metro is literally outside the front door. It's a neighborhood, complete with market during the day. If you're from the suburbs or some idyllic small town, you may think it's a bit dicey, but it's Rome and a large city and I never for a second didn't feel safe, but I'm from Chicago and used to large cities. A great, friendly experience for a few nights in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Lock Up Valuables In Room”
Reviews.Author: Chablis8152
Reviews.Content: Don't leave anything of value in your room. We had money taken off the desk on the 2nd day. We know we should not have left it there, but we did. The cleaning staff had to be the one who took it and when we reported it they seemed to not believe us or do anything about it. We were out approximately $175 and they would not do anything about it. We have to turn in the key every time you leave the hotel so the only one who could have taken it was one of the staff. They also booked a transfer to the ship for us, which was outrages and we had to pay the concierge the 160 euros ( which is approximately $230) for a one way transport, which meant he took his cut,

Reviews.Title: “Great place with very happy memories!”
Reviews.Author: Goodluck_travelling
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and after my fourth time visiting, I am looking forward to returning. The first time was in September 2005 for our wedding reception. We had never been to Italy before, but we wanted to get married in Rome. We emailed numerous hotels before deciding on the Napoleon because of the helpful and friendly response from the manager. Our wedding reception was wonderful, made so by the attentive and welcoming staff. Our room was bright, comfortable and clean and we were never disappointed when we had dinner in the restaurant - finished off with a drink in the relaxing, spacious lobby. The hotel is within walking distance from the Colosseum and easily within walking distance from other popular tourist spots. For those who are unable to walk far, there is a metro station right outside the hotel front door. My husband and I hope to visit the Napoloen Hotel if not every year, every other year. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “3 star only”
Reviews.Author: LMA1
Reviews.Content: The Napoleon Hotel was a disappointment. The reception and restaurant/bar areas are huge and lushly decorated (as shown in the hotel's photos) but our hotel room was tiny and drab and like previous reviewers, we got a view of an opposing wall. There was free wi-fi internet access, which was much appreciated on a rainy evening with nothing else to do. The restaurant food was good but overpriced. The cold breakfast buffet was generous but hot dishes came at an extra charge. The location is not ideal - the neighbourhood is a 'hood' and the condom vending machine in the street gives you an idea of the local trade. The piazza across the street is a dusty, dirty park. But if you are willing to take the Metro, the hotel is only metres from the entrance and it is on Line A, so you have direct trains to Termini station, the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza del Popolo and the Boghese park. Overall, I think the hotel is overpriced and overrated. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Napolean? NO-polean!”
Reviews.Author: patriciaIreland
Reviews.Content: During our honeymoon in August 2007, my husband and I stayed at the Napolean hotel for a week. I have very mixed feelings about the hotel. On first glance it is a lovely place. The bedrooms were small and adequate, although I had a sore back on more than a few mornings from the bed! It is not conveniently located for most of the major sights of Rome, having said that the metro station is located just outside the hotel so it is easy to travel around rome and see everything. The area itself though does not come across as being very safe at night (although it might have been fine) but we didn't venture out at night to find out! The staff were very hit and miss as well. some of them were lovely (bar staff) but some were very unfriendly and rude. I definitely would not recommend eating in this hotel unless you really have to - on one occassion my husband got a lasagne which was cold in the middle and although they replaced it quickly and without fuss, the next one was also cold in the middle. I also found the breakfasts to be very limited and if you wanted anything like bacon and eggs you had to pay extra. on the last morning there the milk in the jug on our breakfast table was gone off which put me right off what I was eating! This hotel classes itself as a 4*, and this it definitely is not. It is more like a good 3* hotel, but nothing more. Next time I return to Rome (hopefully I will and there is a coin in the Trevi fountain to testify to it) I will not be staying at the Napolean!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wald
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon for the 3rd time in 4 years. The location is excellent--a quick ride from the airport, walking distance from the termini, and right next to a subway stop. A 10 minute walk to the Coleseum. The staff are excellent. All go out of their way to be helpful--booked tours, called taxis, recommended excellent restaurants, advised on buying tickets for public transportation. This time we were 3 and had a triple--the room was curtained into two sections, good for family traveling together. Bathroom was large. Restaurant and bar were quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mario200884
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip last month in Rome and my wife booked my stay in Rome at this wonderful hotel.Arriving there was not a problem, from the airport the taxi ride took like 20 minutes. They gave me a nice second floor room with a large bathroom and an incredible view of the city. In the morning the breakfast was served at 7.30 and i want to say those were the best pancakes I have ever ate. The staff of the hotel very warm and kind to the guests, they even arranged for a car for me during my stay. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: khansen
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat worried about staying here after reading the reviews, however, it was a fine stay. Sure the hotel is not in the heart of Rome but everything is easily reached via metro or cab or foot. I did not find the area to be too sketchy. The rooms were adequate, not fancy, but did the trick. The hotel bar/restaurant area was a great place to unwind at night. Do not ask the hotel conceirge for restaurant recommendations as he will refer you only to the cheesy places that gives him kick backs.

Reviews.Title: “An average stay in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: troyory
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for the subway service (Termini station) and is a reasonable walking distance to many of the major attractions such as the Colosseum.. I agree that the front desk staff was hit and miss as far as their friendliness and genuine desire to help. They have one computer located on the second floor lobby. I needed access to the computer several times throughout my stay , and at tims felt that requesting the required special code from the concierge was a bit of an imposition. My wife and I ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and although the service was slow we found the waitress to be very friendly, the food tasty and the price reasonable. We also ate at a restaurant nearby (Roman tica) and very much enjoyed the food. so much we ate there a secnd night. There was also another restaurant across the street that was very good also (the name escapes me). Our request to locate an Argentinian restaurant a couple of minutes from the hotel (we saw it drivng in from the airport) was unsuccessful. We were surprised the front desk was unable to help us as we were sure it was only a few minute walk away. the room was a decent size and was clean. We had a problem with plumbing (toilet) the first day , however the problem was quickly resolved. It was a bit loud as we were hearing our neighbors down the hallway from inside our room. the noise was constant thorughout our stay. Lastly, there was a problem with our bill when we checked out. We were charged for a dinner that was not ours. However, I did not discover the error until after I had paid the bill by credit card. However, the manager quickly refunded our money in euros after realizing it was not our room number/signature on the bill. Overall, we'd say this hotel was average and would not highly recommend it. However we would not say it was a bad experience. Rome however was absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel near the underground”
Reviews.Author: Enrets
Reviews.Content: This is a very handy hotel for travellers. It is close to the main train station (Roma Termini) and the entrance to the underground station is just opposite the hotel itself. The single room I was given was not particularly large but had all one needs. The bed was comfortable and the room itself was quiet (it overlooked an inner court). Toilet and shower were clean. It's a no frills hotel rather than a luxury one (so perhaps its four stars are excessive), but it's far less expensive than other hotels of its kind. Breakfast is of the continental kind: cereals, cakes, croissants, bread and jam, cheese and cold cuts; one can order also cooked breakfast but must add a few euros to the bill (otherwise it's included). The area around the hotel is not especially touristy, but it's not far from the Coliseum and the proximity of the underground makes it easy to move to the most attractive and best-known sites. There are not many restaurants to be found nearby, but the hotel has a good restaurant, which is also relatively inexpensive. I found the hotel staff kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome”
Reviews.Author: usherbell
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as a single traveller for a week and could not fault it. The location was right opposite the entrance to the underground, was 10 minutes walk from the colloseum. The staff were polite and helpful, especially the bar staff, I was made to feel special.The room was clean and well appointed and the restaurant was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: tokyogal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. If you want to impress your wife, DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL. The front desk staff were unfriendly upon checking in, the hotel was dark and depressing, and it is in a seedy area of town. I get very bad allergies so I took a wet cloth to wipe down all of the dusty furniture and pictures on the wall. It was disgustingly filthy. The beds hard and lumpy, the TV was old with very poor picture quality and it only offerred two international channels. The walls were paper thin...so thin, that we had to endure the snoring in the next room. I am very surprised by all of the good reviews, very surprised. The only good thing that I can say is that we will NEVER have to stay here EVER again.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mags4567
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations about this hotel,but were disapointed from the moment we arrived.staff very rude and were only nice when they got underhanded tips.Othere reviewers have said the same so TAKE NOTE! rooms very dark,walls thin.terrible considering it was 200 euro a night....disgraceful. reception staff only smiled if they thought you'd give them a 10 euro tip.very popular with irish wedings but i think its a bad choice and wouldnt recommend it at all.there were a lot of disapointed customers there who were too afraid to speak up DONT HAVE YOUR WEDDING HERE. .location very far from main attactions so taxi everywhere,and a tough area at night .In summary,too overpriced,unfriendly,dodgy area.We were glad to go home.I feel i need to post this as i use trip advisors advice when choosing hotels and they are usually right.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Egidius
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week and it was a very pleasant stay indeed. The staff was very nice and helpfull. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with plenty of choice, and allways enough of everything. The room was nicely decorated and by no means small. There was a little private vault in the room to store our valuables. Our room was on the third floor, at the backside of the hotel so we didn’t have a view, but there wasn’t any traffic noise either. Nor did we ever hear any of out neighbours; it was all very quiet. The bathroom was all new and clean, with a shower, bath and sink. The beds were good, everything was clean. The lounge is chic and very large. One day they served little snacks and wine -as much as you liked- to all the guests for free (they called it “Tasting & Talking”). A very good hotel for a reasonable price. The neighbourhood is not the best of Rome -it ain’t bad either- but it is not far from Termini station and at the edge of the center: it is easy to get to whatever place you want to visit, there is a subway station just outside. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great service...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shawn67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Napoleon as a part of our 10th Wedding anniversary...before taking our trip to Italy I emailed the Napoleon asking for a room upgrade. When we arrived at 7:30 am on a Thursday the front desk people had my email on file along with a fax fron the vatican with our reservations for the Sistine Chapel. We stayed in room 218 which was very nice sized with a small seperate sitting area. We went straight to the breakfast buffet were had loaded up on food for the day (pretty standard mix of warm and cold foods). Walked from the hotel to Santa Maria Maggiore and San Giovanni Laterno and then to the Collesium and the Victor Emmanuel monument. From there we walked back to the hotel stopping at some gourmet grocery stores along the way. We had dinner at a restaurant of the Santa Maria piazza with a great view of the basillica. Next day there was a transit workers strike (!). Our concierge found us a private car which got us to the Scavi Tour in the nick of time (cost 40 euro). Walked from the Vatican all the way to Spanish Steps. Then found out that the strikers were allowing the subways to run from 5 until 8pm. Never had an issue feeling safe in the neighborhood around the Napoleon, there are alot of great shops, grocery stores, etc, in the Hotel Napoleon/Santa Maria Maggiore area. The hotel staff and service was great and we really enjoed our stay. Please note that my wife and I are in our upper 30's and we are in good physical shape so walking is no issue with us. It may be an issue with others.

Reviews.Title: “The Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PrincipessaLinda
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been happier with our room, location, and our daily breakfasts. Our room was on the 6th Floor. The room was penthouse size by European standards with a large bathroom. Breakfast was excellent and by all means ask for as many cappuccinos as you want. But the best thing about this hotel was the location of the Metro Stop. It was exactly 20 steps from the front door of the hotel. This is a major plus in a city were mass transportation is of daily importance to all. Book your transportation back to the airport through Airport Shuttle for 25 euros for one person plus 6 euros for each additional person. The front desk will charge you a minimum of 50 to 55 euros for transportation to the airport. If you don't use the hotel friends taxi service, they will tell you they don't recommend the Airport Shuttle. I quickly accessed the situation and figured out the front desk gets a percentage of the fee from the taxis cab driver (the same fellow that picked us up on the arrival). The Airport Shuttle was on time and got us to the airport quickly and safely. I say safely because you take your life in your hands driving with the taxi cab drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best part of town, not very safe, clean, or convenient - 1.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: wasif20
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon, using Expedia, I put a note to that effect when I was booking it, and the 5 other hotels I stayed at in Italy and Paris seemed to care about that because they gave us great rooms and service. It was not the case here. Service was ok, the manager was nice about directions. The room was EXTREMELY cramped with a horrible view, not very clean, everything was old. The manager said there was a wedding party staying there and they were booked solid, nothing they could do. The hotel was in a very very shady part of town, and walking back at night was not easy at all - not fun if you have a pretty young wife with you with unsavory characters staring at the both of you (had one arm around my wife and the other one on my wallet). It was not convenient to metro or bus (about a 4 block walk to the nearest bus stop). You could walk to the Coliseum from it, that was one good thing about it. The lobby was cramped, you had a sitting area one floor up, large and nice ballroom style, nice place to sit and have breakfast, computer there with internet use. Something that i didnt like was you had to walk up one flight of steps to catch the elevator to your room (you could take the elevator up one flight and then walk across the ballroom for the other one as well, took forever). This was my least favorite hotel out of the 6 that we stayed at in Paris and Italy during our honeymoon. Further explanation: On our 15 day honeymoon, 3 days in Paris, 12 days in Italy, I booked our honeymoon through Virgin Vacations, they included 3 nights in a Rome Hotel, I chose Napoleon, luckily it was full and they put us in Hotel Columbus on the other side of town which we adored. At the end of my trip, I had to book a few days on my own, the girl at Virgin who booked my vacation, raved about Napoleon, saying she had been there herself, I went ahead and booked it at Expedia, paying like $230 a night, I could have stayed at other places that were cheaper but I felt like it was a safe bet since Virgin listed this as a superior hotel and the girl on the phone really raved about it. I wouldn't stay here again because of the area, and the general crappiness of the hotel. If its just a bunch of guys with you, and you get a FANTASTIC deal, stay here, otherwise DON'T DO IT!!! 2 stars on their best day, there was no 1.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!”
Reviews.Author: Cloodia
Reviews.Content: I have to apologise in advance for this review. When we drove from the airport I had high expectations of this hotel and I was very excited. We pulled up outside this, well, I would describe it as cheap looking, area with lots of entrances to various shops. On our left there was a beautiful park and I had presumed the hotel was behind the park. I glanced out of the window and saw a hotel across from us. "Thank goodness we aren't going to be staying there," I thought, "It looks like a really bad hotel." Imagine my shock when our luggage was brought into that, "really bad hotel". The main reception area wasn't big at all and it didn't look very clean. The lounge area above was, strangely enough, nicely decorated and it had a computer. It was then that I thought the hotel wouldn't be so bad. And then I saw our room. We had booked a junior suite. Yes, a junior suite. There was barely enough space to move in the room and the bathroom was miniscule. The room decoration was dark and depressing and there wasn't even any room service. I was very upset. Our curious family had a look at the fire escape plan on the wall to see how our room compared to all the other rooms. Our junior suite was in fact the biggest in the corridor, meaning I couldn't even begin to fathom how incredibly claustrophobic the other normal rooms would have been. The breakfast was not fantastic and the only really good thing I found about this hotel was that it was near all the good sites to see. It was probably the most unpleasant experience that I have had of hotels so far.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ruskieray
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite which was very small and very tired. The room needed refurbishing and the bathroom frankly needed gutting. Not at all acceptable. The view from our room was of a brick wall. The breakfast we found uninspired. Reading other reviews on Trip Advisor we seem to be very much in the minority which I find baffling? The staff were fine but distant and the surrounding area is shabby and run down with some dubious characters hanging around at night but the Maria Maggiorie is very close by and the walk down through the park to the Colliesuem in the morning was lovely. I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel. There are better properties at the same price in much better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient well run hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: AllyDick2
Reviews.Content: I attended the wedding of a friend in Rome last May. There were about thirty of us staying at the hotel. There were courtesy minibuses laid on to take us from Fiumacino airport. When we arrived at the hotel, there were porters there to take our luggage to our rooms. The buffet breakfast in the hotel was impressive. I also liked the pleasant manner and professionalism of the staff at the reception. There were two receptions by the way which was most impressive. I will definitely stay here again if I go back to Rome. The hotel is ideally situated beside the Vittorio Emmanuel Metro station and the Colosseum and Trevi Fountain are not far away either. There is a gorgeous Chinese restaurant called Man-Yi about a block away. It is very very cheap and the food is amazing. I urge anyone who is staying at the Napoleon to look out for it. There is also a good Irish bar called Fiddlers Elbow about half a mile away - although it is difficult to find ! On the whole , I will be back here again for all of the different reasons mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: corcalaoi
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay in this hotel after seeing it listed in a travel agency brochure..I went on line to see their website and liked the look of it very much so booked it. Originally we booked a three day package which meant the hotel collected us from the airport. A chauffeur driven mercedes awaited us at arrivals on the first day. We came a day early than the booking afterwards and though the hotel was fully booked they accomodated us with a small box room for that initial night. For our trouble they were most apologetic and gave us a complimentary dinner and bottle of wine which was great not to have the hassle of searching for a restaurant late on the first night. Our last three days in the hotel we had a large room with a big bathroom. The room was fully airconditioned and had a nice little mini bar and satellite television. It was very clean and well kept. The breakfast was a continental buffet with plenty on offer from breads, meats, fruits and cereals for an extra €3 a hot breakfast was cooked. For tea lovers they gave a choice of tea for breakfast something of a novelty in a coffee mad country. The lounge is of faded old world grandeur with a grand piano if you wish to play a tune. There is also an internet point if you need to stay in touch with this medium. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located a ten minute walk down hill to the coleseum and a ten minute walk up hill to the train station termini. The metro leaves outside the hotel and takes the route to the coleseum and circus maximus alternatively you can travel on the metro to termini and catch the other metro line for the trevi fountain, spainish steps and vatican. The newspaper stall outside the hotel sells transport maps which detail bus, tram and metro services. Tickets for the metro can be bought for 1/3/7 days down at the turnstile. The only problem with this hotel is its location to restaurants, this is a wasteland for good restaurants but hop on the metro and you will soon have a good choice. A taxi from the city centre at night back to the hotel is about €7.50 approx.

Reviews.Title: “Made my 50th birthday Special”
Reviews.Author: P_with_G
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel by looking at the reviews on this site. None of them seemed too bad so we booked and were very pleasantly surprised. We were celebrating my 50th birthday so we asked for adjoining rooms for the 4 of us, a double for my husband and a twin for my grown up kids! We were very comfortable. The rooms were clean and tidy. the breakfast was very nice and you could order a cooked breakfast for an extra £3.00 which delighted my ravenous son! The staff in reception were very helpful and polite. For instance we wanted to go shopping on my actual birthday so they gave us a map and marked all the shopping streets for us (in pink I might add!). On the eve of my birthday there was a knock at the door and a porter stood there with a tray of sparkling wine and 4 flutes! The card read Many Happy Returns from the Manager and staff of the Hotel Napoleon. Well that just made it didn't it! " 2 lovely restaurants very close by recommended by staff. Food very good. Restaurants were Romantica and Bianca I believe. The lounge was very large and sort of faded grandeur style with a grand piano. My son played on the evening we were waiting for our taxi so I hope they didn't mind his constant renderings of Coldplay. It's in a very good location - right next to the metro. Gill and Peter

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shassa
Reviews.Content: Hotel arrranged pick up from airport free of charge. Hotel reception and lounge area very tastefully decorated, clean and well maintained. Hotel bedroom was not the largest by any means, but the real downer was the size of the shower. You had to get out of the shower to use it! Very quiet hotel, slightly away from the main centre, but certainly walkable and, of course, the metro is right outside the hotel. Would certainly recommend this hotel if you don't mind small shower units!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, helpful staff, but slightly too expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. First 2 nights we stayed in normal room which is ok, but we got upgrade for last night and room is nice. Staffs are very helpful with lot of information. Breakfast was good. Hotel is in very convenient location. Just 10 mins from Collesuem and Duomo which you can walk through the park. Subway is right in front of the hotel (but subway in rome close at 9 pm)..The weak point for this hotel is a bit too expensive. we pay 200 EUR/night which i expect to get better quality. If you get deal around 150 it would be perfect. The picture that hotel post in the website is the view from hotel (not hotel itself).. By overall, we like this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Rome recently. The hotel staff were very friendly, food was delicious (really tasty), rooms a bit small but it is an old roman building and they were very clean. There is a lovely feel about this hotel and we really enjoyed staying here. Reports of the area being seedy and lots of graffiti, well this is not how we found it we strolled around the area at night and had no problems. The graffiti is part of all of rome so dont let this put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it's price”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMajor
Reviews.Content: Well, you don't get enough for the price you pay. Our room was very small. The walls were very thin and we could hear everything our neighbors were saying. The bathroom was very, very small and the shower was just ridiculous. There's only one computer in the hall with extremely slow Internet connection. Hotel doesn't provide free airport shuttle. Although we paid a lot for our accommodation, they said they could pick us up from the airport if we pay Euro 50. The service was good, receptionists very helpful, cleaning great, breakfast good, restaurant very good, although too small.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: City-Sights10
Reviews.Content: We received very good service, the hotel driver was waiting for us at the airport and tried to give a good commentary on the way into Rome. The reception staff were excellent and could not have been more helpful. The bar and lounge were very nice, cheap drinks and good food. The rooms were clean, quiet and had everything you need for a short break, although they are starting to look a little tired, but that reflects the price you pay. The Metro is directly outside the front door of the Hotel and costs 4 euro for a day pass. The Hotel is within walking distance of the Colloseum, but for other sights I would use the Metro(we couldnt figure out the bus or tram routes!) The breakfast was very good with plenty to choose from. I agree with a previous review not to walk from Termini to the Hotel at night, it was the only time during our stay I felt unsafe, take a Taxi instead for about 5 euro. All in all I would go back to this hotel, particularly for the very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bru⋁
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights in Rome staying at the Napoleon and on the whole were very happy with it. It is situated in a leafy square and our room looked into the courtyaqrd at the rear so was really quiet. The room was a bit on the small side but worth what we paid for, clean and tidy and comfortable for all the time we spent in it as we were mostly exploring this glorious city.
