The staff were all very frinedly but not subservient which is what we like. Found a good little Tratoria/pizzeria nearby in via Alberto which served the most amazing hot chocolate pudding. The metro is literally on the doorstep and took us to the Spanish Steps which was a great shopping area (pity Demi Moore's face was obliterating the Spanish church at the top which was covered in scaffolding and hence the huge banner). Walked to the Colliseum very easily (15 mins)and at night never felt intimidated by the area at all. Would happily recommend this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My parents, my partner and me stayed here for one week and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The rooms are clean and are worth what you pay in terms of size and facilities. The area may make some people feel uncomfortable when they see the graffiti, but, to be fair, lots of Rome suffers from that. The locals (old and young) are content to walk around at night so don't be intimidated. The area is safe. The streets between Termini station and the Piazza where the hotel is should be avoided at night as bag-snatchers so operate here. The metro is virtually opposite the front door but unfortunately does stop around 9pm. If you have to make the walk between Termini and the Hotel, use Via Cavour and then Via Carlo Alberti. We found the service polite and efficient at all times. The restaurant is average but ok for the odd meal. We wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A little difficult to find, but worth looking for.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. It was a little difficult to find, but a haven once we found it. Located on a busy piazza, it offered a quiet retreat after a long day walking through the city. Take advantange of the great breakfast before you head out. There's also a bar area that offers sandwiches and drinks during late afternoon hours before the restaurant opens up. Though not located near any major attraction, there is a metro stop located right outside the hotel. It takes about 20 - 25 minutes to walk to the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Vatican City is easy to get to by metro. We were warned about pick-pockets on the metro but had no problems. The staff was friendly and the rooms were large. A very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect wedding reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently got married in Rome and chose this hotel as it was recoomended by a travel agent who specialised in Rome weddings. The choice could not have been better! There were over 30 guests at our wedding and the meal, service and ambience were absolutely excellent. The staff could not have done more and the food was as good as I have ever tasted. There is a lovely lounge area in the hotel making it suitable for a wedding and for general relaxation. I found the hotel room to be spacious, clean and very quiet despite the central location. The hotel is also exceptionally close to the Metro system although I would caution against pick pockets as two of our guests were robbed on the metro on separate occasions. A tip for safe travel on the metro is to take the less crowded carriages ie; the first or last carriages.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, at best 3 * in a slump area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tonton007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and find this to be a 3 * hotel at best. The room is spacious and clean but it is very basic and has no kettle, rubbish bin, shower gel or slippers in the room. Breakfast is no good (limited choice - 3 choices of ham, croissants, toasts, apples, oranges) and none of the food was fresh. Service at breakfast was very poor. Concierge was OK depending on who you speak to. Apart from Franco Quirinis (who helped us with restaurant & museum bookings), the rest are just rude and incompetent (e.g. the Colosseum is the closest site but they did not know whether there is an official tour or not!). We enquired about restaurants and tours that we read about on this site / heard from friends but they were not interested in helping us at all though they have ones they recommend at more than double the price!! In the end, we had to sort it out by using the internet ourselves. Internet is convenient though the computer has not been cleaned for years.. The worst part is the location. Though its right next to the metro station, they stop running at 9:15pm and given some restaurants only open at 8pm this can be a problem. The area is definitely not safe in the evening. One tip on Rome is that you should take guided tour whenever you can. Angels tour is good and is worth it as the tour is relatively small (10) and you can understand what they say (native english speakers). There was a big queue at the Vatican on the day and they were very apologetic and gave us eur 5 discount (so eur 20 each) though its not really their fault. The tour lasted more than 3.5 hrs so eur 20 was well worth it. AVOID the ones outside the Colosseum who claims they can give you a tour for eur 8. We (more than 30) ended up spending 30 mins standing at the SAME spot inside the Colosseum!! It was so bad that half of the ones who joined actually left halfway through.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Lao_Shr
Reviews.Content: Our pqrty of 8 people stayed at Hotel Napoleon after arriving by cruise ship in Civatechia. The Hotel arranged our transportation for 8 people and baggage from the port to the hotel at a reasonable rate. We then had a 4 hour tour of Rome in the van and saw 8 of the top 10 attractions in Rome. Staff at the hotel provided excellent service, including a delicious continental breakfast. The Concierge gave us advice on using public transportation, local attractions, and restaurants. We had an early flight out and the Hotel Concierge arranged for us to have coffee/tea and a sack continental breakfast to take away with us to the airport. Overall, all 8 of us were very pleased with Hotel Napoleon and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home From Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got married in Rome on 27/05/05, we had 40 guests, all of whom stayed at the Napoleon Hotel with us. The guests varied in age from 30's to 70's, The whole experience was wonderful, staff were friendly and very efficient. We stayed for 4 nights. The hotel arranged all transport from airport plus bus hire during our stay. We decided to have the wedding meal in the Hotel and it was magnificient. They made a huge effort to make our wedding very special. All the guests said they would stay at the Napoleon when next in Rome. We travelled south on our honeymoon and returned to Rome the night before we left for Ireland, we stayed @ Napoleon for our last night in Rome and it felt like coming home! Fantastic Staff particularly, Roberto, Peter and Domenico, great location within walking distance to lots of sites, convenient transport links. Free Internet access which is really handy. Area outside looks a little seedy but we found it to be quite safe. We did find two nice restraurants nearby - Romantica & White Horse about 4mins from hotel. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Free champagne on our honeymoon, how nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a long day of traveling and five minutes after we were in the room there was a knock on the door. Our travel agent had called ahead and told them it was our honeymoon and the manager sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne. We were very shocked and grateful. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, especially since we had never been to Rome before and spoke little Italian. The rooms were comfortable and clean. There was free internet in one of the sitting areas, which was really wonderful. And the best part was that the metro stop was literally out the front door 10 feet. We really enjoyed our stay and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff is not friendly!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from Apr 29 thru May 3rd. As we arrived late in the evening on the 29th, the hotel told us we we have to take a taxi from the airport, even though transfers were supposedly included. Upon our arrival, the night desk clerk was very warm and friendly. The day desk clerk was hit and miss, as far as being helpful or informative. Their was a gentlemen named Domenic, who we believe was some sort of day manager. This man needs lessons on how to deal with people/guests. He was the most unpleasant man we came across, always seemed to be put out if asked questions. The breakfast included was nice, nice variety of items, the serving staff was not very responsive. We were not able to use the in-house restaurant. The one night we tried we were told that you needed to have reservations and that they had no openings that evening. (Which we were not told upon check in.) The bar serves limited drinks. The rooms were dated, but comfortable. Though be careful when taking showers, the temperature of the water changes. As with the previous reviews, the location is convenient to the metro system and the neighborhood is seedy at night. We were recommended to a nearby restaurant, "Rom Antica" (about 2 blocks from the hotel) Very nice! The waiters were attentive to everyones needs. They have live music. Their grilled vegetable starter is excellent. We would only recommend you use this hotel if you have previously been to Rome and desired only a hotel close to transportation systems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Roman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed in the napolean for 4 nights at the end of jan 05. picked up from the airport for free if you stay over 3 nights which saves the hassle of attempting public transport or paying 50 euro for a taxi (which is what we did for the return) a few words of italian are handy to converse with the little old italian man who picks you up but he does point out all the relevan tourise attractions to you on your journey in which takes about 45 mins from Ciampino airport. one thing that is handy is to have some loose change if you can because it is customary to tip the driver (we gave him 5 euro and he seemed really happy with that) and also the porter when you get there takes your bags up and you need a couple of euros to give him. Hotel decor is very grand and traditional and is very well kept. rooms were well laid out and although not exactly big there was a little clockroom bit which is very handy to store cases and coats etc. bathroom was lovely. Was about a 10 minute walk to the colloseum and about 15 mins to the main hub of the city. V central but far enough away to not be disturbed by the hectic roman traffic. Check out the restuarant at the hotel which is lovely. Although only a small menu food was gorgeous. Breakfast in with the room price was traditional continental but you could pay extra and have a fry up, but no need really Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone (and have done) is excellent value for money, the staff are very helpful and friendly and will order you a taxi to round off your trip back to the airport. Just on another note - Rome itself is very reasonable for food etc, in fact i only spent £120 in 4 days and that was eating every meal out and not skimping on any sightseeing or drinking!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel I was looking forward to staying there. Although most of the points mentioned are correct the main problem I found was with the noise. This was due to plumbing and the open staircases giving rise to constant general noise of people coming and going up and down stairs etc. After a hard days sightseeing I wanted somewhere to rest and relax and this was definitely not it The hotel is near the sights, rooms are comfortable, staff are civil but that is it. There is nowhere around the hotel to eat at night.

Reviews.Title: “after seeing the reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews other guests had written on this web site . I was confident i had chosen the right place for my husband and myself to celebrate our pearl wedding anniversary this april . Yes the hotel was clean and was in walking distance to all major attractions . But be careful the area isnt very nice to walk in at night and there are no decent places to eat or bars to have a drink ! And dont expect a warm welcome or a friendly smile from the management as this we found came only from the chambermaids ! !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Napoleon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Napoleon hotel from March 26 thru April 1, 2005. Our room was large enough, very clean and had a large bathroom which appeared to have been recently remodeled. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the hotel even sponsored a wine tasting during our stay in which most of the staff mingled and talked with the hotel guests. We ate at the hotel restaurant only one time, but the food was good. The hotel is located near the ancient histroical ruins (we walked from our hotel to this area). One nice touch: we had an early flight on April 2, and when we checked out, the hotel had prepared a sack breakfast for us. We would certainly recommend the Napoleon.
